ssU6DBC7BrtMiXUeTDTOiQ.text: My husband and I used to work at a very well known sushi spot and after work we would go here with a his friends and coworkers. It's always been very good  and we really enjoy coming here.

8HyHguSS7HkMbmIoQpLgQw.text: They are lucky I'm giving 1 star for their sushi. Sushi isn't bad but their service however is HORRIBLE!!!! They look very unhappy to be there and it reflects on their service.. ALOT. They are really slow and take their sweet ol time to greet you at your table and when they do finally show up they have attitude. this isn't just a one time visit.. We've given them multiple chances to prove us wrong but it's the same thing everytime! We love our sushi but not enough to deal with their awful service! We will bringing our service else where!

f-kNEZxRz5kL31nUa1vi_g.text: They do not take reservations so the wait is about 30 minutes.    The menu has an option of an all-you-can-eat (AYCE) dinner or ala carte.   We did the AYCE and the orders came out fast, hot and fresh.  Everything that we ordered was awesome, we ran out of space before we could sample the entire menu (not that it was possible for 4 average appetite people)  This is another place we are going to visit on our next trip to Vegas!

cuFnZ6hyoDDNzfrEk2M32A.text: This is my go-to sushi restaurant. The quality of the fish for AYCE beats any other place in Vegas. I love the female mid aged Asian waiter, she is the most friendliest and attentive waiter. She always asks if we want to order more and always refills are drinks. She always has a smile on her face, she's my favorite. If you love sushi you should definitely check this place out. Their menu is great with pictures of what each roll looks like. Definitely recommend.

mSbmd0yUR8mN-xl9AHduww.text: Usually go to sushimon (the sister restaurant) but decided to give this one a chance, they have ramen with their AYCE and tuna cracker appetizers (spicy tuna on crisp rice) but food took a little long to come out and they forgot a few of our orders. I'll definitely come back, but will stick to being loyal to sushimon.

USBOFiAxeQDshCBVhmbD1A.text: Delicious and affordable which makes me a fan, but service from Gio is the best. Try to ask for him. He's quick and attentive!

Zj36XAGo_Ime6g9HUkcj2w.text: When it comes to "all you can eat" sushi, Goyemon has to be one of the best here in Vegas.   Their AYCE menu is pretty extensive which includes a lot of variety. Like most places they say you have a one hour time limit but the waiter was always around if we wanted to order more and believe me we ordered enough to feed a family of four and it was only two of us.   First thing on the menu that caught my eye was pork belly. I know most of my reviews mention pork but c'mon "ALL YOU CAN EAT PORK BELLY" I was like a kid in a candy store. The pork is braised to perfect tenderness and lightly grilled for that chard flavor. Another thing that was unique was their Spicy Tuna Fire Cracker. The crunchy texture of the rice and soft spicy tuna tantalizes your taste buds. I tend to order most of the Nigiri sushi and the quality of their fish and seafood is tops!   The only thing I would say was "so so" was their deserts with the exception of their lychee sorbet. But its OK by this time I was comatose from all that sushi goodness.   I would have to say Goyemon has set the bar pretty high for me when it comes to AYCE sushi.

8QTvMncglAbRTyrAVmAU0g.text: Long wait, Good food, Service was ok over all experience was good. I've been there many times (from day one) Tony is an amazing Sushi Chef that we have followed around. Only draw back of the place is occupancy. Way to popular for such a small establishment. Price is fair for AYCE and portions are proper. I'm not a big fan of rolls but might mix it up once in a while and have one or two. I prefer sticking to the basics. Will be back to review again, next time I hope to give them that extra star!

NGBr7UCrvL7DyqH3UYCQTw.text: Came here with my mommy friends after shopping at 4pm..no line. Sweet! We were sat down quickly and our server was on top of waters & drinks for all of us. We tried so many different kinds of sushi. I could not find fault with any of them. Even the desserts were amazing. My only issue was our waitress disappeared around time for dessert so we had to ask another server to send her over. If there would not have been such a delay..and we did wait a bit..I would have given them 5 stars. I will be back again soon though.

hLEipT2IUwMUupoZ0fJ-Bw.text: Yelp, you never steer me wrong!  The hubby and I went on a Tuesday night and we sat at the bar. We decided on AYCE and that is definitely the way to go. Price is standard at $26.95.   We ordered side dishes first: grilled yellow tail collar, fried calamari, grilled pork belly and baked green mussels. Baked green mussels were good but not nearly as good as Sin City Sushi. We liked everything for the most part but the grilled pork belly is something special. The pork belly was juicy, flavorful and melted in my mouth.  We mostly stuck with nigiri and everything was fresh with not too much rice. The standouts for me were the super white tuna and snow crab meat. Our chef, Mike, suggested a variety of items to try and one of them was rice, raw quail egg and masago wrapped in seaweed. It was surprisingly yummy.   The only roll we had lived up to it's name, Ecstacy Roll. I can't even remember what was in it but it was good! I like that you can do half orders.  What bumped this review up to 5 stars for me were the desserts. The hubby had the green tea creme brulee and I had the tempura ice cream. I wasn't too thrilled with the tempura because it was spongy and not at all crunchy. I did, however, eat most of the green tea creme brulee. It had a good consistency and right amount of sweetness. I still had a little bit of a sweet tooth so I ordered the lychee sorbet. It was so yummy and was a great way to cleanse the palette.   A huge plus was the exceptional service. The sushi chefs were friendly and were gracious enough to suggest different things to try. Our glasses were always full and empty plates were cleared right away.   I am now a believer of the type. I love that they have a frequent punch card. I expect to get that free 10th meal very soon!

VwHUkxtExA2l8Y_-zvgiCg.text: Having eaten here several times, I must say I am impressed. For an out-of-town visitor, this place is off the beaten path for most vacationers so I am happy to have found it via Yelp!  Every time I have been here, it has been for lunch, so I can't promise the same experience for dinner (although it sounds like everyone enjoys the evenings as well). I have also only gotten the AYCE (all-you-can-eat) experience so if you are ordering a la carte.... what's wrong with you?!?!?  :o)  But seriously, there are so many options and for an AYCE place, this is probably the best one I have been to in America (and that's saying a lot!). You can order half and full rolls, I recommend starting with a number of half-rolls so you can experience more of the options.  The flavors themselves are balanced and each roll is it's own unique experience.  In addition to the rolls, you can also enjoy a selection of grilled items. I loved the tofu!  I probably won't make it out here if I am not renting a car, but you better believe I will be back to Goyemon soon!

a7g_11iYIzFvJ0g5aoHQcw.text: Goyemon is always a good time; definitely one of my top 3 sushi spots in Vegas.  When I hit up Goyemon, I am always looking forward to hitting up the specials of the day and getting down on some fresh nigiri cuts when I'm here.  Plus, I've grown very fond of the Green Tea Creme Brulee.. so nice.  Always an awesome time at Goyemon!!

3EvfGPxGSmzkYqb29SuuyA.text: Im a LV local and have tried Goyemon so many times for years. This is a review about the average experiences.  "The service: 1 stars" (as you can see in other reviews. In my opinion, only the male Mexican server is good)  "The food: 4 stars" (considered it's AYCE restaurant. Love their one-bite size sushi, unlimited strawberry & vanilla mochi, half-order of rolls. But fish are sometimes not so fresh.. I know it's AYCE...)  "The waiting time: 2 stars" (if you go to lunch & dinner time, especially dinner, you usually have to wait for 30-60min.)  "The stamp card service: 5 stars" (if you are living here and like AYCE sushi, then collect the stamps. 10stamps =1 free AYCE)  Okay, overall .. "3 stars" from my experiences!

jYRk4YMh59CJ_GsBE5ARJA.text: This place is good, very good.  Not great, nothing special, but good.  We did an AYCE double sushi date last night.  First, we waited for 40 minutes for a table.  At that point, we were super lucky it was all you can eat because we were ravenous.    All the fish was fresh and tasty.  Everything was rolled nicely.  We were very happy.  The only dissapointed was the baked green mussels.  They were terrible.  I would go back if someone suggested it, but I certtainly wouldn't wait 40 minutes again for a table.  I think there are better places in Vegas.   We tried just about everything...hamachi, snapper, smoked salmon, uni, scallops, mussels, yakisoba, gyoza, 2  salads, miso soup, crispy pork belly, tuna rice cracker, 7 rolls including sexy girl, 911 (habenero makes it super spicy with good flavor, a nice departure from the usual jalapeno) , sunrise,  frying jason, pastel, and so on.    The service was nice and efficient and the punch card is an extra cool touch.  One really nice surprise is the variety of desserts offered.  The tofu cheesecake was extra delicious!

ZO0-R-uTbCIhS37l9cP7TA.text: This place is okay, albeit slightly over-hyped. If I was in the area I would have sushi here again, but I would absolutely not go out of my way to dine here. I met Jessie B. for lunch here while on my way to my hair appointment in the area. We sat at the bar and most of the time I felt ignored by the chefs. It's almost as if they were purposefully trying to avoid eye contact. I sampled several half rolls, and they were all tasty with fresh ingredients. I just feel that with an imposed time limit for AYCE you really don't want to worry about being able to get the chef's attention since the wait to get your roll is still pretty solid once you do place the order, unless it is nigiri. I liked the scallop rolls Jessie had and 911 and Athena were solid. I think the rolls and the names are pretty much identical to Sushi-Mon who only had slightly higher rating from me due to better/faster service.

hkOEXa3etk3p7203RtDDFA.text: Unlike my friend Aljamin who posted below, I had a great time at Sushi House Goyemon. I've had this place in my bookmarks since May but never had the time to actually go and try it out. This was my first visit and I ALWAYS judge the sushi on their tamago nigiri. It was HEAVENLY. I striked up a conversation with our waitress in Japanese and she explained to me that their tamago was made using a family recipe. She even gave me the option of just getting the tamago without rice. (Which I did and it was amazing!)  The sushi rolls were pretty good, it being my first time, I didn't really know what to get and had to check their website for picture references. I would have given this place a 5 star rating if the rolls didn't come out so slow, but I had a very pleasant experience!

56_cqVMb3b7xjvqy-nyR-w.text: I went here Oct 7th. I just moved to vegas few month ago. Tried to find good place eat. So I'm always seaching on yelp to find something good. So I find this place a lot a people said food n service is good. But it wasnt good at all.  I had a AYCE. Fish quality wasnt good. N employees looked so mad no smile.  Never ever wanna go back.

-47Gxcx-SxsVbaqJoNI8mA.text: One of the best places in Vegas off the strip for all you can eat. The other place is called Sushi-mon and they share the same owner lol. The all you can eat menu is extensive. The service is pretty good as well. They are very cautious with customers over ordering because they don't like to waste food. I believe you have to pay for anything you do not finish.

-XeFgaeSn5X3v6CX79UDtg.text: This is hands down, the BEST ayce sushi you can find anywhere!  Everything they have here is melt-in-your-mouth fresh.  They don't over stuff you with rice either just because it's ayce.  This place is when quality finally meets quantity.  Remember to finish off with their amazing desserts.  The green tea creme brulee has me drooling for days after consuming it.  Lychee sherbet was also tarty and sweet and oh-so-yummy.  I'll go back to Vegas JUST FOR THIS, JUST FOR THIS!!!!!!!!

O0is1mXDaKsw81Nl-OZ7lg.text: Another one of the best sushi places for all you can eat. I want to say I enjoy the rolls more than Sushi Kaya's however the service when I went here was incredibly slow and there were portions of the restaurant that it seems no server was even attending to.

KF2gP36m3j5cJg8VqJe81w.text: Many friends recommended Goyemon to me, so I go to get a try,. The waiting time is so long, it doesn't matter, but their services are really bad. The food is so slow to come out and the quality is just OK. Many of the sushi house in town provide the same quality, even better. I definitely will not come back.

qwTcveUAa_mpFmQ0kfgtcQ.text: After my friend raved about this all you can eat sushi place, we had to try it. We ordered six different sushi platters including Hurricane, Alaskan, Dragon, Rainbow, Ecstasy and Frying Jason. All of them were absolutely delicious. It's hard to pick a favorite and describe every flavor. The hurricane sushi  and the flying fish stood out more because they have more of a crunch because its a tempura roll. Other than sushi, i also tried the Niko Udon soup bowl with thin sliced beef and noodles.  We sat in the private dining room. The service was good. However be prepared to wait for an hour on weekends. Also, they have an AYCE options on the specials, which is a great deal if you can shove as many sushi rolls in 60 minutes, The time constraint is a bummer but they're pretty good on bringing out the platters fast.

iELslwbV9jFDTdqz9x6jdA.text: I was getting cabin fever at the Mandalay Bay!  Yelp... Take me away.  I saw a picture posted by Mona W that looked so good I decided to give this place a try.  AYCE sushi?!?!  WTF?!?!  Nasty... Right? Not here. Not at all. Lin was my sushi chef and he was great. (We were both very quiet, but that's okay since it was pretty crazy all around the place).  $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. Not bad. It's not Sushi Sushi by any means, but it's pretty good. (Don't want to tarnish my credibility but it was okay. Not great. Sushi should be great, otherwise don't eat it. Just saying).

GvWNizk95BfDRHv4fe0aCg.text: Got ignored the whole entire time we were there, I got charge extra for sharing my miso soup and couple of rice pieces with my 1 year old. Really?! She's a year old...

l4tC1dDcvgQX2BaDYX2A5g.text: I wouldnt come back here. Go to Umiya instead!! Near Palms place. Soooo much better.  Came here for a late lunch and upgraded mine for dinner ayce. Took forever for orders to come out and i dont know why considering the restaurant was getting emptier by the minute. We sat at the bar too. Also the cut of the nigiri sushi was the smallest and roughest cuts ive seen so far in lv and they were all pretty bland. The chef didnt even understand my orders very well. He assumed I meant 4pcs and not 4 orders which really annoyed me since their 1 order is considered 2pcs!!! I think sushi mon also does small cuts but their quality is so much better so its forgivable. Fyi...i didnt have a  japanese sushi chef nor an asian one  which i think another reason why he was so slow and cut the fish so poorly... Once he knew i was annoyed he started picking up the pace but i literally had to drown my sushi in soy sauce bc they tasted like nothing.   Maybe they had a off day...dont matter cuz there shouldnt be one. Consistency is key.

DFhHmom17nKcunGbJ1HFaA.text: Food poisoning. I didn't eat all day, and decided to just go ham and eat AYCE sushi at night on Saturday June 25th. My girlfriend and I both had food poisoning.   Im a first-timer and I was recommended by a friend.  The food: Some of the cuts of sushi was a bit warmer than I expected, but that didn't phase me. I'm not too sure what caused it, but some of the items we ordered were: *Crispy Rice Roll *Lasagna Roll *Mussel  *Seaweed Salad *Salmon, Yellow Tail, White Tuna, Garlic Tuna Nigiri  *Shrimp Tempura  The dessert: *Lychee Sherbet x2  Melted because the waiter freezer was broken  I love sushi, I've been to almost all the AYCE in Vegas, I enjoyed the food here and if I would I put it at 4 stars, but this was just a horrible horrible experience.

_Igom4IVe2KnSaFMZfgbYQ.text: Amazing. The sushi was fresh and extremely savory. I had about 8 different rolls during lunch, some nigiri, some sashimi, and the calamari special. Yeah, I ate too much but it was worth it. The hurricane roll was by far my favorite. The service was great, the ambience was great, and I liked that it was away from the strip.

s_sNXldRMTSa8DdsEhSe4w.text: The AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas are top notch.  Where else can you eat your fill of nigiri sushi for about $25 a person?    We arrived early, at about 530-545 pm and the restaurant was already full.  With only a short wait, we took two seats at the sushi bar, which proved to be a blessing.  It was so much easier to give our orders directly to the sushi chefs and instantaneously receive our sushi.  At a table, you're at the mercy of the waitresses, who are harder to come by.   Do yourself a favor, don't waste time on the rolls.  Not even one.  I don't care how interesting that fried/eel sauced concoction sounds.  They are huge, heavy and a waste of stomach space. We had the Cynthia roll and a Soft Shell Crab roll of some kind and while you can get 1/2 rolls (4-5 pieces) they are clunky monsters, bigger than the size of your mouth and glopped with mayo and eel sauce.   Instead, focus on the sushi.  There are two-order limits on just two kinds of sushi - the amebi (sweet shrimp) and the uni (sea urchin) so make sure you order those to the max.  The uni was great - fresh and creamy and extremely flavorful.  We also really enjoyed the yellowtail and the salmon belly and liked the halibut, aji, and unagi.  With the amebi, request that the heads be fried, because they come to you in a miso soup, which is a nice contrast to all the cold foods you are eating.   Goyemon isn't just about sushi though.  They have a pretty decent hot foods menu to provide some variety to the meal.  The pork belly was tiny in portion and not super tender.  The grilled vegetables are nicely grilled.  They even have udon and a ramen which is only available if you're there late at night.    Make sure to save room for dessert.   Though they have things like green tea icecream or fried icecream, they readily admit those things are store-bought.  They take greater pride in their housemade green tea brulee, which has a sweet, subtle, jiggly matcha pudding with a paper thin brulee on top.  Another delicious dessert is the lychee sorbet, which is store-bought, but really aromatic and a nice palate cleanser.    This is no Nozawa but the quality was really quite good and for the price, unbeatable.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ayce sushi, aji, salmon belly, Cynthia half roll

aUUdqbkWkXht87U88pkFqw.text: Well it was alright, imean seen all he post on Facebook and is was hyped up to much to disappoint me. Service was to slow for me, especially the sushi chef's that really didn't attend to you as you were seated at the bar. I been to few Sushi bars and service is above average and the Sushi Chefs are al over it. So this is way I rated Goyamon 2 stars because of all the hype and came to a disappointment. Won't be going back anytime soon.

pLZcrTihFapeECSQxSRu4w.text: The atmosphere is welcoming and the food is quite compelling. The nigiris were exquisite and fulfilling-tasted like it was fished right out of the ocean (cleaned of course). I loved their rolls-mine came out delicious and had the right amount of everything.  I eat a ton like $100 worth of food and I'm satisfied about the price-I love all you can eat sushi xD  My server was some nerd (goes by kayvinh)--he knew how to keep a conversation and was very friendly. Found out he was a diamond player in league and well all I have to say is hes a diamond server as well

d80lMdfNz5S1uJLeMF6Wwg.text: One of the top three all you can eat (AYCE) sushi places in Las Vegas.  Goyemon has everything I want in a sushi establishment and more.    *shakes butt*  This place will get busy and that's why I come in when when they're at it's slowest or before the dinner rush.  This place doesn't close until 3am but the last seating for all you can eat is 2am.  If I'm ever in the mood for some late night AYCE this is my absolute go to spot.    There is a late night special, the Shoyu ramen is available after 11pm.  It is tasty.  There are other special items available throughout the day as well, look at the board.  I like sitting at the bar because I can ask for more and be served quicker.  The menu is vast and I feel sorry for people who comes here to order rolls, nigiri (sushi pieces) all the way.    Simply put, no fancy stuff here just good quality sushi.  If we were to dine here, don't look at me weird when I start off with 15 orders of Conch (when available) and 15 orders scallop nigiri.  Some servers strictly enforce the time limit rule which is stupid, especially if the restaurant isn't busy at all.    If you get AYCE, you can get a stamp card but they don't always tell you that or remind you.  So you have to bring it up, if you forget your stamp card you can have your receipt stamped and bring it back with your stamp card.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Masago with quail egg.

gE1NoCf4WIIilUXPaGku_w.text: Thanks for redeeming yourself. I went back here 2 weeks ago after having had an unpleasant experience last time.   Sashimi grade went back up to how I first remembered. It tasted much better. Everything else on the menu was really delicious as well. My faith in goyemon has been restored. Yaaaaaaaay.   I will be brining back more people again as long as their quality stays good.

mTnx7Ly8f01XMkeix-0lbA.text: Wow the service had been declining in the last few months  Waited on the waiters for a some time and finally got a drink after half an hour not good seeing how the river makes one thirsty  Waited on my check for what seemed to be an eternity  Maybe I need to check out some other sushi places?  The food read ok but not the quality I have come to know

fa5sdP1jglvT7oQ5UK7odg.text: If you have the privilege of being served by the head chef Hugh (spelled Hidu) you will enjoy your dinner at a level you've never experienced before. The food here is absolutely amazing and the fact we got all you can eat made it even better. We probably would've walked out of here spending around double what we actually payed($60). I very much recommend this sushi place.

EP3eJHNHlMoQjG10Xbf-KA.text: My favorite all you can eat sushi place. The selection of dinner items are awesome and your bound to find something you love. They have a wide selection of appetizers and my favorite has to be the pork belly with the mango salsa. It's a must try. And the nigiri selection is super fresh and my go to is the super white and the garlic tuna. Another reason I love this place is because there is no limit on the number of dessert items you can order!!! Most other ayce have a limit. Unlimited dessert!!!!

2zgGivTUVq7tqnIC1yQj_g.text: One of the best ayce sushi places in Vegas with consistently made dishes and fresh sushi!  Great selection of nigiri, rolls and side dishes makes sure you get your money's worth.  Dessert selection is quite good compared to other places.  Standard pricing for ayce and also take advantage of their lunch specials which are a la carte.  I recommend the deluxe lunch combo which is a large amount of food for little price!

p5dnF7zk0rwF-AR-pp5YvA.text: I actually don't eat much sushi, but I've been meaning to check this out for a while now. I knew they often get very busy and the wait tends to be long, so I called ahead and made sure it wasn't a longer wait than we'd preferred. This was early Saturday evening, and when we arrived, we ended up getting seats at the sushi bar immediately for two, no wait at all. We decided to not go for the all-you-can-eat, and ordered the ecstasy roll, California roll, seared salmon, seared tuna, yellowtail, super white tuna, and the sunrise. My favorite all of them all was the ecstasy roll. There was such good and strong flavor to it, and the seaweed salad with fish eggs on top just made it so much better. The service was great, and orders of the sushi and rolls came out pretty quickly. Would I have waited an hour to eat here? Probably not. But the food wasn't bad.

x1Da8k4xEWMNaPj-PdyYtg.text: The most consistent of all the AYCE spots in Vegas.  Every time I go there, I know it is going to be good and the service is steady.  My favorites are the garlic tuna nigiri, Domingo Roll, and Uni.  The pricing for kids 3 and under is good.  But they don't have a AYCE price for kids between 3 and 12.

yluFenzEJmIrv-k51damvg.text: First time eating here and I had a great dining experience from the beginning to the end. It was a monday night and although almost every table was occupied, it was considered a slow night according to our server. My husband and I were immediately taken to seats at the bar where the real treat begin. Chef Hieu explained the menu to us and gave us his best recommendations. The food selection was amazing and there was a great variety of nigiri. We thoroughly enjoyed everything he served up. The quality of their fish was fresh and we topped it off with some bomb mochi dessert and sake. You can't beat their reasonable all-you-can-eat price either. This is our new go to sushi spot whenever in we're in vegas.

DhlNVh_iR7lnt_wIhjDVvw.text: Best all you can eat sushi in town. Service is always on point. My go to server is Timothy. Always great service ! Sushi is fresh and tasty. Good price for all you can eat, and great variety of rolls. Open until late so you can stop by after a long day at work.

t7NKIl9UmqxoplYr03dWdA.text: I have been to this restaurant twice with my two children.  They are 1 and 4. Both times I had been charged 4 or 5 dollars per child extra. This time we sat down and the waitress demanded I pay full price for a four year old!! Over $25! That is ridiculous!! What horrible service.  Keep in mind if you have a family.

Af6TYBZvXVQSPofuWAAnyQ.text: Came here the other night with a friend because we both were craving sushi. Did the AYCE Dinner for ~$27 with a pitcher of Sapporo, Not bad, walked away paying less than $40. Gets pretty crowded and at peak times, it could be a wait. The place is small, but their quality is  good. I especially like the fact that they're close by my boyfriend's apartment. It can get quite loud with large groups, and other people trying to hear their company. Ample parking, both close to restaurant and in the plaza. If the place is packed, prepare to wait to order and eat. The portion size is great, not just piece but the size, I didn't get too full fast. I still was able to order a small scoop of Lychee sorbet . I was definitely a happy camper after this experience.

eq7nikTjf74iLHkSeSf8Xw.text: Best sushi buffet I've had in a long time!  We sat at the bar and Andrei was our chef. He was very attentive and everything tasted great. Our server was super friendly as well. Even though its away from the strip, I would definitely recommend it! For $27 it's a deal!

dAaB4BBtxVEdqTnae5xMvQ.text: overated,price wise and food. Too much rice for all you can eat. Lots of better places for ayce sushi. Only dishes that are worth eating: 1) White tuna 2) Scallop 3) Pork Belly 4) Tempura

L75zf-b1yc7wLSmedUBayw.text: Outstanding! We are from out of town. This was recommendation for local. We had all you can eat lunch. Fabulous service and everything fresh. Just amazing.

GizfXbI5xMs0PZGJlBEUOA.text: BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI!   I cannot believe I am saying that about a sushi place in Nevada! IN THE DESERT, and I am from Southern California!   You can order half-size orders, so you do not feel too overwhelmed. And it gives you the option to try a variety of sushi rolls.  HANDS DOWN, get the white tuna and lychee dessert at the end!

KlPntNbxmbcGaydNqpduEw.text: Kyuri is so cute she gives great customer service and she makes you feel like you're welcomed.. the food is delicious and it did not take long for our orders to come in I will definitely be coming back here it was our first time and we all enjoyed it

i3kSNlgYkQ_iYvAy6HYrVQ.text: Great food great price. I would definitely come again.   Came to LV with a friend and he insisted this place is better than any in LA....It is !!!!!!

4Ry9NY-VQumt2aIO_glhBg.text: This is the only sushi spot my boyfriend and I will eat sushi in Vegas!  Just be prepared for a long wait time though they text you when your table is ready so not bad at all.

Wx38dEmWj5vmF-Dhnf7Z9Q.text: All you can eat for 27 for dinner. Slightly more expensive than other all you can eat Japanese joints I've been to. All the rules are the same (no left over rice, no sharing, etc). BUT, the good thing is that the nigiris have relatively small amount of rice. And the best thing is that the fish quality is actually commendable. And there was even TORO! And the toro was not the bad quality ones either! The service is slow, and the second round of food comes even slower. But worth the wait for the toro alone!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious nigiri!

fTNmUnU1GAPABZBekecY-w.text: My go to AYCE in Las Vegas! There open till 3am so it's my go to late night spot as well. They always have something new and exciting to try on their chalkboard. Everything is pretty fresh (as fresh as you can get while in the desert) and taste really good! I always go for the Nigiri and the selection is amazing!

O9j3IKcZztJvuIdube8gAw.text: Fish was fresh, rolls are good and the best part, you can get 1/2 rolls (4 pcs) so you can try many rolls!   Try the sashimi salad! I love the dressing that is on it. Stay away from the poke salad. My cubes of tuna was hard.   Service was beyond terrible. There were 2 empty tables for 25 minutes but the hostess said she couldn't seat us until the waitresses/waiters gave her an ok. What?! I was heated before eating my food.   They actually have pretty good food for an ayce place. It's a shame that the service was so bad because even though the food is decent, I will probably not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 order of ecstasy roll &amp; salmon nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke .. not too great
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi Salad. Good!!

2z3ula6B__tPwoJQKdkM4g.text: Have always enjoyed this place it's one of our favorite all you can eat sushi spots but this is the 2nd time we've come here in the past few weeks where we've been turned away for all you can eat. First time we came at 2:35 and we were informed that it "ends" at 2:30. Arrived there tonight at 2am and this time informed it "ends at 2am" what's the point of being open till 3am if your not offering it at 2am let alone no where that states that's your policy?

okSYnvmDugwpjp6M6edz2w.text: I have to update with a star lost unfortunately.   The last few times haven't been as good as before. I think they are suffering from growing pains and staff changes. I do not see my favorite sushi guys and I know one in particular does not work here anymore. While the food is still made right and the cuts were decent, it lost that personal, familiar charm and the new guys didn't make an effort to really talk. It was busy, so fair point that they may not have had the opportunity so maybe something will change again, with time.  The big thing for us was the rice has been too warm on visits of late. Last time it was affecting the fish that it was not appetizing. While I get they are busy, they should have someone making and properly cooling rice throughout. It happened twice at a busy but not line out the door rush time. The second time severely changed out love for this place.   We will probably come during a off time again and see what happens. I still thought the fish was fresh, I like the rotating specials and the many delicious dessert options.  As of right now, the changes has made this spot suffer a bit for me so it'll be a while until we are back. I'm hoping in that time they figure out how to deal with their popularity and adjust the way they do things to keep a standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panna cotta
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aji, cajun tuna, conch, jalapeno tobiko (daily specials)
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bonito w/ black tobiko (daily special)

yrX99mGPdmnSysVUUTb3RQ.text: Summary:  Great price, nice decor, delicious food.  Decor: Not too tight but definitely not a big restaurant. All the little Japanese touches you would expect like a samurai sword in the restroom. (Sarcasm).  Service: Fast and friendly service, every time we ordered things came out within 5 minutes. Drinks included in AYCE. We arrived early on a Friday night around 5 so there was no wait but when we left there was a line for bigger parties.   Food: They have daily specials that switch throughout the night which is great. We got to try out the Salmon belly which was not on the menu. The Uni and Sweet Shrimp although only one order per person on the AYCE menu us delicious. The best sushi for me on that is not one per person was the Snow Crab Meat, very sweet and delicious.  Price: The quality and freshness of ingredients backs up the 26.95 per person at night.   Final Thoughts: Look at the photos on Yelp and try more! Delicious!

IDJQaZH2YPjZQu9YG225Jw.text: I can eat here everyday...  so many selections and the sushi chefs are so nice! My favorite are the nigiri (super white and salmon) and veggie rolls! The match cremebrulee and mango mochi? YASS! Just be ready to be on a long wait on the weekends BUT! It's worth it:)

vilFlfa1DtL--yyYkBiChg.text: I had the dinner AYCE on a thursday night for ~32. Although it says only 1hr, we ate for 1.5 hrs. no rush.  - No wait time. I came here before and I had to wait 45min to be seated, so we left. This time we were seated right away. It's hit or miss.  - 1 TV. If you want to watch a game, they have sports on at the bar. - Fancier than sushi mon. If you have eaten there, the sushi plates look a lot prettier. - Ordered and served to me. Service was quick to average. Took 5 to 10 mins to get my orders in. Got them in bundles.  - I recommend the ecstasy with orgasm sauce, spider, volcano, lemon roll?. avoid fukomaki. It wasted tummy space.  - No salmon skin roll or any kind of hand roll? did i miss something? I got it at sushi mon. :/ - For non-sushi, get the gyoza, grilled yellow tail, and pork belly. avoid the shumai. it's really tiny and mushy.   - After awhile, sushi got mushy, red dragon. Probably bc I was getting stuffed. lol.I drank it down was a really hot miso soup that hit the spot.  - Great desserts! I had tempura ice cream and strawberry mochi. There's  also green tea ice cream and creme brulee. way better than sushi mon.   ^___^!

pY4acIlZXG_LukX9Sct8Gw.text: Delicious choices on AYCE menus...so many delicious rolls to choose from. Also, a "must have" is the pork belly...yummy!  Our server was very courteous and helpful with it being our first time there.  Give this place a try. The place is a bit small, and could get easily crowded, but waiting for a table is very well worth the wait!

Y7dZiYFXGv2ZM2qwAYS3gg.text: This place is known for it's all-you-can-eat fare, but I went here for lunch. Their lunch specials are not bad: the presentation of the food was nice, however the sashimi cuts were not fresh at all. If there's one thing I can't abide, it's bad seafood. Not only is it dangerous, but it's appalling.   Despite that, the wait staff was very nice and prompt.

t2GV-XJMm1Ze-Zw0322pSw.text: This place is a must try for AYCE sushi in Vegas!  My husband I have been going here for a little over a year now, and have learned a couple of things after a few (we'll leave it at a few) visits.  First thing, come early or be ready to wait.  We usually come on the weekends and if you come during peak hours you could be waiting up to an hour sometimes (still worth the wait BTW).  Second, always do AYCE even if you think you're not that hungry.  The a la carte prices can get pricey and you're probably going to end up at the cost of the AYCE anyways.  Plus, be adventurous.  We love the AYCE here partly because you can try something without fear of not liking it.  Sushi house goyemon offers a loyalty card where you buy 10 AYCE and get the 11th free, so plenty of reason to come back.  The sushi at Goyemon is fresh and they are very generous.  I mostly stick with the Nigiri and the rolls which you can't go wrong with.  I'd also recommend trying the sashimi salad, rice cracker, and pork belly (mmmm pork belly!).  The desserts are a perfect ending to the meal, especially the mochi and the green tea creme brulee.  The service is just OK (thus 4 stars instead of 5).  I understand that they are busy on the weekends, but I usually find myself practically having to wave my hands in the air to get attention from our server.  A little more attention would have been much appreciated.  Overall, the food is outstanding while the service could be a bit better.  Still your best option in Vegas for AYCE sushi, hands down...4 stars.

QSfcE_Ek1txje-4RyFdqmw.text: After first round of ordering some stuffs for a party of six of us. We were ready to order again then an Asian male server asked us by quote "are you guys sure you can finish all of that?" ... *moment of silence* ... Are you kidding me? Im not trying to be mean but what kind of server ask that question in a AYCE restaurant. Shithead. I used to be a server and no empathy for him. Totally ruined our appetite and experience about the place. We came in at 10 and we were waiting till 11PM just to try to ramen. 10 minute in the ramen and the female host asked us to leave for we have sit there for too long according to them. WTF? I hope your business run-well on that kind of attitude. Never come back even they might be the best AYCE in town.

-qO1hcCqLzesryY0G6BBhw.text: Sorry people - I have to update this because I went again for dinner, and it was the worst visit yet.  I've had enough and I don't think I will be going there again.  The service, while decent when we first got there,  went significantly bad the longer we stayed, and my party of 4 was only there for the allotted hour, even though there were many people there who had been there long before me.  The last 20 minutes we flat out got ignored, and once some of us got dessert, we were shoved the check and pushed out the door to leave.  The food also worse, but the nigiri was still solid, and the only reason why I am giving this 2 stars.  The cooked fish was still extremely dry, the pork belly was cold and rubbery, all of the cooked chicken dishes tasted very bad quality.  With all the other solid places in town, I don't understand why people still keep coming back here, and that includes the yelp elite groupies who have the grammar skills of a monkey and can't write a decent review. They all think they are extra special and try to get treated better because of it, then inflate their reviews of Goyemon higher than it should be.  And honestly if that's the case, shame on them.

71kMuGZtvKJpX7RcAg3Swg.text: Went in for dinner tonight asked if we could watch the world series and the server said sorry its on a set channel we are not allowed to change it. Last time I go back

UX-KLSsD_jYuSpInwqJx8w.text: Wow!! really.... rice for nigiri its insane. They put so much rice that I cant even break a part with my chopsticks. Well I come here once a week and I always leave 30%-40%tip. I guess they don't want us come here. Thx for the all service I will never return here

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MmLZEqipeG7HYHn9z9DY3g.text: I would like to leave no star for the overall experience.  Cons  - Emptied dishes never be picked up on table even the table is covered with emptied dishes. - Staffs are unfriendly and completely ignore the customers. They walk away even they see you waving your hands for request. - Foods take more than 20mins even the business goes slow. - Mochi ice creams take 40mins to arrive including the time we request for the desserts twice.  Pros - The dishes are served in a very decent good portion.  Lastly, I personally do not refer this buffet restaurant to any of my friends. I own a customer service - oriented business in north Cali. I seriously concern about their quality of business if I'm the boss of this place when I know my staffs are ruining the reputation of the business.    I hope the owner of this business can take my advice and observe the quality of your staffs. Thanks.

iYB3kUf8cKO5dsdCzaj2fA.text: On a late Thursday night, a friend and I were looking for a bite to eat, so after a quick search, we decided to try out Sushi Goyemon.  We saw online that they close at 3:00 am, which is usually the case for many sushi places in Vegas. We arrived at 2:15 am, and the sign on their door says that last call is at 2:30 am, so we still had time to order. We were seated and we ordered the chicken teriyaki bowl and green tea ice cream. Two simple items that tasted fine. However, I was in the middle of my meal and at 2:45 am, the woman who seated us approached us and humbly said, "Sorry, I don't mean to rush you, but can you hurry up so I can close the restaurant?" I thought we had had 15 minutes left, but I guess the entire staff wanted to go home, so they decided to rush us so they could close early. I wasn't even finished eating! We saw another table leave very shortly after that, and we were the only two left, with the rest of the staff just standing there watching us, waiting for us to leave. It wasn't even 3:00 am yet, but we left at 5 'til. I guess they actually close at 2:30 am instead. I took the rest of my food to-go, and we left. Don't visit this place if you're looking for common courtesy.

nPl33-yjeGja3qnDjZledA.text: Love this place and sushi chef Mike.  He makes the best Tekka Maki (Tuna Roll) in town!  Many all-you-can-eat places use cheap products, but not here.  The quality is great.  The service is also excellent.  Even though we only go there about once a month, they always remember us and bring us our correct drink order.  The only downside is the wait for dinner can be very long.

afGHCTD_ap5JH9NYpgtVcA.text: We loved it! Price was good, fish was fresh, lots of variety. We would come back. I think we like JJanga a little better.

iHf6w2ahZr1cC5cEbtk4tg.text: save your money and just go somewhere else. if you have tha patience go to yama sushi instead. these clowns here take your order verbally which can only lead to a bad experience smh. ps there was hella rice on tha nigiri. and they lack on special rolls like tha baked lobster roll

psQ9LcBVWKAKw-xZ7HaLOg.text: Oh sweet dear lord Jesus they're open late and it's All-you-can-eat sushi! And how the hell do they offer pretty much THE ENTIRE MENU. It does cost more than your typical AYCE sushi joint, but DAMN is it way better!  27 for dinner is the price of admission to this wonderland of fish. They have a bunch of daily specials that you are more than welcome to try. My head was spinning trying to pick what I wanted, but then I slapped myself into reality to focus on the sushi, particularly the nigiri!  The nigiri here are pretty small which means I can eat a shitload of them! My favorites were the Ama-ebi (sweet shrimp) served with the deep fried head, the salmon, the hamachi (yellowtail), and the kanpachi (amperjack which was one of the daily specials). I didn't want to try the numerous other things, but next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely try more.   I mean HEY, be happy! Come here late at night, have some sushi and just chill! This place is definitely worth trying if you're feeling for some AYCE sushi in Vegas. I wasn't disappointed!

KvTXVXFQlVwsO9Gy5KmhfA.text: Thanks Yelpers for another wonderful suggestion. While I don't partake in the AYCE, the menu items have a been really freaking good. I don't know what they do to the tempura shrimp but I am addicted! The best part is that the rolls are not only super-tasty but they're not overly huge with too much rice. It's the perfect stuff-your-gob size and allows me to get two rolls instead of just one. Yum!!!

-ik6zQCPCoro7WFRpouWGg.text: I was surprised I hadn't reviewed Goyemon before - I've been neglectful and aim to make up for it now.  We were craving sushi, and with so many good AYCE places in town we decided on one of our favorites, Sushi House Goyemon on Decatur.  Yes, we knew better and still we arrived at 7 PM.  After a wait of about 1.5 hours (I swear, it's worth it to satisfy your AYCE sushi craving) we were seated.  The guys took a picture of the specials board and then simply decided they wanted one of everything (not including dessert).  I perused the on-line menu earlier that day (the anticipation was killing me) and decided I would focus on trying various rolls besides having a few of my favorites.  Let me start by sharing with you that I was especially happy with the AYCE in that you can order 1/2 a roll (four pieces).  Who needs more justification than that?  I started with Sexy Girl:  a harmony of shrimp tempura, crab meat & cucumber with a generous kiss of spicy tuna and scallop yum yum on top, then sprinkled with tempura crumbs, a spicy garlic and spicy eel sauce.  I was very happy with the ratio of fish to rice.  My very scientific measurement is if I can put one whole piece in my mouth.  Too much rice and there is no way I can; just the right amount and it fits like a glove.  Slightly warm and sooo good!   I'll sheepishly admit I ordered a 2nd 1/2 roll as my last item of the evening.  I quickly ordered my favorite nigiri, hamachi (yellow tail).  It was so fresh and delicate and just beautiful.  Mmmm...  I ordered the garlic tuna as well, which I enjoyed but truthfully like the garlic sauce a bit more at some other places.  The pork belly with mango salsa is a must have when we go - it never disappoints!  Succulent and juicy on the inside, charred on the outside pairs perfectly with the sweet mango salsa.  Time for a palate cleanser!  No Name roll was perfect - Spicy tuna and asparagus that still has a nice bit are blanketed by the delicate flavors of yellow tail.  This roll is served cold and is bland compared to others.  The fish sing in this composition, and it was really quite refreshing.  My husband and I shared a bowl of octopus poki (good, just not one of my favorites) and I snagged a piece of his unagi (eel) as well as a piece of someone's Red Dragon (spicy tuna, cucumber, & avocado with eel and eel sauce on top).  I really wanted to try dessert, I really did.  But I couldn't.  My belly was very happy and very full.

CdrbBX_OXs6Dx-N3I1QkkQ.text: I gave them 4 stars on my first visit for dinner AYCE.....and I was hoping that it would be as good for lunch AYCE....no such luck.  It was atrocious, revolting excuse for sushi.  When I walked in, I had a bad feeling when I saw two latino looking sushi chefs at the tsukeba.  Not that I have anything against non-japanese itamae, but from my fairly vast experience....it's not a good sign in general and boy was I right.    Since I'm Japanese, I don't order any rolls.  I always go with straight nigiri, none of those yum yum sauce, fancy rolls bulshit and here are what's wrong with their "sushi".  1)  It was ugly.  Cuts of fish were uneven, too small, and were just very asymmetrical and poorly balanced with rice.  When you have two pieces and they look so different, there is a significant lack in their sense of aesthetics, and more importantly, utter luck of skill.  2)  Sushi rice was horrendous.  To make things worse, there were 2 sushi "chefs" and they seem to be using very inconsistent sushi rice.  One was soft and overly sticky, and the other was dry and hard.  Neither of them had proper vinegar flavor, and was too bland to be called "sushi rice".  They obviously have no idea or skill to make proper sushi rice, which is just as, if not MORE important than the fish that goes on it.    3)  Utter lack of nigiri skill.  Sushi rice was too hard.  You had to chew it.  That is what happens to amateurs and newbies who do not have the proper skills to maintain shape of nigiri while having enough air within it so that if falls apart in the mouth.  4)  The wasabi issue- I was embarrassed for them.  My first order of nigiris had no wasabi.  So I asked the waitress (non-japanese) that I need to have wasabi in the sushi.  She comes back 2 minutes later that "most people" don't want wasabi so the "chefs" cannot put wasabi in the nigiri.  Let me repeat "THE CHEFS CANNOT PUT WASABI IN THE NIGIRI"  Let me make this straight.  In Japan, the sushi chefs will occasionally make UPON REQUEST nigiris WITHOUT wasabi for little children, I mean like kindergarden aged kids. Never do they even consider NOT putting wasabi for adults.  So I tell this non Japanese waitress that I don't care what "most people" want.  I want wasabi in the nigiri so that I don't have to peel the fish off of rice and have to put it on there, and it is the PROPER way to make a nigiri.  So she goes back and talks with this "chefs" and they finally comply with my "request" to make a proper nigiri WITH wasabi.    It's very unfortunate that whoever the Japanese sushi chef is there allows these "sushi chefs" to let these joke of a sushi out to customers under their roof.  I asked the waitress if there are any Japanese chefs at lunch time and she says that it depends on their schedule, sometimes yes, sometimes not.  Well if a real chefs can't be there to properly supervise these jokers then they might as well close down the restaurant instead of allowing these atrocious nigiri's out to the customers who may have the palate and knowledge of what a real sushi should be like.    The management should be embarrassed with what went on today.  If people think that this kind of atrocity is sushi, then I am truly saddened.  There are better restaurants with real japanese sushi chefs in this town who serve decent AYCE sushi.  But if people have numb enough palates to keep going here then so be it.

Gb4f0vFglyx62Z0A2r3DwA.text: First of all, I don't like to give bad reviews, and I generally consider myself a patient person, but I came here after working a 13 hour shift and I was starving. Gave my name to the host for a table for two, waited a good 15 mins, gentleman who comes in after, gets seated before me, really? Um ok? Finally seated and drink orders placed, my iced green tea tastes like dirty water. Then we order a couple things (I generally don't do AYCE sushi because I find the fish isn't good) so I opted to do a la carte for my first visit. I don't like rolls with mayo, or dairy, or sauces like "orgasm sauce". I immediately noticed the rice to fish ratio was way off, fish was dry, rice was dry. Great.   Now let me get to the service.....we couldn't get our server to come around once, the cutest little old lady sitting at the table next to us flagged a server down for her check and then told them that we needed our server as well. Again, never saw her. At this point it's when I contemplated walking out and leaving money for what I thought we owed. Service was atrocious. Never refilled my drink and couldn't order any more food, which was probably a good thing. I will never give this place a second try or recommend. Overrated.

qmcazEFYWKIw1GeSrko0GQ.text: I went here yesterday and we received it order really fast. We got two rolls ( puffy and lemon) and a chirash(fish and sushi rice) salad. My partner has a shellfish allergy and we like to split. I asked to ensure that only fish was only the salad and informed the waiter of the shellfish allergy. However, we had octopus in the salad (yes the is a part of shellfish allergys). I just wish it had all of the ingredients listed in the fish salad before I ordered it. Regardless the rolls we ordered were  a million times better than the salad. I can't wait to eat the puffy roll again. I like that the rolls are not too cold and you can tell your rice is fresh. Additionally, they have pictures on their menu! I would definitely come back.

w9XVec6V2m1OCRJCQVsWrg.text: I came in about a week ago & had one of the best experiences with customer service in my life . Joe S. Was fantastic.  He was efficient . He was fast . He was polite & well spoken . I truly felt like I had been to this place more than once . I will be back over & over . Thank you Joe!

NaLIiQzJLBifwqnQNiTNgg.text: Terriyaki Chicken Bowl...Freakin' Amazing! I would move to Vegas for this alone. My daughter is a huge fan of their Alaskan Roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xIjxTAKYVp5ZY8fJHOFmvg.text: This is the BEST all you can eat sushi place I've been to. I always attempt to make a trip over here when I'm in Vegas. It is off-strip, but not too far either. It's worth the quick taxi or uber ride. It is slightly cheaper during lunch time, so that's the time you want to go. It's only $22 for all you can eat, which is a serious bargain compared to some of the restaurants on the strip.   Seriously go here if you're in Vegas. It's a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi so fresh!

ZpiMPqXkuHzhC2b3XG5diQ.text: I'm from Northern California and we only have a handful of AYCE sushi spots out there. Goyemon definitely hit the spot and has a more extensive menu than I've seen out there.  Along with that is the friendly service. 5 stars in my book as I watch my bodybuilding friend work on his 30th order. And theres always room for ice cream.

DCokFMXTTVXTJYDIUJDdTA.text: What a disappointment.  My party arrived around midnight on a Friday night. The restaurant was packed and on initial appearance looked to have been a great, late night dinner selection. Sadly, the entire evening went south from there. We were a group 3 and were first in queue to be sat. The hostess had us slotted with a wait time of 20 minutes. That 20 minutes passed, and passed, and passed.. all the while the hostess was loudly talking to the table beside her about drugs and other college influences.   The 20 minutes ended up taking over an hour, and finally when a table to seat 3 was available.. the hostess was nowhere to be seen.  The hostess reappears and looked to be doing some sort of "paperwork". After waiting about 5 minutes I decided to walk up to her and ask "excuse me.. can we sit here now?". She continues working on whatever she is doing and spouts "oh that's reserved for a group that's waiting". Confused.. I look around, and SURPRISE, there are no other groups but my party.  She looked up, finally acknowledging me, and says "oh are you the party for 'X'?" ..... that should have been my queue to cut my losses and just leave.. I'm the fool.  Turns out she was closing out her to-go orders so that she could leave. You know we waited an hour, and you knew the table was open... I figured common sense was... common.  Let's get to the food and service. The waitress was quick to bring us drinks and take our initial order.  The food also came out in a timely fashion.  The first bite was underwhelming. The nigiri tasted like pre-made sushi. The rolls were better than the nigiri, but not by much. Every single roll broke apart causing the dreaded soy sauce rice pool.   Do not order the seared salmon. It's definitely pre-made. It comes out cold and they put so much ponzu sauce on it that it's nearly inedible.  The 2nd and 3rd orders took far too long to process. You need to wave down your waitress and endure them telling you to wait for any and everything. I know serving is a difficult job, I was a server for many years, but she took no time to check up on us.  If you want sushi... avoid this place.. subpar sushi with terrible service. If you like to be frustrated then this is the place for you!  Note: I forgot my retainer at our table and decided to cut my losses... I'd rather buy a new retainer than to ever step inside this establishment again.

X-LnFyz_vUed2cqnADNx9A.text: Came by today around 11:45am and it was fairly empty. Place started to fill up around 12:15pm to 12:45pm.   $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner AYCE  The fish quality here is pretty good. I would say that it is on par with some of the best AYCE sushi spots back in SoCal, if not better. The ratio between fish & rice was perfect. It was not too much fish or not too much rice. The rolls were a bit disappointing though. The presentation was not quite as good as I expected and the taste was whatever. I would recommend ordering from the starters (miso soup, seaweed salad, etc), nigiri, or hand rolls.   The service was pretty good. I read some reviews before heading here and was expecting the worst service known to man, but it was the exact opposite. There was a bus boy continuously running around clearing our table and filling our waters. We had 2 separate waiters constantly checking on us and putting in our orders. Our orders were coming out only a few minutes after we placed them (consistently).   My girlfriend pointed out a sign that mentioned that they were out of "Uni until further notice due to bad season"

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow Roll

aJd5csuotkB4z6Log7IVwg.text: Nice decoration and feel. Ordered sesame chicken, they brought out a plate of regular chicken with no seasoning, no sauce, not even any sesame seeds. I took a bite already curious and there was no flavor, nothing, they proceeded to tell me that was their sesame chicken and has been. Cancelled my order and refused to eat anything else, the chicken alone wasn't even good so I didn't want to even try it with any other "sauce" if they even have any sauce

J9fEniPtL7f0iUMLnmo7Hg.text: One of my favorite sushi ayce restaurants in Vegas. Been here a couple times and it hasn't disappoint. No smelly fishes. Good proportion of rice to meat. Im not a fan of Uni but its pretty darn fresh here. The pork belly was good. If you feel like drinking, I recommend getting a lychee bottle to share. Its pretty smooth.

9e4IKqoYlr0F3wMzXvGlYA.text: Giving this place a solid 4 star rating relative to their competitors. I felt like they did a decent job and the fish quality was good enough to warrant a trip back. It was a buddy and myself. We sat at the bar to be closer to the Thursday night football game. There's only a small tv in here, so if you are looking for a place to watch the game, probably better to look else where.   Our first mistake was not ordering a ton right off the bat. By the time we ordered and got our second round, we had lost momentum and stem to do some damage. I would recommending knowing exactly what you want and ordering a larger volume of it. We wanted to try a variety of items but it was a clear mistake. Best to order 2-3 types of nigiri then do a bunch of orders for each.   The big thing with places like this is they perform really well at the beginning to draw high reviews but once they are somewhat established, they start to take a nose dive on the quality front.

eAUuOaqU1QO10ONwgucGRg.text: Their AYCE is really good! All the rolls that I tried were delicious. They even have a spicy roll that is my Everest! I love spicy food, but I've met my match when it comes to spicy rolls.  The space is a little tight & there may be a wait. But for the most part, you can get seated right away.  This is away from Chinatown, so this is good place to go if you're craving some AYCE sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get in my belly =P

3fom5yfSYamlDxd3SrPbig.text: Spent the last few days yelping sushi spots in the valley because I wanted my diet break meal to be epic!  Goyeman was very good. The taste, quality and wide selection of sushi met my expectations as you fellow Yelpers have reviewed. My wife and I both got the AYCE. I got 3 specialty rolls, 2 nigiri, and 3 side dishes including ice cream tempura. The wife got 3 specialty rolls as well.   I have eaten at a couple AYCE sushi spots in the valley but my wife had never been with me. When we go to buffets she tends to like to sample a bunch of different things and often leaves some on the plate if she didn't like it (and YES I get on her about wasting food). Anyways, Goyeman BLEW MY MIND when they charged her extra for NOT finishing her rolls. So 2 of the 8 piece rolls she ate 4 pieces of each. So in addition to the AYCE price, they charged us the 1/2 the price of each roll. I've never seen anything like it in my life! I thought the waitress was messing with us until she pulled out a little plastic card by the menus and it outlined the same.   I don't eat anything with cheese or mayo so I couldn't touch them. I would have eaten them and saved us the additional $10 if I could.   When that happens they let you take the additional pieces home. We were going to run some errands when we left and it was 98 today so taking the sushi with us did us no good and it was thrown away 2 hours later.  If I find out other AYCE sushi spots in the valley do this strange charge thing, I'll come back and change my review to a 5. But I did not appreciate paying more for rolls we didn't eat. One of them, she legitimately didn't even like. So because you order it you gotta pay? I just can't wrap my head around it...  So good sushi for sure but as of now, definitely will NOT be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider Roll (right) and Royal California Roll. Very tasty!

8DA3S0-wC-rPJNvqT5cdFA.text: Goyemon is one of the best sushi spots in Vegas. They have a huge assortment of rolls and make all kinds of nigiri. When it comes to seafood, there's not a lot that I'm willing to eat so I appreciate their large selection of menu items to choose from. I personally love their spider hand rolls, the sexy girl roll, and yellowtail (hamachi) nigiri. They also have specials written on the chalkboard for things like salmon collar and yellowtail collar which I highly recommend.   When Goyemon first opened, they had some really unique appetizers and amazing desserts. Over the past year or so, these specialties have almost disappeared altogether. Their dessert selection is nowhere near as good as it used to be. They used to have things like green tea creme brulee and chocolate mouse in addition to the typical sushi house selection of ice cream and mochi. I know its a little silly call out a sushi place for its dessert, but it was one of the things that was great about this place that set it apart from its competitors.   Anyhow, back to the sushi. They are a great option for AYCE (all you can eat). If you think you'll eat more than 2 orders of rolls, then you might as well go AYCE. It includes appetizers, all the nigiri, the rolls, ice cream, and mochi.   As Goyemon is a very popular spot, the wait time for dinner can often be well over 30 minutes. If you come with a large group or eat here often, be sure to ask for a stamp card. From experience, I know you can use the stamp card at the two Sushi Mon locations as well. If the wait at Goyemon is too long, I'd recommend calling the Sushi Mon on Sahara and checking their wait time as the menus are exactly the same, though the specials might vary.

-AY_EfzGjFKmZuEtVamwLA.text: The sushi rolls and nigiri were good. The service was slow and took time for orders to come out. When we asked the waiter for the daily specials, we were told to go up front to take the picture of the whiteboard.

z0slmm32GxL-DNCUoGsmJA.text: The first ayce sushi restaurant I've been to about 5 years ago, and I'm surprised I never got to review this place!  Right off the bat- I'd like to say that it's best to go during lunch (specifically when they just open) because it's a pretty small spaced restaurant and it's quite popular. **It's a 99% chance you'll be on the wait list during dinner!**  The wifey and I went during lunch an hour before dinner started and there was probably only about 3 tables open out of like.. (guesstimating) 8 tables + the sushi bar. We had gotten seated immediately from a young and kind waitress, and was serviced quickly for beverages.  She had went for the lunch special chicken teriyaki bowl, about $5.50-$6. And I of course went with the all-you-can-eat which is around the same price as every other lunch ayce $21-$22.  The quality of the sushi is top notch (ayce standards). My fav, garlic tuna nigiri, was so freshly garlic'd that it didn't even need to be bedded in a generous portion of the garlic ponzu(?) sauce.  & Fish to rice ratio: not so bad. About 8/10. All of my orders came quickly as well and the two servers + busperson were attentive and even paid attention if I made eye contact with them so that they can come and help. That's very rare!   We finished at 3:45pm (yes, we're quick eaters) and when the check came they had mischarged me for dinner ayce price! But after letting our main server know, she apologized and charged me for lunch. We also got a stamp card too and can be used for their sister restaurants as well! (I believe the only sister restaurant I know from them is Monta Ramen).  Overall really great service and pretty good sushi! I recommend for lunch special + ayce lunch forsure. Thank you Goyemon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great lunch special options/pricing!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She said there was so much chicken on top!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fav nigiri choices! From top to bottom: Eel (Unagi), Crab and Garlic Tuna.

giiE1kixXJ0Y7__px_aEjg.text: Best AYCE in Vegas, great service, huge menu, high quality, consistent. I  have been coming here for years, never a bad meal

Hp3brbvSKVzRalulPOXlmw.text: Love! Let's start off with the service...  Hieu was a chef and he was amazing - was very accommodating to all our request at such a prompt manner. You could tell with the quality of the food with the passion behind the chefs.  Our server yuki was also great, she was very kind and we didn't have to wait very long for our tea and soda.   The food was yummy! We ordered the yellow tail seared...it was sooooo yummy and zesty! We also ordered baked mussel and it very buttery and good.  The shitaki was perfectly grilled and it almost melted in our mouth. The cold tofu was also delicious! Thinly sliced.  I would recommend this to anyone in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider roll
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry sake
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese!

BPO04EgIRqbXgtgivrZnrw.text: One of my favorite sushi places in town. They make the cajun albacore just how I like it with a little lemon. Service is quick and good value for AYCE.

6D2OK8rQScYPgw9Vi_k5qA.text: The amount of love I have for this place is truly sickening!  This has been my go-to sushi spot for the past 6 years.   First off, I'm not a seaweed fan... I was scarred by seaweed in my childhood lol.  So I only eat tempura rolls and/or nigiri (and appetizers).  I love that the AYCE includes appetizers, and now ramen as well too!  My husband and I come here on a monthly basis.  We both do the AYCE and order a ton of appetizers.  Some of our favorites are: spicy tuna cracker (FAVORITE!!), garlic edamame, teriyaki chicken (hit or miss), shrimp tempura (2 pieces/order), vegetable tempura, udon noodles, and pork belly with mango salsa (hit or miss).  My favorite nigiri here is the cajun albacore nigiri.  The food comes out family-style, meaning it just comes out as it is done.  So we usually order everything at once.  They have a specials board.  Some of our favorites have been the lemon salmon nigiri, chocolate mousse, cookies-n-cream ice cream, and the sesame mochi (favorite!!).  We haven't seen the sesame mochi in forever.  That was the best dessert ever!  That's the sad thing about specials... you get attached to temporary items!   We love this place so much that we had our rehearsal dinner here.  That time, we were sat in the private room on the left.  It was a chaotic night with some food being served to the wrong tables and missing items.  But we were a party of 20, so I understand.   Service is hit or miss here.  It just depends on who your server is.  This is why I am giving this place 4 stars.  Also because of the inconsistency.  The food doesn't always taste the same, and sometimes it's cold.  More often than not though, everything is great.  If you are going to order a lot of sushi/nigiri, I would highly suggest sitting at the sushi bar!  Your food comes out much quicker, and it's cool to watch the sushi chefs!  Make sure you come during dinner, as they don't have the full appetizer menu available during lunch.  Also, be sure to ask for a stamp card.  For every 10 AYCE meals purchased, you get a free meal.

HD9TIzpBSxjU-zwemz5Z_w.text: Tried their lunch special, 2 regular rolls + miso soup + small salad for $8.50.  GREAT lunch special if you are looking for a quick lunch bite. Their special rolls are also very good.

2eOAuo2k5mVBLQ2J2fDSeQ.text: So, I've been to this place 3 times and all three have been negative experiences. I'm going to focus on this last time because that's really what made me never want to go back. First of all, the wait is always long. Perhaps that's because the wait staff takes forever to care for the costumers. After waiting 30 mins we finally get a table. I ordered a tempura box for the kids, my boyfriend had the "all you can eat" and i myself ordered a roll. We ordered waters but had to wait for our waiter to come back because he didn't think to leave any straws. Most of the stuff my boyfriend kept trying to order they didn't have and were already out of.... umm why not mention that when the costumer orders all u can eat?? It was getting late and our waiter pretty much disappeared. I had to ask someone else for a box and the check. I got the box (no plastic bag to go with it, I guess you ask for that separately) and the check but after 10 mins and still no sign of our waiter I decided to get up, walk to the front and get a plastic bag and pay the check. Needless to say we didn't leave a tip. Despite of how some of the service industry people might feel, you are not entitled to a tip, you earn one. There's been times when the waiter was so good, I tipped more than my bill to encourage that waiter/waitress to continue to provide good service. This waiter never came by to check up on us, no water refills and I had to walk up and pay my own check because he literally disappeared. Half the time I spent sitting there was waiting for my waiter to reappear, maybe this is why it takes forever to get a table. Either way, I personally don't plan to come back, there's many other good sushi places in town where they appreciate repeated costumers. Believe me there's nothing special about this place. Food is good but not worth the hassle.

MJ40tJ6d8ErMdZsGqnAizw.text: One of the best for AYCE, if you want to have a great time with great food do not miss out on this place. The seating is limited so if you have large parties try to be early or expect to wait. They have a white board with sushi specials that change each time I eat there. I find this to be one of the best for the price at around 30$ for dinner with AYCE. Love this place

NkmqfS__QSlDYrQVmi7s1w.text: Fish was fresh and staff was friendly. That's about it. My wife and I had the ayce sushi which was decent but, rice was on the lower quality side. My son had the tonkatsu special combo dinner. The meat was dry, they had no sauce and tried to substitute with unagi sauce, and the rice that came with it was even a lower quality than the sushi rice. Probably won't be back.

7f-9qnXch7CR9q-vJAR3ig.text: Best AYCE sushi buffet!!! The wait is long because the restaurant is very small. I think the capacity of seats were only 60 people, if I saw it correctly.  But being small allows the staff to be more attentive, which was great!  The wait was around 90 minutes, but it was worth the wait.  Also, they have an awesome system that allows you to track your standing.  It's different from other AYCE buffets.  The servers still come and take your order and all you have to do is stuff your faces lol.    The quality of food is awesome. Everything on their menu was fresh and enjoyable. Some of the ones that we enjoyed the most were the fresh salmon nigiris, shrimp tempera, eel, 911, and something ruby roll.  Make sure you get the half(4pieces) orders so you can try as many as you can.   Seriously, I think I was so stuffed to the point I felt sick... which I don't recommend but it was definitely worth the visit.  Will probably make it our go to place in vegas!   Oh, and don't forget the Mochi ice cream and Lychee sorbet!!! Perfect ending to the meal.
