k4kOeSi5pH2YQHG42Rwnvg.text: Recently revisited this place and quality has drastically changed for the worse... I was sitting at the sushi bar and also encountered, cross contamination of different fish and tamago(egg) that was being saved for the next day...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ThN-NNURKDayOF_QF4-JYQ.text: The sushi restaurant has its own rules to choose, eat no more than 45 minutes, but they sushi let me wait for 30 minutes ,service is very poor, and will not laugh she looks very angry, so I feel very uncomfortable I don't come back anymore

wNsXHx06vgIvxfWaIyG5iQ.text: Living in Dayton, OH, you experience first world problems like not being able to find a wide selection of sushi, let alone good quality sushi whenever you want it.  As such, it became somewhat of a moral imperative that the wife and I get our fill of sushi while in town.  After a little Yelp research and based on the recommendations of trusted local Yelpers, we ventured off-Strip for lunch at Sushi House Goyemon on a Tuesday.  We arrived around noon, the dining room was a little over half full, but all of the seats at the bar were open.  We sat at the bar and the adventure began.  With almost 1500 reviews, there isn't much more that I can add to the discussion.  You either like sushi or you don't.  The concept of AYCE sushi made to order appeals to you or it doesn't.  One more opinion likely isn't going to sway your dining decision.  Goyemon's AYCE sushi for lunch ($21.95) and dinner ($26.95) seemed a buck or two less expensive than its peer competitors.  Although the lunch didn't offer items like uni, which I love, I was fine with not having it as an option for lunch.  Their Daily Special nigiri selections were outstanding and more than made up for any items excluded from on the lunch menu.  The special salmon belly was mindblowing with its fatty, almost butter like flavor and the special Mentaiko (a marinated fish roe) was something that I'd never seen offered before even at high-end places like Nobu and Morimoto.  It was great trying something completely new.  Service was fast and friendly as our orders came out at a steady rate.  The most important thing about any sushi joint is the freshness of its seafood.  Goyemon had amazingly fresh seafood.  No strange or fishy smells, only that of the ocean.  The quality and freshness of the seafood was on par with high-end places, but at a fraction of the price.  It certainly beat anything we could find in Dayton.  I truly understand why Sushi House Goyemon is a favorite among locals.  If you love sushi, I highly recommend this place for lunch, but I also imagine it's great for dinner, too, which is something I'm sure we'll try the next time the wife and I are in town.

Jb-rkmeT_Wde7Nj5pkm2hQ.text: The death of an all star. Being SoCal natives, Goyemon would be one of our priorities when visiting our favorite Vegas food spots. We remembered Goyemon for their fresh appetizers, awesome desserts, and their amazing nigiri.   A favorite of ours was the grilled pork belly, it would come fresh from the grill with a pleasant crunch on the outside with your first bite but would melt in your mouth from then on. The sushi was the main reason we wanted to come back. From fresh and balanced yellowtail and uni, to their consistent fatty salmon and tuna. Their sushi was unbelievable for an all you can eat location!  It's been about a year since we came to this place and coming back made us miss the Goyemon that once was. The appetizers and desserts came lukewarm, barely any fish came with the rice, and the quality just dropped. Now don't get me wrong, I absolutely love sushi rice and I wouldn't have had a problem if it was made properly. Over cooked sushi rice with too much water, with a less than desirable seasonings that sushi rice needs to have its character. The increase of business and customers may have taken it's toll on one of Vegas' greats. The fish was good, just not enough of it with orders, and if the rice is bad then what the hell can you do about the sushi! Goyemon you were a great friend and we had a great run, but it's time to move on.   Here's an extra star for old times sake. Good luck Goyemon.

iKVjt8vn5yIkb4DEuq_E-w.text: Sushimon and Goyemon, but moreso Goyemon due to distance, have been my go-to places for AYCE sushi. There's never a trip to Vegas where I have not stopped by to dine, even during business trips to Vegas. However, at this last visit, I've became very disappointed by foremost the quality of the fish and secondly with the service.  Every non-nigiri item came out first -- the appetizers and regular rolls. We sat for quite a while waiting for even just one of our nigiri orders. Sadly, the long wait wasn't rewarded at the end.  Halibut nigiri... stringy and chewy. Had to spit out part of it because I really couldn't swallow it.  Scallop...lots of lemon juice. Did not seem fresh.  Cajun albacore...completely doused in sauce.  1/3 of the nigiri fish were smaller than before, which made it seem like there was too much rice given.  At least the snow crab meat is still good, so we loaded up on multiple orders of that. Seeing that this may be my last trip to Goyemon (will likely go back to Sushimon), I also ordered my usual 2 orders of green tea ice cream and 2 orders of lychee sherbet, while getting the tempura ice cream just for kicks (the tempura batter gets to you at the second quarter piece you eat).  I'm sad that I will likely not return, unless things change, and I hope that the diminishing quality didn't hit Sushimon as well.

F0WOh-QDX59ox3m9Ot121Q.text: My go to AYCE sushi spot! Whenever someone comes to visit Vegas, I always bring them here and we leave full and satisfied!

MYtFAiU-3deLIqbF2F0QVQ.text: I just moved to Vegas a few weeks ago and I've been craving sushi and sashimi for a while. Coming from California and being near the coast, I was hesitant about trying seafood in a desert state. How fresh can the seafood be? Goyemon surprised me.   FOOD:  Lunch and dinner menus offer appetizers, sushi, rolls, sashmi, salads, udon, and combinations. Main entree's range from $9-15 on average. They also offer an all you can eat option at lunch and dinner prices. I ordered the SS combination which includes 7 slices of sashimi and California roll. The combination includes miso soup, salad, and rice.   QUALITY: Fresh. I've had California roll where the seaweed had odd fishy flavor and chewy pieces of sashimi, but not here. Every slice of fish melted in my mouth.   CUSTOMER SERVICE: I ordered to go but received friendly service over the phone.   ENVIRONMENT: The restaurant appeared to be busy and lively. The place is medium sized with a sushi bar.   Overall, I'm coming back!

ZPn_UFspci_y23tfiHELjg.text: Amongst a city filled with overpriced food with those who are already poor from gambling, this was a gem to find. We came during lunch right at 12pm when it opened and there was no wait to get seated. It was pretty small inside with limited seating at its bar and tables, so come early if you don't want to wait. About 30 minutes into eating, there was a huge line waiting outside so just a heads up.  The sushi was amazing. It tasted fresh and was nicely presented. My favorite is definitely unagi and it did not disappoint. We ordered various nigiri, appetizers, and rolls and after a while, they all started tasting the same but that was not a problem because it was all good. One thing I would stray away from is their fried calamari appetizer. It had a unique, chewy texture and was sour. Not that appetizing and it almost ruined our appetite. Good thing we had that near the end. My absolute favorite thing would have to be the lychee sorbet though. It was nice and creamy and it was a good surprise to find chunks of lychee jelly inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mochi ice cream and lychee sorbet
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MvDRaUTLy-M9NN5yzaVS3Q.text: $27 for all you can eat, high quality, great service sushi!! I recommend Goyemon to all of my friends coming through Vegas. It's open late as well, making this a sure bet for good dining after a show or spending the day in meetings.  Favorites: pork belly, ecstasy roll, and the lychee sherbet! The 911 roll is one of the hottest I've had, so if that's your interest - give it a go! Cons: Plan on a wait - no phone reservations, but once you are there they will let you wander and text when they are ready!

STQ8Apv_vomeqq-mcc654Q.text: The wait here is always long. I don't normally like AYCE but when there are visitors from out of town they always wanna go to do AYCE sushi. The food here is good but the service is just whatevers. Maybe it's because how busy the place is.  The food for being an ayce place it is pretty decent. I usually just get a lot of the super white tuna and salmon belly nigiris. I don't really do rolls but if you do order a roll, the good thing is you can order a half roll.   Usually I don't have too much complaints about this place but today we must have had a first time sushi chef. We sat at the sushi bar gave our order and the sushi chef would forget our orders and we would have to reorder. Our server forgot our orders for our side dish appetizers and we ended up not getting our appetizers. Food is a little better than the service lol.

7kGfOeDlIlfRwLH7o8ktGg.text: The servers ignored for most of the time that we were there. Our plates stacked high and getting refills took forever. They brought the check before we were even done. The only good part was the sushi chef.

zLHpWzehOMLVrES8hnsL2Q.text: The waitress from Thailand is really something.  She does not welcome you, no single smile, purposely "delay/forgot" your order. We were observing her, and she treats the same way to others.  She works like a robot, just there to taking order and taking forever to delivery. We were there to celebrate birthday, and it was terrible experience.  There were 2 pieces of sushi rice dropped on the table, so we left on the dish since it's dirty. She came and said " YOU HAVE TO EAT THE RICE, OR ELSE I WILL DO CHARGES ON SINGLE ITEMS"  She is just so rude.  Not going to return as long as she is there, there are many other good sushi restaurants.

S_dTNvqsIMpnGPNQ2fXwfQ.text: I use to really love this place. However things are going downhill. Apparently they don't serve pork belly anymore? That's a major bummer, it was one of my fav things here.  The major issue is the service. All the servers have extreme attitude and would just throw the food on the table and walk away, not even explaining what it was. That was if the food even showed up at all. Orders apparently went missing even though we were here for lunch and it was slow. The guys behind the sushi bar were on their phones... shouldn't take 20 mins to get two orders of Nigiri. AYCE is 45 mins so make sure you order everything the moment you get here since it takes the full 45 to even receive anything.  The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because the sushi still tastes good but Goyemon is not the same anymore and I probably won't be back, not when you have excellent places like Sakana

TnbdKLyXS9qfv1u2QJtyzg.text: My go to place whenever I'm drive down to Las Vegas! This must be my 30th time dining at their restaurant and finally decided to leave them a review.  Price is very reasonable for the options that are available. Huge selection of appetizers (some that you will never see at AYCE chains), nigiri, rolls, and sushi. Their quality is pretty consistent and is high for an AYCE restaurant. I always leave with an upset stomach when I go to AYCE and buffets, but it's never the case with this place! *4 stars overall for the food and price.  Service could be good or bad depending on how crowded the restaurant is, and of course, what time you go in. I usually go at opening for lunch or very early for dinner so the service I get is always great. Waitress always get the order correct and is SUPER fast taking down my long list of orders which I have to say is AMAZING! *5 stars overall for the service.  Make sure to check this place out when you're in town!

I9zCT0zsUpRAJTMoRTi6lQ.text: I usually go to Sushimon but ever since they made me wait 3 hours and never called me back after taking my name down, I stopped going after 10+ years. Screw them. I went there since at least 2006. This is theirs too but I always thought the sushi was better at the original location. We went on Saturday at 3:30 and waited about 30-40 min. The staff is efficient as the other place. The fish was fresh. And they have pork bellies here. The rice is not as sticky though and it falls apart often.  Is it me or are they putting more and more Yuzu sauce in things? I am not a big fan of it because I think it masks the flavor of the fish. Overall I can't complain but it's nothing to gloat about. This place is probably in my top 5. The edamame is a little saltier than I like. The salmon eggs and quail egg is placed side by side here. Usually I like it on top. I'd rather eat at Sushimon but it's a matter of principle. You get crap service and there's no one to complain to. They are so busy making money with their 4 locations that they can probably care less about one customer even if this one has been patronizing them for years.  The desserts were good. I think everyone can find something to like. This place is good and deserves 4 stars because there are a lot of bad sushi places too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s sushi what can I say? More colors than Dolly Partons coat of many colors?

Pjy-eIGUdQnZBbutX7tFuw.text: I'm not always picky when it comes to eating sushi as long as their fish doesn't look AND taste like it's been sitting out for a few hours.  It's a small sushi place, but luckily it wasn't busy when we got there. They don't take reservations, or at least that's what the lady told me. Their menu has a pretty good selection of rolls and hot foods and the service was quick most of the time. My favorite was the salmon roll, I can't remember the exact name (salmon supreme? some shit like that) It was just salmon on the inside with more salmon on top LOL. Also, I loved the garlic tuna nigiri. Fish seemed like it was a good quality.  For dessert I had the lychee sorbet and the tempura ice cream. The tempura ice cream was okay, but I really enjoyed the lychee sorbet.  A bummer was that uni was only served during dinner time. Now idk my sushi rules all that well but if you ask me, uni should just be served 24/7 with no limitations. I mean it's called AYCE man. Gotta have that sea urchin ;)

H9yTAZhba6AwK2vg7_tsnQ.text: This place is all you can eat for 27.00 at dinner! I sat at the bar (flying solo) and ate what would normally be about $70.00 worth of just sushi. The chef was quick and efficient, the food was really good and I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7AkCxo7iq8kh1VWag6xqqw.text: I love this place. We eat sushi every Sunday and choose goyemon every time. I think everyone gives this place a 3 star because of the service but we get good service all the time. I don't expect the servers to smile at me but they are very accommodating making sure we get our orders. They remember us and knows what we will order for our kids. The fish is always fresh and we don't wait long. If anyone chooses sushi 21 over goyemon because there's no wait there it's because they were on dirty dining. I'm a die hard Goyemon goer.

uMGyOEEifEt_UnxDel1NdQ.text: This is the place for you if you want a bunch of zombies and depressed people serving you food.  Seriously, the sushi chefs are so miserable.  They don't smile, they don't acknowledge that they've heard your order either.  It used to be fun sitting at the bar, but now it's so depressing.  Sitting at a table is a terrible idea too since service is so slow and the servers screw up your order all the time.  We've been frequenting Goyemon for years and it has progressively gone down hill.  I feel it's finally time to say something.   The freshness of the food has stayed relatively consistent.  One thing I must mention, and there is probably a direct correlation to the sushi chefs, is the quality of the rolls.  They look like a 2 year old made them.  Sloppy, ingredients falling out, rolls falling apart.  I can't even pick up a roll without it falling apart.  Sometimes way too much sauce and sometimes no sauce at all.  This situation is not just a one time "off day".  It's been at least three times.   Mayhaps it's time for you to find a different AYCE sushi place.  Unless mgmt does something about this issue.  We've been to JJanga to get our AYCE fix recently and not only is it fresh, but everybody is so nice and the rolls actually look and taste like a sushi chef made them instead of a 2 year old.

13TgxTRSSVRGhIRcoY7imQ.text: My all time favorite sushi spot. TOURISTS do no waste your time eating sushi on the strip. I cannot tell you how many bad experiences I have had eating sushi on the strip, along with a horrifying bill to follow. Goyemon is fresh, affordable, and unique. Open late, and offer a great lunch all you can eat price! They truly have a flavor, rather than everything tasting like the same roll like other places. Their fish is very fresh, service is quick and attentive. I will continue to come to Goyemon as long as I reside in Vegas.

Fx0a1TBqEch4SHbhkNBgCQ.text: Can't say enough as to how much I love this AYCE sushi restaurant! Fish is always fresh, fast and friendly service. Been going there for years and sushi is always consistently good.

J64mM7yJlC-fP-ZDFZ4D7w.text: Goyemon is great for all-you-can-eat, I'm not a huge fan of the portion sizes. The salmon is a little on the tiny side, especially if you're ordering ala cart, almost $5 for 2 pieces of tiny salmon is not really that great. Aside from the portion sizes, the fish seems to be very fresh and tastes great. I took my husband here for our anniversary and we got AYCE, we made the mistake of ordering sweet shrimp.. we generally aren't shrimp lovers, but we wanted to try it since it was one of the things that the dinner menu offers.. we shared 1 order, he ate his in one bite.. mine had the tail attached so I was using my chop sticks to sort of.. cut the tail off, once I was able to get the tail off I noticed the shrimp hadn't been deveined.. total turn off. It's literally not that hard to devein an order of shrimp, it makes the restaurant look lazy and makes me question other things. If we go back, we definitely won't be ordering shrimp. Our go-to place is I Love Sushi, but we wanted a go-to AYCE sushi place, since I Love Sushi doesn't offer AYCE.   The waitress we had was great.. I was nervous because a lot of the reviews said the food was great, but the service was terrible. Our waitress was super nice and our food came out relatively fast.   All in all I'd give Goyemon a 4.. If I hadn't received a poopy shrimp, I would have probably been more apt to give them a 5. So hey, Goyemon.. devein your shrimp, it's kind of gross.

diGPgnA9z5mvpuiSqozZcw.text: This is my favorite sushi place!! I use to work in the same complex and would watch the delivery guy come in every day with their fresh fish. They have a great variety of food not just sushi but also beef and chicken dishes. Even my toddler loves to eat here

u9Cx2q2qgENk9YL80YOWDA.text: I usually dont think AYCE sushi places are all that great and are often given good reviews for no other reason then they soak everything in yum yum sauce and deep fry it. This place definitely the exception to that. Easily the best AYCE I have had in Vegas.  The quality of their fish is really good being that we are nowhere near an ocean or decent body of water. Also inexpensive for the price.   I usually judge a place on the quality of their nigiri not the rolls. The salmon belly is my favorite! Also they have great scallops. Also AYCE includes  grilled fish which is awesome. Grilled super white tuna is easily my second favorite.   The lack of 5 stars is due to the rush on getting you served and out. It gets so bad that I have been asked what I want to order before I had sat all the way down, then again 30 seconds later and again 30 seconds after that (I wish I was kidding). But otherwise the service has been great.

d2jekPKj_dUO2jFK8WXBaA.text: Great all around. Also have All you can eat lunch and dinner. The "Moment" roll and the "Royal California" are on point!

oVnhyLQpU_0YhXDqLWI7cg.text: We were there for lunch on Christmas eve. This place is NOT authentic Japanese. No chef there was Japanese (one waitress was Japanese, but she doesn't make sushi anyway).  As for nigiris, those were the smallest I've ever seen in my entire life. I don't understand why they have to make each nigiri so minuscule. On top of that, we had to wait forever to get the food we ordered. 1.5 hours to get all the food we order is simply too long. You can find all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant in California at much lower price, with much shorter wait time, and more authentic Japanese!

oWGmtE4oeZSlTjNPTeTjLw.text: More like 3.5 stars, but nothing really impressed me. This place was pretty good, but I think my heart will always lie with Asahi in Riverside.    PROS:  Decent price for ayce ~$25 Didn't have to wait too long Mochi ice cream- vanilla, strawberry Green tea ice cream  CONS: Too much rice in their sushi Baked mussels were over- baked (and we ordered this multiple times)

es7ZnKpzSYVnnEKCVkt85Q.text: Hands down the best sushi you can have in LV!! Sushi is fresh, they have unique & delicious sushi roll combinations, staff is friendly, and the ambiance great.

MIGzQ1dRg_inRQFQAehc3A.text: Bad service from the sushi chefs.  I understand it is busy, but the chefs don't even look at you when you are at the sushi bar.  Absolutely terrible.

3K2u-h6-l_XPCl9WqMTWHw.text: I decided to try this place.  First off walking in and not being greeted by anyone is a fail.  The hostess did not even glance up even though she knew we walked in.  We had to politely go up and let her know that we would like to be seated.  She kind of mumbles something and then walks away to go deliver checks to the respected tables.  We finally get seated.  All the waitresses were kind of serving all the tables. The sushi rolls all kind of tasted the same.  Though I did get enough food for my buck.  I should not have to continually ask for water and during down time see the hostess not doing anything.  But she did seat everyone who came in after us right away...  It made me miss my sushi place back home.  My sister was disappointed as well.

0G_cIrwAmfnN1KbEH6i75A.text: Busy as usually but always on too of things part of the reason why we always come back. I'm hungry ...... Pork belly yum yum!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NbqVqhvzvTGEkPjYb2eaAQ.text: Always a line of peeps out the door. Gotta do the AYCE. Try as many of the appetizers as possible. The baked lasagna is delicious.

DYsNw3pH1hB0IU2hKHu7xQ.text: HORRIBLE.   My husband is a fan of this place & comes here every time he is in Vegas. We came to Vegas for a family trip so of course we came here to eat. I don't know if they switched owners or what's going on, but service was absolutely horrible today.   It took over an hour for our FIRST round of orders to come out. We complained twice about how slowly they're bringing out our food and both times, no apology.  We put in our second order, but after 20 minutes of putting in our second order, no food. We ended up just leaving without eating our second round of sushi because it was taking too long.   We wasted 1.5 hours here. Sushi was alright but not worth all the time wasted, and didn't even get our money's worth because of how long they took. We will not be coming back.

dCDy7aLc8yKqpEiOFcy1Sw.text: SO.... INCREDIBLY.... FULL..  Got the AYCE here and it was spectacular. They have a ton of specialty rolls, (TWO PAGES IN FACT) with all of their descriptions on the menu AND pictures of each one on a separate, laminated menu. All the rolls looked absolutely delicious and I was lucky to try many of them. I got a perfect seat in the bar right next to the sushi chef so my food came out quickly and I was able to get everything exactly the way I want it.   I highly recommend the ecstasy roll, the sweet shrimp unagi, and the volcano roll. They do not skimp out on the quality of the rolls even if you go with AYCE. The rolls are big and will fill you up real quickly if you do not pace yourself. There are SO many choices too, so come in being prepared to choose decisively so that you can get your food sooner.  Their desserts are also pretty bomb here as well. I talked with the chef and he told me that they have the only lychee gelato around. I ordered that and the green tea brulee. Both desserts were incredible, but I especially loved the green tea brulee. It wasn't overly sweet and I loved the green tea flavor and crispiness of the top.   It was a great meal and I'd come here again if I was in the area!

SnOiy6qHlLdU337vmGB4Gg.text: Totally agree with Anthony M and i can see why Nelson Q is the duke of the place.  Most AYCE places have restrictions on a few items and i get it you cant have a giant stock of sea urchin in the back and no way in hell is one guy going to eat 40 of them expensive prickly buggers. I get it. But restrictions on ice cream mochi?? You telling me i can eat as many rolls that contain soft shelled crab or all the yellow tail and fatty tuna nigiri i want but i'm limited to ONE sphere of ice cream covered in sweet rice paste??  NOT Goyemon...Here you can pig out as much as you want. Had the spicy ass 911 roll and want to order an ice cream because 2 glasses of water, 3 packets of sugar, 3 bits of a spider roll, almost licking the plate the pork belly came from didnt work?? (True story) Well order some ice cream! It's dessert time and you've already ordered an ice cream? Well order some more ice cream! Damn that lychee sorbet hit the spot but you want another? Yeah you guessed it...order MOAR ice cream!!!  And the big ass list to get me some of those 'useful' clicks from you guys  Crispy Rice Cracker Spicy Tuna thingie  - Oh man this was awesome, Crispy rice with spicy tuna on top with some sauce i think it was yum yum sauce drizzled on top oh lord this was good  Pork Belly  - Being Vietnamese i've been eating pork belly most of my natural life...These grilled pork bellies are something else...Too much sauce on the pork belly? Still delicious. Not enough sauce on the pork belly? Still smokey grilled taste delicious  Deep Fried Prawn Heads - If you like prawn heads then order a batch of deep fried prawn heads they are AMAZING. If you dont likek deep fried prawn heads order a batch for someone who does like prawn heads.  Yeah i'm gonna stop reviewing now...making me hungry.

nmtaQqNVaRowuyUSAPQJhQ.text: Probably the best AYCE sushi spot in Vegas! Love that it's open late night, and that they have daily specials. It's also great that they don't give an abundance of rice and small cuts of fish. Seemed like most of their rolls were amazing (and they let you do half orders for AYCE so you can sample more!)   Must try:  Salon Belly: buttery goodness! Grilled pork belly: delicious fatty goodness Yuzu Sorbet: tangy, refreshing goodness  I highly recommend sitting at the bar is possible, you'll get your nigiri and rolls much quicker.

2m1QAL7pw4deyOHZvDFgzg.text: Terrible service, was virtually told we wasn't welcome. Was told the AYCE was finished at 2:05am in a rather rude manner even though they closed at 3am that night, then told us half the bar section was closed off where we requested to sit, then served us a Sake that was bitter and tasted off, we just walked out. Never going back there again, it WAS my favourite sushi place

1uMxLZMg85jUSsDC3UzZzg.text: I give it a 3 star because the food is fantastic but the service literally sucks. Make sure you sit at the sushi bar otherwise it will take 20 minutes for you to get your drink. our server took off in the middle of serving us because she had to take her break.

UHpPKxaJxshwHYtYnIK-mg.text: Walk in to sit AT THE BAR, 5 seats open, wait for tables, Waitress tells me 10 minute wait for BAR seat, because they dont want to backup the sushi chefs from serving everyone else IF I sat at the bar!???? WTF. (Btw, there were THREE sushi chefs working). WILL NOT EVER GO HERE AGAIN.

fFwwmuu4Xc4-IGwV8gC_1g.text: This place is prolly one of the best Sushi restaurants that i've hit up in Rack City. I like the art work of the Samurai warriors on the wall and the samurai sword in the bathroom showcased in a glass case. My boy Whoadie is a chef that's been Elite for the past 3 years who has become vegetarian recently but decided to have a cheat day to come smash on the all-u-can-eat sushi for $28.95. We ordered some pork belly, seaweed salad, poke, unagi, ebi, a bunch of their fusion rolls, and a gang of sashimi, then make sure u got room to eat sum green tea ice cream!

CCMbYGsKwsWnP_IDPkmdvg.text: Got my tempura ice cream this time around but the servers got much of our orders mixed up. We were in the back room. But the food was still excellent - kudos for super white tuna, hamachi, pork belly and hurricane roll. I'd rather sit at the bar and watch the chefs make the sushi fresh.

RceI3br-Beg3zxE_Sqf9uQ.text: MY FAVORITE PLACE IN LAS VEGAS!!! This place never disappoints! Their sushi all you can eat has the same quality if not better than the quality you expect to see in good Japanese sushi restaurant that serves a la carte! I recommend every single thing on the menu. The staff is friendly and helpful, too. If you like sushi, you have to go there, 'nuff said!!!

FnktC9uVrcLxEsAL7ZAiew.text: Update: After all was said and done, it was 8 of 13 people that had food poisoning.

hPz_4h2PKFaVS9JMD0tu_w.text: Fast service! Ordered items to go and it was ready in 10-15 minutes. Hostess was pleasant and helpful with the menu items. She even showed us the best combinations for ordering, saving us $10 on the order. I will have to come back and way here when I'm in this neighborhood again :)

2m0lCI-5_zrSKQiXXzCCOw.text: This is my favorite sushi place in ALL of Las Vegas.  Their rolls are just good!  The prices are decent too, I never do all-you-can-eat at any sushi place because I usually eat less than ordering individual rolls would cost - two rolls fills me up.  They have the best spicy tuna!  My boyfriend always gets the salmon special, it's a dinner combination plate that comes with soup, salad, a little scoop of potato salad, big scoop of rice, shrimp and vegetable tempura, a california roll, AND teriyaki salmon for about $12.  It's a great deal!

UBB9OUzB4Gd5CRlV95yszA.text: Went here for lunch. All you can eat. Wasn't busy when we arrived. Waited over an hour for initial order of sashimi.  Last order we received smelled and tasted of ammonia. Place was dirty and the bathrooms were not functioning. So after the service, the bathrooms, and the poor quality we informed staff we needed to leave and told them we did not want to pay full price because of the previous issues listed. They were unwilling to compromise, so we paid and left.  Very sad too, we use to frequent this place.  Had to call the health district too.  Shortly after we left wife and I were both physically ill.

FvMr8q1w55jKEKczCA4eVg.text: My go-to AYCE sushi place. The quality is good, and I am a big fan of their AYCE desert as well (especially the lychee and yuzu ice creams). Although service can be a bit slow sometimes, I understand there is a huge demand of quantity from several different tables at once. Every time I've been here, the staff have been pretty accommodating (with the exception of Lin, who waved his finger at my sister, telling her she couldn't order any more sushi that one time we were seated at the bar). The price is reasonable, and the food is good for the most part. I wouldn't order non-sushi items there, like the calamari or takoyaki.

5H40cNRhMzkbDD2ATMo1ZA.text: Always busy, sometimes underrated. Love their pork belly. I wish they have more servers because of the long wait all the time. It quite in the middle of nowhere for me. I get claustrophobic and they placed us in the middle of the room so I was quite uneasy.

svzsAmNyqvTz1HwzMHWu5Q.text: Food is great and I love the all you can eat deal!!! Excellent quality for a good price!!!

g-uJG17abNuu053jl684rA.text: went here with friends because it's supposed to be great sushi so I thought we'd try it out. wait was long, they need a bigger place in my opinion because it gets too packed in there. sat at the sushi bar. chefs were cool and were open to substitutions and deletions of items I didn't like.  sushi was good but not even close to the best i've had which i'll be reviewing soon.   here's the problem..**** Food Poisoning!!! *** me and my friend were crazy crazy sick from the sushi (all you can eat). I've never had food poisoning in my life, believe me you don't want it! needless to say Never again will I go to this place.

OjbrTGJSYfvYzEyepOyg3A.text: The $27 AYCE is definitely the way to go here. If you can get a spot at the bar, do so. But it was so packed when we got there around 9pm, and we waited about 10 minutes to get a table. Not that 10 minutes is bad, but I don't think the sushi bar even started clearing out until well after 11 pm.   The beers are pretty cheaply priced as well, at $3.50 per small bottle, and $5 for the large. They also have beers on tap that starts at $3.50 a pint.   My cousin and I mostly stuck to the nigiris because we feel that is the way to best get your moneys worth in an AYCE setting. Let me just say that the BEST thing we ate that night was definitely the sea urchin, as it was fresh, clean, and tasted like the deep ocean. The second best thing we ate that night was the super white tuna, which just has some kind of indescribably amazing mouthfeel to it. The third best thing was definitely the yellowtail collar, which everyone raved about on here. It was tender, juicy, tasty, and simple tasting. The kind of thing that doesn't need a sauce to add flavor. We also got the pork belly, which was good, but I think I'm spoiled at home when we grill pork belly and I didn't think it was as good as we get it at home. But if you don't get to enjoy pork belly in similar fashion, by all means it's still delicious.   My younger cousin definitely had it all out with everything fried on the menu. Calamari squid (which was super tender and not chewy at all), shrimp tempura, a bunch of shrimp tempura rolls, etc. She seemed to enjoy all the of them, and especially loved the lychee sorbet she got for dessert.  We also got some cut rolls, my favorite of them being the Lemon roll (california roll wrapped in tuna and lemon slices). I don't know what it is about the flavor of lemon on fresh fish, but I guess I'm just a sucker for fresh citrus or something. We also got one of the soft-shell crab rolls (I forget which one), and it was huge and pretty tasty. Nothing as extraordinary as the other fresh fish stuff, but still pretty good.   For the desserts, definitely get green tea creme brulee. It's a lot more custard that you would think. The tofu cheesecake was also delicious, but I think having the creme brulee first kind of overshadowed the cheesecake.   The only trouble I really had with the whole experience is that we ordered so much and so fast (we were really hungry) that when the food started coming out we had no idea what we had left because no one kept track and the food was coming out in random order and time. Some came out right away, others came out at least 30 minutes after we ordered. The sushi bar was constantly bustling, and is actually really small for the amount of orders they probably receive. Next time, I'm definitely implementing a way to keep track of our orders, because I think we didn't get a 911 roll or something. Not that it mattered seeing as we were extremely satisfied and had the AYCE. But it's still something to keep in mind because you order everything verbally to the waiter, and ours didn't seem to have everything organized lol. That was okay, because he still made sure that all of our food was coming out--to the best of our memory, at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi monster roll. In comparison to an edamame.

3LQWXzSZLWpy_BrobAvrEQ.text: Please be prepared to wait. An all you can eat sushi menu is such an amazing deal you won't regret it!  Great sushi, busy atmosphere, and worth it! My fav is sweet shrimp nigiri sushi and halibut sushi.  What to choose for rolls is endless.

Su_R-5NTKBaTu85BiVS_UQ.text: I've been to many all you can eat sushi's, and by far this was a great experience. I loved the bar like atmosphere, and small exclusive feeling. Only downside were their rolls which I knew after inspecting were a death trick when it comes to all you can eat. Massive amounts of fake crab meat and rice to help fill the empty void I created through starvation all day.  However everything else besides the rolls, sushi wise, were worth ordering... Shrimp tampura on the other hand was extremely salty.

GwQ7z4y0Ed_Gya9XuS-lIw.text: This was the first stop of my Las Vegas Food Tour and wow was it a good one. I have to admit that this was my all time favorite sushi experience and definitely a top 3 overall dining experience.  I chose to sit at the bar (which I highly recommend from now on). I chose to do the AYCE and was flabbergasted by the large selection of nigiri, rolls and special rolls they had. You can add appetizers and desserts to the AYCE as well. Sushi Chef Fredo saw that I was completely clueless about what to order so I basically turned the keys over to him. He basically ordered for me, and I have to say that this is the only way to eat sushi from now on. It was an awesome experience. I also appreciated the way Fredo made the nigiri sushi...he didn't overpower the fish with a ton of rice underneath.  Highlights:  Pork Belly - At first, i thought the soy sauce marinade was gonna overpower the pork belly and make it really salty, but when i ate, it was incredibly delicate and tender. It is similar to chashu. In addition, the pork belly comes with a side of mango salsa to top off the meat. 5/5  Blue Fin Tuna, Toro, and Super White Tuna Nigiri - These were my top dishes for the night. The blue fin tuna was incredibly soft and tender, which makes it just melt in your mouth. It was freakin decadent. I was told that the toro is the belly of the tuna, which makes sense because it tasted fatty and tender...just the way i like it. And the super white tuna (which i've heard is escolar...not tuna) was also really good. It tasted like butterfish. 5/5  Hurricane Roll - the best of the special rolls IMO. It had shrimp tempura and an assortment of other stuff. I think it had rho as well. And it must have been topped with some eel sauce and this other creamy white sauce. I ordered so much, I don't remember what was in it. But i do remember that it tasted balanced and flavorful, and was simply the perfect bite. 5/5  Frying Jason - This is basically a BSCR but the filling had crab sticks and cream cheese. Pretty bomb. 4/5  Grilled Yellowtail Collar - this was also the bomb. you can taste the smokiness from the grill and the fish was light. it felt like you were eating outside your bbq. 4/5  I also ordered:   baked mussels (fantastic)  dynamite (basically the topping of a BSCR in a shell)  orgasmic salad (seared ahi tuna in some greens and lime juice. a bit sour)  jala jala roll (your basic roll with spicy tuna in the filling topped with albacore, salmon, tuna, and a slice of chili pepper....pretty good)  scallop nigiri (it was good, but he put a bit too much lime juice on it)  supreme salmon roll (probably my least favorite. it was a salmon roll topped with salmon. a little overkill)  Finally after all this indulgence, i finished off my meal with some green tea ice cream. delicious.   p.s. all the dishes i ordered can be ordered in half orders.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hurricane roll

DLi3f7merdV38rsiO8lM7w.text: Went back for another friend's bday dinner. I didn't eat all my rice and they charged me $5.00 for it. How rude. I could of just hide the rice but I was too lazy and didn't want to brother with it. Left like 5-6 pieces of rice. Talk about crazy charge. Also they didn't have all the desserts. Grr..

Lzm2LQGpoK8khBBb8KR-AQ.text: This place is AMAZING. Not only the best all you can eat sushi place I have ever been to but the best sushi I have ever had..and I have eaten a lot of sushi. All you can eat delicious appetizers, succulent sushi and heavenly dessert. Everything is so fresh and the vibe is really great as well. I always make sure to stop there on every trip to Vegas!

uS7ulJiVf7NigwNm6zDGVw.text: This place is a little more upscale looking than Sushi Mon. Had the AYCE.  The sushi selections and other cooked items came in small portions.  Like a mini sample taste serving... the typical you get at normal sushi places but you can just order more.  Loved the grill calamari- it also comes fried if you want. They didn't have toro when we were there :(. Seaweed salad and garlic edamame were yummy as well. Salmon belly and uni was buttery. You must have the tuna over fried rice! There were times we ordered one serving and they doubled it. Then there were other times when we wanted a double order and they gave us one. Hmmmm...? Overall it was good $26.95 pp.

CMSKqDkLpl_8r8hR86HKOw.text: Too bad I don't live in vegas or I would be here all the time!! this place is DELICIOUS!!!! It is completely worth the $26.95 all you can eat! It is True the pork belly is delicious. Their fried shrimp head is also yummy. I really dont have anything bad to say about them!!! I didnt even have to wait for a seat when I came, which is a plus. Though i am sure if you come later, the wait will be long.  The employees are very friendly and helpful explaining the "rules" for first timers. I will be back everytime i am back in vegas!!!!

gzOnu0HDcz0drD-lXHlGuQ.text: Dropped by this place for lunch on a Friday afternoon during Rock in Rio weekend. At first, the impression was bad: The wait took FOREVER. But we took it as a sign that it must be popular and, given its small size, it sort of made sense. The 45-min wait was also exacerbated by the fact that we were all starving. But we decided to stay and wait it out, and boy am I glad we did!  The AYCE offered so many choices, we were overwhelmed with the options, especially since our stomachs were eating themselves at the time. We decided to take it slow and order some rolls and nigiri first. Some of my friends got miso soup, and I got some gyoza. After the first orders came out fairly quickly, the deliciousness of the meal overtook us and we decided to go all out. We ordered enough to feed a family of 20.   Some notable dishes were the white tuna, cajun albacore, and seared salmon. I also love unagi/eel and this place did not disappoint. I think one of the best things about goyemon is that you can order HALF ORDERS. What!? Don't want a full 8-piece roll? Get a half-order! No more leftover sushi to shove down at the end. I'm not sure if other sushi places did this, but when the waitress offered it to us, I knew Goyemon cared about efficiency and possibly its customers' waistline.   The service was great. Although busy, the waitress was always around, and our waters were always refilled. We did not have to wait 40 min per order like some other sushi places. All in all, a great experience at AYCE sushi, and I can honestly say that I haven't had too many good AYCE experiences.   TL:DR - Had a long wait, but TOTALLY WORTH IT. Half-rolls galore!

Qjn7htIL8NIe695QEZvdwQ.text: ***300th review***  AYCE sushi dinner for $27 is a steal especially when you're in vegas!  The sushi chefs are friendly, quick with your order, and use quality fish.  The only thing that I don't like about this place is that seating is very limited and expect to wait before you get a chance to sit down.  We came in on a Monday night and still had to wait about 10 minutes.   I definitely recommend getting 1/2 orders of all the rolls so you can try more without getting too full too quickly.  Since it is AYCE, it's your chance to try some of the more expensive items on the menu.  Just see what sounds good to you and order!  Some of my favorites were the pork belly, seared tuna, sexy girl roll and the rainbow roll.  I also tried the uni (sea urchin) since it's also apart of the AYCE menu and too expensive to order for me normally.  It's very interesting.... creamy and reminds you of the ocean.   Lastly, be careful of what and how much you order... if there are leftovers you will be charged the retail price of each item.

Aq6NF2fdS3i1yQP2LaGpIg.text: This place is amazing.. Everyone's very friendly good customer service.. Sushi here is the best.. Can't go wrong with all you can eat sushi. Sometimes the wait is almost an hour of its busy but who wouldn't want to go to a place everyone enjoys the food and gets a lot of attention.. I'm rating this place a 5..

Uj9IZc4oJPiMopekFejJkw.text: My husband and I have been coming over 3 years & its our go to sushi spot. There's another sushi restaurant right across the street from us but we rather to drive 15 minutes to Goyemon.  Service here is always nice & very quick. Food comes out quick & is yummy every time. We always do all you can eat its a good deal for all of the food that we eat including dessert! We try to go during slow hours because it can be a long wait during busy days like the weekend. Even when you have to wait they use a great system thats texts you to let you know that your table is ready! We love this place & will keep coming here for sushi.

do0AoY34eFUqePknYtRxXQ.text: Okay this is my 4th time here and I really like this place for nigiri sushi. the rolls don't really impress me. I am more a nigiri person, sushi is about the fish not about jazzed up mayo or Teri sauce. Goyemon does have a impressive selection of nigiri for a AYCE.   They also do have great desserts and appetizers. I like it because no limit on dessert like some places.   They also have a black board that changes daily with specials that includes special fish of the day. On this day it was conch, konpachi, Bonita, jalepeno massage and negatoro. The conch nigiri so good.   On this day service was greatly improved with servers being really attentive to us. I have tried most of the major AYCE sushi joints in Vegas and no one can beat Goyemon on fish varieties and varieties of rolls, appetizers.  Only con is the long wait, usually 30 to 40 min wait. Very popular place and it's a small place. I've been in there at 1am and it's packed during mid week

DAwyQbpcq_5iRDOzk8aYXw.text: They're getting one star because every time the bathroom door opened it smelled so bad I had to get up and go outside. The rotten smell permeated the whole restaurant and everyone sitting around us was plugging their noses. It was absolutely disgusting, yet the manager or owner (not sure of the title) and waiters seemed completely oblivious to it. Yuck!

LWGv8n-ARxR9y1b-7YKGvg.text: I won't go too in depth because pretty much everything that needs to be said has already been said.  - IMPORTANT: the dinner menu has a slightly bigger selection, most importantly pork belly, one order of sweet shrimp (amaebi) per person, and one order of sea urchin (uni) per person. - service can sometimes be a pain, especially if you have a large group, you will be seated in a private room on the right with two large tables and have difficulty attracting the attention of your server - TIP: in a group, don't order too much at once or else it will definitely take longer to get your food (i.e. 20 orders of nigiri per person in a party of 6) - nigiri: garlic tuna, salmon, cajun albacore are staples, and their uni is also great - rolls: to each their own, but beware the 9-1-1 IS pretty spicy - no matter how full you are or how full you think you are, you'll have space for dessert. lychee sherbet is my personal favorite - there are a bunch of AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas, but I always end up gravitating back to Goyemon  The only downsides are service and lengthy wait. Whatever. Goyemon is undoubtedly the best AYCE sushi in Vegas.

bZM7bFjaNP8pzU3CKkPNIg.text: Wait is long and not worth it late at night. Seems fun for a big group but could get annoying with the smaller space and wait times. Sushi is delicious and well made. Chefs take pride in their work here for sure. Lively atmosphere!

TNoUPuumMeAHm3tHyHtlDA.text: This is the ONLY ayce sushi place my super picky boyfriend ever wants to go to, so it's a good thing I like it. Huge menu; everything is included as far as I can tell. It's always busy here, so be prepared to wait. It's always worth it though. The sushi's always fresh and fast, with friendly service. What more could I want?

Rr7Gr6m1UcIL1vN5zbJDeg.text: My sister, who is a bigger foodie but doesn't write, lives out here and was the food and beverage manager for Ritz Carlton in D.C. so she knows her stuff. I recommended this place considering the # of reviews and 4 stars on Yelp. However, although I didn't try the food, I wanted to leave this dirty smelling joint asap. The place smelled like old fish, was dark, loud, and very crowded. Because I was so hungry, we left and went to her usual spot Umiya. Considering these places are all you can eat raw sushi joints, I'd rather be a bit more picky and eat at a more cleaner establishment. Even if it was the late lunch hour rush, the establishment should be clean and not smell like the kitchen if they're serving raw fish (my pet peeve). Dahmmit...I feel terrible for writing a bad review about this joint, but Umiya was just that much better and even a few bucks cheaper with the free drinks.

lQn4OXdQwiVQ05FFldor1w.text: I don't think I can describe how full I am right now... (How am I gonna manage to get off this bar stool and walk down the narrow hallway to get outside? I gotta be rolled out of here) Sushi house goyemon is probably the best to go to for reasonably priced and delicious sushi. The air conditioning must be down right now, coz it's quite hot in here. Good thing they have ice cream and mochi for dessert! Must try the sexy girl roll and hurricane roll! So good! Okay? Just come and get your sushi on.

EtvcwqolWTcJsxBMxsGYYg.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE. Very rude and mean people.  I used to like this place. Big sushi with little rice.   Now they serve in small fish with much more rice and dam the rice in weird sauce. Thus their rice won't even stick and falls off. (Few people reported this)  We gave up on picking up the rice and left them on plate. Some fell half way onto table. Guess what they decided to charge us for a la carte when we can't finish their horrible rice.   This is only our first round too. They sent 3 different servers to complain about the same plate and command us to finish them even though we don't like it. (I understand if I'm on second round but dude it's the same damn plate)  This just lost me and all my friends as customers for life.

s_rCSx9_H3wKj1nZlaomfw.text: Be warned!  I called at 1:37am to make sure last call was still 2:30am.  Woman that answered said, "yes, last call is 2:30am."  I arrived at 1:50am, party of 1, hostess/manager says there is a wait to be seated and she can't guarantee that I will be seated in time to be able to meet the 2am last call for All You Can Eat sushi!  Wtf!  I drove all the way there for her to tell me that!!!?  She couldn't even explain that to me on the phone.     Ridiculous!

ju2ba0kPjpYvYw87GcSRfA.text: Also one of my favorites. Always fresh and they let you have half rolls with all you can eat. The place is not cheap but once a year we splurge and take the drive down.

P4o32XLY0dBGYwboaK-ftQ.text: Ok, if you decide to eat here...be very hungry and expect a long wait. BUT it's so worth it!   As for rolls...I don't know what to recommend to order. Everything is so good. Nigiris are fresh! You may be better off eating/ordering fresh fish rather than those fatty baked/deep friend rolls.   Pros: You can do half orders and unlimited desserts. Cons: Long wait, not good for groups (it'll be a longer wait)  Must go to for AYCE Sushi in Industrial Area.

Zlee7Ee2SDyZYuedFeWMiw.text: It used to be good but they really lose quality... Doesn't worth waiting...  The problem is not the price or waiting. But it's the food and presentation what sucks...   Sushi Kaya is always better alternative.

3vrC0JPy49RHwQ2C_AiQlw.text: Goyemon features a delicious all-you-can-eat sushi menu, but the service was a little off.  We came in on a Sunday night around 6 p.m., and were seated right away.  The nori/seaweed that they use here is SO flavorful and really adds to the sushi.  This is the only sushi restaurant I've been to in Las Vegas that used seasoned nori.  What's amazing about this all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant is that they don't force you to eat like 10 pieces of sushi per roll.  You can order half-orders, which is really convenient, especially on your first time!  Additionally, instead of charging you per piece you do not eat, you have a time limit.  We were not bothered by the time limit, as we were already full.  In fact, the server never even mentioned the time limit.  I ordered Garlic Tuna, Teriyaki Chicken Roll, Mahalo Roll (i.e. Spam roll), Crispy Rice, Spider Roll, Tamago, and a Rice Cracker, which was a special.  For sides, I ordered the fried gyoza, sesame chicken, seaweed salad, tuna poke, and a sashimi salad.  For dessert, I ordered three different flavors of mochi ice cream (no limits for the dessert like most AYCE sushi places either!).  The Garlic Tuna was amazingly fresh!  The sauce was a bit too lemony for my taste, but the fish was delicious!  I love crispy rice rolls, and it did not disappoint here!  I have to say that Spider was probably my favorite roll.  The soy paper was a nice touch and I loved the mix of deep fried soft shell crab and fresh crab meet.  I am a sucker for non-fish rolls also, so I would definitely recommend the Teriyaki Chicken and Mahalo Roll as well.  The sides were hit-or-miss.  The tuna poke and sashimi salad were not fresh at all.  The tuna poke was extremely disappointing and lacked flavor.  This was surprising considering how impressive the garlic tuna roll was.  The sesame chicken was also disappointing as it tasted undercooked and did not seem to have any sauce or seasoning on it (not even sesame seeds!).  The dessert, of course, was delicious.  The service was weird because our servers switched in the middle of our meal.  Thus, someone dropped the ball on our side dishes and we basically had to reorder it, but it did come out very quickly after we mentioned it to our new server.  The rolls came out pretty quickly (with a few exceptions), but at times it was hard to flag down our server.  Overall, both of our servers were friendly though.   I would definitely return to Goyemon, as it was one of the better sushi restaurants that I have been to in Las Vegas.  I am not quite convinced it is the best one in Las Vegas just yet though...

Ws1jp5IxLzwuiqbdgsQgPw.text: The whole dinner was a plateau on the palette. Yes the fish is fresh but that can't be the only thing that draws you in. When I eat sushi I'm looking to be excited and thrilled and nothing at this place did it for me. Especially the presentation, it just seemed quick and rushed. But the food seemed oversold from everyone else's review. I had salmon most of the night and a sad creme brulee, the top wasn't even even cooked all the way. Unpleasant to the eye and displeasing to the appetite. 1/5
