dlYYnq5wPXPE8BQklhuU-Q.text: The wait time is NoT worth it.  If you can wait that long then you should expect for your food to come out so fast, that there is no freshness after a certain time because all your food coma out at once, and there is no time to pace yourself. This is the strategy I suppose, eat fast, get full fast, leave, new customer. Repeat.  Will not be returning unfortunately.

PGP4_Ej-o3YIbt3AQP961g.text: I remember this place being pretty good. I personally thought it was over hyped...and a bit pricey in comparison to sushi kaya. It's not a knock your socks out place but more as a safety choice for sushi if you have no where else to go. Not a big selection either  Also...the service? 1 star. And it's ridiculous how long it took for them to finally take my order.

IhTH1UH5AlJwGobiOOITeA.text: Love this place, AYCE sushi, cheaper than a la carte. Rarely ever get disappointed, except for the time they sat us at the table closest to the restroom I think they were having plumbing problems that night, since then they have fixed that problem. The only thing that is not part of then AYCE is the hamachi collar  boo! Have yet to try their ramen after 11pm. Favorites  braised grilled pork belly, atama (fried shrimp head), super white tuna nigiri, salmon skin roll, Cajun albacore, ikura with quail egg, salmon nigiri, and the list goes on!

_JawgFLh_X8h8h-9n3XxJA.text: LuV LuV LuV - This sushi bar!  I usually don't get to sit at a bar and eat sushi since i've always got the baby with me. But when I get the chance to sit at the bar, " TONY" tears it up!!!  I tell him! " I'm a Hungry Beast" and he says " no Problem, you little CockaRoach" j.k.  He says, " I got you! I give you the goods tonight!" Since I love ALL sushi Nigiri Style hands down I trust tony gonna give me the goods...And he delivers with a BANG! So, I recommend sitting at the bar if you get a chance.  Why do I love the sushi here, well not only is it very fresh but it also has a Quality that is hard to find here in the city. I also like the portion to rice ratio because sometimes they give you more rice than fish and I really do not appreciate that.  I also like the side items! The Pork Belly is a delicacy here that I will never not have! Also the Spicy Tuna Cracker Rice is good!  mmmm... It's all good and I am just dreaming about all my favorite sushi here!! I like Mango for desert so they actually had a really nice Mango Mousse this last time that I went. I also like to look at there daily specials to make sure i'm taking advantage of the All You Can Eat!!!

qFjWG3QiF-5lk_0K7E-YWw.text: I'm usually not a fan of AYCE restaurants.  Especially when it comes to Sushi.  Sushi Goyemon is the exception.  This is not your standard ACYE sushi affair.  You don't walk up to a station.  There are no lines.  Food does not sit out under a heat lamp.  Rather, you order what you desire from the menu at the comfort of your seat.  The menu here is extensive and consists of your standard sushi, sashimi, and rolls.  However, they also include a variety of appetizers, grilled items, specials, desserts, and more.  You may come here thinking that you'll get your value here only based on volume and how much you can consume.  Don't be fooled, their food here is delicious.  You'll get your value from quality as well.  Some of my favorites from the menu are; -  Sashimi Salad -  Seaweed Salad -  Super White Tuna Sushi -  Salmon Sushi -  Cajun Albacore Sushi -  Sunrise Roll -  Dragon Roll -  Sexy Girl Roll -  Volcano Roll -  Mochi Ice Cream  The atmosphere here is like any other typical casual Japanese restaurant.  Then again, you don't go to AYCE for the atmosphere.  Just be cautious of the long lines and wait when you arrive.  They don't accept reservations so expect a wait during peak times.   The price for dinner is $27 which seems fair amongst the competition in Vegas.  But given the amount I usually eat when I come here, I guarantee they're losing money.  It's one of the few places you can go in Vegas and leave a winner.  Come here for pure Japanese gluttony on great food.  You won't be disappointed.

b-2enM06jf1if7w5rNLwMA.text: I tried this place about a month after the grand opening. Its a sister company that Sushi mon owns, I think, anyhow the place is beautiful and servers were ready to serve. All you can eat style, sushi was fresh & hella tasty, sushi chefs were speedy but precise , servers were good in keeping up with orders and maintaing a clean table. Another real good sushi joint to try.

Jwb9LCjInc6agQFz2Jdh7g.text: The food is really what gets the 4 stars! All you can eat dinner for $26 was worth it! The customer service could have been much better :/ our server seemed as if she hated being there and had very little personality when coming to our table. Could've been a bad night for her. The sushi was yummy! But Yama is still out favorite!

H2VwxAD2E4DbQ-Y4Sno-Lw.text: I have found my new favorite AYCE sushi joint in Vegas now.  Before coming here, I was a fan of Yama Sushi, which is still really yummy, but now that I've been introduced to this place, I don't know...I think I might have to come here now rather than Yama.    We arrived with a party of  6 and the hostess told us it would take about an hour and 15 minutes or so.  The place is small with a main dining area and two larger tables to the side of the restaurant for larger parties.  We ended up waiting about 50 minutes or so, which wasn't too bad!  There are a few tables with chairs outside so you can sit back and kick it.    Now onto the food... portions of their nigiri are smaller than what I'm used to in regular sushi restaurants, however, I think it's the right portion because it's not overwhelming and it makes you want to order more.  Fish is fresh and delicious..melts in your mouth taste, which is awesome, rice on the nigiris, perfectly packed and does not fall apart when dipping into soy sauce, this alone deserves a single star.  Sushi rolls were amazing to taste and the the size of the rolls were pretty generous.  My favorite would have to be the spider roll and dragon roll.  I had to get two of the spider rolls because it was that good.  They made it fresh so the soft shell crab came out nice, warm and crunchy.  Price came out to be about $34/person, which is not bad depending on how much you plan on grubbin'!  When we come to sushi places where it's AYCE, we always try to get the bang for our buck.  I definitely can't wait to come back here on our next trip to Vegas.    Staff was friendly, food came out quick, prices are affordable for AYCE,  bathrooms are clean.  I really enjoyed my experience here!    Desserts...I had the vanilla mochi and it was nothing special.  I wish they had more flavors of the mochi rather than just vanilla and strawberry.  I could really care less about the dessert though cause really it's all about the sushi here.  Yummy in my tummy!

SyCwWXYT5p9q_PjiMjov7w.text: Even the best food and atmosphere can taste horrendous after lackluster service and poor response. Until the current manager changes the way he handles complaints, I give this place only five more years.  The restaurant was maybe 3/4ths full, so I was expecting faster service than the times I have been here when it was jam-packed full with a line out the door. Continuing, I looked over the menu (it has been redesigned), and I saw that the same favorites were in place: Braised pork belly, super white tuna, and cajun albacore. I started off the night with an order each of amaebi and uni for me and my boyfriend, and we also ordered two half rolls to start. The both of us chatted as we awaited our food, and the natto roll, amaebi, and the uni came out. I was pleased with the sweetness of amaebi and the freshness of the uni. "So, I take it that the Calico roll is still on its way?" After an affirmative, we placed a few more nigiri orders. For your reference, the Calico roll is not a deep fried roll: Just a few slices of fish in the middle and slices on top. Not a very time-intensive roll at all, so we were sure it will show up soon.  By the time we finished with our sushi, we continued to wait for the rest of our orders.  About ten to fifteen minutes pass, and it seems that the sushi still has not shown up, so we decided to order some braised pork belly and miso soup. That order came fast (within maybe five minutes), and we were glad to note that the portions were larger. However, one bite in, and the insides of the belly were frozen. Maybe there are some people that like their fatty meats cold, but I personally prefer it to be warm and melty. We brought this up, and after an apology they took this to the back. As a customer, you can see the sushi chefs working on their sushi, and you can see the grillmaster who does the grilled entrees and desserts. The waiter (we later learn he's the manager) and the grillmaster exchanged a few words, kept sneaking glares towards our table, and rather than getting right to cooking it, they stood there and chatted for a better part of a couple minutes. It didn't look like they wanted to fix the problem.  As this is going on, my boyfriend mentions that service seems to be slower than usual, and I cannot help but agree. I did point out to him, though, that if he would just sit at the sushi bar for once, we can get fish faster in general. Five minutes later, new pork belly arrived to the table. Blackened and charred on both sides. Well, this time they definitely made sure that it was warm on the inside. We scraped off the black charcoal and ate the belly.   We inquire about the status of the rest of our order. Our waitress replied, "Oh, you haven't received it yet?" "No, we have not received it yet." She apologizes, we say it is fine, and we place a few more orders for their specials for the night, namely salmon pork belly nigiri. The rest of the orders filter in, including the salmon pork belly, but we had to reorder the orgasm sauce, the miso soup, and a few other nigiri because they lost the order. I contemplated over the service as I was savoring the fatty salmon belly. The rest of the orders showed around fifty minutes after we sat down.  My significant other declares that he's done, so I decide to follow suit. I note that in the course of the extended delays and mistakes, our table time has already reached the hour. They lost our orders for desserts, and I couldn't seem to reach anyone for a response. I note that the moment I place down my credit card, someone zips by quickly to pick it up. I asked for a comment card, but not having one, I wanted to speak to a manager about our experience.  She went to go see the manager, and I recognized him for helping out on the floor. He turns his back to chat with someone else for a while saw him shake his head, and decides to head over with our missing dessert orders. I thank him for bringing the dessert, though I brought up my main points, namely how service is slower than usual, and how our orders were messed up. He says a brisk "My apologies", and then he explains someone was out for the day and servers switched. I understood the first part. Yet, it was the same person who took our order from start to finish, so I asked if he was sure that was the reason why. To this, he retorts,  "You see the people waiting outside at the door? Yeah, you can't expect everyone in here just to serve you."  Serious misunderstanding on his part, and he left me to fume silently. I do not like to go to places where I don't feel welcome, and while I won't judge a place based on the behavior of one worker, I will judge it based on the behavior of a manager. A place that can't take fair input graciously will only deteriorate over time.  I hope that when I return two years from now the management has changed. There ARE better AYCE in town, for cheaper, just as fresh, and faster. I'll be writing reviews for them as well.

rBo8QZEFGHVsdTANthphzw.text: Was a big big fan of Yama sushi until I found this place. Yeah it cost a buck more for their AYCE but there's no stupid limitations on the mochi ice cream and green tea ice cream.  There's also no (3 Rounds of Food) like most AYCE sushi places. Was worried that service would be slow but actually the food came out pretty quick. Overall very impressed and will visit again.

qylze32mMM0T4HXuCQ04TQ.text: Arguably one of the best AYCE sushi spots in Clark County, located south of the intersection of Decatur and Tropicana. Very nice setting and condensed so that service can be more closely-knitted. NOT.   This place had very high expectations and anticipation from me. Not only because of the amount of praise it generates but i is also the sister sushi-house of Sushi Mon which is located on Silverado Ranch Blvd and Maryland Parkway. However, based on what all my friends told me and all the yelp reviews, it seemed pretty decisive that Goyemon had an edge. Only for me to say HELL. NO.  I came here on a quiet Saturday afternoon with two friends who I picked up from the airport. We began with the classic yellow-tails and Volcano Roll. I understand that volcano roll can take a little while but really, 20 minutes...? Especially when there's maybe like 3/4 occupancy in the restaurant, you would expect much quicker. I mean, don't get me wrong, the quality of the roll was amazing, but to take 20 minutes is no justification. I'm a hungry guy, when I'm in an atmosphere such as AYCE, I'm there to be in for the kill.   Right after the Volcano Roll, I asked for the ecstasy and philadelphia roll. Note, everything I order is half rolls, not full. I like diversity over quantity. This time, it took somewhere from 10-15 minutes..... COME ON. These chefs are professional and I understand that they can be under duress but I'm SURE that this joint has been under far more pressure ever than by one single person with that being just me. How can it take nearly 40 minutes to make 3 half rolls???? I can run to the strip and back in that time. (Ok not really). Then I just ordered the sunrise and sexy girl rolls and after that, I was way too frustrated with the incompetency of the services so concluded with my mochi and green tea ice cream. And no, it's not because of the chefs. The table next to me which had one less person ordered rolls later than me and received them before me. Not to mention, they are FULL rolls. NOT HALF. If anyone can PLEASE give me a logical explanation for the terrible service, I will be happy to give you my stamp card which is at 10, making my next visit free.   Yet, for a tab at $70, my friends and I ended up paying $10 for service. Obviously they feel the need to tip just because they feel bad. But I don't feel bad. Feeling bad is for all the hungry kids around the world. Their terrible service may be explained that they like to stall me so that my stomach can process foods faster and make me full quicker. But that's why I'm here because I'm going to fight it if I have to. They may have done this so that my stomach can process the foods faster and to make me full quicker. Nevertheless, a business tactic that I don't appreciate because they don't appreciate my business.   Make no mistake, this review is subject to change because I do hope that they can make up for their stupidity. The food quality is the cream of the crop. But if they choose to fail me next time in serving me, I will pay the price and no tip. Then I'll never return, only to keep my commitment to Goyemon's sibling, Mon.

_yQZfKrQ3SMxdv7SdLgWHw.text: After several days on the strip, we were pleased to have a car and be able to explore the city as we pleased. Before our flight the last night, we hit uo Sushi House Goyemon based on it's Yelp reviews. The all-you-can-eat Sushi was well worth it and provided unlimited yumminess from appetizer to dessert. The best things I had:  Seaweed Salad Sweet shrimp Sushi (Tuna, Salmon) Fried ice cream  I had many other delicious items and definitely ate my 27 dollars worth. Drinks are also cheap here, but be warned, you may wait quite a while for dinner.

HTq3mi3I5YDmqSZAs3s-eA.text: Tried this place for lunch on the weekend with the wife and had a great experience.  We sat at the bar and did the all you can eat (AYCE) option and the service was outstanding.  Everyone was super friendly, the chef's clearly knew what they were doing, and did a great job keeping orders coming out with a pretty decent sized lunch crowd.  As for the food, it was great.  Nigiri was properly prepared with an excellent fish-to-rice.  Rolls were also great - we tried a bunch and didn't have one we didn't like.  One thing I really liked here was that they have some unique rolls that go beyond what you usually find at the typical AYCE place and all of the flavors meshed nicely.  I like spicey rolls and let me tell you, these folks put together some fine spicy rolls.  We also tried to apps - calamari and steamed shu mai and both were outstanding.  In particular, the shu mai seemed to be freshly prepared and did not taste or feel like it had been prepared from pre-made, frozen shu mai.    Overall, this is a great option for AYCE sushi and we'll be back regularly. And if you like you're meal, make sure you get a frequent diner card.  If you fill it in you can get a free AYCE meal.

o-3_mYbgg-TeERn9Gd0Cmw.text: When I first got here they quoted me about 20 min for a seat, I was seated in 5. Go for the all you can eat and if you can, sit at the bar. Extremely fast service, kind of a team serving effort, which was a little different, but my cup was never empty and my plate was always full with delicious sushi. I will definitely be coming back here on my next trip to Vegas.

mhsiUbMQAXvOx-8AlL6XKQ.text: This place has great sushi in a nice atmosphere. Very busy full of people and is open late at night. Their service has never been that great but the past few times I've been. There have been big problems with service and the last time I was totally ignored. It sucks because I like going to this place by my house. But like I said, I'm not going there again to let them treat me like I'm not an important customer.

nDsEqBoYYuWu_H34-Yawiw.text: This is the best sushi in town. We come at least 3 times a month. I love everything about this place.

3mneNO1Awq7h6E7pT-iN4g.text: Wow. AYCE sushi at a great price (26.95). Had mostly just nigiri (white tuna, salmon, yellowtail, halibut, mackerel, etc.). They also have an abundance of extra items outside of sushi and rolls. grilled pork belly w/ mango salsa was good, not great. the yellowtail collar was out of this world. the sauce that came with it was even better. Also, they include uni (1 order per person), bluefin tuna (1 order per person), and bigeye tuna with the ayce menu.   The only knock i have against this restaurant might be the time it takes for the food to come out. There was always a few people waiting for seats at this restaurant and i can see why. I suggest eating at the sushi bar.   O yea ayce desserts are included as well.

FWW5OfV5gtlJxIwhKFW5zw.text: Such a yummy place! Service is so AMAZING!!! I have a seafood allergy and they are always remember and keep me safe!!! Food is so good as well! Will always recommend this place to anybody who wants any kind of seafood!!!

IRghAusDbHMQ30UVSjbXOg.text: I think if this was my first AYCE sushi in Vegas it would have 5 stars.  Compared to other joints on the east coast this place is awesome.  Fresh, fast, and decent sushi without jamming too much rice in.  However, my first visit to Goyemon was after being referred here by a personal recommendation that my favorite sushi place was not as good.  And unfortunately I was not impressed at all!  Sushi on Rainbow is superior in every aspect except for the atmosphere.  But I was here for the sushi, not the fancy decor and it left me very unsatisfied.  The nigiri was wet, mushy rice with bland fish.  The rolls were prepared faster than a McDonalds burger and the lack of time and skill put into the rolls showed.  Their non-sushi stuff was good but again, thats not why I came here.  Very dissapointed!

1TVocqdJY4A_ZyjAQFg5YA.text: The Lemon roll was awesome! It's a California roll with Salmon and Yellow Tail & lemon slice on top. And this place is open late (3am) for those of us that get out of work at crazy hours.

yWlZ3BE27H3kr0iIdjvkaQ.text: With so many sushi places in Vegas, you'd think they'd give better service to attract customers. To begin with there was a long wait to be seated, even after our table opened up. The server pretty much ignored our party. We had to remind them of our orders, the last two rolls took forever to be delivered to the table. Will not return here and honestly don't suggest it. On a positive note, the strawberry mochi was good.

raBenpO3Ix55qVEwrIu5UQ.text: This place is awesome, too bad I was pretty hungover when I ate here.  From what I can tell though the sushi is fresh and tasty.  They also tasted pretty authentic and not the bastardized type you can find in other low end sushi joints.  Too bad my stomach wasn't feeling that great so I wasn't able to fully appreciate the "all you can eat" aspect of the restaurant.  I'd definitely come back the next time I visit Vegas.

mQDXs6ZEzbLXD_92y_YHAg.text: This is the best all you can eat sushi in Las, Vegas hands down. The best time to eat is dinner time if you like uni, toro, bluefin, and sweet shrimp. I would suggest to come early for dinner because it can get busy. I believe they close at 3 am but their last seating for all you can eat sushi is at 2 am so plan accordingly.  Service is usually pretty prompt. Sit at the sushi bar if you want to know all the better cuts of fish for the day. The sushi chefs are cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More uni.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked mussels.

4SIMTr7AgIpuZh47sUr8jA.text: Every time I've gone to Vegas for trade shows(6) we have come to Sushi Goyemon, $25 a person for all you can eat is great pricing, the sushi is fresh and they sake selection is awesome.   The service was great, food came out fast and establishment has alway been clean, I recommend this spot for big groups for sure!

dp6YyTqJTM1FsL6APc5krQ.text: First time here with my family for a late lunch. It was about 345pm on a Sunday. We were seated right away.  The server took a while to get our water and orders which was okay since we took a bit to get settled and seated.   Let's start out by saying. Customer service really makes or breaks a place no matter how good the food it.   My first impression of our server was that she did not want to serve us. She did not offer a smile. She was very monotone and moved about sluggishly. We had children with us (ages 5 and 3). We asked our server how much it would be for our 5 year old she said it would be the SAME AS THE ADULT for AYCE (What the heck!) and our 3 year old was going to be charged $3 for AYCE. Luckily there were lunch bentos that my 5r could have. Fortunately, my 3r loves tamago, so he definitely ate his share.  If you are at an all you can eat restaurant where you have to place orders and they have a maximum time limit (45 minutes here) your orders better come out quick and your servers should be quick.   Miss attitude was slow and her body language was so negative that we began asking other staff members to help us with our orders.   The food was excellent, my compliments to the chef. I really enjoyed the hamachi and wished that I could try their uni (dinner only).   Halfway through lunch my 3r had to use the restroom, so I took him to the women's rr. It was clean enough. I always like to leave a comment about rr in any establishment I am reviewing on Yelp. Dirty and cluttered restrooms are a pet peeve of mine.   Overall, I'll probably try to come back to sample their uni but I won't be back with my kids since they can't eat the Adult price worth of AYCE food. Oh and my tip to management, hire people who want to help people. If you're in the people business, you need to be a people person. Just being honest!   Oh and if you're the type of server to stereotype your guests or customers that you are serving, then you stereotyped the wrong family. We tip good for good service and better for excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C_rm0hRZOqlObvjli7MlTg.text: This has been in my draft and it's waaaay over due but here we go..... for whoever is interested in this! This happened in the first week of June 2018  I've been to goyemon countless time in last 6 yrs. I had bad times and good times here but overall I like their sushi for the price.  Today, we went for lunch and we ordered some items for the first round. So many items were missing and the half roll came out as a whole roll.... but I didn't mind so much at the time and there was a black out!!!!   The entire electricity turned off and an annoying skinny dark blond white girl came to us and said that they would have to close and they would charge us for half price..... She didn't even apologize or anything. She didn't even look sorry. She acted like as if she was doing us a favor!?!? Yes, it's not her fault but she could have at least showed her empathy to us. After she told us that, she immediately took her restaurant T-shirt off IN THE RESTAURANT while all the costumers were there and started to get ready to go home!!!! How inappropriate and unprofessional she was!!!!!   I was also  a little upset that they charged us for half price..... We didn't even get all the items from our first order.... and I was soooo hungry!!!! In fact, I had to go to a buffet after this tragedy. They even charged the full price for another customer who didn't get to his dessert yet!!! I don't think it's nice or they are honest! How they handled this black out really disappointed me and I don't think I would want to go back to goyemon at least for a while.... I've been so loyal to them and what they did was not so fair or nice....

X-rbgwOG1EUkPWpbS_hZOQ.text: I remember when I came here back in 2013 and the food was wayyyy tastier and fresher. I'm not sure what happened but the quality has declined by a decent amount. The food isn't as fresh and the nigiri isn't as well made. I even had multiple run in with rude waiters and waitresses. I'm disappointed in this place because I used to love it so much. At their higher then average AYCE sushi price I would take my money else where now.

Wfc_j5Kz0V0COXgXcQO9sQ.text: We've been here countless times in the last 7 years or so - the only place we'll go for sushi.! Everything is always good, especially the grilled items (pork belly, calamari) but the service could be more consistent. The hostesses are typically snobby and don't give warm welcomes. The servers seem to always be changing out except for one fabulous guy (I'm bad with names!) who's been there for years. Other than that this place would get a 5!

kbY-KSKa9aRm2dRBXFZEVQ.text: fresh fish, good selections of menu, more genuine Japanese style sushi that is AYCE!!!   so far the best AYCE sushi I've eaten in Las Vegas.  waiters and sushi bar chefs provide good service. AYCE sushi that is actually good and satisfying your tastebuds and stomach without hurting your wallet.  There are many worse sushi places that are also more expensive than this place.    some of my personal recommendations:  - check daily special menu on board. you will often find better fish and other items that are not on the regular menu.  - if you are trying out something new, order half sized roll so that you dont end up filling yourself too much too quick.  - nigiri is small. its about 1/2 of typical size. you might want to order double if you expect regular portions.  - this place gets busy and often with long wait. plan accordingly or avoid busy hours.    - because its busy, sometimes take long time for your orders to arrive. anticipate this and order more in batches.  - if you are small group, sushi bar is a great choice - you might be able to cut through the wait and get a quick turn around on your sushi orders directly through sushi chef.

FtnseB-wy9KGxpLfZTn-QQ.text: I love sitting at the bar and talking to the chefs and asking them for recommendations. I'm a big yellowtail nigiri fan with spicy jalapeno and ponzu sauce and the chef made it to order :) Try the Cajun whitefish or tuna, you won't be disappointed if you like spicy!  The Tonkatsu ramen came with my all you can eat dinner meal so I scarfed it down after all my nigiri and special rolls. That pork belly was bomb, mine was a little cold but I still ate it! Super tender and melts in your mouth.   Thanks guys, especially my server Ashley! You were awesome!

BPKQdTGPiK-9NacikiftYg.text: I just ate there tonight with my Family for my first time. I have never wrote a review for a restaurant ever before. After tonight I had to!  I don't know how it was ever possible?!? I've ate at other all you can eat sushi places and had many rolls. Tonight I was only able to order 1 and half rolls along with a short order of appetizers. When we ordered another roll way before the hour we received THE Check! Like wow, may we have our roll first?!?!! What a Rip?!? No recommendations here! You're better off going to even an less than average all you can eat sushi spot. Amazing why this place  still has customers....spoiled my hunger for the night. Thanks for nothing. Also on another note-our waitress didn't even return to us after knowing our order was incomplete. They sent the cashier to give us our check. Unbelievable...I've never had this bad a service.  Buyer Beware

YQrg1tBXMT8iOC-NkZrOKA.text: Been coming here for years.  I can't help but get AYCE every time we come.  We usually stick to nigiri, with our favorites being the salmon belly, uni and amaebi.  I always feel guilty ordering the rice cracker but it is addicting!  The only reason for 4 stars is service has been spotty over the years and definitely depends who the staff is at that time.  Most recently the service has been good, but there had been times in the past we felt rushed to leave our table to open it up for another party.  Overall good times here though.

Ibfjd1BmdOpoSCW7E6XxpA.text: Very friendly and fast service. All you can eat sushi HELLO. Small restaurant so go early

JtN3ahQupo19JSKnGvMGcg.text: Goyemon disappoints again. Service is once again lacking. We decided to give it a try once more but nothing has changed since the last time. This time it's a heavy set Asian waiter with a bun. ( sumo wrestler?)He needs to be trained in proper customer service. Make sure you time yourself coz they make it a point that you have 60 minutes for AYCE.(rudely) On the 2 stars, fish is fresh but don't expect uni, they seem to never have it every time we're there. Take it off the menu to save you one more disappointment. Just a suggestion: Hire people that likes people. Employees just going through the motion, no happy emotions, negative vibe will always ruin a meal. I definitely will not be back, and this time I'm telling everyone not to patronize this business.

CrZyKI34pQ9XCDN-hOKE7Q.text: Always go for their AYCE! This sushi joint is amazing, a lot of choices to choose from. AYCE price is worth it trust me; regardless if you go for lunch or dinner.   They got a lot of nigiri, handrolls, specialty rolls, and side dishes that won't disappoint you. The quality of their fish is exceptional and I've always left the place feeling satisfied.  As for their service, I didn't encounter any problem with their servers (so far). They usually came around when we needed them and we didn't have to wait on them for an unreasonable amount of time. Friendly and busy atmosphere, this place is pretty popular with the locals.

PSt3NsMpcuRolkxTuLtt9A.text: Every time I come to Vegas I make it a point to come here. The AYCE sushi here is fresh and delicious. I prefer rolls and my hubby like nigiri, they have an ample selection of both as well as appetizers such as miso soup, gyoza and tempura shrimp. I forgot to mention, they have desert too! The service is always great and you never feel rushed to finish.   I highly recommend the chubby roll and my Husband would definetly recommend the super white tuna, he always raves about it.  Things to note: It is pretty far off the strip so expect a drive.  Parking is abundant, so no worries there.  Be prepared for a wait, even right when they open there are already people waiting.  Bottom line, if you are looking for AYCE sushi, this is your spot.

70anSQ6PzZq0RAvEXUBJQA.text: I'm not a sushi fan, but they have good dishes there and serve half portions. The service is quick and the staff friendly.

r7PBdEaWpErpYF23kc3uYA.text: We came here yesterday evening as a large party of around 20. Understanding that Goyemon usually doesn't take reservations we asked in advance if it would be possible for them to accommodate us and they said yes, they had a side room available for our size. Perfect! All they asked from us was to turn up at 8pm with the party, so we did. We waited. Firstly outside of the restaurant in the humidity as there were too many of us to wait inside. 20 mins into waiting, we were getting too hot, so were finally able to come in and waited down a slim corridor to the restrooms - inconvenient for all guests. 30 mins in, we were still waiting and at that point it dawned on a server to hand out some water. Grateful for this, however at this point we were getting a little impatient and definitely ready to sit, knowing that with a big party it would take time for us to order and receive food. ONE HOUR into waiting, 9pm, the host finally asks to speak to the manager who is not to be seen. Talking to the servers available near the room we are supposed to be seated at, there are still parties in there being served. Not near finished! We are pretty much ready to leave having consumed one cup of water when a server says that they are now setting up for us in the main restaurant and we are thankfully sat less than 10 mins later. After OVER AN HOUR WAITING with a party the restaurant knew were coming, we were sat in a tightly packed space in the restaurant but finally with some menus to order. Thankfully the servers were very quick with drinks and despite there being a lot of us, food came out rather quickly. I was definitely looking forward to the food, not just because I was starving but I was also hoping the restaurant would redeem their disorganisation with the quality of the food.  Unfortunately though, that was not to be. I ordered the Caterpillar roll which was very bland and both my partner and I thought the avocado on top was not very fresh to taste. The Moon roll was better and flavours could be tasted this time - an average tasting roll that filled the gap. Finally the spider roll - full of crab which was good, however the deep fried crab that came with it was so deep fried that you could only really taste the oil it was cooked in.  All in all, the initial disorganisation and over an hour wait for a party they knew were coming was disappointing. If they did not accept reservations and were not in a position to accommodate us for over an hour, they should have told us so. Finally, with so many excellent sushi establishments in the valley, we are looking for great flavours and fresh food, unfortunately I don't believe the food served here was anything more than average, so if it wasn't for the wait, this would be a 3 star review.  We won't be returning and I hope they are better organised for whoever tries them in the future.

iRKXRRgW_sZd1KZF0_jKlA.text: Craved sushi and decided to eat some all you can eat sushi with some friends at Sushi House Goyemon. There are a couple of AYCE restaurants located around the valley. This one is no different, offering a variety of special rolls, nigiri sushi, baked rolls, appetizers, and other dishes including rice.  The food itself was not bad at all. I liked the taste. I usually order nigiri sushi and I felt like there was a bit too much rice in the sushi. The rice to fish ratio seemed a little off. However, the food is not the reason that I knocked off a couple of stars from my wedding......  Our first plate of sushi and drinks came by fast, which was a good sign..... at first. After eating the first couple of plates of sushi and apps, the service became increasingly slow. Waters even became slow to get refilled.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zHeeyVmkj2VusJRQbnYDSQ.text: Goyemon is my favorite spot for ayce sushi :) It's waaay better than Sakana. I feel that the fish here is much more fresh and they have better nigiri. Sakana has a better fish to rice ratio compared to Goyemon but the quality of the fish at Sakana isn't as good as it used to be. I feel that they drown all their fish in sauce to cover up that it isn't as fresh.  I always stick to nigiri at ayce places since I don't really like baked rolls or rolls in general. I'm in love their salmon belly , super white tuna , eel , cajun albacore , amaebi (sweet shrimp) , and fresh scallop nigiri here. Their sashimi salad , vegetable/shrimp tempura , and garlic edamame are really good appetizers. Other ayce places don't really make tempura right but here it's on point. My favorite definitely has to be their dessert though. I love how there's ayce ice cream mochi , green tea & red bean ice cream , tempura ice cream , yuzu sorbet and creme brulee. Dessert isn't limited to one per person which is a big plus to me since half of what I eat is dessert anyways. If they had mini honey toast then it would be perfect.  The service here is alright. I used to work at an ayce place so I understand how hectic it can be. As long as the food here is excellent then this will still be my go-to place. Always get the dinner option over lunch (since more options available for only a few dollars more).

Kf7UTMIfCBhk1vw-_PLm7g.text: Staff was very friendly. Sushi was okay for the price. My favorite was all the sushi that was made with salmon.  The shrimp tempura was good. I was happy that they close late. I would go back.

mdpSxODqWqvqgPzxrr4yGA.text: I would say one of the most best sushi in town. Always fresh. But don't forget to make reservation before come here. There is always a line.

qaood7jn6HHs_EbX6yL8Eg.text: Went to Goyemon for AYCE with another couple for lunch. Excellent variety of rolls for all you can eat!!   A few favorites for our group were: Spicy Tuna Sushi Max Orion Sunrise Mingus Baked 428  The other really nice option was to order half rolls - that allowed us to try many rolls without committing.   Service was attentive, not overly friendly. Plates were cleared extremely timely, beverages sat empty a few times.   Would definitely go back.

bFTYf7zRr08DNafOvTrtfw.text: AYCE sushi for $26! ($21 for lunch) SIGN ME UP! Their fish is pretty fresh and of good quality for AYCE. The menu selection included in the AYCE price is HUGE, including cooked appetizers, nigiri and rolls. This has been my staple restaurant every time i visit Vegas. Go earlier in the evening to avoid the long wait.

CuVwIVBw_APPQWto137vEg.text: We spotted this place on Yelp after searching for an All-You-Can-Eat sushi restaurant in the area. This place had just opened for lunch on that morning, but it was almost filled to capacity with people seated at every turn. The sizable interior included a large sushi bar in the back, TV, and three rows of tables that spread across the floor. We were fortunate to snag one of the last tables that came with laminated menus. It took a while to get the server to come by our table, but the food was well worth the wait.  For $21.95 per person, the menu was extensive, and included a list of nigiri, hand rolls, specialty rolls, side dishes, and desserts. Among the nigiri, my favorites were the Fresh Snow Crab, Salmon, Seared Salmon, Scallop, Yellowtail, Halibut, Red Snapper, and Salmon Eggs with a Quail Egg on top. The quality of the rice was good with nice textures, and the sushi chef did an impressive job with ponzu and yuzu sauces to add excitable dimensions to the fresh fish. On the down side, the cuts of the fish were noticeably small, sloppy, and inconsistent between pieces. We were also initially disappointed at how small these pieces were, but this has allowed us to sample a wide range of specialty rolls.   In particular, I enjoyed the Red Dragon Roll that came with spicy tuna, cucumber, avocado, fresh water eel, and eel sauce on top. The sweet eel and avocado nicely intermingled with the spicy tuna. The noticeable crunch from the cucumber also rendered both freshness and texture.   The items to avoid were the Poke, as freshness and texture were both disappointing to say the least. Similarly, the Surf Clam Nigiri also lacked the profile to worth the calories. The Jala Jala Roll sounded good on paper--with chopped albacore, cucumber, avocado, salmon, yellowtail, and jalapenos--but it turned out dry and could use a sauce on top. The Crab Meat Handroll was also another item to avoid, as the imitation crab lacked the right sweet profile, and without a second filling, the flavor was insufficient to stand on its own.  Service was a hit or miss, and a bit rushed without taking into consideration that we were first time customers, and needed time to learn how to best orchestrate a meal that works for us. Overall, we had three rounds of sushi, and despite the shortcomings, we rolled out of the restaurant thoroughly satisfied. Interested diners can expect casual dining atmosphere, decent to good sushi, good value, but feeling a bit rushed given how busy this place can get. Good enough to warrant a strong 3-stars recommendation. We hope to return for a better experience when traveling in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZbDdP3bLfVy_8VVaJadkWA.text: What a disappointment. I came here about two months ago and had a wonderful experience. I was so excited to go back to Goyemon and introduce this to my friends but instead I left disappointed, unsatisfied and embarrassed! The sushi was not fresh - they didn't even have the Wagyu/Kobe beef and the waitress wasn't very friendly. In fact, the she seemed really annoyed to be there. When I asked questions about the sushi rolls, she literally rolled her eyes!   Not only did I leave unhappy, I was so embarrassed how I hyped this place up to my friends. They weren't impressed either. It looks I won't be coming back here for a while. I hope they step up their game. Sigh. I guess I'm back to looking for a new AYCE sushi bar when I'm in Vegas.  The only good thing about this place is that the dessert (mochi ice cream) is AYCE.

tDJsApqzDPzbNU-9HLhXmA.text: WORST SERVICE EVER..  This one's for you IRVING (waiter of the night)!  30-40 minutes to even get noticed (yes we timed him)??? Very unacceptable!!! No apologies, only a butt-hurt attitude to add the "cherry on top"..  What really set me off is... It is FREEZING in the restaurant, all I asked for was miso soup.. Had to order it twice, almost a 50 min wait for MISO SOUP, and again... Even after the issue was brought up kindly-- no apologies ...  Even the guy refilling the waters was more attentive than IRVING..  How frustrating for something that could've easily been fixed ...

XGBRpgIGb8DPVue1BfCeew.text: I have returned! Much to my amazement the food & service is still outstanding! Still an awesome off the strip sushi spot to dine at!  This time we came on a Monday for lunch and beat the mad lunch rush! Whew~  We dined for about 1.5 hours for the AYCE sushi and ate til we had to unbutton our pants :)  :: GOTTA HAVE IT (4/5) :: - Sashimi Salad - Seaweed Salad - Garlic Tuna Sushi - Salmon Sushi - Dynamite - Pixie Roll  :: LOVE IT  (3/5)  :: - Baked Mussels - Tuna Poki - XTC Roll - YellowTail Sushi - Frying Jason Roll - Tempura Ice Cream  :: LIKE IT  (2/5) :: - Yum Yum Scallop Sushi  :: NOT DYING TO HAVE IT AGAIN  (1/5) :: - Moon Roll  (there was no fresh water eel) - Jala Jala Roll

iBqaNVHVi076q2Kzrb9spg.text: I love this place! Usually we go to Sushi Mon but this location is closer to the Strip. I've been here for both lunch and dinner and they are both equally delicious. In fact my love for this place may be just a little bit more than Sushi Mon since they give minimal rice for the sushi.  Service is great. Be sure to check the board for their daily lunch/dinner specials. Get here early so you don't have to wait!  The AYCE price can not be beat for the quality you get. Can't wait to be back here the next time we are in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OaNs5Yk2uBvCnC0vJSH6Bg.text: The nigiri is really great, very fresh. This is our first time visit but had a really great experience.

M0q_lwBX5b0Ht48dHamLtA.text: I was impressed for the value! It's AYCE for $26.95 and tax. They have a huge selection of different types of sushi rolls and nigiri sushi. Over 50 different rolls from what we counted! It is all made to order. They also have a decent selection of appetizers from gyoza to yakatori meats. Uni is limited to a set portion per person. That was surprisingly fresh! Come ready to eat your heart out. I was also impressed it was open so late at night and busy too! The service was good, no complaints there.   If your looking for something off the main Las Vegas strip, you should definitely consider Goyemon!

IQ6UrMx6X7rXk5mlia2PUA.text: I usually come here when I have AYCE dates with my friends (6+ people). The wait is usually long during busy hours and the weekends. Despite having a table reserved, all members of your party must be present to actually start sitting in your table. But once we do we eat like no tomorrow lol!  I mostly just order handful amounts (as in like 20pcs or more) of Cajun Albacore and Salmon Belly. Sometimes White Tuna. Let's not forget almost every piece of dessert (Mochis, Green Tea Creme Brulee, Yuzu Ice Cream). OOOOOH DELICIOUS~

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts! Yuzu Sorbet, Green Tea Ice Cream, Strawberry Mochi, Green Tea Creme Brulee, Plum Wine
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Belly!!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Albacore!

uwiWNM8BZach7FfmMM_26w.text: Too busy for mediocre sushi. I don't know what happened to this place.  Used to be my favorite sushi place and now it has drastically decreased in quality and service. The mussels and fried shrimp head taste the same,  but the raw sushi is blah.

czPTCD0PLWt1E3n2e1213Q.text: Their selection of fresh fish is unmatched by any other sushi place I've been to here in Las Vegas. The price for their AYCE should be outlawed because it's so low for what you get. If you can sit at the bar and rest easy that you will be served by the brothers Gian and Andrei. I would say they are the best chefs there and they're the most hospitable. It had been a few months between visits and they totally remembered me.   This place is ALWAYS busy. So get in early or put your name down and get ready to hunker down.   It's all worth the wait - they have on their AYCE : Pork belly, Amaebi, Toro, and about 3 - 4 other rotating fish. The staff here is pretty good, some better than others. They also have fresh grated wasabi here too, it's worth the burn.   The rolls are ok, but as for me fish and rice only, leave the sauce at the bar.   If you love sushi and get that late night craving for Sushi, Check it out, but remember the key is to sit at the bar with Gian and Andrei.   ENJOY!

R7NiBvOQNCnfhksJS0WD9A.text: Three stars just for Timmy! Our server didnt bring waters(forgot), made us feel like we were annoying, forgot to ring in food that we waited an hour for and timmy took care of us and brought us our drinks. This used to be our favorite spot but i dont think I'll be back. Timmy deserves a raise.

KeIDdhYE3_w9VIb3_K80Mg.text: Goyemon's service definitely needs work. Saturday around 4:30 and they are slow as molasses even with a packed restaurant.   The quality of fish has seriously gone down and well the bad service just makes it bad overall. At 430 there's a wait and you would expect it to be amazing AYCE with the wait. The scallop is drenched in lemon juice, the yellowtail was poorly cut, etc etc.   Overall really disappointed by the quality. I won't be back for a long while.  PS. I was in the bathroom for the rest of the night after that. =\ I know that's one of the risks of AYCE sushi though.

W4WK-9aGgHSFx7Q0eNrL7Q.text: This place is ok. It's a solid sushi place. Nothing blew my mind but nothing was gross. it looks clean, our waiter wasn't like very outgoing or extra nice or talkative really at all lol but she wasn't rude and she kept up on our refills. I am completely stuffed, I wish I could give 3 and a half stars. I'd come here again. Unfortunately Sakana was my favorite sushi place but they were on dirty dining, which broke my trust so I can't go there anymore. But I like this place better than Yama. I'm satisfied, it was good. I'll probably come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C4B3tlw8MWJAJvzo3MWyWg.text: I have been coming here for quite awhile. I still recommend this place to others for ayce. I like that they have pork belly in a pineapple glaze and they have a special's menu you can order from as well. And you can also get udon. They're sometimes packed and theres a wait but they are open late so not a problem. Service from the servers is just okay in my opinion. They get the orders in and food out asap but they don't really have any personalities. But it is what it is and as long as they keep the food coming no big complaints from me. I still like eating there and will recommend it.

DsUnegASz8mFCpgddDOF1g.text: This place has officially taken the Number 1 spot on my Top AYCE sushi restaurants. So congrats Goyemon!  After reading reviews I knew the wait was inevitable. This place is small! Very small space. Which explains the wait time. We got there and it was about a 35 minute wait but they do grab your number and text you when your table is ready. The text even says if you need a few minutes reply back and they'll wait 2 minutes. So don't wonder too far.  Automatically when we sit down someone takes our order. They must know the wait made us extremely famished! Ordered so many rolls (as seen in my pictures). I am a half roll kinda girl. I love getting half so I have more room to try different rolls.   Some of my favorites were: Sunrise Roll- This roll had cajun albacore (my fav), cucumber & avocado inside and its wrapped in tuna, yellowtail, shrimp, and white fish! I mean thats an amazing combo of fish. It taste so good!   911 roll- Seriously the spiciest roll out there hands down. When we got it I thought, wow what a simple roll but boy I was wrong. It's spicy tuna with habanero sauce. Now I've had sushi rolls with habanero sauce before and it was NOT as spicy as this roll. This had my mouth on fire.... but in a good way!   Nigiri- Very fresh! The garlic tuna was to die for. And of course my favorite Cajun Albacore!   Spider Roll- Very large roll of sushi wrapped in soy paper and not seaweed. Might need to bite it twice to finish. Very amazing flavors of the soft shell crab inside. BOMB!   I honestly loved every single roll I tried. I wanted to keep eating but my stomach would't allow it. The presentation of the rolls and different colors of the fish used was beyond beautiful. I love when my food not only taste amazing BUT looks amazing. Even if I ordered half rolls of everything-- it looked just the same as if it was a full roll.   service was great! Thanks for a great experience Goyemon! See you for dinner next time for that green tea cream bruele !

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise roll -- yum
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this. Picture of the speciality rolls

PoROzDQyyy9LbZCmuWH8KQ.text: Worst experience ever. The fish quality was Walmart quality. Disgusting, fishy aftertaste. All the appetizers were horrible. Also, they charged us more for not finishing the nasty fish they brought out to us. Do not come here! There are many better options in Vegas.

Lmu5cgFFAcDFxIA0w8WObA.text: This place is usually always packed and we lucked out with the wait only being a couple mins! We were dying of hunger so we optd out of AYCE and went the a la carte way.  Not sure if this was the best way because we still ordered a hell of a lot. Lol  Shrimp tempura- nice and light, it's hard to get this wrong.   yellowtail with jalapenos- the sauce it sits in sets it off!!!  Spider roll- it will be an unattractive challenge to try and fit the whole thing in your mouth but it's worth it!  Tiger roll- delicious.   Green mussels- although my date was hesitant in trying due to the name... But he did anyway and ate most of the order. Says it all  Cucumber salad- definitely his portion that I tried. It's ok... Probably would be great if I liked cucumbers. Lol  Yakatori- perfect chicken skewers. It comes with 3 and I was lucky to still one before he ate the plate!   For dessert we share tempura ice cream!   All in all service e is good and food is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream

KZnGuINZFPyawWzzWoICfw.text: Not impressed.  Tonight was my first time here and was suggested by a friend.  The Tako Nigiri which is my favorite nigiri was STACKED with rice and had very thin slices of Tako on it. The masago with quail egg was sloppily put together and a mess.  The 9-1-1 was INCREDIBLY spicy so if you order that prepare yourself for the spiciest roll I've ever had.  The puffy roll was decent. The garlic edamame had little to no flavor just covered in grease.  The service was mediocre it took forever to get water or tea refills and I had to sit with empty water for 30 mins.  I try any new sushi place with an open mind and this one fell short for me. I prefer Koma and JJANGA to this place for sure.  It wasn't the worst sushi but it wasn't very good either.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sloppy masago with quail egg, and thinly sliced Tako nigiri... :/

Lm7jBiIatz4lqNAYmdi-ug.text: Used to be the best AYCE sushi In town but I won't refer anyone here anymore. Service obviously sucks (or I should say getting worse? The server here never smiled) and food quality is getting worse. They don't even care how to roll rice anymore. Oh yeah, the server was trying to charge me for rice I left on the plate....I understand the rule but come on, your rice sucks and bigger than the sushi...trust me, I did my best and no bitch I'm not paying for the leftover. Lychee sorbet is good tho lol

aNFw2FQuqyXgrH34a_NysA.text: Terrible service. We came and were put on the list for two people and the wait was 45 minutes. We wait 40 mins as other people are driving up and walking in to be seated right away!! I ask the hostess but she was too stupid to answer my questions. There were two empty tables and she refused to seat is. This ugly b*tch even told two women that the EMPTY bar had a 30-40 minute wait. What the hell? There are so many places to eat and this business is losing A LOT of money due to this miserable waste of space. I hope she reads this and feels as stupid as she is and as dumb as she looks.

Mvl7IJD9CP1g9xFfcdyZsg.text: Excellent service, lots of parkings, not much of waiting, food services really fast, everything is fresh, servers are efficient. Our server's name is Joe, he is very friendly, very efficient. We will come back again and try to seat with the same server.

irlLb1gXVTDgAp61UBNtJw.text: My bf and I went here after Wet n Wild so we were famished. It was my second visit here and he insisted this place is his close second favorite location for AYCE sushi in vegas. The last time we were both here was last year.  It was around 4 so we just missed the lunch rush and were happy we didn't have to wait too long for seats plus salmon belly was on special, yummmm.  What we liked: Miso soup: the bf said this was one of the best part of the meal, and it was the first thing he had. I'll take his word for it.  Spider roll: wrapped in soy paper. Great texture and crunch from the crab which was perfectly fried and the filling was nice and balanced. Wasn't overly saucy either.   Salmon belly: ordered it once and it wasn't a really good cut. Then ordered again later and it was perfect. Great big fatty slices of salmon belly that I made sure to savor. ---- The meh: Udon soup: bf ordered this as the ending to his meal. it was really just the noodles, broth and green onions, which was written in the menu but I kind of wish some veggies or meat was in there..   Super white tuna: I LOVE super white tuna but the one here was not succulent and melt-in-your mouth as I know it to be. There was no sauce whatsoever. Or maybe I missed it lol.. just okay.  Yellowtail: very small cut of fish! But still managed to taste a little above average. Was better than the salmon we first got for sure.. ---- What we didn't like: Pork belly: great presentation and meat looked appetizing as in had great char and color. Sadly the flavor really was not there and both slices had large flab of fat right down the middle that was just too unedible. I love pork belly and fat but after eating one slice and forcing the fat down, I couldn't do with getting the other fat glob down.  Sashimi salad: I did not know the crab mayo stuffing from a typical cali roll would be considered "crab meat" or sashimi for that matter. Yep, they layered this right atop the cubed sashimi pieces and there was a fairly good amount of it more than the actual sashimi. Still ate the whole thing cause had to..   Takoyaki: does not come dressed with sauce, mayo, aonori, green onions or furikake that should be on top. The two fried balls come with just the sauce on the side to dip. The inside was very mushy and had on or two tid bits of octopus. At least the outside was crunchy and there were some octopus inside..  mochi ice cream: we got red bean and strawberry. The menu only said they had vanilla and strawberry so I picked strawberry. Bf got red bean and I was like "they have red bean???". Table next to ours ordered a green tea one and again I was "???" But I stuck to my choice. They came out like flat disks lmao. And the mochi had some ice crystals and was not very elastic and chewy. As the ending to my meal, totally disappointed and would probably have gotten better mochi aisu from a grocery store but hey, it's ayce. --- Server was nice and checked up on us regularly. But service of food did take some time from time to time. Only once did the runner mistakenly bring one of our orders to the table next to ours but realized and brought it to us. They missed my one order of mackerel and I didn't bother to try to reorder it. And instead of getting the cucumber salad, they brought us seaweed salad which was still okay and we didn't bother to get it corrected either.  Overall, we left kind of unsatisfied. The cuts of sushi were pretty small and thin compared to other earlier pics on yelp. Maybe it's hit or miss or based on the chef behind the counter? Quality wasn't that great either. Bf  agreed it wasn't how he used to like it. I honestly don't think I will be back..

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super white tuna and first order of salmon belly, both mehhh ._.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat disk of mochi aisu
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can see ice crystals glistening xD

Z768z4ty0xOHhTX4kjEqjQ.text: After the epic meal in the tatami room hosted by Tony T. (see my review for the event), Eric R. bugged me to return here for dinner.  We arrived on Saturday around 7 and were seated immediately at the bar.  The AYCE is an amazing deal, as it includes the specials on the daily special board, grill items, salads, rolls, nigiri, and all sorts of other things.  Some of the new things I tried included the grilled tofu which was quite tasty and amaebi shrimp head miso soup.  The shrimp were a bit harder to eat since they were not fried, but the flavor of them in the broth was good.  The mackerel was cured wonderfully.  Since we were at the bar, we had a nice view of the crazy action here.  We were taken care of by 4 different sushi chefs, and it took me awhile to even start a conversation with Chef Jun, a real Japanese chef yay!, in front of us.  However, the biggest disappointment is the rice.  Sushi is all about the rice.  The volume of this restaurant is huge because of the crowds, and the rice is not acceptable for sushi rice.  First of all, it was HOT.  I am talking just made, no cooling/fanning and hardly any vinegar/seasoning.  HOT rice with ice cold fish tastes bizzaroooo.  It ruined the meal.  I noticed the first time we ate here that the nigiri slices were all out of whack.  Because of the volume, the slices are not cut with precision but with speed.  I watched the chefs cut awkward nigiri slices that barely covered the hot rice.    Eric R. asked Chef Jun about the rice.  He said they have such a demand that they just use hot rice, and he apologized because he knows it is just like sushi faux pas 101...most sushi restaurants I have been to make rice in advance.  As someone who learned how to make the rice from a local Japanese market recently, I know that it requires 45 minutes to an hour of fanning and cooling prior to serving, and that is for my small batches (3 cups at a time).  Though there is a lot of variety and I have no complaints about the service or quality, I could never enjoy hot rice touching cold uni or cold amaebi or cold hamachi...you get the idea.

6sp9zfkiSF2bNk0x6Kd-yQ.text: I've been there couples times and I was always happy about everything. But last time I went there I was really disappointed ! We took the all you can eat menu and we have been waited for 45min to be serve. And the restaurant wasn't busy at all ! We stayed maybe 2 hours total ! We ask for a discount and one of the employee told us that it wasn't impossible except having free beers. We weren't drinking tho... my friends got really upset so I went to see another employee who was really nice and she helped me having a discount.  The food is good but my last experience there didn't satisfy me...

X2eW7ujUA183gkrWPVfwfw.text: Was up in Vegas all last week and a friend recommended this place for all you can eat sushi for about $26 and this place was probably one of the best recommendations to go for sushi. First of all, they close at 3am so you can go ahead and carb load late at night. Haha. I had a variety of sushi rolls and did not disappoint at all. For what you get and what you pay is totally worth it. Only problem is that I would recommend is order as you go because it can get really confusing when the orders come out and you end up eatting your friends sushi cause they put it on the same plate as yours. So order one thign at a time and keep track of what you order. But great place for some sushi.
