Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v3ukKl2LN6DQOn3v9hB0BQ.text: Love this place have been here a few time when in Vegas.  Food is good service of great and I always leave really nice and full.  I highly recommend this place if your in Vegas.  Just a different way from LA.

OFLpeGrfwtZW8TrSNdybuQ.text: 5 stars!! Best sushi off the strip. 3 reasons...  1) All you can eat!! 2) nigiri isn't overwhelmed with rice. The fish is very fresh and cut perfectly. The piece of fish is actually bigger than the rice. 3) pork belly, melts in your mouth. Seaweed salad is delicious (different than most restaurants, awesome seasoning added)  If you're daring, take a shot of ponzu with quail egg   My only issue would be that the place is really small so you'll definitely be on a wait. But it's so worth it! I've been to this place 5 times since I first discovered it. Definitely my new favorite spot.

x_etdiG48XcCMNRMwM6c-w.text: Goyemon!!!!!! My favorite sushi place in town!!! It's a bit on the small side and is always packed! The place does not take reservation so expect to wait a while during peak busy hours. However the place is so worth it.  First things first, if you're not doing AYCE then there is no point coming here. Other than that if you got a big appetite and looking to satisfy your craving for Japanese sushi then this is the place to go! Everything here is really good. If you're into the Nigiri sushi, you have to definitely order the SUPER white tuna, Cajun albacore, seared salmon, sea urchin....ahhh whatever just order everything!!!! Also if you like ramen you should come here after 11pm since that is when it is added to their menu.   I love this place! I'd give it five stars if it wasn't for the long wait times.

8BX1Iz3VbnYz8Uok-WfO-A.text: Omg this place is UNREAL. I've had sushiMON before and didn't realize they had sister restaurants. This place has a better atmosphere in my opinion. We loved our sushi chef, Hieu. He was incredibly helpful and made us amazing rolls and nigiri sushi. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone. We'll be back for sure!

ToxjiXmPblaDDqipzSYpiw.text: The sushi was excellent. The service, however, was not. Came here for my birthday was a big group of friends, and we were seated in the room on the side. Maybe it was the fact that we had such a big group that the gratuity was automatically added on already, but the server was inattentive and rude. After we were finally seated, we were left alone for at least 10 minutes, no drinks at all, until my friend had to go and flag someone down. How do you forget that big group of people who just got seated!? And even throughout the meal, it was difficult to find someone to order extra, and when a friend wanted to order more, the waiter actually said, with attitude, "really? You want to order more? But you have more food coming." It's AYCE for a reason, and if he wanted to order more and satisfy the glutton in him, he could.   Overall a very disappointing experience.  Though the food itself was amazing, there are many sushi restaurants in town that are just as good, and they offer better service than Goyemon.

BwPTBX9jboguhqhz5BavXA.text: Food 2/10 Service 5/10 Presentation 2/10 Ambience 3/10  Small place, terrible presentation, nothing special! You can find a better AYCE

DBGYrPvlND_kgxTeJifFUQ.text: This was a great stop for lunch. Had the AYCE. Absolutely loved the Andy roll and the Supreme Salmon roll. Everything was fresh and amazing. Service was excellent also. This just might be my new Sushi go to place Tip: Get here early for lunch, the place gets packed!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andy roll

bLdytG8clu26iQG_nSQO6w.text: Very bad service!! The food is ok. The waitress is never smiling and nice to us. Half of desert you cannot choose. The worse experience in jappenase restaurant. Will  never come back again.

6jFX80YxahqOi0W8925kWA.text: Took some friends who were in town here for dinner. The wait was only about 30 minutes so no complaints there. The sushi was good, not the best but it was decent for the price. One big problem - I GOT FOOD POISONING!  Woke up around 4am and was very sick. I should note that no one else got food poisoning except for me, but nonetheless I have never gotten this sick after eating sushi before and I eat it quite a bit.    I would recommend checking out Sushi Kaya. I have never gotten sick after eating there and it is very comparable if not better.

HhLyL7agXrffEy-jPNUYLQ.text: I guess it had to happen. When I first came here about 2 years ago the quality was excellent for an AYCE sushi place. The sushi rice was actually close to sushi rice. It was one of my favorite spots for affordable sushi.  But I came today and was surprised to be seated right away. I guess other people must agree that the quality has really dropped like crazy, because I don't ever remember being seated right away. The rice just tasted like mushy overcooked white rice. I seriously doubt they did any seasoning of the rice. But looking around no one really ordered nigiri sushi so I guess they don't care about making quality sushi. It's too bad. But for the price it's still ok. Just not worth any special trip like before.  So sad

cFy_KQCP4zgXjBtSxuQzOA.text: One of my favorite past times to which I should stop due to the lack of money is eat all you can eat sushi. Alas eating fresh fish is just too good to pass up. I love eating and sushi is my favorite food so I cannot pass up eating at all the sushi places in las vegas.   This place is one of the more top notch sushi places that I have been to with fresh fish. I am more of a nigiri man myself which is why I speak about the freshness of the fish. It is very important to me to have fresh fish. The texture of these fish are amazing and have the taste that you expect to come from such fish such as salmon and tuna.   The sushi rice is also of great texture. Sticks together still in your mouth like it's supposed to. I use my fingers to eat my nigiri and the residue left behind from the rice is minor which tells of great rice.   The reason for the 4 stars is because if the quality and presentation of the nigiri. The sushi could look better. I usually like to appreciate the food before me but there doesn't seem to be anything pretty about this fish but again this is not that big of a deal.   This is a great place to go for beginners of sushi. Goyemon has a lot of menu items that anyone of all sushi levels can enjoy. The quality of fish is amazing and can be enjoyed as raw fish or in a roll. Enjoy!

je-GaevIKEn_wHYyYKiYJw.text: Brought my parents here on Mother's Day for AYCE lunch. Service was friendly and efficient; food was delicious & fresh!  Not sure if you can make reservations, but we didn't. Our party of 3 was quoted a wait time of 20 mins which I felt wasn't too bad for a holiday weekend. They take down your cell # and text you a link where you can check your place on the wait list. When it's almost your turn, they'll text you again and you can respond whether or not you'll be taking your spot -- great feature IMO so you can leave the restaurant and wander around (though there's not much to walk around in the plaza). If you choose to leave, at least you can text them back to let them know you won't be coming back for your table so it doesn't clog up the line for others.  We ordered more appetizers and nigiri than rolls, but everything we ordered was delivered quickly and tasted fresh! Rice to fish ratio was fairly small and although they state a time limit, it was never enforced. Service was great - our server came back multiple times to check up on us, take more orders, and refill our water/hot tea (complimentary). They do half rolls here in case you can't finish a full one and there is no limit on desserts! Order the lychee sorbet - it's yum!  We frequent Goyemon's sister restaurant Sushi Mon as it's closer to our house, but we'll be coming back to Goyemon from now on for AYCE since the fish is more fresh and service is more attentive and friendlier!  Also, make sure to get a stamp card! You get 1 stamp for every AYCE purchased and a free AYCE after 10 stamps. Make sure you don't lose your card as they do not combine cards & cards expire after 1 year. This card is valid at Sushi Mon as well.  Finishing touch: all moms in the restaurant received a long-stem red carnation on Mother's Day :)

1qP2VjSA6vuN2BlCywAxHA.text: My 3rd time here on 8/2/16. We waited for 75 minutes for our table of 9. The kids were getting HANGRY and it wa well I've 100 degrees outside while we waited. When we DID finally get seated, the wait staff came to get our drink orders quickly and delivered our drinks quickly as well. Since the 2 kids in our party looked like they were about to have a melt down, our server was quick to bring out their food first. Which all of the adults were appreciative of. The majority of the rest of the party had the AYCE and only 2 ordered separate meals. But by the time it was all said and done, everyone was eating off each other's plates and no one said a word. The various servers constantly checked on us for drink refills, food refills and then finally deserts; which we also got seconds and thirds of. Food as with previous trips was excellent. What they could improve on would be making sure that customers who are waiting outside are checked on, offered waters during the hot summer months. Also, they should consider taking reservations for parties of 6 or more.

_LRgtbsmuPWjzDLh2NSfsA.text: Love this place the first time I came and I love it even more. I had all you can eat this time and I tried a bunch of new things. They were all delicious.

9hewyx6CmG8fZP1RzOu3Mg.text: AYCE sushi for $27 for dinner is well worth the money. There is a time limit for an hour but that was more than enough time to stuff myself silly with sushi. It took forever for the hostess to seat us as we waited about half an hour to sit at the bar. For dinner, you are limited to one order of uni and sweet shrimp per person. There are so many options for sushi and rolls (you could get half orders). Check out the specials on the chalkboard because those items aren't on the menu. Save room for dessert! The lychee sorbet was my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vBaya4fv0J1o0NAG1OMd_A.text: I just found my new AYCE sushi spot in Vegas. When it comes to AYCE sushi, I'm pretty particular. While some places limit what you can get on the menu or overload your rolls with rice, this place does the exact opposite. The sushi AND appetizers/starters are included in their AYCE menu, and they have a great selection of unique starters and specials. (Their Spicy Tuna Rice Crackers are a must!!) They have a good selection of speciality rolls, and each roll comes with plenty of fish. The $27 price is competitive for the quality and quality. I just wish I had enough room in my stomach to try everything, but I'm definitely coming back!

UtgqaU5QlFun4_oKW3THCw.text: The wait s always super crazy! But it's always worth it. One of my absolute favorite sushi AYCE in Vegas. I recommend it to all to friends and they always return and bring more people. If you enjoy all you can eat this place is a must!!

esjT4NAuSudV_7SkMLQ_Xg.text: Their wait is silly, tables are open but they still made use wait, the staff doesn't care about the people waiting, they just like to wander around and act busy lmao, it's a funny sight to see

miwliiRB6NVj1pSWH18rAw.text: They were very friendly and completely on the ball with our orders, taking dishes and refilling our drinks! Loved it! & they their sushi is super fresh & delicious.

wZP_T7Ot0ZEe2FXgc9alcA.text: I'm jumping on the bandwagon. This place has been getting rave reviews and now I know why. I walked in on a Thursday night and the place was packed. Luckily, one lone spot at the sushi bar was calling out to me.   Everything I tried was good (except for the uni... but I'm just not a fan of it).  Grilled pork belly - Amazing! One of the best pork belly dishes I've ever had... succulent, juicy, tender, crispy edge, perfect amount of fat... It comes with a mango salsa, but it doesn't need it at all. Eating the pork by itself is the way to go.  Uni - I'm not a fan, but wanted to give it another shot since I've only had it a handful of times previously. After trying it here, I still don't like it. It was too salty and texture is not the least bit appealing.  Tuna nigiri - fresh, bright, silky texture, not too much rice.  Moon roll - eel, scallop, tempura flakes. Excellent roll, the eel took a backseat to the distinct flavor of the scallop. And, they didn't over-sauce the roll allowing the flavors of the main ingredients to shine.  Orgasm salad - Didn't quite live up to it's name, but still delicious. Nice bit of heat with the spicy chili sauce.  Spicy tuna crispy rice - Loved the crispy rice and the tuna was excellent. Each piece is big and it comes three to an order.  Hamachi nigiri - Wonderfully fresh, generous cuts of fish. The slices of fish were so big I couldn't even see the rice it was sitting on.  Tofu cheesecake - made in house, this dessert was incredibly rich and creamy.  The service and experience at the sushi bar was great. Chef Fredo took time to talk to everyone and explain the menu even though he, and the other chefs, were slammed. This is one off the strip sushi spot not to be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu cheesecake
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna crispy rice

8QI6OYtuxmCwWCiQFHs9_A.text: Facts: dinner AYCE option 26.95 open til 3 am, limit on Uni(sea urchin) and Amaebi(sweet shrimp) of 1 order (2 pieces) per guest. Also includes cooked items and dessert.  I guess the more recent reviews reflect the how things are now at Goyemon.  Thinner fish on the sushi, less quality,  and as for the service it's a craps shoot.   Some waiters are slow but I can see they are trying, so when I see that, no problem.    One of my first job was as a manager at Nobu NYC so I am a sympathetic diner who know how hard restaurant staff work.  What ruined my experience are some of the Japanese sushi men (not the Hispanic sushi guy, who was efficient and pleasant) who seem visibly annoyed and condescending when you ordered after the first round. Worst is the cuts of the fish drastically got worse.  I wish I didn't see these things (job hazard).    Bottom line: AYCE carry their limitations.   To maximize your experience at Goyemon , sit at the tables and allow a few errors to the hard working waiters.  If you must sit at the bar, hope that you get the Japanese man with glasses or the young Hispanic man. Bon sushi!

b1KWJizYs0NLLApsuCA2-w.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this AYCE sushi. This will definitely be my number 1 stop when I'm in town.  Wait is long so get there early. Even though they have a time limit, Japanese people are just way too polite to try and enforce that. While We waited the 1 1/2 hours for our table, I could tell that there were people who had definitely exceeded their time limit and still continued ordering and eating.

3zTq7EqoSfsY5BdYyruqMg.text: Based on tonight's visit i wouldn't return. Firstly, after waiting 35 min we were told we could be seated in the VIP room as soon as the rest of our party was here, as long as they arrived within 15 min. They did and then when we walked inside they had given our table away. Once we were finally seated, each order took extremely long to arrive and our server disappeared for 15-20 min at a time. With a 60 min limit on ordering, that was pretty inconvenient. Every time they did bring food over they basically slammed it down in front of us and walked away not caring where it went or even trying to just place it in the middle of the table The sushi wasn't the best I've ever had and with this kind of service I wouldn't come back.

XcNLwQrbsB66RUq5brRIdQ.text: Came here and sat at the sushi bar by myself and had a great experience because of Sushi Chef Hieu.  He not only exceeded my expectations, but went above and beyond to make dining here a great experience! Chef Hieu is very knowledgeable with fish. He did a great job explaining the tastes and textures of the fish to help make my decisions on what to order. Chef Hieu was a very polite, helpful, and funny guy. What makes him a great chef is he listens to your likes and dislikes to make recommendations to you and they were phenomenal. The food was AMAZING! Don't forget to try the lychee ice cream! It's delicious! I will definitely be coming back not only for the amazing food, but because of the exceptional customer service I received from Chef Hieu.

7EUXWlX_e9CqUOUG-SGlOQ.text: I've been a loyal customer since they first opened. I started eating there late nights after work with friends before it was the juggernaut that it has become. Unfortunately, last night will be the last time I will be eating there. I mostly eat Nigiri, and it has, apart from a few times, been fairly consistent. The rolls have been alright, but like I said, I'm not that big on rolls. The service however, has worsened every time. Last month, my girlfriend waited for 45 minutes for her rolls, suffice to say, sheer had a horrible experience. Like the loyalist I was, I was able to convince her to give it a second try. We were able to order two rounds before the server just forgot about us. She never came back to refill our drinks and take additional orders. We had to beg another server for our check so that we could leave. We waited for 45 minutes.

EvjPKs6e46G-xHMvnyMEaw.text: This place has Sushi that is in a class by itself, It's open until 3am but 2am is the last all you can eat seating, so late night hookah people might want to check it out.   The usual assortment of Nigiri and Rolls but also a few unique items. They have deep fried rolls and seared salmon. Very tasty. Try the Pork belly or the Cajun Salmon, Cajun spice and Chili sauce that is sweet and wonderful.  The staff is very friendly, and will make you feel at home.  It is so good that you should be prepared to wait for a table. But then again, if no one is in a place, that speaks volumes.  Located on Decatur and the 215 South, near Hacienda.

3bbpSzbWwVF2SZ-QsAsUTg.text: Goyemon has become our favorite Sushi place. We drive 20 minutes from Henderson to regal in this all you can eat buffet. It is a busy place and you can expect to have to wait for a table during dinner hours but it worth it. We order a glass of wine while we wait...the sushi sizes are generous and the endless possibilities make it a nice challenge to try them all! Sushi is really fresh and well cut, portions are generous and the service is prompt. We have come here with 8 people and the service was as good and as fast. My favorites are the hand rolled Unagi and Salmon Skin.

JAqBcuj9OEF-61iLQirllQ.text: Amazing! $26 and some for all you can eat (an hour to order sushi and grilled items) super white tuna, pork belly, hamachi, red dragon roll, hurricane roll, Teri chicken roll and everything else recommended!!!  The fish we were served was fresh and good quality! None tasted dry and better yet, no fatty strands.  We had a few mix-ups on orders but it wasn't a big deal since our party was pretty big. Great service and they had a lot of patience and kept their cool.

cQ9Tp1ay46uySAhr9iNAHg.text: By far the WORST customer service ever.  A few months ago the hubby dined with a buddy and was asked to leave after they paid their bill and the server collected the 30% tip. We actually boycotted this place but decided to go back because it was close to where we live. We walked into the restaurant sat for 20 minutes waiting for a table during lunch time. Although all the tables were 2 tops and we were 2+ a baby we were never acknowledged. However 2 people walked in and were immediately assisted. When I approached the waitress/hostess she said well you guys are a party of 3. Wow....I actually gotten way better service at fast food restaurants before. Restaurant is decent but I'm not going bother spending my money there with that kind of service.

kke4_y_f968-ab2uqBCBwg.text: I literally live around the corner from Goyemon.  I used to frequent Sushi Hana, I missed out on Shin, but was pretty stoked about Goyemon.  I WAS coming here twice a week for about a month.  PROS:  Open late with a last call at 2 am.  Super plus seeing how my boyfriend doesn't get out of work until 1 on the weekends and my work schedule is just all over the place.  Reasonable prices for the quality of food.  I like that they have an AYCE option even though we always ordered a la carte.  My one peeve:  After ALL the times I had frequented this place in such a short period of time....my boyfriend heads in with his family for dinner.  It was a party of 5 and 4 of them ordered AYCE... my boyfriend ordered a sashimi platter because he wasn't in an AYCE mood.  The server watched him like a hawk.... the ENTIRE night.  Long story short, my bf is a bit of snob when it comes to service so now.... he won't go back in there.  Sad face for me.  Aside from that.... My favorite roll is the Hurricane roll. Sesame chicken (karaage) is pretty good.  Goyemon was all about convenience for me... :( pretty bummed that I can't go back

IptHB4AbFuZVJLA8BBzYvw.text: Another good AYCE sushi in the Southwest neighborhood of Las Vegas; yaye!  I love how their nigiri sushi is fresh and isn't overloaded with white rice.  The nigiri here has the perfect distribution of rice and raw fish.  They have your normal rolls here but nothing that really stands out in flavor. But I like to order my favorite rolls and they are good here: Rainbow, Spider, and Stacey Roll.  They are the perfect size, fresh, and yummy.  They have all your normal sides as well, but the one that is special and unique here is the pork belly.  It's fatty but tasty and a pretty good portion.  Their baked mussels are a little over cooked here, but I like it a little burnt.  My friends did not appreciate it though.  They also have a better variety of desserts than other AYCE sushi places I have been to and they are also AYCE and you aren't just limited to one so that is definitely a plus.  This place has a super long wait if you come at prime times.  Come right at 5pm and you will get here before the dinner rush!

8ztZQ2CBMyNmvfq5k93kiw.text: Yuckkkkkkkyyyy! Ok so I'm a picky sushi eater but I think you kind of have to be right?? This place smells when you walk in like rotting fish. The women's bathroom was disgusting. It's super over crowded probably because it's so cheap. I'm giving two stars because my husband actually really liked the place and he had about 10 orders of pork belly and he said it was really good. Also it's only 2.50 for beer so that's worth a star.

9vvWh5pMGVjSiwMUEijNnA.text: I would have given Goyemon a five star several months or  years ago, but since I never wrote a review it will now lose two stars.  I loved Goyemon after I became disappointed with Sushi Mon (Silverado Ranch and Maryland Parkway) quality several years back.  Plus all the employees i like there transferred to here.   The last couple times i've been there I have been really disappointed.  The place seems to be adding way to much rice to their rolls and the fish wasn't that fresh.  To add to that I feel the service part has really gotten bad.  I can never get someone to refill my drink, take away the empty dishes, or take my order.  I know the wait is always long, but after waiting that long i would expect some service.  I think i'm over Goyemon for awhile.

QRZHHFYAS3VGavHswoZpEw.text: Terrible service ...I had to wait forever for everything  from a glass of water to the actual order . First the waitress brought the wrong order and then I had to wait half hour for an order of fried rice.

oNU4kgiwPsL-iiAGavTpqQ.text: The sushi is pretty good for what my opinion is worth. I usually eat the stuff that has been either baked or cooked in some way because I'm a loser (or so I've been told by various companions of mine at sushi restaurants). As far as being Paleo friendly, I don't think you can get much better than fresh fish, kelp, and some white rice. Skip the soy sauce (contains gluten!) and the mayo-based sauces and you're golden.  It's expensive, like all other sushi restaurants, and I'm skeptical of the quality of their fish for that price like I am with all other sushi restaurants, but given that it tastes so good I'll give it the benefit of the doubt.   The only real problem I have is that given the price of the all-you-can-eat, I feel like I have to eat at least 3 rolls to break even so I always leave there feeling like I've eaten way more than I should!   (To clarify, I prefer wild-caught fish over farmed fish, but they make no mention on the menu or anywhere else about the sourcing of their fishes, and when I asked the waitresses didn't know. Wild-caught fish would be worth the price and I wouldn't call them too expensive. Farmed fish is not worth the price, and if that's what they use then they're too expensive.)

R-W6IW2KZUnd82QKVBuERA.text: This is definitely one of my favorite Sushi places on the West Side! And I'll tell you why.   I'm a big fan of AYCE Sushi, whereas my friends are more into individual rolls at really nice Sushi places-almost Sushi snobs. Now I love individual rolls as much as the next guy, it's just I can't afford to always pay for 2 or 3 individual rolls, knowing that the bargain hunter in me wants to take an establishment for all it's worth when AYCE is involved. I love being able to sit for a long time, and take my sweet ass time ordering Sushi and the sides to my hearts content.   I would totally eat here for lunch, except I only have 45 minutes for lunch, and I like to take my time eating sushi, nigiri,sashimi and Side dishes. So I save Goyemon for times with my friends who like to chow down too. And Yes, AYCE places do have a tendency to have slightly lower quality per roll, but-knowing that you just ate about $100 of sushi for a mere $26.95(dinner) or $21.95 lunch- brings a smile to my face every time! I'm happy eating grocery store sushi, so I'm not picky...and Yes I do know what amazing sushi tastes like.  I do love there open seven days a week, I do love the courteous and prompt server girls that barely speak any english, and I do love the fact that there is almost nothing on the menu that is off limits, some piece do however have a limit of 1, or 1 per order.   I like to go in with a totally empty stomach, which can be bad at times if you don't like to wait. Usually the wait at Goyemon is about 15-25 minutes depending on what night of the week. One drawback is that it's a pretty small sushi place as far as sushi places go, and the bigger the group the longer the wait due to the limited though intimate space. Take note that if you waster food, they WILL charge you for excess waste-which is pretty standard in most places.  Another thing you can do is order the next round as you get an order placed in front of you. I like to do a sampler of a little bit of everything, but some of my best friends go straight for the jugular skipping any roll with rice and ordering Nigiri & Sashimi (Unagi, Salmon, Tuna, and Urchin) plate after plate after plate. My personal favorites are the Volcano Roll (baked YUM!) The Dragon Roll, and Salmon Roe.  One of the things I did notice is that if you order the most expensive stuff on the menu over and over, it comes out very quickly at first, and as each order goes in, they take more and more time to get it out to you.  But, seeing how there's no time limit...you've got time to spare! ;) Also, if it's your first time there, sometimes you'll space off and not realize a roll is 8 pieces, so if you want to try everything, ask for a 1/2 roll (4 pcs) so you can pick two rolls at a time.  On top of it all, you get a cool little atmosphere, great for hanging with friends, and nice hustle and bustle by the staff, and round it all out with dessert (I love the Red Bean Ice Cream!) and leave a fat & happy Buddha belly!  I love bringing people here! Be sure to check out the awesome sword in glass in the wall in the men's bathroom!  Cheers!  ~MikeB

PhnnXSGH42UqVY9x80mF7w.text: This is becoming one of my new frequent sushi spots. They have such a unique menu of rolls, the sushi is fresh, they have quick service and the servers are pretty attentive.   The spicy tuna rice cracker is soooo good and so is their edamame. The rolls i really liked were the pastel, calico, sexy girl, lemon and yesibu. I love that you can do half rolls and sample everything. Although, the whole rolls aren't overwhelming big that you can only eat 2.   Can't wait to go back.

ofLwTQATdwbjFtB94nQ33w.text: The hubby and i were in town for the new year and after spending so much money on food on the stripe, we decided to drive a little and try some local non-touristy stuff. Of course we turn to yelp to help us find a good place to eat.   Thank God Yelp brought us to Sushi House. When we entered the restaurant there was a wait and the hubby and I were afraid it was gonna be awhile since the place was packed. It was just our luck that there was a table available for 2. (I guess everyone waiting were big parties.. Lucky us) Anyway, we were surprised that. This place offers AYCE Sushi. Which of course we had. The sushi was delish!! Very fresh and they were NICE thick pieces.  Next time we come to Vegas, we will pay this place a visit...   Enjoy! =)

E5EwWct3hEb2cYzgYzKiOw.text: This is a small Sushi house. You will most likely have a 20 to thirty minute wait. But it is well worth it . Did the all you can eat for $27.00 the flavor was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DE79be7n6OilhTcrer1R5w.text: Price and quality are outstanding! The service is a little rushed, but that seems common for AYCE establishments.... All in all, I would definitely recommend this place!!  Highlights  Salmon Octopus  Uni Tuna Pork belly Baked green mussels( at least four orders every time I come) Jala jala roll   For dessert, green tea creme brulee - yum!  Also, if you love lemon and are unfamiliar with yuzu juice, be sure to ask for it! A must!

vw1AwddrxwngAndd4b8jqQ.text: Who would want to miss out this all you can eat Sushi place??  We had 6 people. We were taking to a separate room.  The interior has a warm welcome feeling with typical japanese setting.   I ordered my personal favorite Dragon Rolls, Spider Rolls, eel and cucumber rolls and hand rolls, fried calamari, yakitori chicken, California rolls, shrimp Tempura, teriyaki Chicken, and miso soup.  Yes, all that food for just $28!!!  The sushi rolls were made to order and just the way it should be! Every roll was made to perfection.  The tastes are delicious. I finished all of them.  I probably tried some of other things that my friends ordered too. I felt stuffed!   For dessert, I had Fried Ice cream, red bean ice cream and green tea ice cream.  All very good.   Friendly service! Hopefully I will have chance to come back again!

jpoNxEuttqmh5Sh5FXRZVQ.text: I came to this spot with my girlfriends before heading back home because we were craving some sushi. This place is just OK. I wasnt expecting spectacular quality of  fish because after all, it is an ayce sushi spot. What i really like about this place though is that you can order half rolls so that you don't get overly full off of the rolls and have more room to try other things. 2 stars off for horrible service. We literally had to call over the hostess because our server was nowhere to be seen 80% of the time.

7r4A46s1OJ6nNGNKEEVthw.text: Our family of 4 got here during the dinner rush (6-7pm) and we waited about 30 min before we were seated.  Our drink orders were taken right away but we had to wait a bit to order our food. No biggie, I expected it.    My husband and I ordered AYCE while the kids had a la carte dishes. Now, the sushi was great, the only gripe I had was my kid's chicken yakitori had to be sent back a few times before it was deemed edible, meaning it was raw and noticeably so.    So if you order anything from the grill be sure to check it before eating otherwise your stomach will be paying for it later.

69oz7msYYgY27khZbdiHYw.text: I am glad we read the reviews on this place and chose it over the other place nearby. They were spot on. the ayce sushi was great. lots of specialty rolls and selection. the service was fast and fresh and they even have a stamp program for those who are locals and come by often. we were only in town for the weekend and craving sushi and this hit the spot. the only downgrade was the miso soup and salad just a little bland for my taste. would recommend this spot to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caterpillar and shrimp tempura and much more on AYCE menu!

N4X5mKLFsj6_2I9RYWVypw.text: I have to be rolled out of this place after AYCE, because I can never say no to the green tea creme brulee after all the sushi. Great selection of rolls and variety of desserts.  The wait is usually 30-40 minutes at any given time of the day, but we like to use that time to take before we stuff ourselves silly.   *Will only seat you if your whole party is present

GRF5Jn6oF-sI-hT3FSOoOQ.text: Probably my favorite sushi bar in Vegas, which happens to be one of the most popular. So, first off, be ready to wait for a table.   Once you're in, the place is small, but well utilized to fit as many people as possible. The service is fast and accommodating. The entire place is nicely designed and edgy for an off-the-strip sushi place.   All food has been stellar here, but I'm not a sushi snob, so it's hard for me to be disappointed. For being popular, it's quite the treat to see they offer AYCE, which I get every time.  One of the best oddities of Sushi House Goyemon is that it's open until 3 a.m. Since I have late dinners, this is very accommodating.   All in all, with the solid food, great hours, and ambiance makes it one of the best choice for Vegas locals.

STR9wpjaasPMh_ZnnwWsfQ.text: I have been determined to find real Takoyaki.  That's why I tried this place out.  I was disappointed.  I'm pretty sure theirs was thrown in the deep fryer, which is not the way real Takoyaki is made.  It's also more mochi-like (sticky rice) rather than batter pancake-like & didn't come with the white sauce, mayo or usual garnishes.  The caterpillar roll came out looking like sloppy.  Definitely not $10 worth.  The rolls we got overall tasted decent/average.  The sesame chicken was so dry and flavor less, I had to ask for teriyaki sauce to drizzle over it.  The Green Tea Brulee was so small, the pictures are deceiving, it didn't have a hard shell on top, but it tasted great. I probably won't be going back there again.  They have a lot of competition in this town, if you know what I mean.

bz69UUCs8sOWNlzsJIvIxA.text: Love this place for All You Can Eat sushi. If you've never been to an AYCE sushi place before, you basically can keep ordering appraisers, nigiri, sushi rolls or dessert from the menu until you are full. The sushi quality was 8/10 imo. But for AYCE, that's awesome!!  Nigiri was thankfully more fish and less rice. Gyoza, garlic edamame and mochi ice cream were all A+. What a great value for money. Usually for $22, you can order maybe 2 rolls at a sushi place or maybe a nigiri platter, here it's just so much more. Would highly recommend this place!

lDoPV4SWQdvhPw_JDYHVuw.text: This is my go-to place for sushi in Vegas.  Every time someone says they have a better place I try that and then come back here.  The quality of the fish for AYCE is one of the best I've ever had.  They are very busy most of the time, but I've never felt like the wait staff has ignored me.  They are always very nice and the sushi comes out as fast as we order it.  My favorite part is they have daily specials of sushi such as masago jalapeno and salmon belly, which is SOOOOOO good.  If you go, I would suggest always try something from that list, as it is fresh and different.  If I had to give a con, I'd say that the bathroom facilities have gone downhill over the years, and there are a lot of things in the wrong place or broken.

rhJSF7gj1wq5KsDfTEqxNQ.text: Great sushi bar and fun chef's that will make whatever you want however you want it!  Very economical and locals favorite!!!!

bJxA8KKrLDdnUpsS_tU_xw.text: Came here for the $26 AYCE sushi. You get an hour to stuff your face! The service is pretty bad, and even downright rude at times, but just grab any waiter walking by and place your next order or get your drink filled. If the review was just for the service, I'd only give this place one star. But the 4 stars are for the price, variety of menu options, speed and quality.  Here are some of my fave menu items: - Sashimi salad - Miso soup with shrimp heads - Fried shrimp heads - Garlic edamame - Pork belly **one of the best I've ever had! - Rice crisps **wasn't sure about this, but ended up ordering 3 more plates of it! DELISH - Cajun salmon **check out their chalk board for specialty items.  - Cajun anything!  - Superwhite  All of the rolls were fresh and none of them were overloaded with rice. The dessert menu is by far the best I've seen on any AYCE menu. The mochi and green tea ice cream were sooo good! They even have chocolate mousse, just the perfect ending to a great dinner.  You may have to wait if you come with a group of 5 or more, and they stop seating at 2am, so make sure to get there with enough time. This is quickly becoming a local hot spot!

jKJWFtaAemD2l-il5SERLQ.text: Four of us went to this place on 12/21/2012 for all you can eat dinner. All of us got severe food poisoning after 8 hours later. Trust me I am in the medical field. At first, severe nausea and uncontrollable vomiting occurs. Next phase comes watery diarrhea for 12 hours. If we didn't eat activated charcoal to stop further toxic absortion, we might have went to an ER. Please be aware of this place, aside from their horrible service, their food is dangerous. One important thing I want to mention is their menu item "Super White Tuna", also known as Escolar (White Tuna) according to wikipedia. It is known to be toxic and banned by Japanese government!!!! But don't you worry, they serve it right here for us who do not know. Here is your reference, en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/... I will need to further research this but after going through the poisoning myself, I will never go to this place.

2p61kxrgH03SFeOw0f7eHg.text: Par to sub par for a AYCE sushi bar.  Nice atmosphere, decorating, lighting, outside seating, and open till 3am, are some of the selling points, but their fish pieces are small, sushi rice was borderline and their sashimi salad was a sad excuse.  Unlike other AYCE, their soft shell crab is not included in the $27 price tag.  Their one redeeming item was their "pork belly". Pretty incredible, actually. Ive never seen this item at other sushi bars, but after eating their sushi i understand why they added it to the menu.... I suspect it's their only reason for success.

987t5DIFzNxPKiEmPhmauA.text: I come here to eat all you can eat sushi. My first orders came pretty fast but after waiting 20 mins, they don't ask if I want more. Now time is up and I can't eat anymore. I definitely won't be coming back to this place.

vPueL_g0O5yZ-4E1qUcvwA.text: For $21.95 AYCE Sushi lunch special, it's pretty worth it. We tried everything on the menu & being hammered from the night before & dancing so much @ marquee helped with the appetite.  The service was friendly, the sushi was good, and so were their appetizers & special dishes. I did notice majority of their rolls included spicy tuna, which for me is AWESOME because I love spicy tuna, but if your a purist and you know your sushi, you know why they use it, but anyways ----- dessert options ... must get is the lychee sorbet & tempura ice cream.

_guxHeGKV8d_LvHY7f6Ogw.text: This place is one of the reasons why I go to Vegas!! For $26.95, you can eat the BEST AYCE sushi dinner in Vegas. It is a short drive from the strip, but way more worth it than other overpriced restaurants on the strip.  I highly recommend getting their fresh nigiri, but if you are in a big group, make sure to order reasonable amounts at a time since ordering too much at once will slow down your order significantly. Their rolls are very good too to go well with the nigiri. You WILL feel VERY VERY full after eating lots of exceptional sushi, but everyone has a second stomach for deserts, right? Their lychee sorbet will cleanse your palates as well as make your day better. This is a MUST stop for any Vegas trips

_lzo17isdwhnfbAg-L6AuQ.text: In the beginning,  we were waiting forever for our sushi! But after awhile, we started getting everything faster. The rice to fish ratio is amazing!  You can order just half a roll rather than a full roll! But you have to go early because it's a small restaurant and doesn't take reservations.  The baked mussels were so good along with the mochi ice cream they have for dessert!

rV5XCzLNHjBmZXWiHJuKvQ.text: AYCE Sushi! SOOO GOOD!  Got here like 30 min before they opened so me and my group of friends got to sit down immediately when they opened.   First off we got here for lunch so some items on the menu are not included in the lunch menu. If you do get it, you have to pay the dinner price for AYCE. I wanted to try the pork belly but it was only for dinner.  Also, you have to make sure you don't overeat. You will be charged for anything you do not eat. Even if you order a nigiri and just eat the fish off of it and leave the rice, you will be charged for the rice leftovers! With that warning, my friends and I were cautious only ordering small amounts at a time. We did pretty good as the portions for the sushi items were not that big and when we order we ordered for the whole table instead of individual servings.   The highlight for me was the super white tuna! It was really tasty! I would love to come back here for dinner but would want to come here early as I hear the wait could be as long as 2 hours!

pu0-zI1cd94oMir-WAh2zQ.text: I was disappointed with my last visit to Goyemon so I am knocking off a star...  First off, Freds, the amazing sushi chef that took such great care of us when we'd go in for lunch, it no longer working for Goyemon.  We enjoyed having Freds make us surprise rolls as we devoured nigiri, and he was a GREAT conversationalist. I have yet to experience the same type of friendly customer service from the other chefs that work during the lunch hour.   More importantly is the waitress service. The first time they forgot our edemame it wasn't a huge deal because, like I said in my original review, that's just more room for more fish. But this last time, I actually DID want to munch on some edemame as we waited for our food. What reasonable excuse is there for it to take over 20 minutes to get some damn edemame at a sushi joint? None.   Drinks were slow to get refilled, plates were slow to be bussed. I understand that the space behind the sushi bar is limited and so it's difficult to have more then 2 sushi chefs working, which can sometimes result in the sushi coming out slow. The management at Goyemon really needs to either hire more wait staff, or better train the ones they do have, because a great sushi eating experience should not be soured by slow and inefficient waitresses.   Goyemon, I still like you but if you keep this up, I am going to have to find a new spot to fill my urges for raw fish. :(

mi5mPCvjmFGAPBptPHgZ3A.text: We ordered about 10 different things and they only served about half of them. The waiter starts to ignore us after the first order.

n_7zWf7nHQNP539k6uu6tw.text: Experience here was terrible due to the lack of quality service. The waiters constantly messed up our orders. We were given extra orders of sushi and was told that we'd be charge for the 2 pieces of extra rice left on our plates.

ID98GgmoRj0UOeGqmKOEBw.text: The best part is that it's AYCE and they provide sushi in the middle of a desert, the food is good but nothing to write home about and the food takes a while to come out. The service is great though. Our waters stayed full and the bus persons came by frequently to clear our table of the empty dishes. If there was a 3.8 star then I would give that instead but no more until they improve on the meal prep times and quality.

vd6oAPg97ZP1qBgV0d7jYw.text: Our favorite place for Sushi. Its always packed, especially at night. The first time we went here was at 130 am and we had to wait 15 minutes to get seated. We always come here for a quick sushi dinner stop or a full buffet. Its a small place. Not fancy but it always hit the spot. The dinner specials for $10 is the best deal. The sexy girl and rock and roll are our favorites.

dxUryEb9oXOr6Kihy2yhxg.text: Came here last night after work with my coworker and my cousin. He told us it was a great place to eat, he wasn't wrong. The hostess and our waiter were nothing but smiles and its nice to see that when being helped. The dragon roll was absolutely delicious, as was the hurricane roll. I tried the ecstasy roll and it wasn't what i expected. (Probably won't order that one again). Now that i am writing this, i forgot we never ordered the 911 roll. Good thing we plan on going back (: now i'm looking forward to it. It was an overall good experience.

6QCwn4j51Okq_i2Kw-HAng.text: Great sushi ! I ordered a miso a magma roll and 1/2 a lemon roll. All yummy but I spent $18 and wasn't full so I should have just done the unlimited lunch special for $21 :) next time !

Sr9oY8s8JP6awoPotr086g.text: Everything is always great.  Good for those that don't eat sushi as well.  Not five, because of their awareness of customer comfort

MEo3Yk8F4-vnAKO_cHw_DQ.text: We went on a Thursday night and was told it would be an hour wait, but we were actually seated within 20 minutes. The service was nice but super slow. It seemed like they were overwhelmed, but when you looked around there were plenty of servers. We ordered our food, but only 4 of our 8 items came out. Then the server came back around and asked if we wanted to order more. We had to inform him that we only received half our order the first time. He apologized and said that the kitchen might have accidentally threw away the order. So we reordered, but this time the food was wrong. At this point we just took it and ate what we could and left. Food tasted okay, but the server needs to be more organized.

j86uiEjoSX7ZDMkuyY3tiw.text: Like a few Yelpers before me who mentioned the parking situation in this plaza being quite deceiving... We pulled up on a Saturday night at exactly 6pm. I was like, "No cars, shouldn't be packed." I walked inside to find a few people waiting and I proceeded to inform the hostess, two please. She said, "Okay maybe 30-40 minutes." Where in the hell are all those people waiting then? I didn't really see them or their cars. In actuality, the wait ended up being about 20 minutes. I did tell her we didn't care if it was the bar or a table. Plus, it was only two of us so that probably made things easier. The restaurant itself isn't that big to begin with. Also, the tables are small and in close proximity to one another. I could've practically reached over with my chopsticks to ninja that Cajun albacore sushi off the neighbor's plate if I wanted to. There were some nice flat screens on the walls, just in time for the NBA All-Star events.  I HIGHLY recommend you arriving early. Don't show up during crunch time and expect to be seated immediately. They NO LONGER accept reservations nor do I think they care if you carry a platinum player's card from one of the many prestigious casinos on the strip. You may want to ditch the entire posse because rolling deep here will probably mean a substantial wait time unless you come super early. This restaurant closes at 3AM and opens at 11:45AM so you have plenty of time to figure out when is best to stroll in.  Once seated, you have the option to either do the regular pay for whatever you order or go all out and hit the AYCE: lunch $22, dinner $27. Personally, we were there to make it rain. Here's the thing about AYCE especially when it comes to sushi, you must have a strategy. Now, before you all say that you hide the rice (which they repeatedly discourage it here; signs placed everywhere), that is not the only tactic to rely on. First, let me be clear when I say that they do not try to play you by giving a heap of rice. The rice portion for our sushi & rolls was actually quite minimal and I give them props for it. Most AYCE sushi joints as we know will load up with this lovely carb to get us full faster. If you attack all the crazy rolls they have, you will obviously get full fast. Luckily, for you they offer half orders on 80% of their rolls so you are able to try their many numerous rolls. Our first round, we attacked the sushi off the bat. I could've sworn, we ordered up to 8-10 nigiri sushi. Might as well test the quality of the fish.  The amount of food we ordered was tremendous even though it was just the two of us. Our small table was always cluttered or packed with dishes, either empty or full. Service was quite efficient. They constantly cleared out our plates, refilled our drinks, and the food came out in a timely manner. You have about an hour to do the AYCE I believe. Don't worry, it's plenty of time. Don't feel like you need to order everything in the first blow and gulp everything down. We probably ordered 4 or 5 times total and we still were able to somehow squeeze in desert before the hour ended. Before you kill everything in front of you, bust another order so that they can start making it and it'll be in front of you sooner to save time.  As I said, we ordered way too many different items that I can't even recall much in great details. Don't forget to check their specialty menu because it may change daily. They supposedly serve some soup noodles starting at 11pm. I guess to draw in the drunkies.   Not everything was a thumbs up but I definitely thought that most of what we ordered was pretty good and fresh. If you love pork, get the pork belly appetizer. You will probably order a few. The spider roll was great but uber heavy and if I would've known, I would've avoided it so I can eat more of other things. Plus it's listed under the "Can't order  1/2 only" section. Check out the Sexy Girl roll, that was one of the tastier specialty rolls. You will notice that there are many sexual inspired names for these rolls too. The miso soup was a bit bland. You can get the tamago sushi, sweet steamed egg without the rice which was really fresh and baked to perfection. The lychee sorbet and the green tea creme brulee was just alright. I wished I ordered the tempura ice cream or the always classy, green tea ice cream too but I was about to explode at that point. There were a number of other stuff we ordered but I'll leave the whole "wanting to order everything on their menu" experience for when you go check them out yourselves.  I would like to add though that their seaweed salad was very refreshing. We ordered it 3x!  I don't think you will be disappointed if you ate here. It was one of the better AYCE sushi joints I've experienced. You can't expect the bomb biggity bay at these type of AYCE sushi places but Sushi House Goyemon does an overall outstanding job in every aspect of the getting the job done.   Remember, I warned you to stay away from this place during peaked.

LTsR3PJsxHmJthJZqlqb8Q.text: So annoyed that I waited over two hours to get disappointing sushi. You must go early, probably like when they open, to avoid a rush. I was discouraged to go somewhere else for ayce sushi based on the fantastic reviews. One of the review said they went somewhere else and regretted it so I didn't want to make the same mistake they did. But I guess it was a lose-lose situation. The server we had was great. We put in a massive order once we sat down because we had two hours to study the menu. The sushi itself was disappointing because their nigiri and rolls were small portioned and the fish wasn't fresh. You can find fresher fish at Sakura sushi east of the strip. It is not worth starving yourself to eat mediocre sushi. Don't do it, just say no and go.

AGzPbXJiDnj7hpwC0LDjLg.text: We did the all you can eat sushi for $27 for 1hr. It was so worth it for the amount of sushi we can eat. We ordered all the rolls and nigiri we could. Service was great and food came out quickly. We also ordered steam dumplings and pork belly and shrimp tempura, etc.  All of this was included. Everything was on point. In the end, a full belly and a cot calling my name.

k_VFBIJwU3HaTWl7Wyvnsw.text: Really decent all you can eat. Lunch is for $21 and you can get half portions on most rolls so you can try a bunch of things.   I've been here 2 times and service was good the first time, but the second time, we were a little concerned because the quote is 45 minutes but the service was dragging and we were thinking they would cut us off directly at time.   I do appreciate how not ever roll is covered in sauce. Even though some rolls were overly complicated, the fish was able to speak for itself in most instances.

hrcoKE2JcK2xomCqIE2iGw.text: I love that's like $20 for all you can eat sushi it's a amaazzzziiinngg  it was my first time  and it was totally worth it . I recommend you go

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy girl

NM4z1bPN3L925T5zHTuRag.text: Alright alright alright. I mean that in every Matthew McConaughey way possible. This place is solid as a an AYCE sushi place can get.   We were seated in about 40 minutes on a Friday night. The hostess had told us an hour and took our number, I was very pleasantly surprised at the convenience of the online system in which you can see where you are in line. Every restaurant in the world should have this system. We were seventh in line, then fifth, and then a text "Are you coming? If so press 2" etc.   The rolls here are sub par. They aren't bad. They aren't good. Nothing I ordered really "popped". They were good, but they didn't leave me flabbergasted and fascinated like Yama Sushi's 'No Name' roll or Kaya Sushi's 'Cinderella' or 'XXX3' roll does. While eating a roll all I could think was "I need to order more nigiri." Why? Their Sushi Nigiri is by far the best in town that I have had.   Salmon Belly, Salmon Collar, even plain ole' happy Tuna and Yellowtail were all phenomenal. Melt in your mouth. Oh lord the unagi made me want to order all of it they had in the building. The rice was perfectly made, even a Japanese chef would cry at its delicious chewy and sticky quality I imagine. Their sushi rice is the best I've had in Las Vegas. If you come here, come as a fan of nigir. If you come here as a fan of rolls and rolls only you are going to be disappointed.   My girlfriend is one of those people , she gives this place a strong 2 1/2 stars.   The servers were friendly, we had no issues with service. The 26 bucks a person for dinner was definitely worth it and we'll be back!   TL:DR: Go for Nigiri, not for rolls. Order Salmon Belly and Pork Belly.

aKwEq1l1eXp_mcfrRrHO3A.text: This was my second time here. The first time, if I had written a review it would have been a solid 4.5, but something must have changed here!  On a Thursday night, there was an hour wait. We were hungry but we all thought it was a good sign that it was so busy - wrong! After our hour of waiting around, we were seated by a bland hostess who didn't seem to want to be there. Then we waited at our table for someone to take our drink order. Once we finally got our waters in, we ordered some AYCE appetizers and nigiri. I've never waited so long for any nigiri ever!  Basically, the entire meal, the service was terrible. On to the food review:  The rice on the nigiri was very small (YES!), so we thought we could eat more! But. The rice was so hard and chunky that it was barely edible. The fish was good and most of the rolls that we had tried were good. The appetizers were all good. Notice, that nothing was great. Well, just one thing - I have to agree that the pork belly literally saved this trip. It was so tender and delicious. Other than that, I have to go with yelp's two star saying, "Meh. I've experienced better."  Yes, I did come in hungry, and yes, I did leave full. But it just wasn't a great experience for me. With so many fantastic AYCE sushi places in Vegas, businesses really do need to step up their entire game. I think Goyemon maybe have fallen complacent in their ratings.

DCMsUPZce5jFMLSwqYiWlg.text: I usually don't write reviews but I have been in the service industry for 7 years and this was one of the worst places I've been service wise. I feel as if all these reviews a bias. First i'll say we went there to celebrate my gfs and her friends birthday. We tried to call to make a reservation and they said they don't do that... ok cool. We showed up as a walk-in at approximately 7pm... we literally waited for a table for 2 hours on a MONDAY night... it was super busy at all. We finally got a table at 9pm the server came over and was so disorganized taking orders. I was the first person in our party to order food... and the very last to receive my food after an hour which on the menu it states "All You Can Eat" is only for 60min.... that's how long it took me to get my very first order. We waited for forever to get any food whatsoever. It was a complete mess and so disorganized I will never go to this place again.   Ratings:  Food           3 Service         -3 Wait time        -10

G9hxseC3p0yEqYR5eFRSqA.text: This place almost ties with Sushi Koma as my favorite AYCE place.  Certainly the owner wins for most energy. She came around to every table which was amazing.  The food was fresh. The fish to rice ratio was decent (better than most places, not as good as sushi coma) and the only disappointment was they were out of Uni =[ =[ but I'm definitely willing to come back (and maybe will just call to verify they have uni in the first place)

YTsX8GffbSa89z7xjEXVQw.text: This place was terrible. Walked in and a server was leaning against the podium flapping his gums to a table of his friends. The host had to push him off to get menus and seat us, in Talking Tommy's section of course. Service was pretty bad and intermittent. Constantly had to repeat what we were ordering, which was a real pleasure only to not get what we ordered anyway. Let's see.. The food.  Woah, this was no better than grocery store purchased sushi. I spent $29.50 on this?  *Everything was dry, edamame was that of shoe leather and dry as a bone.  *Rice was super dry. Vegetables in the sushi were clearly previously frozen. *Pot stickers were burned. *I wish I could cuss on Yelp. *bathroom was gross, no TP no soap.  *what happens when a restaurant doesn't have soap in the bathroom? That also means the the employees don't wash theirs either.

mcG-DrYVge0dLRcGpqSsmQ.text: It was a late night dinner with my bestie! we were craving some ramen on this cold night! I decided to swing by here since, it was closer to the area and I didnt want to drive up to Spring Mtn. The wait was about 40 min long.. Tip* - Order Ramen after 11 pm if you want some.. (After Monta closes) --- Next time I would come back and try the AYCE Sushi for sure!! i'll be back!!  4 stars because of the wait time, but the food was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shoyu ramen.. order by 11pm ;) (monta closes)

uvOLM4nn_yrmPpA6VXT-fA.text: Great friendly service every time I come here. Typically I order from the a la carte menu and add a roll or nigiri.  Teryaki sauce is excellent. Their curry is very good as well.   Be sure to check the chalk board near the sushi bar for their specials.  Most evenings they are pretty busy even at 530pm I've had to wait for a table.  Not great for groups of 10 or more.

Dddy1h8JscpsduX8QMhonA.text: I came here after getting drunk at the encore day club so I wasn't too aware of my surroundings but I will try to elaborate my experience! I came here at 11pm at night and the wait time was 20 mins.  I was really cravings sushi and this place offers all you can eat for $26 a person or you can just order from their menu.  I sat at the sushi bar area bc I love conversating with sushi chefs! They give you the best recommendation.   July 3rds staff was on point! All the chefs and waitresses were SOOO nice!!!  The all you can eat is basically the whole menu excluding sashimi. I ordered a lot of tuna garlic and salmon belly nigiri. They even have mochi ICECREAM for dessert and tempura fried icecream.   They offer stamp cards for locals here as well. This will be my goto sushi spot everytime I visit vegas.

HOg4fX6FGGVO-bj4ywhfyA.text: My husband and I are here for the very first time. We are actually sitting in the restaurant as we speak. The guy who seated us were rushing us just as soon as we were seated. I don't like being rushed and I had to feed my 18 month old son first so I didn't have time to look at the menu. I'm very pissed off on how I was treated. I don't care there's many families outside waiting for a table. You don't rush someone just when we just been seated. Because of that, I'm rating you a 1 star. I'm very upset.

x7wrZVyxG7pko1PlW1O3Tw.text: My absolute favorite AYCE sushi in Las Vegas! Good quality fish and very tasty menu items.   I personally go to any AYCE sushi for the nigiri. They give you decent portions of fish on top of a small bed of rice. If you go for dinner, you HAVE to get the salmon belly... It literally melts in your mouth! The salmon, tuna, yellowtail, and the Cajun Albacore are some of my favorite nigiri that are my go to's. My mouth waters just thinking about it!  For appetizers or sides, I always get the miso soup, seaweed salad, and the tuna poke. It makes the AYCE meal complete.   You can order rolls or half rolls too, and there is a large selection you can choose from. They're delicious, but for AYCE sushi I would rather get full off of the nigiri.  Grilled salmon collar, gyoza, shrimp tempura, baked mussels, and teriyaki chicken are a few of the other small dishes for those who might not like raw fish or sushi. Although if you didn't like sushi, I'm not quite sure why you'd be dining at an AYCE sushi restaurant...  A mochi is the best way to end the meal. There's other delectable deserts to choose from as well, ranging from green tea ice cream to lychee sorbet.  The only negative about Goyemon is that the servers can get busy and become inattentive. There's also usually a bit of a wait, but when it's one of the best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas, a wait is a given, and well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh nigiri

aWba60l_-nGAOljEuKmkMw.text: Although we had a long wait...It was our first time eating here & well worth it. My friend brought us for dinner & we picked the All u can eat which is great bc u can try different sushi rolls but also get edamame,shrimp tempura, soup etc. great idea-we will be back next time we come to Vegas. Love the outgoing lady w/blue eye shadow too (manager?) it was packed w/lots of regulars, a good sign.

Rws2MIQKraZnMnZURVlibw.text: Great sushi chefs.  Worse service this time around so not sure I'll be back. Next time perhaps sit near the register at sushi bar and remind them that not everyone is AYCE customers to avoid 20 min delay in bill and leaving AND my name is not honey or sweetheart.

GsQZPgL8y3TBDgORavVK2A.text: I don't understand why this place gets jammed packed. Came here last night with my GF and we waited 30 minutes for a table which is whatever. The sushi was like a 6/10 but the service was horrible. We got the all you can eat and not once, not twice, but 3 times we put an order in and they never brought it out. It took them 25 minutes to bring out udon noodle soup which the brother is already made and steamed shrimp shumai that takes about 2 Minutes. Wouldn't come here again.

wZkArhRUuVHvQ37V7Y97sw.text: Solid sushi place our go to when it comes to taking family and friends from out of town to sushi. I like their rotating specials. This trip was bluefin. The sushi pieces are on the smaller side but that's cuz it's all you can eat. Their pork belly is great so..greattttt. And I like that they have a punch card buy ten get one free. Definitely go now.

qVMAUqpMSaY_s_hNSMQUQQ.text: Not a Japanese-run establishment. (Not even Asian for that matter!) Food: deluxe combo lunch special. Comes with sashimi, chicken teriyaki, tempura, salad, seaweed salad, miso soup and rice.   I didn't care for the quality of the food. The sashimi were tiny slivers. Chicken teriyaki hardly grilled (was white). My miso soup tasted like they didn't rinse the dish when they washed it so it tasted soapy and I didn't finish it.   Location: we only came here because it wasn't far from the International Market.    Service: ok.   I don't plan to be back.

fFq9bj1SwI4PpYJb5kqI1g.text: First time here love to see they have kid prices and it is coke products. So far it's a great experience we are at the bar our chef is great and is getting our rolls to us fast. The garlic edamame is amazing and the tuna poke. Not a fan of the calamari just because I'm not use to thick pieces. But hey they have a "Vegas Knight Roll" that isn't bad and they are showing support to our boys so hell yeah. We will be back.

g1THdD631tMXEkvo8aDjVw.text: I love this place and This has been my go to spot for years but now I'm just disappointed with what this place is now.  The long waits and new non-enthused servers didn't bother us much but the fact that they charged us an additional sushi roll for not eating ONE PIECE of sushi.  What a joke.  The worse part is that the little Asian server with all the makeup had the nerve to take off the trash that we placed on the one piece of sushi and gave us the Option of paying for a roll or eating the dirty sushi. Other than her horrible service, we usually have a great time here

hG5eBZ0s-TgUdKnA3XHdLw.text: Nigiri here is superior to the other AYCE joints with similar offerings. Great Fish to Rice Ratio. Quality ingredients and changing daily specials. Open Late Night. Stamp Loyalty Card 11th is Free.

3CwEqFwW8dKZqAXxDgEQdQ.text: To Goyemon and who ever eats there: On 2018 Valentine's day, me and my wife had dinner at this restaurant, we have experienced very unpleasant circumstance  which a mid-age american couple sat next to us complained to the team lead manager that we were being rude to them and had disturbed their dinning mood. What happened was we were having great time talking about our day in Chinese, we laughed and told jokes, which we have no conversation with them what so ever. Even though after that instance occurred, which we were having no clue that were being complained. After they left, i ask the team lead what's going on and we got to know that we were complained by the couple sat next to us, we as foreigner from other country felt deeply offend by the racial discrimination. In this Yelp post I'd like to say just you might don't understand another language, doesn't mean that people were talk shit and make fun of you, stop your non sense assumption. Black history month which supposed to reminds people to live free and all human born equal, it is truly shame racism and racist still exists now days!   NO RACIAL DISCRIMINATION!!!

8hWlAvUH7LAbANm20pQMkw.text: Great food! The sushi is made fresh upon order and the service was great as well. Highly recommend if you are craving sushi and would like a more peaceful atmosphere compared to places on the strip.

DRANOR6cyhgZqRtKGfVNOA.text: SUPER FRESH ALL-YOU-CAN EAT SUSHI :D  Bite size little balls of deliciousness! The menu is extensive from appetizers, udon, tempura, speciality rolls, sashimi, and dessert! They also have daily specials which they only have a limited amount! When I went they had cooked tuna jaw and salmon belly sashimi. Both were super fresh and tasty. What I really like about this place is that they don't overstuff you with rice like I feel like most places do. I am going to mention what I can remember because I feel like the food just kept coming.   Scallop: You have to try the raw scallop. It was SOO perfect, it just melted in your mouth.   Uni: I tried Uni for the first time here and that was AMAZING! Sadly you are limited to 2 pieces of Uni per person.    Fried spicy tuna: I forgot what this is called, but its spicy tuna on rice fried to perfection. It is one of the appetizers. So tasty! It is fried just slightly to add a little crunch to your bite.   Salmon Belly: This was a special that day which was very yummy! So moist and melted in your mouth!   Tuna Jaw: It was baked I think? It was veryyyyy tasty! This was a special of the day.  Sashimi Salad: yummy!! Nice portion of greens and raw fish on top.  Seaweed salad: can never go wrong with seaweed salad :]  Edamame: There is an option between garlic and regular. I didn't really like the garlic soysauce one. Go for the regular!  Octopus: Not that great, it was chewy, but isn't it always??...  And on to desserts! There were so many choices from green tea ice cream, red bean ice cream, sherbert, green tea creme brule, vanilla ice cream, green tea mochi, tempura ice cream. I think I am missing a few, but there were so many options!!   The green tea ice cream and creme brule were both yummy!! Others said the green tea mochi was good too! The tempura ice cream was just plain vanilla with a thick batter. The batter was too thick and not really tempura fried.. so I wouldn't get that again.   The service was also phenomenal! The food came out quickly each time we ordered and waitress was always very friendly and attentive! This is a gem off the strip of Vegas! $27 such a steal!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh raw scallop
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Uni

YlWywNHxiPSUpgtqQWzRMw.text: Average as sushi places go... rolls lacked proper level of fish.  Wait staff was prompt but distracted.  Bathrooms were gross and dirty which makes one wonder about the kitchen.  We were here on a recommendation but left disappointed.

N6cHdsaWwGT-y9b9t5VMpA.text: I understand the hype.  The fish is super fresh.  The salmon tasted amazing. And I was able to try things I've never tried before. JELLYFISH.  Crazy, right?  The tuna was the only thing that tasted funny.  The garlic tuna tasted more like a yuzu type of tuna instead.  My lady lost her appetite after we got the regular tuna. To her, it tasted how canned tuna smelled. And it ruined everything after that.  But on the plus side.  That lychee sherbet was awesome. Big fan of that.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GfOA5yhzT8_xHQB5kUTnoA.text: Errmahgurd... we come here every time we're in Vegas. I know what your thinking. How good can sushi in the desert (300 mi from the ocean) really be? But take it from a Hawaiian that has eaten fish right out of the sea, that this place is jams! Hamachi kama, salmon belly nigiri, super white, yellow tail, caterpillar roll, red dragon roll, miso soup, and green tea ice cream on lock. This place is like 10 minutes off the strip and open till 3 am. Parking is never a problem and the staff is very friendly and attentive. They're a little slow when they're slammed with customers, but that's completely understandable if there's only a few people on staff at 1am. The only thing I have left to say to the owners of the business is PLEASE OPEN A GOYEMON IN LA OR HI

VqgPFE4SumS4jPZbrxfzZw.text: I doubted this place at first... but they changed and I'm glad I gave them another chance. Good size sushi, good balance, good portion... yah know what I mean. You can actually taste the fish unlike other sushi place.. please stay the same and never change :)

cMVb4oBpAGTcTpoInYyNww.text: The sushi house goyemon is so yummy! Our kids aged 14 and 16 went wild with all the choices. For all you can eat, it's a good value. There are tons of choices for sushi, rolls, desserts and grilled items. We LOVED it! The ambience is cool, and the service is always good. We always come here when visiting Vegas! It's also nice to get off the strip, and pay normal prices. We'll be back!

63bvYps52XfpUyC-vN2SSg.text: If you want AYCE sushi or a late night bite. Here is the place to go. You definitely will be waiting, unless you go early. So just be prepared no matter how hungry you are!  I've tried a lot of the items on the menu from the baked mussels to caterpillar rolls, tiger rolls and others. Also, try the lycee sorbet for dessert. You will not regret it. And if you're a lemon lover, try the Yuzu sauce as a dipping sauce than soy sauce. GAME CHANGER!

I asked about them 45 minutes into our meal and some items still never arrived. They don't care about the service provided or if you ever get your food.

i9MDZvGB0_6GbUDxCGFQWA.text: It has been a really long time since I went there but I still remember how yummy the Frying Jason was! I had never had baked rolls before so I was quite amazed by my first bite. I am jealous that people live in LV can enjoy so many buffets with good quality and good price. I would travel to Vegas again just for food lol. Drop one star because of the service. We were rushed by our waitress who was impatient and rude.

G2IxRDXF7V6XdkCNFHjyWA.text: Always good quality sushi. Good for date night. We often go late at night where they have lunch price for dinner AYCE after midnight.

mvdDkafp4_A-4KqcM7CiuQ.text: I used to love this place. It was great service and great food but now I experience differently. Today I was here and only met a food server twice for the drink orders and the food orders. While we having a meal nobody stops by and ask anything about the food or anything else. It was slow business only 5 tables with 4 FOH staff. Each table has 2-4 people. We had only edamame on the table and the staff walked by taking the dirty dishes away. But I never get to order anything else. It is all you can eat. Even I don't need anything else the server should stop by and ask. By the way the food was great and I give 2 stars for that. Service was bad 0 stars for that.

4b5hY2JQH7f2G0JKA2eAlw.text: My favorite GO-TO Sushi place! Best sushi! Always ask for off the menu items (pork belly-melts in your mouth)

RL4AWhZatQE8hZUAjqu_HA.text: Really good place. Definitely one of the best Sushi places out here in Vegas. Good quality food and service. Their portions are also very generous. This is definitely a go to place if you want sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MH4D5InwVtg5hqvZSZxevQ.text: I usually do the Dinner AYCE. The servers don't necessarily have the best service but considering the limited capacity I can overlook that. Typically wait time is 15 minutes here if not the weekend and 20-30 on a busy day. From a sushi standpoint, their sushi doesn't really stand out; nothing spectacular I can think of even though I order their most expensive rolls. But the appetizers are pretty good. For instance their tuna and tako poke is decent. Their mussels are pretty flavorful. Their tempura is fried correctly. To top it off they do have some seasonal/daily special items like ramen/udon, miso soup with clams and other flavors of ice cream. So food is above average like 3.5 stars. But what makes it 4 stars is the small things: 1. They have a reward program where if you buy 10 meals, you get one free 2. They actually allow their clients to try as many of the desserts as you want (some sushi AYCE restrict you to one) and 3. Their parking is easy (as restaurants expand in Vegas, parking can be an issue whether it be on or off Strip). I would come back.

DO2au38y0QUnvnhghA46mw.text: Service kind of lacked but that's expected with a place that's always busy, but the food was also pretty good. I just wish that they kept up with the water service. Overall, I'd come back again.

UlUGZy2kwFGS8gVZY3GzXQ.text: We really enjoyed our waitress Sarah who attended to us with such care and such a great personality and such a joy to have someone be as kind as she is. We truly appreciate her for being so kind and considerate.  Just as lovely in person and what's inside  shows on the outside. She's a keeper in my book. Don't let her go.  I also would like to say that Sarah is one of the most amazing most prolific intelligent employees that exemplifies noble charisma and her assisting our tables this evening made us feel more than welcome and this beautiful establishment. Thank you so much. Yes I can go on and on about her exquisite deliverance of herself to our table she went up and beyond the Call of Duty your teachings to her exemplified itself in a monumental manner here you thank you so much many places to your establishment and many more employees like miss Sarah God bless

LwTrYucOCvmVKpOzzfStBQ.text: I've never really liked Goyemon.  It's far from where I live.   It's always busy.  I can get almost the same exact menu at Sushimon by my house.   However, my boyfriend loves it so I have to endure.  Luckily for me, even he now sees the decline in service and quality.   On this particular trip we almost never saw our server and she seemed super bothered to be anywhere near us.  The food also came out so slowly.  We got a spicy tuna roll and it was spoiled.   Like actually disgusting tasting and I got no apology or even any empathy for it.  I actually feel like The server tried to ignore us more after that.   The mussels which are my absolute favorite were sad and watery.   The rest of the items were ok.   Not bad boy outstanding.     I just wish my bf would stop trying to see if it's "good today..."
