YRxEz_THjstj76emGtkOnA.text: I've tried so many ayce sushi places all over town. I lived in Chinatown for 4 years so I've had my fair share of the ones in that area as well. Goyemon has to be the best one I've tried so far, why? The quality of fish seems to be the freshest, and their sushi has the most fish to rice ratio. They're not trying fill you up with a bunch of rice and skimp you on the fish.

NKXCTFU0I3AJLneStn52uw.text: I used to always come here since I am a big fan of AYCE sushi. Until a few months ago one of the server her name was Sarah gave us a very bad attitude and was very rude to us which I am not going to mention about the detail because this is not the main reason I am writing this review today. I haven't been here in a big while afterwards as to how pathetic of what happened. Until today I want to give Goeymon a try again because I love the food here and aside from what happened the service was always good. Timmay always take a very good care of me and my friends whenever I come here too. So I decided to come back and I've got an excellent service from Jamie today. I would have given her 10 stars  if I could. She keeps coming back to the table to check on me if everything was ok. She was very friendly and she works hard to keep the service on point. She even offer a new stamp card too.. I will definitely start coming back because of Jamie and Timmay now.

Za2LXdmvcx6NS_KnzbpvBg.text: 4 stars because of service. We came at 9pm and it was not busy at all, we got seated right way. We did ayce option. The server was friendly however it took about 5 min for them to ask us if we would like something to drink. Once we got our drink and we ordered a couple stuff it was great! The sushi tastes really fresh and I love how have large selection of nigiri! In between once we ordered our food we had to wait about 10 min each time for the sever to come back again to take another order. At the end we ended up leaving without dessert because they took too long to come by that we just asked for the check. I would come back again because the food is really good, hopefully next time is better service.

ifAKoG9R6C9QEvCHiNM_pg.text: Lunch menu ....salad dressing was salty and the miso soup was not hot just luke warm....meh lets see how the sushi is.... the whole meal was sub par and I don"t think I would go out of my way to go to this place again since we have so many options here in vegas.

2v-Od9fJnaR9GJhIz_ACrg.text: Our favorite sushi place in Vegas without a question. We love the quality of fish there, the salmon is so soft and melts in your mouth, the selection of rolls is very nice and interesting. We usually have the Jala Jala, lemon, and magma, along with a big selection of nigiris. The white tuna is off the charts and the food always comes rather quickly. Highly recommended ;)

sPsAUp67rcIoIfuyykJ0kQ.text: AMAZING!!!! You can tell a good sushi spot by the patrons and every one in there was of Asian decent...AWESOME.  The food was INCREDIBLE, the service was INCREDIBLE, the KOME KOME was so Delish!!!!! I cannot wait to go back here!!!!

3yt6gbpWnXITEbIpEXlx5A.text: This one star is for our server "Shima". We asked her if we can substitute uni with sweet shrimp since they are out of uni, the response we got from Shima was as follows: "It is not our restaurant's fault for not having uni.  It was the supplier that don't have them today.  It's not like we dont want to serve uni. You are already paying cheaper price for ayce sushi compare to outside."   At that moment I was thinking... Okay that's fine.  I don't need to start a drama over a piece of uni and ruin my long weekend holiday.  She came back later on to check on our table and collect empty dishes from us. She took a plate off our table and dropped a piece of sushi into our pitcher of beer.  Her first response was ... " I don't see it". We pointed point to her, even her coworker there pointing out to her...."the rice is floating in the beer".  At last she agreed to bring us a new pitcher of beer.   Couple minutes later, she brought out a 1/3 of pitcher........................

boKGCO8pXnotnVulCiNvVw.text: This place is Sushimon (Maryland and Silverado Ranch) on steroids.  Same great quality as Sushi mon but with new added specials and homemde desserts.  The green tea cake is very tasty.    The ambience is more elegant an deep rich dark colors that are very modern an inviting.  Their Sushi bar is smaller but they have a grill/range in view of the dinning room.  I am always a fan of open kitchens, that way I know if my food was handled properly (which it always is).    The sushi is so far superior in quality to most other AYCE locations I have tried.  If you can say it, sit at the bar and order OMAKASE.  The Sushi chefs are really inventive and have ingredients that are not listed on the menu which they prepare for fun.  It is a top notch dining experience.   GO, EAT, BE HAPPY!

QIMTN0wB3sUCkKYoUR6PhQ.text: Their menu on their website lists uni and amaebi for AYCE lunch, same with Sushimon's website so don't be fooled.  It's a little disappointing but the sushi(not rolls) is good nonetheless.

lsbgOLBPUaCj_lGS-wBz5w.text: Unbelievable bad service. We were at restaurant for 1hour they never say thank you and no smile. Hirame had bad smell. We tried to order ice cream she say she can't take order because her wrist hurting???? Really ... One ice cream she can't take the order... We ask another waitress she give us a one finger to tell us  to wait!!!!  Seriously?

CtHo4N110eq1DlKd3ecr5A.text: I have returned to this sushi house again and again.  I usually don't like do all you can eat but this place is an exceptional.   The rolls aren't the best but very decent, the rice filling could be a little too thick but depends on who your sushi chef is.  I love the super white tuna.  The quality and freshness of the food is excellent.  This place gets very busy, the longest wait I had was one hour, but it was worth it.    However, you gotta keep eating otherwise the hostess Maria will ask you to leave!  The desserts are bit generic but included in the all you can eat.  Overall, I give a 4 out of 5 for a satisfactory dinning experience.

VVqjxglcLmi2xFD1-8dXKQ.text: I moved here from LA so I know my sushi, apparently unlike the other reviewers of Goyemon. Many classmates had recommended this place but it was more than a disappointment. The eel must have been a week old. The food smelled and had zero sauce. My rolls stuck to the plate they were so dry. We got AYCE and were lost as to what to order because the food was just so bad. Literally, I've had better sushi in a mall food court. Zero stars!!!

LWzyHbumRBKUWqeQ--lF3Q.text: The beginning of the summer marked a realization of sorts: I am no self-professed sushi connoisseur. Far from it, the best I've ever had was probably made in my school's dining hall - sad, I know. But when my brother and his friend decided to go to Sushi House Goyemon, I had to go.  We all decided to do the the AYCE, and from the taste of the appetizers, I was glad we did. From the Spicy Tuna Rice Cracker (rice deep-fried then topped with spicy tuna and yum yum sauce) to the Seaweed Salad to the orgasmic Pork Belly, I was in love at first course. Then, within 2.5 seconds, Katrina M. and my brother ordered nigiri in endless quantities - some of the standouts were the Garlic Tuna (an absolute favorite), Super White Tuna, Eel, and the Scallop. All of which were incredibly fresh; if it weren't for Vegas being landlocked, I could have sworn the Uni was plucked straight from the sea. As for rolls, we ordered the Lemon Roll, which was perfect in all of its citrusy lightness.  Dessert was not even the end of it! With options of Green Tea Creme Brulee (though I am not as convinced on it as my brother is), Mochi, and Green Tea Cake, my absolute favorites were the Lychee Sorbet and Tofu Cheesecake. The former is light enough that I can justify ordering two bowls. The latter combines my two favorite things in the world into one non-guilt-inducing dessert! With the tartness of the mangoes, I can't help but feel okay eating the Tofu Cheesecake - hey, at least I'm eating some fruit too!  Goyemon is certainly smart - not only is AYCE 27 dollars and worth every penny in quantity and quality, but it doesn't mess around with the nonsense of being open for lunch. Dinner only means by an hour of being open, the place is already packed, and there's a line forming. Thank goodness for such a timely brother, we always manage to arrive right after they open and miss the treachery of waiting for such deliciousness.

G2HW5FonFwP3L2gj4teb9g.text: Thought I finally found a good sushi spot. Went there 2 times in 3 days.. Second experience was not at all the same. Got the all you could eat, same as the first time and the same sushi rolls were not as good. We ate as much as we could, they never came to clear off the table as we ate. And before they did finally clear it the guy sat there and counted the 7 pieces we had not eaten. Said we had to eat them all or be charged $11 additionally to the $29 we were paying for All you can eat. We were irritated of course, but tried to eat the now warm sushi rolls. Only got a couple more down. Said he still had to charge us for half a roll (4 pieces) but would be the cheapest roll $6. Thanks bro. Will never, ever go there again. Not consistent. Friend got sick (probably from the warm sushi she was forced to eat). Server was rude and dismissive. 2 stars because the green tea creme brulee was bomb.

LyOB2fHzwptpLQDVbKBXuQ.text: The wife and I were spending a relaxing weekend in Vegas.  She saw the reviews about this joint and we headed on down.  We read all of the negatives about the service here but we had nothing but great service from the waiters.  We were seated in about 35 minutes and started grubbing away.  The pork belly is maybe the best thing ever made.  How good was it?  My wife even loved it and she doesn't generally like pork belly.  We were also big fans of the white tuna, the scallop, and the salmon belly.  My wife loved the pixie roll and the chubby roll.  You can also order a handroll if you don't want the cut roll.  They also have uni, amaebi, and sardines.  They only thing we did not have when we went was the toro.  For all you can eat, they have premium sushi.  Its probably the best all you can eat sushi I've ever been to.

wBZbIVznV95nxwnbdDqwdQ.text: Was recommended by a friend, and not disappointed! The seared salmon nigiri is amazing, along with the red snapper. The octopus was good, if only it didn't have the seaweed wrap (it makes it a little fishy for my liking). Can't wait to go back and expand my sushi palate.

nxqj1uJEiZP-lg09Ha57-g.text: Grabbed dinner here the other night and we had a great experience. We got the all you can eat (AYCE) option and loved it. The atmosphere was nice and the staff was extremely friendly. The chefs did an excellent job preparing the food and they kept it coming pretty quickly. We tried out a lot of the sushi rolls and didn't have any that we wouldn't eat again. You can even make up and order your own rolls here which gives you a lot more options. The calamari app was excellent as well. Overall I would highly recommend this sushi place to anyone looking for a new sushi spot. We will be going back often. Enjoy

xF0R55vxEb9JePhjtUyiNA.text: I have been to Goyemon over 8 times in the last year but won't return again.  The service has never been great but the extensive menu and reasonable prices kept me coming back. Unfortunately the last time I was here the service was just unacceptable.   There is a time limit while dining here. One hour if I remember correctly. I understand the time limit thing but on the night I was there, my friend, her husband, baby and I were having dinner when my friend's brother called. We invited him to join us. He arrived 25 minutes into our meal. We all had ordered ayce and informed the server that he would be too. She told us that he was not allowed to join our table because we only had 35 minutes left. We asked to speak to the manager. The so-called manager came over and told my friend's brother he was not allowed to join us. He was rude and unapologetic.  We tried to explain to him that we had 35 minutes left. I understand if our hour was almost up but it wasn't. We asked if he could sit at another table in the restaurant and our server said yes. We didn't get a chance to ask the "manager" because he rudely walked away while we were talking to him. We really didn't understand why he could have sat at another table but was not allowed to join ours. If the "manager" had taken 2 minutes to explain it to us rather than just tell us no and walk away we might have felt better about spending our money there.   There are numerous ayce sushi restaurants in Vegas. Spend your money where it's appreciated!

98F0GvLOoyI57ZAHvuTdbQ.text: Visited here on Sunday with my sister & her fiance. I did realize I had a stamp card from my first time here, this being my second time. Too bad the card expired since it had been 1.5yrs since my first visit. One year expiration, oh wells lol. The place is fairly small. I can imagine during the busy times there might be a long wait. A plus is that it's open very late(3am) every day, even Sunday. The wait tonight wasn't too long, 20min. I could have sworn the dining time limit posted was 90min but it's 1hr now. I could be wrong and I'm not sure how strictly they enforce it. All-you-can-eat(AYCE) is always the way to go! $27 for dinner here. I do remember the wonderful crispy rice cracker with spicy tuna on top of it. If the rolls look similar to Sushimon, I believe it's the same owners. I'm told they also own Monta Ramen. I had the seared salmon salad. The dressing was a bit salty. My sister HAD to order the Mahalo Roll, which is basically a spam musubi in roll form. Our hawaii roots hehe. Ordered cajun albacore & seared salmon nigiri. They were pretty small even for nigiri, with paper thin slices of fish. Those actually were pretty salty to taste too. That part disappointed a little since those are two of my favorite things to eat when having sushi. Ordered a few other rolls and appetizers. I also sampled others between the 3 of us. Rest were decent aside from the salty nigiri & salad. Service was very good. When waiting for a table, they will take your number and call you when something is available. Our waitress was very attentive, checking on us often and refilling drinks and taking empty plates away. A decent place to get your sushi fill. I was sitting on 3.5 stars for this place. I couldn't in my right mind round it up though. Since theres other places I would prefer over Goyemon that I gave 4 stars.

14i5pQ0AHIxVf8lnSkEZqA.text: Just okay...I would say the most over rated sushi joint in town. This place is always packed but the cucumber salad and tuna poke were as bland as can be!! Everything else was just okay...the sexy girl was fantastic!!!!!

fj7F0DymEwlgB4mJjrvz5A.text: Good food, mediocre service, terrible organization. We had a party of 8. The hostess told us we would be seated once the 4th member of our party arrived. I was the 4th. They then changed their minds and said they'd seat us when the 5th person arrived. So the 5th person arrived and still we waited. The hostess then said they'd seat us when the 6th person in our party arrived. And so numbers 6, 7, and 8 all arrived at the same time. We asked to be seated and were told it would be another15 min and we were asked to wait outside. I refused to wait outside because that was a ridiculous request, it was cold, and their seating procedures were random and stupid. I then asked for a beer while we waited...over 30 minutes at this point. I thought there was no way I'd be charged for this beer, but I was wrong. All in all, we were sat after about 35 minutes and lots of confusion. No apology for the situation and no gestures to make up for it. The food was good. The service was okay. No one knew what was going on. Our drink orders were taken by one server, then 5 min later a different server asked to take our drink orders again. I'll never go back to this place again. There's better sushi restaurants with better service and employees with common sense all over this city. Who needs this place?

O3kbcQM5X5qZ2zaRFSl__Q.text: This is the best AYCE spot in town. Ive tried all the others, Kobe, Sumo, Oyshi etc. The freshness of the fish and cut size beats out the other joints. The sashimi salad and green muscles are great starters and the saki flight reasonably priced. Unless you want premium toro dont go anywhere else for raw fish.

wvf4wY3_guBIjTbzG9C4mg.text: I don't mind the wait so worth it to eat here. I love the AYCE menu. Probably why I am here at least once a week

dxZHkJlUdLXnamqOBC_hvw.text: I love this place but the service sucks during this time I always come after 6 and I guess there's a reason it's always packed around that time but U also get better service around that time.  I walked in and place my order along with my drink order and it literally took 17 minutes just to get to my table and it's not busy and I've seen other people order and get there food before mine even came out!

9qXpnus3T9bKqI-PIEYzBw.text: Very great all you can eat sushi it's part of the chain of "sushi mon" so it's says everything my favorite is exctasy roll and sunrise roll .

Eu5oIAAatHX6QpacJqf_5g.text: This has got to be one of the best AYCE SUSHI places out here! They do 1/2 rolls which is a plus and also a rotating special menu that can be ordered with your ayce price. Only downside is no reservations and be willing to wait 45 min-1 hr.

1U4QpmwVeMu0k3MbKlAZdg.text: I've honestly ate almost all of the ayce sushi places in California. & this is the 2nd ayce sushi I've been in Vegas & they both SUCK! So first of all, my friend made reservations for 5. When we got there, they said they don't make reservations... what? but they were "nice" enough to seat us anyways, but why did you reserve us in the first place? Lol. The restaurant was pretty full. but service wasn't bad. So we all ordered the ayce, but we only got one round, cause it was that bad Lol. All the rolls & nigiri has a lot of rice, it was so hard to finish everything. Rolls are nothing special, pretty basic. nigiri to rice ratio was horrible.... and nothing else to say about this place lol

SWM7iDnyeebxQLH8WeLcbA.text: This is my go to for all you can eat sushi. Sometimes the waiters/waitresses can move slowly BUT the sushi is delicious and worth the compromise on service speed (their staff is very friendly). They allow you to order half rolls which is something I appreciate because sometimes I don't want an entire 8 piece roll!! Delicious baked green mussels (order those first because they take a little while to come out), shrimp tempura is good.....pretty much everything on the menu is delicious. My favorite roll is the tiger. If you order mochi, know that it will most likely be frozen when it comes to your table so just let it sit for a few minutes. Lol

eze7L-uUj4yIyIj4-K-GMA.text: This place is really good.  Been coming for a few years.  Just wish they would take reservations and sometimes the staff is a bit rude.

KW4aWsofaRnI2UoZNMCZBw.text: It's the new spot for AYCE sushi for my sister's family, who goes pretty much every other week.  There's usually a wait time of 30-45 minutes for lunch or dinner.  But it's worth it.  For $30, the quality of fresh fish is good and the sushi rice is small.  We came here as soon as we landed in Vegas.  With two babies and 60 minutes, we were able to chow down 90 pieces of nigiri (30 pieces each).  Hahahahahaha.... I say that's pretty impressive.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ikura, crab meat, scallop
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dynamite
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hokkigai

1sDjRZor1F0AitVEBQ-CDA.text: I have now tried over 4 different all you can eat sushi places around Vegas and this one caught my eye with all the reviews.   The fish is fantastic and my Sushi Chef was the best all around guy we could have possibly had during our experience. Extremely humble and I asked him to make us all his favorite nigiri, hand rolls and rolls.   The seaweed salad is exceptionally good and is a MUST try.  The nigiri is very small compared to most places, but that doesn't matter as you can order as much as you can eat.

3NlCFC3o4QKbeFDKlLUExQ.text: This place is worth the wait! Always check Facebook or call ahead for their specials! Salmon belly is the only reason I come! They do not limit your amount! The sushi is always fresh. I haven't had a bad experience. Service is good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon belly and wasabi octopus. These are specialty items. Follow them on Facebook to get the daily specials.

pgrCXvvbGIGXGiP6yo5f-A.text: Well, first and last time going here. 35 min wait for pure disappointment. The fish quality was okay, but every roll and piece of nigiri had really hot rice. They were out of uni which made me really sad. Then they said that they didnt have mochi, or tempura ice cream, so me and the gf got green tea ice cream only to have green tea soup handed to us instead. From there I assumed their freezer wasnt working, but our server still assumed it would be okay to give us an almost completely melted serving of ice cream. But really put the nail in this coffin was that every sushi place lets you eat for your time limit of 60mins.. At our 45 minute mark our server, (I kid you not) hands our check right as we finished giving her our order, idk if thats a goyemon thing, or if they were trying to just kick us out. We should've went to their other sibling sushi-house like we always do. (I should've took pics of everything lol, oh well)   Sushi-Mon over Goyemon anyday.

jkElS-uqWXnm5J0eIHe6BQ.text: Came here for dinner w/ the fam last night because of the reviews my sister saw here on Yelp.  Got here around 5:15, and got seated right away. Not too long after we started eating, did the wait go from 0 to an hour and a half! Guess we walked in at just the right time.  Food came pretty quickly. My sister even said her "ecstasy roll" was the best sushi she's had in a super long time! Sushi was good and fresh, but the salmon collar I ordered was nothing like I've ever tasted. Over cooked and dry, makes for not a happy foodie. Mom and dad both ordered a salmon dinner special, and both their salmon came out the same as the collar. We were a bit disappointed, seeing as this IS a sushi house.    Service was friendly, ambience is nice, and the sushi was good. I'd come back despite the salmon fail, I just wouldn't order it again.

gZaKXo9WLE5b8tWR7LCLvw.text: I agree with other recent low-star reviews. In the past, I loved Goyemon...but now, it's a shame. There were 3 occasion in the past 3-4 months where I went to Goyemon, most recent being last week (where i went in and went right back out). Apparently, it seems like this place no longer plans on having UNI (They have a sign that read "NO UNI", but it's been there since like 3-4 months ago.   The most recent trip, when i entered and saw that same sign still there, i asked them, since we're planning on getting dinner and UNI is a limited order for dinner but you guys don't have it, what do the customer's get instead...front lady said, "NOTHING." We as customer's just pay more for dinner to get cheated on UNI...honestly considering the wait and the quality of the food going down this place, i can't help but give poor ratings to this place.   I probably will be back to see if they made any changes, but disappointing.

WZzlVa91qMdlg7Pab5os9g.text: I decided too mix up my AYCE sushi last night. I only heard good things about this place from other yelpers and close too my house had too check it out. I must admit this place has LOT more selection then my normal spot 808 sushi. I liked the fact they had chalkboard near the sushi area they write down the special they have each day and most of them is included on the AYCE!! Something make sure take look at when deciding so don't miss anything.   I always start with nigiri. Always been my favorite although I still naturally get my speciality rolls in but am old school fish and rice. I always felt that nigiri one of the best judges of  the quality of the fish. I was impressed for sure the quality of all the fish they have is excellent! The speciality rolls tried the 9-1-1 roll had nice little kick too it and the Ecstasy roll looked good tasted alright but next time try another one. The poki was solid. It usually miss comes too poki at AYCE not all place have them. Still have too give the edge 808 poki style is more local style that I love and use too. The thing that stand out about the poki here is they use some fresh seaweed along with nicely thin shaved white onion, and nice poki sauce. Tried the grilled prok belly with mango salsa. Tasty!! The pork belly perfect hard grill sear on the outside and little of mango salsa top of it. It like pork butter goes down smooth. Majority of it nigiri not go wrong with any one I pounded the hamachi, albacore, and salmon. Loving it!  I sat at the sushi bar. The sushi bar really like the set up! It had lots of room for your sushi. Unlike tradition ones little further back say from the glass and see all the fish there using for the night. You have added shelf on top stack empty plates if pounding away like that extra space (minus is reach further over too get the sushi)! =) They have nice widescreen tv behind the bar. It monday night football so any major sporting event perfect spot for sushi and sports. It not like most place tv far away right in front of you.   The service was awesome. The hostess greeted you and sat you down. The serve keep up with drinks full. The sushi chefs all really friendly, talk stories with them, and lot of fun. You might not want too go early because the place is packed luck out got spot at the bar. The selection is Nuts! Sure I need too go back few more times make sure try everything!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ecstasy (top) and 9-1-1 (bottom) rolls.

pdRZBbpX59L1xpBVgZWT6A.text: If you're an AYCE kind of person then, yes, this place is for you. You can load up on an extensive menu of nigiri, tempura, rolls, dessert, etc. and be totally satisfied.  I, myself, am more of a purist. I want the best of the best so I wasn't all that impressed. It was like eating at a cut rate sushi place when really you were dreaming of Nobu or Sushi Samba.  But, really, for less than $50 you can get all of the sushi you want, who can complain?   I enjoyed the 911 roll which boasted of habanero sauce but totally failed to deliver (I can take a LOT of heat so take this with a grain of salt).  I actually had to ask for a hotter roll. The chefs tried a roll that was supposedly much hotter, but barely registered on my tasted buds. To be fair I was raised on habaneros my whole life so my perception may have been skewed.   The tempura was delicious as were really all the rolls I ordered. It was fun to look at the vast menu, find something I found interesting, and order it. If you want to explore all aspects of sushi, this is a good place to start.   The service is a step above perfection. You don't have to wait or ask for anything.   This place is definitely a casual go-to spot to hang out, try good sushi and relax. Definitely recommend.

8LdiUNSIYy_Lv8eXhVdosw.text: The best AYCE sushi you can get in Vegas. Japanese owned and operated, Sushi House Goyemon is a sushi restaurant that does not disappoint.   The interior design mixes the Japanese izakaya style with the contemporary. It is a nice place to look around, and of course eat.  The service is always good. The staff is quick and friendly, although they always make sure I know 1 order means two pieces. This is because I order a ridiculous amount of nigiri, but it's understandable.  The fish almost always looks and tastes fresh (for an AYCE sushi joint), and the rolls I try dance in my mouth with joy. I like how we have an option of ordering half a roll, so that we can try more.  Last time I came here was a Monday or Tuesday night and it was packed. Know that you'll have to wait about 15 minutes to get a table, because this place is pretty popular.  Be sure to get a stamp card, too. Your 11th visit is free AYCE!

x_l3TJ-1Sh8eKOWTJ7zvhQ.text: The best AYCE sushi I have ever been to. Their fish is one the most freshest I have seen so far in any AYCE sushi places. Their service is attentive but a couple smiles here and there would've made my dining a bit more comfortable. This might be because I was sitting at the bar and the sushi chefs seemed a bit intimidating with their daunting indifferent facial expressions. It actually seemed like they didn't want to work there at all loooool. However, their sushi was good so I'm okay :P my favorites here were the fresh scallop sushi and the roll called Orion. I love this place a lot because I've never seen a scallop sushi sold like this place back in Southern California!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The scallop sushi I was talking about on the bottom right

FoCH_F8U_PEnVgi_ioW61w.text: Best AYCE sushi place for $26.95. Was looking around for other sushi places in Vegas but saw this place and it had pretty good recommendations.   Place was pretty packed at 5 pm Christmas Eve and the estimated wait time was an hour and a half. However within thirty minutes we were in.  Service was prompt and quick. We were greeted warmly and I would recommend this location to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee ice cream also pretty good!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream pretty good!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_gy4RaFQc0I0nIXu7cCuFg.text: We've come to this location many times, this review is based off our last visit. We went in on a Wednesday (April 22nd) with a group of 7. Waited 50 minutes but was quoted 60 so that was great to get in a little bit sooner. We typically come in large groups for celebrations and usually have 2-4 kids under the age of 4. Each parent gets a share plate which is typically $3 as a small child will not eat enough to cover an all you can eat plate. Last night they told us they no longer did share plates unless they were under 3 and we had to pay full price ($26.95) for the children or buy a la carte for them. That was a big disappointment as we've been coming here for over a year without any issues.   Once we figured out what the kids were going to eat, the service was incredibly slow. The baked rolls tasted burnt, half of our things didn't get delivered to our table, we had to ask multiple times for items and drink orders were wrong.   All in all it was a disappointment. This was our favorite sushi spot. We will most likely choose a new place to go to that will accommodate children better. A child is not going to eat $26.95 worth of sushi.

eO0jk_Vjxtj6YQzzetveDw.text: The sushi here is great but the service is terrible. I'm aware that here, you have a time limit when you eat, but half our rolls took 20 minutes to get to us, and meanwhile our server was nowhere to be found. I'm an avid AYCE sushi eater, so I've been to plenty of other sushi places. And I have never EVER been kicked out because of a time limit. Wanna know why? Because I received my sushi in a timely fashion. Which is not the case here. And I'm not talking about just a few minutes longer than usual, I'm talking about how my friends and I sat idly by watching the tables on either side of us get served and enjoy their food for 20 minutes while we waited for food that would never come, because we had reached our time limit.  One of the first rolls I ordered was a lemon roll and I literally did not receive it until 5 minutes before we were 'kicked out'. Keep in mind their time limit is about an hour and a half. If it weren't for the quality of the food I would never come back here. So I guess I would recommend Goyemon, but beware of the awful service.

0dw9NjlpqR1RHDz8KpEjNg.text: We entered hungry as a group of 5 after a long day of exploring around the vast place, which is Las Vegas... We exited as rolly polly balls probably since it felt like we needed someone to roll us out of the joint.    Probably one of the best $30 investments I made for all you can eat sushi. No arguments there.   Wait time can be horrendous and it seems to get packed super fast. Luckily enough for our group of 5, we had no wait!   There seems to be a limit on certain things you can order. The expensive ones like the ebi/shrimp and uni (I believe) all falls under this cap. Ebi was delish, don't forget to try. And to say I'm not usually an ebi getter!  Unagi for days (was a bit boney), but the flavor was there, and the spicy ahi/tuna hand rolls (note, it being spicy, I needed a couple of water refills), and raw fish up the ying yang. We ate anything and everything,  including fried shrimp heads (do not fear the shrimp heads, they're actually not that bad even though you're eating a face).  So though I'm raving why only 4 stars? Because I'm a major dessert fan, the tempura/fried ice cream and green tea ice cream did not do it for me. The ice cream in the tempura batter really didn't taste like vanilla ice cream, it kind of had the consistency of sherbert. Also, the tempura batter was soggy and not crunchy like when you think of typical fried ice cream. The green tea ice cream came to us half melted,  resulting in a puddle of frothy melted ice cream. That made me sad.  Then again, you really don't come to an all you can eat sushi for their desserts. Sushi... Goyemon aced it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy ahi!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat!

LqyeJRgLWqxVQe5Nttv3pA.text: First time we went there, we were sat on the bar so we got our sushi pretty fast. And the chef that was serving us was really friendly and welcomed us great. OF COURSE, WE GOT ALL YOU CAN EAT so it didnt matter how much sushi we got . and the chef was making us all kind of sushi :D it was great. we discovered sushis we didnt even know about and we eat sushi every month. BOMB, GREAT STAFF, and expect the noise. its a really small place so everything echos .

wmblZaQ_2mzb1BHpyF19nA.text: Whatever u do, make sure tony (the sushi "chef") does NOT make ur sushi!!! He totally messed up the uni ( I KNOW RIGHT? how can u mess up on uni?) he basically took out the plate of uni and instead of giving me the whole layer of the UNI piece, he literally kept cutting the uni into pieces and laying it ontop of the rice.. which basically turned the UNI into crumbled broken pieces. ON TOP OF THAT!!  He doesn't even know how to roll out the rice for the nigiri. NEW CHEF PLEASE!!!  not trying to be racial but, THIS IS WHY U DON'T GO TO SUSHI RESTAURANTS WHERE u have MEXICAN sushi chefs. HE SERIOUSLY DIDN'T KNOW WHAT HE WAS DOING...I know it's all u can eat, but damn can u cut the fish any thinner?

WcG8dCGzXRGlU7Xi0qSlHQ.text: Delicious and great service. They neither rush you nor pack in the rice once they've had enough of you. The fish is fresh. By far the best all-you-can-eat (AYCE) sushi I've had... ever.

kiuGR1vEHP4qL7C7xQQQDA.text: I was sorely disappointed. After seeing delicious looking pictures from friends who have been there, we stopped here when we arrived in Vegas. The sushi seemed old and was not delicious. My friend thought the white fish was pretty good, but that was it. Maybe it was an off day? Too bad bc I can't chance another wasted dining opportunity to allow them redemption.

ZIulOVBE6OSFj6tuotzQoA.text: OMG this restaurant I've been so many time and I can't believe that it turn so nasty               ... First thing got to the restaurant the host wouldn't seat us because one of our friend hasn't arrive yet. Ok then told her that he'll be here in 5 minutes. After telling her that she gave us a table. When we sat down the waiter and ready to order she said we can't order yet. She said that we are missing one person and wouldn't let us order first. Wtf. That is really messed up.

y7oGzLR8hL6d_-HAbgJxvg.text: $26 for all you can eat sushi, but the best part is that it's not a buffet!  Basically everything on the menu including appetizers, salads, ramen, and even deserts are available for order and the service is especially amazing at the bar.  The sushi chefs and waiters were fun to chat with and were super fast with our orders.  The coolest thing about this joint was that they took half roll orders!  You could try a bunch of different types of special rolls without ordering too much.  This was especially nice when there were only 2 of us sharing a meal.  3.5 stars for the sushi quality (good, but not great. I'm turning into a sushi snob), but giving them 4 stars for the amazing and friendly service.  Go for an early dinner to avoid the rush.  I can't believe that this place is open until 3am!  Goyemon, where were you when I was in college?!?!

LY12ecHy1Ic6YTQv6gfq7Q.text: Take a seat at the bar and make sure Fredo is your sushi chef. Its the best seat in the house. Of course you are going to do the all you can eat for $27. Order cucumber or seaweed salad, meso soup and edamame to start. You have to try the yellow tail collar, to dies for. If it wasn't limited to one per customer I would eat this all day.  Every roll I had was great. Not bad for a place that has only been open for a few months. finish the meal off with ordering all the desserts! Trust me and Fredo.  Enjoy

kjsUjUY9npVbDzPDeFz2Ew.text: Am I glad I consulted yelp when I was looking for an outstanding AYCE sushi bar in Las Vegas! I promised my son and his friend a I would take them to the best sushi bar when I took them to Vegas a few weeks ago. They are sushi gourmets and they said it was the best sushi ever.  Me? I haven't acquired a taste for it yet but here is my contribution......I tried the fried pork belly was truly a taste thrill!

Nxj7P2T6T-AfWP0rOTqr6w.text: Ate here at the sushi bar and got treated excellent with my girlfriend. Attentive cooks that offered suggestions and even just handed us food (We were doing AYCE... keep it flowing!)  Sat quickly, food came fast and delicious, TV's to watch the games. All in all a perfect night. Favorite roll was the Sexy Girl, and the crab dip chip thing was also banging (plus the waiters brought extra crab dip when we asked! Thanks!)

TZXWc4RmBFlsEbL8hLtkBg.text: The Worst Experience!!! I used to love this restaurant I come down here a lot of times. But today since they change management or maybe owner. I Perosnally Don't recommend you to eat here! New Manager don't know how to take care of the guest.  Hostess is very very rude to the customers. Server taking forever to take oreder. Once the order where place. Food taking so long almost one hour before food gets deliver. Once it was deliver to the table food is so cold sushi was not fresh what is wrong with this Goyemon Restaurant!!!It' not even busy. I Don't Recommend you this place. This Is Not A good place to eat. The chefs where just chatting. Very very bad experience.  Manager don't know how to manage and take actionyou spend so much money for a bad service and cold not fresh sushi.......some of you know that this place was the good before but now I am telling you this is the worstplaceto eatRude! Rude! Rude!

0GKAho6iIafD8y18NpU9Zg.text: What happen!? I'm so sad to even writing this review this use to be my favorite sushi joint I use to come here twice a week and I haven't for a while.... Last week I came here and the quality of fish just went down the toilet :(, there highlight was there pork belly but I had to return mine twice because its just all fat! And still after complaining about it they still serve me it all fat pork belly.... There sushi rice are not consistent anymore it falls apart, I ordered UNi and that was big disappointment you can see the blood line and its just gross to eat . UGH! I'm so sad about it hope goyemon get there act together and start serving good quality food again

vI-uAsnzUYQ65QXGi7f93w.text: This place is quite yummy me and boyfriend love trying different all you can eat sushi places and I got to say this is one we will go back again.   The pros for the place where: -the pork belly was yummy melt in your mouth tenderness - all you can eat dessert (a lot of the other places are like limit 3) -TOFU cheesecake! -attentive wait staff  the cons: -the pork belly was sometimes a Lil cold in the middle -not enough chairs

o3CgDrx1OVHtKF4xzEfC1A.text: Having being loyal to another establishment for the last few years I ventured out to try a new place that would satisfy my appetite and palette.  I was guided here by the folks from Monta noodle House.   First and foremost let me just say this place will now be one of my favorite spots for sushi,  I can say that each piece was pure balance of flavor & taste. All of their varied great dishes and add-ons were prepared with good flavor, even their personal sashimi salad was well made and was a great opening dish.   The extra white tuna was phenomenal, and it melted in my mouth all the rolls we had were well balanced and made with the greatest attention, I complimented all of the dishes with a small tasting of 3 of their best sakes which helped all the flavors unfold in my palette. I recommend eating at the sushi-bar since you get a chance to interact with the sushi chefs and get everything at your will.  Enjoy

gh6jzn7A-nIliWyTfjdC8w.text: The only thing i dint like in this place was the unagui sauce i ask the sushi master why this sauce looks like that,he anwser is because comes is a plastic bottle is not from scratch,huf that sauce was terrible very bad teaste not like the real sauce, the service was exelent very good

0qX52OkzNMYy9bUzq6J4yQ.text: Sushi was awesome!! Interesting enough it was like sushimon which I also love. Awesome cajon albacore tuna. And 911 roll was actually spicy!!! Recommend you go for the all you can eat and enjoy a lot of the menu.

J8C2aMRUKh3Q6OyEGNHySQ.text: Goyemon used to be our absolute favorite place, we would eat here about 4 times a week since it is also close to home. But in the past few months something happened... The service became bad, the portions smaller (we almost always order ala carte), occasionally the fish is very warm. I keep hoping it will change back to how it once was, perhaps they cannot handle their popularity. Goyemon was great but right now it is a solid 2 - 2.5 stars.

PzhhMnNOQWdrVzLbz1v75w.text: All you can eat sushi may make most people think of sub-par sushi rolls. But this place really delivers! My husband and I were in Vegas for our Honeymoon and decided to give it a try.   I'd definitely go again if I ever find myself in Vegas. For $26 how can you go wrong?

gGQYP2lbFjBylhnglYjiYw.text: Sushi was mediocre, service wasn't great, one of the chefs kept staring at my date almost the entire time, and it took forever for the check to c

_HDG0AkI0DQpgn6BbQObvg.text: EDIT - this place has been really inconsistent - --------------------  Didn't think I'd ever give an AYCE Sushi place 5 stars till now.   The sushi here was really fresh.  I was really pleased with the salmon belly, yellowtail, big eye tuna, super white tuna, mackeral,sweet shrimp, and much more.  The fish to rice ratio was spot on and it just tasted of a better grade compared to all the other AYCE's.  In addition to the nigiri, we got the grilled pork belly (think we got 6-7 orders total between 3 of us), grilled vegetables, spicy tuna on crips rice, and much more.  Definitely order the specials off the chalk board - some of them have limits of 1 per person.  No toro the day we went.  Also, go after 11pm to get Shoyu Ramen.  It is the same as Monta.    The atmosphere is probably the nicest of any AYCE.  As stated, they are in the Monta Ramen family, so I am hopeful the sushi quality and consistency will remain.    I've tried over a dozen AYCE sushi places in Vegas.  Please - if you know of any better, message me.  Unitl, then I will be coming back here with my stamp card.  9 more till the freebie!

QHXgOWs58ikl30UJ1nL3Jw.text: Pretty good sushi for an all-you-can-eat place.  Always fresh and they bring it out fast.  Honestly, I'd go here more if they didn't charge the full amount for my 4 year old because, seriously, he can only eat like one or two pieces.

Fv6MWuJhWww2exT87K2X6Q.text: this place rocks.  great sushi, great service.  highly recommend.

YUkUDpZjibP4xRZ9DiukeA.text: this place is awesome. first off, try to get there between the off hours like a few hours before or after the dinner/lunch periods. this place gets packed quick. the food quality is great as well as there service. i would say there is a wider selection of sushi available here compared to others. once the sushi part is done, they have an interesting dessert selection i have never tried. amazing, the green tea creme bruelee.. why have i never tasted this before sooooo goood. writing this review is making me salivate. the fried icecream thing is surprisingly good as well. its not as heavy as it sounds. definitely not the fried ice cream from the o.c. fair, its lightly battered and the whole dessert itself is very light. definitely going back for the desserts, and the sushi. haha

ki6TZUew_bSiBY2w3hm49w.text: this place is awesome for all you can eat. the sushi is fresh and they have the best home made desserts.

PWVMdfsM-9r6A5Jd5rw6Mw.text: My expectations were through the roof but they barely got off the ground.  I don't know man, it must've been a bad night. IT MUST HAVE! It's hard to imagine why on a Friday night such a highly acclaimed venue would have any bad nights, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. I'm down for a second shot at this place, but my first overall experience was very, very mediocre.  The rice to fish ratio was just ugh...bad. No bueno. Yelling mercy. By the fourth sushi, there was nothing I could taste except for rice. The rice itself is so thin, almost like jasmine rice. What is this, Chinese food?? If the rice was at least a bit fuller in texture I wouldn't complain. I can also tell the rice is packed differently. It sits there like a small clump, and its hard to break down when you're chewing it. It's very laborious and completely takes away the experience from the fish. No, I don't hide my rice. I eat them as a whole with the fish. Last night I really wish I didn't. Now that I think about it, I think I did leave a few rice clumps here and there under the dish. Hmm, I never had this problem at Xtreme Sushi...  The service was nothing exceptional. Our waitress barely made any eye contact with our table and was slow to take our orders. It wasn't too bad, but I expected at least to be on par with other venues. I mean, the place was not even full and the waitress was hard to find like a rare pokemon (Pikachu in Viridian Forest, anyone?). I never had this issue at Xtreme Sushi...  The fish is OK. I have to say the yellowtail is my favorite. I'm so glad the yellowtail did not disappoint. The shrimp on the other hand, was not that good. Everything else was mediocre. I decide to give it one last shot and order uni (sea urchin). I really like to gauge the quality of the restaurant by eating sea urchin. Sea urchin spoils quicker than other fish, so it's really easy to spot bad sea urchin by the dull color and the foul smell. Would Goyemon pass the sea urchin fish test? Hmm...The anticipation. Man it's killing me. I wave down a waitress and put in the order...GULP!  Well I wouldn't know until next time because they were out. What?!? Are you kidding me...Although Xtreme Sushi has a limit of 1 order per person, I would rather eat ONE uni than none at all.  So that pretty much sums up my whole night. Will my return at Goyemon be a better experience? Movie sequels are rarely ever better than the first one, unless Goyemon is like the Terminator; mediocre first, EPIC the second. Hmm, we'll see...  *Hint hint, and Xtreme Sushi on Southern Highlands is still the best.* ;)

OtetfmLVdzFXxhxi9yq0Uw.text: Great, fresh sushi that's open late and reasonably priced. What more can you ask for ?

QUFt93SrPLtGLbwMZV5Qhw.text: AYCE sushi plus more.  Recommendation: I would highly recommend that you order some sushi first then decide if you want the AYCE.  The quality of the fish is average or below.  You CANNOT order sashimi.  In my opinion, the best was the lychee sorbet NOT sushi.  I did not find one piece of sushi fresh at all.

OTIzE8-NfRpnAZ5nf34w5g.text: This place deserves ZERO stars. I had the miso soup. Also, I ordered the Domingo, Crispy Rice, Magma, &  Dyamite. Dessert: Lychee sorbet. I was starting to not feel good after the Magma. I went home and felt so horrible. I GOT FOOD POISONING FROM THIS PLACE! I'm pissed that this happened. THANKS GOYEMON!!

WD5JWAbY_bdXi9_t8DqphA.text: Love the super white Tuna!!! Every time  I come here they are super nice!! Tried the rainbow roll, the red dragon and the spicy tuna rice cracker and loved all 3. Want to try the pork belly too!

iPgSQqfv5y5dFzC5aYBIuQ.text: i come from california and whenever i come to las vegas, i HAVE to come here. although it may be packed and the wait may be a bit much, but the service and food here is amazing. my boyfriend and i always come here and sit at the bar cuz we like to interact with the sushi chefs. we have two favorite sushi chefs (or at least i do) andrei and another man whose name i can't remember at the moment. he wears glasses. anywho, the sushi chefs are always friendly and always serve you with a smile. my boyfriend and i normally get nigiri. the fish is super fresh and super flavorful.  what i like to get: salmon belly (when available), salmon, and the occasional tuna. the  blue fin is pretty delicious as well. my boyfriend enjoys the tuna, freshwater eel, and salmon.  their tuna poki and steamed gyoza is quite delicious as well!  this place is a must go! :)

_ZAd2gxHz2AdE3pGIWLh4g.text: I know not everybody comes for the sweet shrimp and uni, but I do.  It's Sunday 5:45pm and they are out of uni. Seriously? Its not even 6 yet. And we asked our waitress if we can get two orders of sweet shrimp sushi since they are out of uni, and the waitress gave us a short answer, "no." And that was it.    I come to this place every time I'm Vegas, but I don't know if I will return after this.  Dessert time - another server is serving us and now they are out of green tea and red bean ice cream (which is all they have) and tempura ice cream.  She said its year end so they are out food.... So, how often does your restaurant stock up ...?

PJ8TVfX8DiCPyH_oZUJsFA.text: Second time in three years.  I was in town for business, brought seven of my clients in and they took care of us.   Unbelievable service,  accommodating and quick.  Plenty of food without surpassing quality.   The best AYCE in Vegas!

88vX2I2GCqpk015SC-XHWQ.text: We are so angry! The sign said no uni today!but we see someone order and eat . Then we ask! They say it is the last one!!!!!!! Why????

SKiOPlQ3fLZtCR_xoLVZ-w.text: The wait was for awhile, but when you're with great companies, it didn't really matter!   I thoroughly enjoyed my uni and the fresh sweet shrimps.  The poke salad was delish.  Nigiri was nicely done, not too much rice.  Too bad I didn't really enjoy the salmon nigiri though because the salmon was really thin so it wasn't sweet.  The scallops nigiri was amazing too.  Desserts = :)  .  It's a good place to go in place of other buffets on the strip if you're just craving from Japanese AYCE.

WJll3xGu_aNghU2-376cRQ.text: We came here with a friend who liked the place. It was packed but we had reservations, got in the door with a 15 min wait. We opted for all you can eat. We had eel, super white,  the excatsy roll, and the moon roll. The fish was pretty fresh , minimal rice. But we waited 20 minutes for drinks. We got some of our food before we got our water and sprite..  Service was slow for a 30% tip. We waited 25 minutes for a moon roll... I would not recommend or make the drive back. Our mussels were sent back twice and they came back cold twice . The sauce they used looked shady. Very thick and overwhelming taste of mayo.yuck

tlC8PvYNyQ2Numtac5MGUA.text: It is more of a 3.5 star place.   The all-you-can-eat menu here is pretty dang good.  There was so much to choose from and everything tasted delish.  I do sometimes think about their Cajun seasoned yellow-tail... yumm...  I can't remember anything that I disliked, but I refrain from the 5 star rating because we ordered some plates that never came out, and the service was just a tad off.  The dessert menu is pretty good with selections of ice cream to green tea creme brulee which I've never had before so that was interesting.  I'd definitely come back to try more items on the menu.

4S2VSCfEXcqyWLGRBlWAlg.text: Goyemon had delicious Nigiri Sushi,  Although the place was quaint our table was very tight and the menus were all sticky. We ordered a grilled calamari they brought a fried one, this was very oily and chewy. Upon arrival the server did not ask for our order just asked one person. It was very slow and I would not recommend to go there because the service was so slow.

eryOG3J39x23OyamWu_6vw.text: Why is it that the more Las Vegas gets over saturated with AYCE sushi restaurants the more the service and quality go out the window? I don't understand how a place with this many good reviews could miss the mark so far.   My friend and I sat at the sushi bar. First off the sushi chef was very rude. He had a bad attitude and was not attentive at all. We had to get his attention several times though he was maybe two feet away. The chef snapped at my friend when he mentioned that we ordered amaebi instead of ebi which we were served. The chef kept saying you can't get amaebi with AYCE. We both agreed a few times that its ok we will pay for it on the side for the regular order with our AYCE. It was very annoying and frustrating. It was such an awkward meal. I guess that was it for the chef. From that point on everything we ordered was either incorrect or lacked something. I know sushi pretty well. I have been a fan since I was 9, I worked at a sushi restaurant for a long time and learned a lot about it and my friend with me is Japanese. I will say the big eye tuna is tasty! This place just really disappointed me. Not only the yelp reviews excited me but my friends have told me so many great things about Goyemon. Maybe I will have to give them another try.

A9dIKIptGEmn2UjeKm_LUA.text: I am not a big AYCE sushi eater but with all the hype I had to give it a shot!  Unfortunately we got there in the dreaded window of a long wait between 7pm and 10pm.  After waiting about a +1 hour for 3 people we were seated at the sushi bar.  From what I read this is the best place to be because the service was fast and efficient.  We were hungry and had plenty of time to look at the menu and read yelp reviews so we knew what we wanted.    After ordering mounds of food I started to get worried about being able to finish it after it started to come.  Luckily I was with 2 men who picked up my slack, I believe this is one of the few times I got my moneys worth from a AYCE!    A lot of what we got was personal preference and following fellow reviewers.  The sushi we received was fresh as far as a AYCE sushi place I was not disappointed we got a few hot items some daily specials and some items that fellow yelpers gave high reviews on.  The price was fair for the food and quality we got, our service was fast and efficient, dessert is included in the price which I never get unless I am at a buffet or AYCE.    All in all a pretty good experience...

ygzwBfePVavKBIimfKqRcA.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a long time &  finally got a chance to try it out!!  As with all AYCE, not everything will be the best quality, but you get good quality fish for a reasonable price.  Some of our faves of the night were: yellowtail - very fresh & creamy lychee sorbet - THE best sorbet, mmmmm strawberry mochi - I love mochi unagi - good texture, not slimy pork belly - great grill flavor but kinda fatty salmon scallop poke salad cucumber salad gyozas  Some of our not so faves of the night were: uni - not freshest sweet shrimp was ok  tuna - not fresh  The location is nice but pretty far from the strip, about 10 minutes drive.  The ambiance is really cute.  Loved the decor and bar area.  It is smaller than I would have expected, about 15 tables and a bar.  The service is top notch as we were never rushed.  Even when we spent about 2.5 hours, they still made sure we got everything we wanted.  I ordered extra dessert a couple of times (hehe).  Definitely recommended for being piggies in the desert!!  What's Vegas without all the munching!!  Don't forget to get a stampcard, buy 10 get 1 free!

1mgWGxBI1Ycz1QYX869u_g.text: A fistful of fish....One more drop in a sea of reviews about this place will not make a difference, noting new to say nothing old, only fresh sushi and great service. I usually don't like to do the all you can eat option, I tend to eat a little bit more than I normally would and with the shortage of fish we're facing it feels almost immoral to over eat something that is close to extinction, I rather be part of the solution and not the problem but I'll worry about sustainability some other time, my ancestors never did, I would've loved to try grilled mammoth, ride a unicorn or date a mermaid but they finished them all and now I'll have to settle with what we have left. Having said that, ayce gives you the opportunity to try new things that you wouldn't try if ordering from the menu a la carte, so get the all you can eat once, try it all, the good, the bad, the ugly, pick the winners and next time you go back you'll impress your girlfriend by ordering only the best, and if she's not impressed by your sushi expertise, don't worry you can always get you a new girlfriend......there's plenty of fish in the sea.                                 Doctors recommended

uxGHlckc3CBf8TNALKiMvw.text: I didn't think they had an AYCE Sushi out in Vegas, so I had to try it out. This is probably the best AYCE sushi joint in Vegas, as it is probably the only one (to my knowledge). The quality of the sushi is great. The only reason I am giving this 4/5 stars is that my group sat at the bar, and the people who sat at the tables got their orders more quickly than we did. Normally sitting at the bar you're supposed to get your order faster since you can just tell the chef who's right in front of you what you want.

zbv9TioKrByi6d9_mt1JtA.text: Fast service and really good sushi. I love sushi and when I do eat sushi I eat a lot of it. Too bad they don't have one where I live.

LDmDDBx7wcQbyQEqvUMLWw.text: This is my favorite sushi place. I've been here 2 to 3 times and every time I loved the service and food. My boyfriend and I always have the best timing for dinner. We get here around 5 and never had to wait too long. Service is always friendly and fast. I never had to wait too long for them to clear out dirty plates or a refill on my drinks. Sushi here is deliciously. Nothing too fancy, but still enjoyable for the price. Downside is the place is too small and the tables are way too close to each-other, but that won't keep me away

f5_FvpE6kxp-VbdQ_Z6alg.text: 3.5 stars is a good average rating, but I'll round up to 4 stars. The reason for the 3-4 stars is due to consistency. If you come at a bad time/day then it's a 3 star, but if you come on a good day its more like 4-5 star. But True to Vegas, it's a gamble... you never know what you're going to get. But to increase your odds of getting a better experience, coming at dinner during a busier day (Friday-Sunday) actually gets a better experience because you'll get better food even though you'll have to wait longer.  The food here is great if you come on a good day but if it's not, then it's just ok. The just ok is still on par with other AYCE sushi places, but the great days are above and beyond better. The must orders with AYCE are an order of amaebi and uni (only one order per person) and the pork belly. The amaebi is good but nothing special (but you HAVE to order it since you're limited to one anyways) and the uni is actually pretty good for an all AYCE sushi place. The pork belly is AMAZING though on those great days- it's just melt in your mouth delicious. I would do the AYCE sushi just to eat all the pork belly if it wasn't going to kill me!!! LOL  We don't order rolls with AYCE anymore, meaning we only get the nigeri for the sushi portion and some side dishes. I think the nigeri is a good size with the proper amount of rice. We usually order some salmon, super white tuna, albacore, yellowtail, and fresh scallop. Of those, I think the super white tuna and fresh scallop are consistently good, the others are sometimes good and at other times a little fishy (no pun intended). If you're lucky and you come on one of those great days, they'll have Toro on the specials board and OMG the toro is SOOOO good and worth it. You HAVE to order the toro if it's available! As for the side dishes, we usually just order the tempura shrimp and miso soups along with a bunch of orders of the pork belly.  Lastly, the great thing about Goyemon is that it comes with dessert! I really enjoy the Yuzu or ginger ice cream, or the creme brulee if they have it available on their specials. Otherwise the mochi ice cream is good too. If you're in the mood to go to an AYCE sushi place, I would recommend coming to Goyemon- particularly on those busier days if you don't mind the wait!

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly!! Melts in your mouth!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The days specials menu

67xSHlhzdCIjrY7KgbFWhQ.text: Our absolute favorite AYCE spot while in Vegas!  Love that the AYCE menu isn't limited like all other spots are.  The only downfall on this place is the venue is small, so if you don't go at the right time you could be waiting a long time for a table! But it's definitely worth the wait

vVQPkQzdiuV0Hz-Ir5zBXQ.text: One of the BEST SUSHI restaurants, if not the best, in Las Vegas!! Clean, friendly, pictures of all the rolls, and DELICIOUS!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ffjHWoMWJiJNN3_gzGl9EA.text: I wanted to try anew sushi place in between my good friend and my office. Thus how I ended up here. I live and die for AYCE. This place was decent but I would not return unless I had to.   Rice to fish ratio: I would say the sushi chefs here use too much rice to fish. This was extremely evident in the rolls. I felt like I was eating a roll of rice garnished with a little tiny bit of fish. It's safe to say they are trying to fill you up with rice.   Fish quality: the quality of the fish was decent but not great. I'm a huge nigiri fan because It really enabled you to taste the quality of the fish. Not impressed.   A good indicator of a decent sushi place is the salmon nigiri. It's such a simple piece but contains such a beautiful intricate balance. From my first bite, I knew I would rate this place no better than 3 stars.   There was a few bright spots however. The super white tuna was excellent. They offered half rolls which enabled me to sample a bit. The sexy girl is a solid choice and the red dragon was good.

pvUCoqscwQ6z8o34jwMQxg.text: Came here from out of town for lunch. I'm glad I got here early because this place got busy pretty quickly. The place was lively though a bit small.   The salmon belly is a must try. I mostly had Nigiri sushi and most of them were pretty good. The service could be better. Our first order went missing and it took a while for order to be made again.

8wc7fDhW1a2KSsr0k-TbHQ.text: Its not like before... kind of sad.. ambiance changed.. food taste ok jus another sushi place.

pbZdozH_jup_w8hxP3gM1g.text: I'm rating Goyemon as an ayce sushi restaurant, not as a stand alone sushi restaurant. As for an all you can eat sushi restaurant, it's definitely 5 star.  Price is cheap compared to what I'm used to in my hometown, and quality is surprisingly greater than just about any ayce sushi places I've been to, which I can't comprehend because Vegas is surrounded by a desert, whereas I live next door to the ocean. I've been coming here or Sushi Mon at least once every visit I've had to Vegas since December of 2015. I pretty much always stick to the nigiri and eat at the counter in front of the sushi chef. They usually have a limit of 1 order of amaebi, uni, and toro during dinner per person. There is a time limit but either they don't strictly enforce it, or I just eat really quick. Have not been too disappointed with most of the nigiri. Portions of sushi rice is pretty small, so that's a plus. Just keep ordering more! Servers check up on you pretty frequently, and you can order appetizers with them.  I normally get the takoyaki, tempura and steamed shumai. Nothing special about them, but it's something I like to snack on while I'm there. The Hamachi kama isn't bad either. Yes, I'm Japanese, and it passed my taste palate test.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi icecream

AgVDvLQ5sgRqtddPprf2sg.text: Really good quality sushi, price is the right amount for the quality.  The service is good and the servers will check up on you frequently, it's pretty easy to wave down a server to order something. The only problem I have would be that they are always packed and they don't take reservations. However, they do have a texting system set up for when your table is ready and they are really strict on the time limit for all you can eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From the top left: seared salmon, garlic tuna, seared tuna, yellowtail (4 nigiri)

MJUcGC2xkmFDIaIZICQLTQ.text: Today we had such amazing birthday dinner for service ever here at Goyemon our server is Timothy IS SIMPLY THE BEST!!! He is awesome, very friendly, fun and helpful  service like this will always take us back here even tho there is always a flaw each time we come here.  The flaw this time host named: Erin wasn't  friendly at all  and just plain simply not welcoming and if it wasn't for Timothy AWESOME SERVICE we wouldn't come back.   With that's said we wanted to thank you Timothy for the best service we ever had here at Goyemon we appreciate it    Ps: Timothy my wife said thanks for the birthday shirt

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our desert with a candle to blow for my wife birthday, Thanks to our best server ever Timothy

Wx8D9vex48Y3sFcg_ZFuOA.text: I was SERIOUSLY craving some sushi so I threw the family in the car and off we went. There was a 20 minute wait and their automated system called us when our table was ready. We were greeted, ordered immediately and then the fun began! Super white tuna, baked mussels, seared tuna, red snapper, 2 shrimp tempura, snow crab meat, garlic tuna, salmon, 2 tuna poki, seaweed salad, a 911 roll, a lemon roll, 3 pastel rolls, 2 strawberry mochis and a fried ice cream later we rolled out happier than the day we got married! Everything was absolutely delicious!!! Service was quick and efficient

hZg0u-MhUbGoIUt2cZrkOQ.text: Hands down the all time best sushi house in LV. I've been a guest here for about 5 years and there's not any other experience that compares to this restaurant. TRY THIS PLACE!

96NpvxyfpECi38kWVUn-YA.text: If I could leave a five star for taste I would... definitely a ONE for service..this was probably the worst service I've ever encountered at any restaurant... My friend and I got there at about 6:40pm.. it took about 10 minutes for them to come and take our initial order... once placed... We had to continuously ask for refills on our drinks... The shu mai that we ordered was cold... There was no clear indication as to who our server was or if we had to just flag someone down to place another order.. The sesame chicken was fatty and disgusting... after having waited for so long for our orders to get delivered... We questioned ourselves as to whether we should continue to order or wait until we get the food... we waited for a good 20 minutes for our last order to be delivered to the table... When they finally did deliver it it was wrong... We sent it back... Shortly there after while still waiting for the order to be remade... The hostess Nicole rudely handed us our check to which we told her we weren't finished and had not yet ordered dessert... She proceeded to tell us that we were 30 minutes over our time with an attitude in a condescending way... We then told her that we still had orders coming... She then huffingly Took the check back to talk to the servers... we then had to get another server to re-order said items... Because there was no communication between the one we had sent it back with and the one who had delivered it or taken the order... all the while... There was a large table seated next to us who had arrived at about the same time that we had... Who was not offered the check... I can't help but feel as though they were trying to hurry us along faster since we are a bit on the larger side... as we got the check from Nicole again... We gave her a punchcard that we had for frequent Dining... She took it and came back and asked if we wanted to use the free meal that had been accumulated... To which we advised no... The checks were brought back to us but there was no additional punchcard given... We went up to The hostess stand where Nicole was... We informed her that we needed a new punchcard to which she once again was argumentative and stated that we were wrong... only after some persuasion and explaining to her why we needed a new punchcard did she then begrudgingly give it... I can confidently say I will never return

6irf-Zgw6Zyz5Cvurur12g.text: Salmon belly!  Small and always packed. This place is cool. Some might think the waitstaff are rude...they're not...they're about their business. There will be a wait to be seated. It's worth it.  I'm all about the nigiri. Fresh, beautiful, well cut fish. Soy/wasabi mix. Im set! Goyemon delivers every time I go there.

HqrzGcT61BCrgEoV1SESAg.text: This is my go to AYCE sushi spot to go to in Vegas. There is usually always a wait when you come here so don't come starving in case it takes an hour for you to be seated. The place is not big and they close the party room sometimes so wont use the tables in there making you wait longer than you have to =/  What I love about Goyemon is that their fish is usually always fresh. Salmon belly, ikura, and uni are my favorite. Udon is yummy and included in their AYCE menu as well. One of my favorites! Not many AYCE sushi places include udon with their menu so this is a plus for me. For dessert Green Tea Creme Brulee and chocolate moose is yummy!! Also included in their ayce but not listed on the menu so just order it haha  Their price of $27 a person for AYCE is pretty average here in Vegas. What is pretty ridiculous tho is that it's the same price for kids. Would be nice if they had a half off price for children or something bc I'm pretty sure my 4 year old did not eat $27 worth of food. Then they charged my 6 month old baby $3 to share with me ..I guess smh haha

ew0Ibv_zTkv2UKmid1UrEg.text: This is our 3rd visit. The 1st and 2nd visit was awesome, and that's the reason we returned. Well, this 3rd started really bad. Our sushi chef was extremely rude.  When our party of 4 arrived, we were super hungry; I placed several orders, I immediately noticed the chef was not happy with so many order. He never said "Hi" or how are you!  I continued placing orders,he was talking back, like I needed to stop it I was ordering too much, and he was giving me hard time.  I got up and complaint to the manager. We were having all you can eat! So I felt, we could order. The manager immediately gave us another chef. He apologized for the other chef's behavior and was very professional

j5F9r_x_gfYgeXEx7i-Ygw.text: For the price, this is place is as good and as fresh as it can get. Unbelievable!!! Sushi's are great and doesn't keep us waiting at all. Very full and happy.

zvvTKLLU6qsqAlOtJIGx3Q.text: Goyemon used to be the AYCE place in Vegas 6 years ago. The quality has dropped every year but I keep trying to give them chances. Service is very subpar, slow and unfriendly. The last time I came here (few months ago) was the straw that broke the camels back.  We sat at the sushi bar and asked for all you can eat. We ordered one order of each nigiri we wanted to try and was immediately asked by the young sushi chef if we wanted two orders each. They have the policy of no leftovers or we be charged so we politely said no one order only. He said ok. After we got the orders, half of the nigiris were drenched in sauce and falling apart, one of the fish on the nigiri was also dried on the ends?? We picked 2 of the sushi we were ok with and reordered. The sushi chef checked the order and scoffed "I already made this before"... seriously ?? I didn't even know what to say.  Needless to say we won't ever be back.

j116oW33YRcPZcfcsOOHEQ.text: This is a fantastic place!!! Caesar took care of us well. We weren't sure on what to order so he asked us what Fish we like and made up a few platters on the spot for us. The combinations he came up with were delicious. My favorite was the salmon nigiri which he put a thin slice of lemon and some caviar on top. The flavors of each sushi platter was so complex and delicious. To top it off he gave us some freshly made wasibi, which by the way is tantalizing.  With this being a sushi place, the quality of the fish is very important. The king mackerel we ate was flown in from Japan the night before. The fish is never frozen.   This is hands down the best sushi I've ever eaten. Better than Nobu!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some items on the menu.....
