liRvjifIALvgxdFaz5rwmQ.text: This place has high quality fish and costs a couple bucks more then other all you can eat sushi restaurants. This place is also open until 3 am which is great if you are looking for a late night place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t figure out why this restaurant would put a pregnancy warning sign above the urinal in the men&#39;s bathroom.

G75MCwHPDV3M1JZgEXNdEg.text: Buffets are a must in Vegas. When you get sick of the usual buffets on the strip, Goyemon is a good spot to hit up. It's $27 for all you can eat sushi! Aside from sushi, there is also soup, appetizers, and even dessert included in the AYCE price. So I can eat as many pieces of mochi ice cream as I want?!   The fish is relatively fresh and the best part is that they don't give a huge portion of rice, that way you can enjoy the good stuff. They offer uni and amaebi as well, but unfortunately those are limited to one order per person (2 pieces), which is understandable.   Highlight of the night was the 911 roll. It's essentially a roll with a crazy spicy sauce. The spice was good but it killed any taste of the fish. Spicy rice is what it was. Don't try it, I warned you.  Service was great. We were checked up on often and tea was refilled. Worth the one hour wait? I'm still deciding, but waiting that long definitely worked up my appetite.

gEL0IexYiYa5vhQUFsDabA.text: Not really a huge fan of AYCE sushi. Seen this in California since the early 90's. It seems to be part of the Las Vegas landscape. I guess it is buffet mentality, most bang for the buck. You would not think eating sushi in NY, LA or Tokyo would be a world of difference but it is. I would say that in my opinion of all the AYCE sushi Vegas, Goyemon is the best I've seen. I was more impressed when they first opened. They have since increased their hours and business ten fold. Quality is hit or miss. Probably would not recommend Sundays, that's when anything raw becomes questionable. One of the key differences is the variety of product and the fact that they do use fresh tuna. Everyone else is still stuck on frozen blocks. Which btw is pretty disgusting. I think I mentioned this before, but anything bright unnaturally pink or red is frozen. Maybe you don't care what you eat. A friend of mine recently said "you paid $70 for sushi? You got ripped off, I usually only pay $25 for AYCE". Patted her on the head smiled and said yes you get what you pay for. Imagine this, of all the fresh tuna sold on the world markets, some doesn't get sold. Just like the last bunch of produce sitting there in the grocery store. Some of this tuna can become 3 weeks old. It is poorly handled then poorly stored. After this some company in Vietnam or Korea buys 10,000 pounds of this old tuna that nobody else wants for a rock bottom deal. This tuna is already starting to rot and turn grayish brown on the outside. But thanks to modern technology, these overseas companies invest in machine and equipment that will treat the fish with coloring and preservative. All of a sudden it's red again, not really natural red, but good enough. Then it is frozen, packed and shipped to the US. Funny enough, these countries ban the sale and use at home, but the North American client is big business. That is the tuna you eat in most AYCE sushi bars. Enjoy! Back to Goyemon who also owns Sushi Mon. But for some reason the quality is different. Don't order ala carte, they don't want that either, that's why the same shit is still served. Technique on sushi pretty good. Tuna - usually really good. last time they were using a cut of the tuna that most people would scrape or discard. could tell by the weird taste and texture. 1 star. Hamachi - always decent, but all hamachi unless wild comes the same farm raised fresh, frozen, treated with preservatives or all natural Salmon - decent as well, though not a big fan of Atlantic salmon. the only really healthy salmon is possibly Scottish or wild. Seared salmon is good and gives a nice textural contrast. albany.edu/ihe/salmonstu... Hirame - always good Pork Belly App - nice to see something different, tasty but the mango salsa needs some work Katsuo - decent, but they use frozen Amaebi - actually not bad; only one per person Uni - only one order per person. seemed like a lower grade or frozen? never had this before, taste is ok, but there is a weird uniform color and texture Unagi - same always good Sushi rice - usually good, though the last time was kinda dry and seemed old like it was sitting around all day Tempura - yuck don't get this, might be better in a roll or something Tamago - good, thanks for making it and not buying frozen Super White Toro - bleah Red Snapper - actually frozen tilapia Gyoza - same pre-packaged frozen crap Green Mussels - yes frozen NZ Green Lip Mussels, super cheap and baked with eel sauce and mayonnaise Rolls - all good, lots of rice, you will be full after about 4 of these then so much for AYCE Service - Good and attentive All in all worth making a trip every few months to get your sushi fix. Not the greatest in the world, but one of the better ones here in the desert.

TUgp4xzmxzafWlqqwB-5Vg.text: Food was good, some of the best tuna and salmon in town.

AlXkkjRwHjpscWlTU19imQ.text: If you come to Vegas don't forget to visit this sushi place!  My personal favorite are the baked green mussels and the fresh scallop. I am not a big fan of sushi but this place is an exception. The price very fair, you get quality in each plate. Enjoy!

qxNCuIrbgJuxta8al9ak6w.text: My friends and I wanted some sushi and Sushi House Goyemon was highly recommended on yelp. We went during dinner and was lucky enough to be seated right away. I suggest asking your server what fish is fresh that day and making that your main order throughout. The quality is pretty good here considering its an AYCE for under $30. You get stuffed quick because theres a good amount of rice thats put into the sushi/rolls (so watch your rice intake). The tuna was phenomenal that night and I had 4 orders of it alone. Grilled pork belly is popular here but personally wasn't a big fan (mega fatty). Loved the yuzu sherbet! So refreshing & light. Service can be .... Non-existent at times.

gvKBP3_3Ws7XmdPRDD_Q-g.text: Food's OK the service sucks . 4 table's empty in 8 people waiting for a table outside what's that all about. And a 30 min wait people there's better place to eat in this town this is just another sushi bar

3z-0R3fbOPv7elhGYt61tA.text: Never in my dreams I would even give an all you can eat sushi another try. The last place I had an all AYCE experience was over 4 years ago. So fast forward to Sushi House Goyemon. I just had to trust Yelpers on this one and gave it a try. I surveyed the menu. Made to order sushi that include nigiris? Check. Grilled items? Check. Specials like unlimited aji, salmon belly, & negitoro? Check. Unlimited desserts? Check. Apparently I've been missing out on the Las Vegas AYCE sushi scene.   So I moved here in late August and I've been back for 4 times. Once I waited for 20 minutes. All the other times we've been seated right away at the sushi bar. For $26 per person (dinner), I'm getting WAY more than my money's worth. In fact, I tend to average around $80 every time I eat here, just on nigiris, grilled items, sides, & desserts.   Four stars for VALUE. I knocked off one star just because the cuts of fish tend to be inconsistent and service can be spotty at times, but nothing that would deter me from coming back. - I was always satisfied with the quality of fish they serve (for an AYCE) Sadly, their uni is just so-so, so don't expect high quality stuff. And please bring back the green tea cake on the menu! Overall, this one AYCE I would not hesitate to recommend, but I am still on the lookout for an AYCE joint that serves the freshest uni!

-UxGtUH_IKq7vGDQsbEVbw.text: Disappointed..sushi wasn't fresh...I really wanted to like this place, but it fell short of all my expectations...  Didn't have most of the dishes that I wanted, and dessert was not included during the lunch ayce..  Yelp, you have failed me!

eJTAZ4EDYg8Qohcuw2H6rg.text: This place made me super happy! Stuffed my face and my bill was only $44, WITH two beers & dessert and that's for two people! We had the "no name" roll which my husband said was "perfect" and the tempura vegetables, as well as miso soup and green tea ice cream. Everything was amazing!

8uVhwgyr7y4WXlIVVAj8Gg.text: Worst service I've ever had at an AYCE sushi place. It took 30 minutes to get what we ordered. After we finally got our order, it was mediocre at best. I won't be going back.

oS4l6OG0wTNGu8MnuDE3CQ.text: I think they have the freshest sushi in town with many real Japanese working there, which is nice. However, my complaint is the restaurant is too small and its very common to wait 1+ hr for a table which is absurd.

eO66nylCuw8J_YFjtoO9Mg.text: Service on point, sushi one of the worst i've ever had.  Fish dry, sushi rice super hard, felt like eating a rice ball. Non experienced chefs, need better assistance. This place won't be as busy as it is if they continue what they're doing. Won't be making a visit in the near future.

pURJOG19U5mRk9noZTjHDg.text: When we arrived at 2pm, we were told it would be approximately 45 minutes wait for table of 2. After waiting a while, we noticed the sushi bar wasn't full. We asked if we could sit there, the hostess asked the sushi chefs and came back saying that we needed to wait because the main dining room had 2 large parties. More people left the sushi bar, and there were many seats available, so we asked again after 15 minutes, and we were seated. This is the first sushi bar I've been to where the sushi chefs did not greet you when you sat down. With the AYCE option, we were told we could order sushi directly to the sushi chefs. They didn't even make eye contact with us, it seemed awkward to flag them down and make an order. It was also oddly warm for a sushi bar, they had fans blowing in that area. Didn't think the sushi bar was very welcoming.

848Eobf1Wz0czxv_ub6SjA.text: I liked this place v much when I went with a friend. He ordered all you can eat for us both. Yummy! The food came fast. The service was on point. The guy who helped was courteous and well spoken. They are always busy and I can see why.

1RmE22hVuP_KOI9OdwXpiQ.text: Wait. What the fuck happened here? Everything went downhill.  Maguro: Was old and fishy. Uni: Better than last time. Hotate: Rotten. It was like bitter/sour. Seriously horrible. Ama ebi: Suspect as a motherfucker.  Why the 3 stars still? Poke, tobiko w/quail egg yolk, ikura w/quail egg yolk, hamachi, hirame and a few other nigiri were still pretty good. Oh and we got there right when they opened and yet they were out of salmon collar. Ummmmm WHAAAAA?  Side note: At lunch you can pay the dinner price and get 1 order of ama ebi and 1 order of uni per person. BUUUUUT you can't get all the dinner stuff like the pork belly. BOO!

nWUsS2SNYNLQe3yiHQjyNw.text: (4.5 star) We decided to try this place for lunch to avoid the long lines and crazy wait. We arrived at 12 (11:45am is opening time) and was told there is a 80 min wait. We decided to wait it out to see what all the hype was about. This place is definitely worth trying and waiting for. Their sushi was great and everything was very fresh. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. This is the best AYCE sushi place I've ever try. Til next time Vegas....

1dQEJXG7LXloITy9KCIk8g.text: The place is usually busy and that is cool.  I think the Sushi Chefs rush too much and some of the sushi is awfully put together but that's okay I am eating with my mouth not with my eyes.  I got bored of this place probably because there are certain restrictions what you can order as regards to the meat section but that's okay too, it's right across the street from where I live.  The staff is attentive and they try to interact with you, I like the staff.  If you are looking to just eat, this is the right place, if you are looking for creativity-move it along.  The price is fair for what they charge you on the dishes you would like; go for it!

F3_YZ8bD44M39xhd9RSQ3Q.text: Just be prepared to wait when you get there. But just know that it is also worth it! Friendly fast service and everything is fresh. Do the dinner all you can eat to explore the menu and return and bring friends.

_m24ywA1TjiwU_4qQfLRRA.text: Awesome-sauce ayce sushi place! Loved this pork belly, crispy spicy tuna dish, uni, and the highlight of my dinner was the lychee sorbet and green tea creme brulee.   The orders come out a little slow and there is a lot of rice so they can stuff you with less sashimi. They have lots of sushi roll choices and it is so worth it for the dinner price compared to the buffets on the strip.  The pork belly is a must-try. I am a big dessert fanatic and had 4-5 lychee sorbets by myself and 2 green tea creme brulees. I have never been to an all-you-can-eat sushi place where they let you have all-you-can-eat dessert too, so this is place is a gem! :D my sugar tooth was high as a kite on lychee sorbet and green tea creme brulee! Great to change things up and eat at this ayce sushi restaurant when you get sick the hotel buffets.

9TZiKTxiF0KuWr2EO9Q1cg.text: Best AYCE I have had  in Vegas. Service is slow though but because it is so good I come here once a week! Green tea brulee is my fav :)  PROS: sushi, food, price, dessert CONS: service

R9juPOzgADvUkyNHEffIZg.text: One of the better AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas. There is definitely a large selection of sushi that you can order and other food items that you can order.  I would suggest trying to come a little bit earlier since it can get very crowded and the wait tends to be fairly long. You can put your name down and come back (or they will call you when your next on the list). They do have a time limit on the AYCE (one hour) to limit the time that you sit and increase the turnover of patrons.  Some of the better sushi pieces - yellowtail, salmon, super white tuna, albacore, and halibut. You can also get uni and sweet shrimp in the AYCE but it is also limited to one order (two pieces) per person.   I'm also a fan of some of their appetizers - poke, seaweed salad, pork belly, and baked green mussels.   Overall, we have started to come here for AYCE more often as long as we don't have to wait more than 30 minutes (which on occasion does occur). It is a place to come when you have a big appetite and want to eat and eat and eat. And don't forget the AYCE dessert - green tea and red bean ice cream are definitely something to get too.

Wm7vyrJ2s-EL9odNU5YcJg.text: I have been going to this place for several years. In all it's a great AYCE sushi bar that is open until 3am! Great selection, they don't sit there and play games, they actually get to know you, and what you like, and cater to your needs. They also have a loyalty program which adds up to an A++. This is my favorite Sushi spot hands down!!!

_52HXmk_JZVBnb0Soq2vcw.text: Goyemon is my favorite all you can eat sushi spot. What brought me to actually spend time and write this review for them is because the woman manager's customer service quality is excellent! I can't say the same about the employees. My server was Sarah, she was good but could be much better by improving her attentiveness, there were a few times where we had to get other employees attention just to get Sarah to take our orders. But ultimately, this review is for how this manager made my parents' first experience amazing with a bad start. While we were waiting for our food, a Busser girl was going around collecting plates off of peoples tables, she wasn't paying attention and knocked the plates onto my mother's arm and shirt. The first rule of apologizing to someone, is to say you are sorry. This girl said "it's ok!" As her first response to my mother. Ultimately, we know it was an accident, but it was the employee's way of handling the situation, was bad customer service. She should have apologized as soon as it happened. The manager came over and she made the rest of our experience, back to enjoyable and amazing. She was very understanding and calm.  I have been coming to Goyemon for many years and let my parents know that this is the only ayce sushi place I would go for casual dining. This day that they tried, it might have gone off to a bad start, but it was the manager that made my parents happy again and satisfied with food and service. Quick service recovery! Love it!

GUxBdtF8ef8nXnCg4c2sLQ.text: One of the better AYCE sushi places.  Definitely go there early for dinner or expect wait times in the excess of 30 minutes.  Here in Washington, there is definitely an array of options of AYCE that range from slightly better than Safeway to some pretty decent stuff in the Emerald City.  Whenever my partner and I are in Vegas visiting family or the odd wedding, we definitely beeline to this place at least once.  I am a fan of nigiri, so the quality of the fish is up to par.  Girlfriend loves rolls, so I guess she likes it.  This is one of the places to offer half rolls--so you get the opportunity to try a roll and not have to fill up.  This generates the opportunity for your palate to try the many other options available.

xlzo4-HXu93Su-Mf22chbw.text: Definitely the best all you can eat sushi place I've tried!  What I like about this place is that the fish is very fresh. Can I can definitely tell with the Uni. At other places like Yama and sakana, the Uni is extremely bitter, and tastes like the ocean.  It's gross. But here, the Uni is slightly sweet, creamy and so so good. I ordered mine with a quail egg to add to the flavor. It's only one order per dinner though. Unlike other places, they don't do sashimi here. Just nigiri rolls appetizers and dessert. But the nigiri is so fresh and this place by far gives you the least amount of rice. The ratio is very balanced so you don't feel like you're just stuffing your face with rice.   Their rolls are less saucy here because I think the quality is much better. If you're s a small party, order half rolls so you can try multiple and don't get sick of one. Sometimes there's a wait but it's worth it. Staff is friendly tend to your needs. The high notes for me were the salmon, Uni, and white tuna!

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half tool and yellowtail nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri!!!

ac5Glwgmc_0JFXILiqJS3w.text: First of all, don't pay attention to the old reviews,this place feels like it a had a big change, from most of sushi chefs to servers and hostess, food quality is improving and service is getting better, I decided to give them another chance since the price and food are good and I loved it. They have jalapenos tempura, BOMB!!!! Try the new pineapple Tajin sake cocktail,really refreshing, like drinking candy, lol.  Keep it up guys!!!

dBrKeusKcfiVLfhfucv1pg.text: If you are in Las Vegas and craving for sushi this is the place to go! Whenever I'm in Las Vegas I'm making sure I have lunch/dinner or lunch and dinner there. EVERYTHING on the menu is absolutely amazing: seaweed salad, poke, sashimi (quality of fish is surprisingly good!), nigiri with right amount of rice (some places are making me laugh when I see their huge rolls or tiny slice of fish on top of giant ball of over cooked rice), tuna cheek, pork belly and don't forget about tempura or green tea ice cream!  I really wish we have Goyemon/Sushimon in Chicago!

lVIuQ8CzQ_7yu3lkrqFcoA.text: I like this place for Sushi. It gets pretty packed but they have a wait system that will send a text to your phone when the table is ready.

iaSHVy0WTYPys3JwZYMeHw.text: Currently dining right now @ 6:41pm on a Thursday night and the food and service is great! I come here on a regular when I crave sushi and every time I come I am very satisfied  The quality, and presentation of the fish are fantastic, service from the sushi chefs is great tonight  Shout out to the chefs who are working in front of me tonight, the level of efficiency and organization is top notch!

1I6Z6dZfRK5nl-UVaaCebA.text: I love this place, super fresh food, service is good. It's a nice restaurant. That's the only sushi restaurant I go in Las Vegas.highly recommended!!

rBM2djd4517ZVXLqRaQZpQ.text: Great experience, the sushi chef was a complete gentlemen. Very pleased with the service and the fish was fresh.

L90-OxSHLytNXhCwR-tLYg.text: Tv thing still sucks if you trying to watch sports, but they have brought in a better selection and quality of fish. And their desserts are great too. I come often now with my family, so FYI be prepared they always have a wait. But it's great all you can eat sushi spot

kjX1A0KBoopUuqyYPPOfMQ.text: This is my first time ever eating in an AYCE sushi restaurant. I have seen a lot of my friends posting on social media about this place and wanted to see what all the hype was.   The restaurant was not so busy when we got there. We had a wait time of 15 mins. We had a party of 8 people. My friends and I loved uni that we wanted to eat during dinner time because that was the only tine they served uni. Dinnertime starts at 4p.   We didnt have our own waitress. All the waitresses walked around to each table to help serve the customers. The staff was helpful in letting us know how the ayce works. The restaurant was also clean.  The price for dinner is I believe $26.95 per person. The food wasn't at all as I expected. The sushi and other food came in small portion. The nigiris was very small, unlike the ones back at home in Hawaii. But the food was delicious, especially the uni. I wished we could order more uni but we was told the customers could only order one order of uni per visit. I think its because uni is an expensive delicatessin. I also liked the maguro nigiri.  I really recommend this place and would definitely return when I visit Las Vegas again.

95-5ykZW1GQEMnsSIPvYhA.text: Came with some other residents from other specialties during orientation for dinner. We had a large group and were told it would be an hour wait (we entered around 5:30PM but were not seated until 6:30PM). The restaurant is not that big so I can understand having to wait but we ended up being seated in a side room, so I'm not sure why they didn't just open up the side room earlier.  The restaurant is clean and has dark walls/tables. Service is okay, but it can be hard to flag down a server later so definitely place large initial orders/ask for what you want early on. There is a one-hour time limit I believe, but don't know how strictly it is enforced.  We had a large group and some of our food orders got confused; either things didn't come or came really late/in different waves. Not a huge issue, but just something to be aware of if you have a large group too.  The AYCE dinner price is $26.95 per person, so not totally sure it is worth it. Sure, there are a bunch of rolls, but not as many appetizer/side/dessert items as another AYCE sushi place I've been to in Vegas. Quality is not bad though, and you can order half-orders of rolls too.  Solid place for AYCE sushi, plus it's only five minutes from my house.  P.S. Open until 3AM!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 sexy girl.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red bean ice cream.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ika (squid), tako (octopus), and hokki (surf clam) nigiri.

YzvaIlCa5EULhguKt0wtpg.text: I used to go here all the time and the stamp card was a bonus! But lately the quality has just gone ridiculously down.  Some of the sush already fell apart before I even got it. The rice isn't packed enough, so that when you try and pick up nigiri, it just disassembles.    The meat is no longer fresh, and uni (one of my favorite orders) tastes bitter.   The service is less attentive as well, it was so hard to get someones attention to order. Also a lot of my orders were missing, I usually have to reorder 2-3 things a visit now.   Over a year ago I would've given them a 5 star. However they just seem to no longer care about quality. I'm shocked about what they think is presentable food. I'm sad, but I will no longer go here.

eOEtXpjhakY1hYUPK6fyAg.text: Emoji heart eyes across the board. There's too many good things to write about so I'm going to sum up the important stuff.   1. No reservations. It's a first come first serve basis. Very long wait. But worth it.   2. Super white tuna nigiri is EVERYTHING! We ordered 12 orders amongst 3 people because of how buttery and fresh the fish tasted. The eel is amazing as well. The eel melts in your mouth.   3. Unlimited dessert orders.   4. Ayce is $26.95 per person.   Worth every penny! I never want to eat super white anywhere else but here! This place set the bar to freshness.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super white nigiri. TO DIE FOR

Ku5CurL2syh4MzAlia10JQ.text: Went in at 1040pm got turned away. I've been 10+ times. Went to bootlegger on lvblvd. Got treated like a VIP. Big difference. I've never felt so turned away in my home town. Won't be recommending or returning again.

qvF2yUwv5FJuyS_ScsFRdg.text: I love this place! Came here for the first time with my girlfriend to celebrate her friend's birthday. It is a little pricey for two people at dinner for AYCE you will pay around 62 dollars but if you are anything like me you will eat A LOT lol. I think the lunch price is 21 something. but it is worth it! Gyozas, dessert, soups and a few other items are all included. They have a bevy if options. Red snapper, yellow tail, tuna, salmon, and albacore are just a few of the different fish they have.  They also have a daily special items like Cajun salmon or grilled pork belly etc. The restaurant itself is really small though so if you have a party of more than 5 it'll be a little cramped but intimate at the same time I recommend the Salmon belly and Cajun albacore!  ***CERTAIN ITEMS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE  FOR DINNER*** I understand that to there are different tiers to sushi and some places may be considered more high quality but I have venture around Las Vegas and tried different AYCE places and none of them have been as good as Goyemon. I know there are different palettes as well that people have. If you are looking for a place that you can go and get some good sushi and kick back with some friends or family I'd recommend highly. Me and my girlfriend go biweekly because we love it so much!

CQiagX3wy6p_I7_t0l4UJA.text: After having read so much about this restaurant from other reviews, I found myself extremely excited over the meal. Now, I've been to a few different all you can eat sushi restaurants in my days and so though I was excited, I really wasn't expecting all that much from the meal except to be really full. Thankfully on a Thursday night at 6pm my wife and I were able to be seated quickly without a wait!   The price for the AYCE sushi menu is $26 per person(a great price!) honestly, I was incredibly surprised by how amazing the meal was! Every piece of sushi was delicious and not packed full of rice like many other AYCE places are(there is a rule that you have to eat all of the rice. If you don't you're charged extra, but this wasn't a problem at all for us, again due to the small amount of right included with every piece of sushi).   I especially loved the scallops and yellow tail sushi, and the pork belly was to die for! This is the best AYCE sushi restaurant I've ever been too, even better than many other non-AYCE sushi restaurants I know of. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed!!!

bjnz2DM4vSBPMabUBU5oRQ.text: We coming here may it be from our date nights or having diner with friends and family .... the wait time can be kind of long but it's so worth it .... they do have a time limit of 90mins but you'll be rolling out for sure if you had any more time ... The service here is always AMAZING  they have a big selection of sushi down to unlimited DESERTS ..... they don't play around I always order the tempura ice cream #like 3 orders hehe ... we love SUSHI  HOUSE GOYEMON

9jWy3JF7V37aE1yZXuV9_w.text: Lazy quick review.  So every time a friend or coworker suggest another ayce Sushi spot, we try it out.  Unlucky for every other spot, we compare it to Goyemon , and they always lose (even Sushi mon).   Our go-to... the BEST AYCE sushi in Vegas.  Not much else to say, order everything.   Salmon belly nigiri, fresh scallop nigiri, uni,  Toro (special, only available sometimes), grilled pork belly, calamari,  baked mussels, sexy girl roll, Spider roll, crispy rice with tuna...  Pro-tip: you can order half rolls to try more options!

0ZYgfRyIvZtpVm3OgP3inQ.text: I wish I could give 0 star if I could!! We were sitting at the sushi bar. Trying to Enjoy some all you can eat food with good friends. Unfortunately the sushi chef ( Denis & Tony) was watching us almost every single bite, my friend dropped some rice on the plate, the chef actually yelled at my friend's face, told her to finish all the rice. How can you tell customer what to do? If you think we are wasting food, just charge us on the bill. But you effect other people's eating mood.  We are really pissed off the whole 35 mins we were sitting at the bar. The food is not worth it if the treatment!! Trust me.......... You will feel super uncomfortable like you being monitor

TJEcrFpE8XkV3CFq7fbyjA.text: Great place for ayce sushi. If you like sushi they have a large variety of choices. It can get crowded so it might be better to go on an off peak hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proof of my visit
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Tuna, Hamachi, and Salmon Nigiri Sushi Mmmmmmm!!!

HJDkpLmU2KJG-GU5IwBrbA.text: I've been coming here on and off for years. Generally, I pick earlier or later lunch and dinner times to avoid the crowd. The wait here can get ridiculous at times that I don't even want to bother. The place is rather small so it can get packed super fast. Call first before going there so you have an idea what you are up again.   I think this place is great for their lunch specials and the AYCE lunch and dinners. In terms of quality, I do think this place needs a bit of quality control. When it's good, it's amazing good and when it's not good, it's puke worthy bad. Talk about BIPOLAR SUSHI! Overall, it is good for the most part. Their lunch specials are great too- good amount of food at a decent price. I usually get their seafood bowl or deluxe combo for lunch when I'm not looking to stuff my face with AYCE.   The sushi chefs here are quite friendly but everyone else tends to look pissed off. I don't know if this place is too busy and they are too tired or someone just needs a hug, but generally, not very welcoming or friendly. Occasionally, I'd encounter a friendly one and that's always a pleasant surprise.

d2QfC11tDmnDqbASCB2lmw.text: Came here for a vacation and this is the first place I went to. I came and sat at the sushi bar and Hieu was the Chef. He's very friendly & makes the sushi very presentable. To top it all off, the sushi was the best I've ever tasted in Vegas. Coming here again next time!

tREIR3-ALokT2WY6BlEWhA.text: Their sushi is bomb. Im a big fan of them because everything is so fresh and you get decent size portions.   Sushi - fish pieces are pretty big, but there is also a fair amount of rice. When doing AYCE the rice can be a pain. Fish is good quality and very tasty. Favorites include eel, super white, and cajun albacore.  Rolls - they have a way with sauces! They do a good job of mixing flavors and textures.  Great selection and good variety. Favorites include lasagna, lisa lisa, and pastel.  Apps - good selection of apps and they all are on AYCE menu.   Dessert - nice selection of mochi and other special deserts. I cant get enough of their strawberry mochi and green tea ice cream. Also, as a bonus, dessert is all you can eat too!  Service can be hit or miss, they have a tendency to bring out nothing or everything all at once which can be hard to handle. They usually have a wait but its worth it. Overall, a great choice for sushi.

yh5Yk6e1W5XJ-7RrXTW_lw.text: PLEASE TAKE ME BACK!   Oy, this place is so good, it is painful to think about when I'm not in Vegas because I crave it so much!   What to Order: - Ecstasy Roll (Oh. My. Godddddd.) - All of their Nigiri is to die for, especially albacore, tuna, and salmon - Green Tea Ice Cream - GREAT Hot, Freshly Brewed Tea - You pretty much can't go wrong with about anything on the menu     (sorry I know that does not help)   These guys have everything down to a science. They server you fast and a lot! Trust me you'll be excited to dive on in, but a little tip, brace yourself and drink plenty of tea to help you eat as much as possible ;-)   If you are worried about the freshness of an all you can eat sushi bar- just to put your mind at ease, these guys get anywhere from 1-2 shipments of fresh fish DAILY. Flown in. Yeah.   I'm from California, and, no joke, we make sure to rent a car when we fly into Vegas just because we want to drive out to this place during our stay so often that it is cheaper than getting a cab. Yeahhhh, it's that good. Haha!!   I could go into a long spiel about how unbelievable this place is, and how wonderful and accommodating the entire staff is, but when it gets down to it, this place offers you amazing, fresh food at an insanely reasonable price. That's all you need to know really. I come here every, single trip to Vegas, and is often the reason we even plan trips to Vegas. So just trust me on this one..... or trust the other 1,000+ reviews on this place.   You can thank me later.

Z7JyXXgpgRFiSjpxqvGdeg.text: Came back again, as always and actually had the same server who definitely upped his game! Must've had a bad day, way to go Goyemon... :]  Happy Panda

GOGivx9jWuL37pQnexHdkA.text: The sushi literally melts in your mouth. That is how fresh the food is here.  I have been to many many sushi restaurants.  I remember going to this 5 star restaurant in the heart of LA, where each nigiri order cost $11-$20+.  The quality here is a VERY close second to that.  All you can eat for $22 for this quality is unheard of.  Service is usually pretty good and quality is consistent every time.  They let you order half orders of the rolls so you can have room in your stomach to try more things as the rolls are always more filling.  The amount of rice in the nigiri is just right (some AYCE sushi restaurants put a ton of rice to fill you up faster for cost efficiency).  The side orders are also very well done.  Even for people who don't like sushi, the side orders are more that worth it.  The best thing about this place is food quality.  I have never been to an all you can eat sushi restaurant that is of higher quality than this place.

u0AnemLpWn4SCd-h2ZPXTw.text: Ok I've been to goyeman several times. The one thing I hate about this place is the wait! You will have to wait if you have a bigger party than 4. They do take your number and text you when your table is ready. The food- phenomenal! You have to do all you can eat. Very reasonably priced $26.95 for dinner and you can get appetizers to dessert and everything in the middle. I love the fried shumai ! Service is quick once you are seated!

BHhtgFOJnqsYAyrwCtfJYA.text: Horrible service. They don't care about their customers. I wanted to make a reservation for 13 people for my birthday. They said that they don't make reservations and that we should arrive at 5:30 PM and just wait till 7:30 PM to be seated. Or if the table is available earlier, I suppose I would have to take the table and just wait till everybody else arrives at 7:30 PM. I understand not taking reservations for small tables 2-4 people. But seriously, who doesn't take reservations for a table of 13.  They are obviously money hungry and very careless. I don't feel that my request was unacceptable.   I ended up reserving at another sushi all-you-can-eat place. No problems

BaDWsoyPXq4sAdiaka__LA.text: Great all you can eat sushi place in Las Vegas.  It's True that the waiting time is a bit long; however, once you are seated good quality sushi make your tongue happy. I like the fact that they have daily specials and Japanese draft beer. Most of the sushi is not over-seasoned which is great because you can taste the fish not just the sauce. Been going there since they opened and I'll continue going there. Friendly service and great sushi!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let the party begin!!!

zl4D1PU-4umvB5Jiomg_gw.text: Decent for ayce sushi. My buddy took me here for dinner and coming from la this place wouldnt make it very far in la but for vegas residents this must be the spot. Hungry ? Try it will fill you up and not break your bank.

vOaGNhlxcOPoU8zzakaM4Q.text: Goyemon? Methinks you mean GoyeNOM. Of all the AYCE sushi houses across town, this is the one I continue to come back to, time and time again, and my sushi cravings are never left in naught after a visit. The staff is friendly and efficient, the service is quick, and the bar/tables never seem to be fighting for the sushi chefs' attention in getting their fish onto the table. They don't toot their horn about being one of the more popular AYCE sushi restaurants but they do have an organized system once they start to run a wait, and will even take down your cell phone number to call you if it gets so long you decide not to wait in the restaurant itself.   I usually try to venture out and try at least one different item I'm there, either on their placemat, printed, or chalkboard menus, but usually the process goes like this because in the end, I'm more than pretty dependable:   1. Appetizer. 2. Nigiri sushi. 3. Some type of 1/2 roll.  4. Uni (sea urchin). 5. Ama-ebi (sweet shrimp)  6. Repeat 2 as many times as necessary before 10. 7. Dessert.  8. Happy happy, joy joy.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melt-in-your-mouth pork belly
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. L-R: yellowtail, salmon, tuna

EEKrUxp79yzezUKj0Go6yQ.text: This place is crazy good! The amount of food & quality for an all you can eat sushi place is ridiculous sushi selection is AMAZING!!! Dreaming of going back

Bhym-2alWGpjDzkGT7sHHw.text: The customer service is the worst I've seen. I was recommended by a friend to try this place a few months back and I liked it. It wasn't great as the night we went they ran out of uni but nothing was memorable except for the jellyfish nigiri special which I really enjoyed. It's the only thing that actually made me want to return again.  So tonight I called in to see if they had the jellyfish nigiri special and they said they did. The price for dinner is $27 for the ayce which I consider pretty steep but I figured I'm only in Vegas twice a year so to have the jellyfish nigiri again I would splurge a little. Drove 20 min. to get there and luckily we got seated right away. To my disappointment I didn't see the special and asked the waitress where it was but they said didn't have it and it was probably a mistake. I can understand that since people make mistakes. Already hungry I figured since we were already there maybe we would just stay anyway. I asked the waitress if she could give us 1 more serving of the uni or amoebi to make it up to us which I think is a really small act but they couldn't even do that. I think 99% of restaurants wouldn't mind making it up to a customer. I don't think I shall ever return due to their customer service.

T_0agfWIVW4KOsvEBoSL0A.text: Came in for lunch all you can eat. Fish is fresh and very good. From a food standpoint it's very good. However two of the waitresses were not friendly at all. One girl with glasses was very rude. My friend ordered a coke she didn't acknowledge him and when he repeated she said "I got it!" Super bad attitude from her and the other girl with light hair was also not very friendly. Thankfully the other waiters took care of us.

tlOT1fe1jIFfbQRrZSrWZA.text: Best sushi ever!!!  the fish is so good and so fresh. Also their pork belly is amazing. The service is always great as well!

Q1z-cGdmeRwSSXNJx3hphg.text: Wait: 40 minutes Service: Amazing.  Very well staffed and fast. Food: not so good.  Going back to Kobe Sushi Bar.  Sushi pieces were very small. Rolls were horrible, horrible, horrible!  Sick: 3 out of the four of us had well let's just say extended periods in the bathroom following.  Not good. My stomach is still sick.  Ugh!

hEaetjWkNz_ojWJOylcMUg.text: This is one of my go-to AYCE sushi joints because of its selection, quality, and proximity to my house. I haven't had anything I disliked and I really like the fact that you can order "half rolls" from their specialty rolls menu!! That's amazing because I love trying as many items as possible and this way, I don't have to eat too much. Their stamp card is also a neat incentive. It does expire though, so it certainly awards frequency in visits or large parties. They do not combine stamp cards, so remember to bring it!  I usually order Tuna, Yellowtail, and Salmon nigiri and hand rolls. Fortunately, they're very good here and one sushi chef in particular handles the fish very well. I like the specialty rolls like the Hurricane, Red Dragon, and Mahalo (which is just a Spam Musubi in roll form, but still so great). I usually go for ones with different fishes and possibly shrimp tempura, but no cream cheese (or I just ask for it to be omitted).  Additionally, service is good and the location is easily accessible. It can get pretty busy, but my fiance, siblings, and I typically go at times to avoid the crowd. That works out well and we haven't had to wait long for a table!  AYCE Lunch is $21.95 and Dinner is $26.95 (as of 09/26/2013).

2dBk0v2N-JztiQ0QG8UhdA.text: This place was truly amazing, we heard about this place by a friend and was so glad we did. I mean the music is very soothing the ambience was incredible. Our food was delicious, the hand rolls were great the best I've tasten. Sushi rolls were huge i mean they looked like pregnant sushi rolls but so good!.

wL5bPBvXMYRLsagA_it6Ig.text: Best kept secret in Vegas and is cheap! We loved it there. Not on the strip but worth the drive!

CpCwFuTJKUmFUYbq6IBALQ.text: Food,   Meh sushi with plenty of appetizers. The pork brisket is the best to try.   Service,   Good service in the beginning, but after a while the server stopped coming to us even when I had both of my hands in the air, maybe because I presented 5 pork briskets? ...... If they don't want me to have any more or try to limit people's portions, then state it.   Otherwise the food is god for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

veMOhXmpR47Wx3luikvXwA.text: Coming from NorCal and having patronized various Sushi restaurants we (party of 8) can say that Goyemon is the best AYCE sushi place we have been to.   The restaurant is located in a simple strip mall next to a Pizza Hut and a couple of foot massage spas (Las Vegas maybe the unofficial foot spa capital in the world) but the ambiance once inside is quite surprising.  Taste is excellent, Price is reasonable and Staff were pretty much on it with orders.  They have a wide array of choices including dessert (mochi & tempura ice cream). The Sea Urchin, Sweet Shrimp Nigiri (limited to two per customer) and unlimited Shrimp Tempura were a pleasant surprise for AYCEs of this price range.   The locals who were with us however said that you have to be here early on order to avoid long lines.  Definitely coming back when returning to the Sin City

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. uni sushi

6g5Kat2r58Z4C3FY3WZ7sg.text: I've been to three different AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas now and I'm torn between all of them. Each has its strengths and weakness and Goyemon is no different. The wait time on a busy night (usually every night) can be up to 45 minutes, but we got lucky and got seated right away on a Sunday evening. They state there's an hour limit (which seems ridiculous) for the AYCE portion of the menu, but I'm not sure how strictly that is enforced.   Starting off with the nigiri, there's only two items that you are limited in ordering: the uni and the sweet shrimp. The uni was fresh and some of the best I've had in Vegas. My other favorites were the halibut (but variable, our second order was mediocre), fresh scallops, and salmon belly. You may also order the shrimp heads (deep fried) by request. This portion of the menu was definitely the best.   Moving on, everything else was mediocre or subpar. The octopus and tuna poke was terrible. There was way too much seaweed and not enough flavor. The pork belly was actually decent and flavorful. The rolls were not very memorable, but they weren't bad either. The dessert was by far the most disappointing. The tempura ice cream was frozen solid and caked in soggy tempura batter. The red bean ice cream my friend ordered was completely melted, more soupy than an actual ice cream. However, I did enjoy the lychee sherbert and the black sesame mochi.   Call ahead for estimated wait times and be sure to grab a stamp card for your 11th meal on the house!

cG4m0VF0nuPmskbE9FoVgA.text: One of the best sushi spots in town. The AYCE pricing is that of an average sushi restaurant ($21.95 Lunch; 26.85 Dinner) if you're into nigiri this is the spot for you. The freshness of the fish served here is much better than other sushi places here in Vegas.  I also like that most of the special rolls on the AYCE menu can be made in half orders, that way you can try out different rolls without filling your stomach.   One con would be the wait times. Expect to wait more than 30-45 minutes if you have a group of 3 or more and don't want to sit at the bar. Busy dinner times and the wait time could go up to an hour or 2. Luckily they can take your phone number down and you can get a text when your table is ready. One thing I wish they could do is take phone reservations because not many people would like to go there just to put in a reservation and have to wait a long time. But then again this place is very popular and has good sushi so it's worth the wait.  I was hoping they'd take a 12 person reservation ahead of time for my birthday because I really wanted to enjoy some tasty sushi with friends. That didn't happen because we tried to call in and since they don't take any reservations through the phone there were no exceptions. Many times we had to go to another spot because we didn't want to wait an hour and a half and my group and I would leave disappointed.   So just be prepared when going here. If you're looking to have a quick meal with a group of people, plan ahead and maybe have someone put a name down that way your whole party doesn't have to wait.  Other than that I still love to eat here and try it out !

UzpkTw2yrwBSnC_hALlS3w.text: Really? This place gets this much play.   In a city where ayce sushi is as common as a Starbucks, you would think you would have something quite unique or special to have this high of a rating on yelp. With this in mind I bookmarked it, ready for my next dead fish outing to be here. I ordered a wide variety of mostly nigiri with a few rolls. The rice to fish ratio is definitely a little more rice heavy than most places, and very much obvious on the rolls. There were no "no rice" roll options on the menu either which is what i usually lean toward. Id say on a positive note the fish seemed of decent quality, thankfully. But there was nothing to require my return to this spot. You let me down on this one Yelpers.

cqot_XMnG-ntTNh8ZQRlNw.text: Hostess was totally unreasonable, our seats @ the bar was ready but she made us wait @ least 30 min before she sat us down. She kept walking around, talking to other customers & doing who knows what...WTH??!! -1  AYCE Dinner Review $26.95:  Sashimi salad yummy 4 stars  Poke salad was just ok 5 stars  White salmon so yummy 5 stars  Unagi was just ok 3 stars  Grilled mussels yummy 5 stars  Black tobiko caviar was pretty good 4 stars  Sea urchin uni yummy 5 stars  Sweet shrimp amaebi so yummy 5 stars  Surf clam was soft, not chewy yummy 5 stars  Scallops was yummy too very fresh 5 stars  Green tea brulee, taste was kinda off 3 stars  Chocolate mousse was very bland 3 stars  Raspberry mousse was too tart 2 stars  The freshness here beats AYCE sushi places in CA hands down.  Lychee was so delicious perfect desert w bits of real lychee inside 5 stars  Green tea ice cream good 4 stars  Red bean ice cream was ok im not a fan of red bean 3 stars  Ice creams were much better tasting than all of the mousses =)  Overall, this is one of the BEST AYCE sushi places I've tried...=)
