T2qJ3JmiMHVrqIKq1gl_ig.text: Love this place!  The best late night all u can eat sushi.  Best part is that you can order half rolls.  So you won't be full or if you don't like a roll get stuck eating it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lemon roll and the Domingo roll

VgrmKQtt6AmYQ5_lGEIygA.text: Thank to Chef Hieu!!! Mine and my cousins BEST SUSHI EXPERIENCE  BY FAR!!! Great  food quality and service. Thank You, Chef Hieu!!!  More then A1 service he showed love

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best in vegas

5taER0KsXyJ0D7dO41m8Uw.text: Go into Yelp talk on any given day, and you will always find a "Where's the best Sushi" thread. You'll also find a million recommendations for Sushi House Goyemon.   This restaurant is right around the corner from my house, so given the fact that it is always so highly recommended, I don't really know why it has taken me so long to come out.    We arrived around 5 on Friday night and were seated right away.   We don't ever really do specialty rolls, preferring to stick with the nigiri options.    This trip, we kept things pretty simple, and ordered the following: Super White Ebi (cooked shrimp) Amaebi (sweet shrimp/raw, with deep fried heads) Garlic Tuna Cajun Albacore Fresh Scallop Unagi, well done Tako Shrimp Roll (not tempura) Mentaiko Wasabi Crawfish gyoza (fried and steamed) Garlic edemame seaweed salad Cucumber salad  Dessert: Black sesame mochi Green tea creme brulee Tempura ice cream Yuzu sherbet.  In a word:  WOW. Really excellent quality fish.  The super white and scallop just MELTED in your mouth!  The wasabi crawfish was nice, with a great punch to the sinuses.  The Mentaiko was surprisingly awesome.   A little spicy, and really really good.  The only thing I had any issue with at all was that the deep fried shrimp heads were just a touch on the greasy side, and I couldn't see the eyes.  ;)  Other than that, I was extremely pleased.  Service was top notch.  Polite, and timely, with only a minor delay getting dessert, but that's because they were absolutely packed, when they hadn't been 30 minutes prior.    I will absolutely be back here again.

7gFVQc7WoXc6wSV54JMtNA.text: It was okay we just waited one hour after every order for our waitress to forget about us and have another waitress take our order.  I will be back again. But not for Pa. Thanks Pa. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm yum can&#39;t wait to eat this green tea ice cream up

ervMpjQ6oWeusEQLv5bYEw.text: A review that I've needed to write for a long time just haven't gotten around to do it. I know you're thinking 2 stars cannot be True about a place that in my opinion is all hype. We waited an hour for a table here because I wanted to see if this place was as good as everyone raves and says is so good. Well my friends I can tell you I wasn't impressed. The knife cuts on the sushi were terrible, the rolls were full of rice and the service was super slow. I was surprised to see not many rolls I liked or was eager to try. The nigiri was pretty alright but I wouldn't drive all the way there for nigiri when I could go elsewhere. Granted it was busy but we've had better service. For a place that had excellent reviews this place was a huge letdown.

O4gfr-eONX5TG3ci1Zz5TA.text: This place has some yummy sushi and great daily specials! Love their dinner specials! That pork belly is amazing! The hurricane and ecstasy rolls are my favorites!  Unfortunately I only give this place 2 stars instead of 5 because their service is HORRIBLE! Ever want to feel like the step child? Come here! Lol.  Love their garlic edamame and grilled squid! Bursting with flavor!

MV-bmVF8KEr4sOkgZutiiA.text: This is the Holly Grail of Sushi in Las Vegas.  First there is the quality of the Fish. Exceptionally Fresh. They give you a generous portion of fish, and just a little rice, so if you have come here to enjoy fish, they won't try and spoil the experience by filling you up on Rice.  My wife, who favors cooked food, has said that the "cooked food" here is better than her two previous places, and has no arguement about making this our number one place to go.   Sitting at the Sushi Bar is an enjoyable experience. The Chefs will interact, and will try to give anticipate what you will like, always making good reccomendations. When I tell them "Chef's choice" for my next call, it's something I have never tried, and I am not disappointed.   The help and servers; always making the rounds and anticipating your needs. Even sitting at the table in a crowded place, I never had to "send up a signal flare" to track down a server. Food service was prompt, and orders were always right.   It is priced at about the going rate in town, $26.95, and I think it's a very good value.   A minor thing; All the help are English Speaking, and it is a good balanced mix of both men and women. Sounds like a minor point, but this helps assure your order will be right, and that a gir wasn't just hired for her looks, and thus may be flirting with a group of guys, while you wait for service.   Why not a Five Star? Because if you go after 5 pm, you will have a wait, usually 30 minutes. It's nice that they are busy, because you want to see them continually succeed, but it's kind of a bummer waiting that long to sit down.   As of this date, this is my new home for Sushi.  To my friend, Clint, you're not jumping on a band wagon, just being smart, and your review is justified.

Nh9AcYcXtcpX_DUSO3Cldw.text: It's one of the best all you can eat sushi I have ever been.  I like how they are so generous with their fish. They don't compact the rice, so that rice is chewy by itself, and the whole thing is soft.  The chefs are good and fast.   It's off the strip. So if you want to go there, you need to rent a car.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K3KwHKeX_fJ8i3j3ebXhRQ.text: Id like to start off by saying I use to love goyemon! The nigiri was my favorite here but yesterday was a big disappointment! To start off there were 3-4 server/ hostess right at the front who did not even acknowledge we were waiting until another couple walked and in and reminded them that we were there first . They're usually really good about greeting you so it threw me off that even what looked to be the owner stood ignoring us and walked away. The fish did not seem fresh ! Me and my bf both got all you can eat due to the fact that we were starving but unfortunately after just two corses were done . We order garlic edamame wich seems to be from a bag that they sale at Walmart it was stale and hard I had a couple of pieces and was over it. We also ordered garlic tuna nigiri , seared tuna and seared salmon . I love salmon but my first bite was enough to make me gag. It was hot on the outer sides of the piece and frozen in the middle the texture in my mouth as I chewed  really made me nauseous. After that I was ready to go but being that I knew we would be charged 60 because we had already told the server that we'd do all you can eat I decided to order dessert wich was ok not 60$ worth but definitely killed my craving for sushi . I don't think we'll be back anytime soon or at all .

P5o7BVs2iBw9fk2tYz1Ueg.text: My first time EVER at an all you can eat (AYCE) sushi place. I was not disappointed!  We walked in at about 5pm on a Thursday afternoon. The restaurant was fairly full but we only had to wait a few minutes for them to clear off our table (party of four). Arriving at an "in-between" time (late lunch, early dinner) turned out to be a good idea, because towards the end of our meal about an hour later the place was packed and there was a line.   The AYCE price was $26.95 per person for dinner (lunch price is only $21.95. Guess who's coming back for lunch soon?) The AYCE includes everything on the menu besides drinks. Appetizers, miso soup, grilled items, salads. Even dessert! Unlimited dessert! What. A. Deal. I seriously spent most of my time looking at the menu while I ate, trying to decide what I was going to order next.   My advice would be to order as many things as you want at once, because it does get busy and food takes a little while to come out. There's an hour limit on dinner, so you want to spend more time eating than waiting. Keep in mind, though, that they will charge for leftovers including rice, so only order what you can eat.   We tried a few rolls. I liked the one called Sexy Girl. Nigiri is delicious...get the ahi and the unagi because both are spectacular. Also, please be sure to try the pork belly off the "grill" portion of the menu, because it just melts in your mouth. Faaaaaabulous, dahhling. Like everyone says, the rice to fish ratio is great and you can get the 8 piece rolls in half orders so that you can try more things before you tap out. Everything tastes fresh and is well-flavored.  Other things we tried were the calamari, takoyaki, sashimi salad, tempura, crab roll, shumai (fried and steamed) and the rice cracker, not to mention practically all of the different nigiri on the menu.   For dessert we had the azuki ice cream, green tea ice cream (mochi and regular), strawberry mochi ice cream, yuzu sorbet (my first time having this. It's a citrus sorbet and it is very light and refreshing), and the tempura ice cream. Tempura wasn't quite crispy on that one but it was still good.   Bottom line: Get the AYCE and make sure everyone on your table has it so that you can all share.  It is so worth your money. The wait staff is attentive and the atmosphere is casual, and you will definitely enjoy yourself whether you are a sushi snob or a fusion fan. It's quality sushi to your heart's content. Five stars, Sushi Goyemon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Second side of the menu.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First side of the menu.

8E2wvwLXgI_pAV-6Bds2_A.text: I like this place. Very good for all you can eat Sushi. Delicious food here and very busy here. Still worth for waiting 35 min or more here to get in. They text you for check in. Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite Miso Soup.

dXixv67poX1vWoDCiTCrxw.text: This is one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. Place is really small and you usually have to wait but it's worth it. We sat at the sushi bar and it was the best decision ever. The sushi chef was beyond nice and our orders came out super quick. Staff was friendly and the fish was delicious. One of the many reasons I come here too is because I love their green tea brulee! OMG delicious. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This Sake was so good!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot what this is called but it&#39;s tasty just make sure you can finish it.

0wtuCzC0vLzlkhcqsQpZ3g.text: Not happy with the service this time around. The food is still very good, fresh and very flavorful, no complaints there. However,  I had to get up from my chair to approach our hostess to refill our drinks and give us some more ginger which she gave us very little of when she delivered our food. I get that they're busy during our visit but at least check up on customers. I've been at their establishment where it was busier and received good service. It was not so busy where they could not accommodate their customers. It didn't help that her personality is not enthusiastic enough, but accompanied by her lack of customer service, it just was not a good combination on her part. The management, for the caliber that their establishment, should be more prepared to have enough staff to accommodate customers. They charge good money for the food at their place but they do not back it ip with the service that paying customers should be getting for their money. I am disappointed with Goyemon House this time around but hopefully they could remedy this very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi combo lunch special: Yum-yum scallop, Shrimp roll, Spicy tuna, &amp; Spicy shrimp Yum.

Cg0goDkhAT7ql4_TH3yNjA.text: The sushi here is pretty awesome. I would say it's high on the totem pole of sushi in Vegas. I mean, the place was packed when we got there (around 530/6pm), so that was a great sign. We sat at the bar and were entertained by the chef's banter in Spanish slang. There are a couple of tables outside but I personally wouldn't do that because of our strong winds.. They have a photo menu for over 40 specialty rolls so you really know what to expect. We ordered the Super Salmon and the Ecstasy rolls. Absolutely delicious. The waiters were really nice and patient with us even though we took forever to order.  My favorite part of the meal was the seaweed salad. I always have one when we go for sushi and usually they are very small. Theirs is averagely priced and so big I had no problem sharing, and it had it's own distinct taste. They also have an awesome assortment of other appetizers and plenty of desserts options. We will definitely be back here!

IDwN1vUd2KssnfL53bJVrg.text: Goyemon is a delicious order-as-you-go all-you-can eat for $26.99 sushi house with sake flights (3 different sakes of your choice) for $8. One order is two pieces of sushi.   That's the short version. Here's the longer version:  My sisters, fiance and I went to try Goyemon. My fiance and I had been there previously. We have noticed that they really get packed every time and there is a momentary wait for a table.   We really enjoyed our two experiences there. I took a star off specifically for their service. It is hit or miss with their service. They either accidentally overservice you or underservice you or some times bring food to the wrong table or bring you the wrong item. I'm sure in the future they will have a better protocol and perhaps create SECTIONS!  However, their fish is extremely fresh, their waiters are truly friendly and the vibe matches its hype. They do not pack on tons of rice to their sushi to try and fill you up. They really seem to want you to try everything.  Their desserts, such as the green tea creme brulee, are of utmost divinity.   They also have cooked foods such as ramen and yellowtail collar (which they run out of very fast).  There is one thing that I did not enjoy there. It's called the Screaming Orgasm. The tuna meat used in the tuna poke dish was fit for tar tar. It was a nice try to disguise leftover pieces of fish with the screaming orgasm sauce, but it was subpar for my taste.  I would say for everything they have on the menu and to only have one small complaint is a huge feat. Good job, Goyemon, and "Go, Ye Mons" (in old English Jamaican accent) to Goyemon to enjoy their delicious sushi.

XbK4J4SgOQ9T06oY-Lq5XA.text: Great Variety, good quality, super busy....  I can't agree that this is the best AYCE sushi place in the valley, however its certainly top three.  Goyeman boasts a variety on the menu that almost no other AYCE can, with the star of the menu being the braised pork belly.  This is a charcoaly, unctuous, porky explosion of delcious!!  It may be one of the best pork belly presentations I've ever had, and it's included in the menu!    I thought that a lot of the rolls had way too much rice in them, especially the 5 piece rolls (soft shell crab)  Nothing really stood out to me, and while the quality was fine, I wasn't blown away.    For how crazy this place gets, the service is very good.  The sushi chefs must be some of the fastest in town.  There is a 60 minute time limit on dinner, which I can understand but I don't like.  Don't order too much off the big menu, you'll get charged for leftover food, even rice.    Save room for dessert, the tempura ice cream is really great.

Kb6JXMdHqWnOFW_DAcyUJQ.text: I absolutely love all you can eat sushi so when I heard about this place opening up from an ad posted inside of Monta Noodle House, I was like "I'm so there!" Not to mention the fact that it's a sister restaurant to one of my personal favorites, Sushi-Mon.  This place should actually be five stars considering everything that they have to offer and the fact that every single bit of it is absolutely delicious but I gave it four mainly due to the fact that I thought it was going to be a new sushi experience when it actually wasn't. They pretty much have exactly the same menu from Sushi-Mon plus a bit more so I was kind of disappointed that it was just Sushi-Mon 2.0  That little fact shouldn't discourage you from going to eat here though. As I previously stated, the food is fantastic. From the nigiri to the specialty rolls, all the way down to the sides and dessert, this place knows how to bring their A game.  If you're looking for a good sushi experience, Goyemon is an excellent place to start.  It's like 10 minutes off the strip so if you're an out of towner, this place isn't too much of a hassle to get to, although when I went there was a wait time so I would suggest calling ahead. Not sure if they do reservations but it wouldn't hurt to ask right?

j6bd1Kc87IwD0iFJdJnmjA.text: I'm torn.  The sushi was really good and for AYCE, that's pretty impressive.  You don't expect good quality for AYCE.  However, the service and largely the hostess service was HORRIFIC and we were NOT the only ones saying so (based on other reviews here and hearing other customers who were waiting at the same time as us).   There was a queue to give our name for a table and the hostess was running around answering the phone and doing everything BUT take our names.  We easily waited 5-10 min just to put our name down (and there was only 1 party ahead of us).  They also had a few empty tables that easily sat empty for a good 20-30 minutes before parties were sat at them.  Part of this is they allow parties to be seated even if the rest of their party is not there.  For a place that is so busy, they should not allow this. I appreciate that they take your phone number down and will call you when a table is ready.  When I've seen this at other restaurants, they usually call when a table is paying so it allows you 10 minutes to get back.  It does not make sense to call after the table is cleaned and setup because then it sits empty.  Furthermore, they should not allow tables to be sat if the whole party is not there - this avoids idle time where people are not eating and the restaurant is not making money.  I saw many parties actually leave and not bother waiting as they were as frustrated as us. IN the end, we did wait and the food was great and came fast!  Still unsure if we would come back.

CDsOb5lfh8c1b5yS3TuqTg.text: My friend used to love Sushi Hana and was devastated when it closed down. I thought the previous restaurant was ok, but Goyemon is magnificent. Everything about it is upscale and almost sophisticated without being ridiculously priced.   The tables are a little close together and it is easy to get caught up in another groups conversation. You should go with a mid size group of 4-6 to truly get the perfect dining experience. The menu for the all you can eat is extensive. To be able to get a full tasting you will need to share and split the duties amongst everyone. Goyemon does it's part by offering many rolls in a half portion size.   Katrina M. and I stuck mainly to the nigiri. The best were the halibut, super white tuna, scallops, and uni. I will devour four orders of halibut by myself and it was better than most places. They use less ponzu sauce on theirs which gives me the impression that there is less to hide. The super white tuna was buttery and melts in your mouth. I am pretty sure I snuck a majority of them away when no one was looking. The scallops had a squeeze of lemon that accentuated the flavors of the shellfish. The sea urchin here is delicious. They were fresh, briny, and creamy.  We had quite a few cut rolls as well. They all tasted good, but I would stick to the nigiri. The lemon roll was one that stood out above the rest. During the meal, I had wanted to order the Sushi Monster Roll. By mid meal, I was getting too full so I forgot about it. A friend ordered it while no one else was paying attention. We got it as our last roll and regretted every minute of it. One piece is the equivalent of three normal ones. The giant roll has a condense deep fried fish center wrapped in seaweed, rice, soy paper and more rice. If you have a hard time with a spider roll avoid this one. I took the challenge and stuffed the whole piece in my mouth. It was not pretty.   Save room for dessert, because it is all superb. The tofu cheesecake is rich and dense. You would never be able to guess that it was made of soy. The green tea creme brulee and cake has a mellow taste. If they allowed for it, I would do AYCE dessert.

Y9ZXqFNV2nKyT6kr9aT7vg.text: I've dined at Goyemon a few times and the food here is pretty amazing. I'm particularly a fan of the garlic edamame, grilled pork belly (hands down one of the best things on their menu), hamachi nigiri, white tuna nigiri, baked mussels...the list goes on and on. The food never disappoints. I will definitely come back to this place! So why not four stars? The receptionist didn't really look like she was happy to be there and the service has room for improvement. Our orders had gotten messed up on several accounts, and because we were in a separate room (we had a party of 14) it seemed like they forgot us. The wait was about 30 minutes which is actually very fast at this place. Sometimes you can wait over an hour...but in all honesty, it's worth the wait. The $26 you pay for the All You Can Eat dinner includes: select nigiris and rolls, more than a few hot (grilled, fried, baked) items, drinks and dessert. Be sure to check the chalk board next to the sushi bar which includes daily all you can eat specials! More than worth it in my opinion!

FRXQ2YDvs2wpRmhbjtA0og.text: My favorite ayce sushi joint in town. They don't take reservations and are always busy so plan accordingly. Great selection of sushi and other Japanese cuisine.

VQn07fHHX8bBKMTuduW3Ug.text: Best AYCE sushi in town! Also, the lunch price you can order everything that's available for dinner.. The only thing is you have 45 mins instead of 1 hr!

YWgZpYvoQ2Vypp5PkeR3ag.text: This is the best AYCE sushi joint in town. I am here about once a month. Can't beat the quality and the price.

wNqhzd6cJv8mDkgiaDdmNQ.text: fun and delicious!! The chefs were amazing. Best part of the meal was the pork belly. But like any good thing a little goes a long way. :) the chocolate mousse at the end heavenly :) and the prices can't beat them for the type of quality in food you get

RWklJAW0utpMjfM52274kg.text: This is my favorite AYCE sushi place in vegas. The nigri sushi has a good fish-to-rice ratio. Its the closest thing to sashimi you will find on any AYCE menu.  They have nightly specials added to their menu and I have enjoyed each one I tried- especially the yellowtail with mango! Oh so yummy! The service is decent but the sushi chefs can get a little backed up. The restaurant is also rather small and they do not take reservations so you may expect to wait a while if you go fri/sat for dinner.

ZvYKGbffWvfHVqPnSEAasQ.text: It's 'bout time for me to review this place since I've already gotten 9 stamps on my Goyemon buy 10 get 11th free card!  I've been to this place 3 times in the past month with different friends each time.  Everyone liked it.  I personally have had better sushi but for all you can eat this is as good as it gets in Vegas.   I love their menu.  You don't usually find sashimi salad, tuna rice cracker, orgasm salad, grilled pork belly, cold tofu, green tea creme bulee, tofu cheese cake, kobe beef (special) in the other all you can eat places.  I've also heard good things about the pork nuggets dish and the teriyaki dishes.  Thumbs up for the decent size cut and small rice portion.   I prefer Nigiri to sushi.  My favorites are salmon roe, white tuna, salmon, yellow tale, red snapper.  I'm not a uni person but my friends who eat uni said it was good.    Good service.  I didn't like the service at all on my first visit but on the last two visits we had great service.  It's not a big place so sometimes there's a wait and I'm not sure if they take reservation.  This is definitely our new favorite all you can eat place.  I hope Goyemon keeps it up!

swjy5DQ16RYMI8x8Z6Y7ow.text: This place lives up to the hype. Took a star off for one thing: the wait can be interminably long and the waiting area is small.  When you walk in, it's very hard to figure out who has already submitted their name and who is in line for the hostess.  It's also really cramped there.  We sat at the sushi bar and got the AYCE.  The sushi man behind the counter was very impressive.  My husband rattled off about 10 different nigiri and roll items and the guy didn't write any of them down.  I thought for sure he would forget some of the items, but that guy whipped them out like nobody's business.  The fish is fresh and tasty, and nigiri is really the way to go here.  The rolls are good, but the two we tried had a little too much going on and the flavors got lost in the jumble.  P.S. The pork belly is part of the AYCE.  We didn't find that out until the very end!  If we had known, we would have ordered some!

PILzgrBU4j84slLdGKLd_w.text: Food is good here but this review is based purely on customer service in which this restaurant lacks! It really is unfortunate they have such high reviews when they treat their customers like 2nd rate citizens. I've been here several times they are always rude if your party consists of more than 4 people. On the last occassion there they would not let us put 2 four top tables together for a party of 8 rather forcing us to have people both at the ends of four top & two top stuck together so our party could not all interact with each other. We even specifically asked them not to set up the table like that but were completely rude & told us we could not sit @ a table with all 4 sitting acriss from each other.  There are plenty of other great sushi places that I would rather give my hard earned money too.

m3PnopYHsLKqcr1u8aISGg.text: We arrived around 9:30-10pm. We were seated promptly and our server was good. She took our order and got our drinks quickly. We started with garlic tuna, cajun albacore,  sweet ebi, and the tamago. The garlic tuna could have used more garlic as I thought the garlic was lacking. The cajun albacore was good. Tasted like some seasoning I had in my spice cabinet but good. The sweet ebi was also good. The tamago could be alot better, seemed as though the egg had been folded over each other to make the shape instead of being prepared that way to begin with.  We then moved on and had the orion, domingo, and the tiger rolls. The orion was good the cajun albacore made that roll spicy yet very tolerable, the domigo had to be my favorite.  The salsa that it was topped with was awesome and was a different twist from what ive had in the past. The tiger was ok. Nothing to crazy.  We then had the crispy rice, lasagna, and the spider rolls.  The spider roll was good. The soy paper was soft and the crab crunchy, very good! The crispy rice and lasagna was no spot light and was very heavy rolls with mayo, eel sauce, that just made the rolls not so appealing.  Overall place was a good time, decent food, and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The orion!!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The domingo roll was awesome!!

n7lLBqPBbtfMvCrU11Smtw.text: I believe this is was one of the best AYCE sushi restaurants we've been to. We come to Vegas yearly and always look for good restaurants. Going 2 miles off the strip to eat here is well worth it. Be forewarned they are busy nonstop. We walked down from Mandalay bay and had a 45 min wait so we walked back and grabbed our car. When we returned we had our bar seat ready for us. The sushi chefs are fun to chat with and give great suggestions!  9-1-1 roll very HOT spicy.  Spicy rice cracker yum Tiger roll looked killer Hurricane & volcano excellent Orgasm salad delicious! Tofu cheesecake interesting - refreshing   Cool thing you can order half rolls so you can try so much!  $26.95/person   We will be back!!!!

M-aiOQLX1p4agLZU2F-SBQ.text: Everything was pretty good. Garlic tuna tasted like Garlic had nothing to do with it. Our server was good. Heard a couple bad stories about a rude server there, whatever. The hostess was ok.

nrUqABHf7Enqf9KB_-l1XQ.text: Coming from Hawaii to visit and our Vegas friends told us about this place. Our friend told us the sushi isn't like how it is in Hawaii. So we decided we give it a shot. Arrive at Gomeyon and told us that the wait was for 75mins for a party of eight and we got there before 6pm. I checked back to see if the table was ready and then they told us to wait an extra 5 minutes. I checked back after 10 minutes to give them more time, table still not ready. We got seated just a little over 1hr 30min. While we were waiting outside we looked at the menu to see what we can share and listed everything on my phone so we don't miss anything and much easier to take our order. We ordered everything all one time because of the long wait, some dishes came out within 5-15mins others came out like 20-30min. Some of the orders didn't come out. Most of sushi was alright and some were good. Good price for All You Can Eat $21.95. Service was slow. Quality of the sushi is average but where can you get fresh caught fish sushi in the middle of the desert.

eqV5LNSybtFVIrz0D-BNvw.text: Added this place to my top 3 sushi joints.  Tried it out last night and it satisfied me and my wife's sushi craving.  We got there at around 10pm and waited about 30min.  The owners are also the owners of Sushi-mon on Silverado and Maryland and Fredo moved to this location.  He is still funny as usual and a great sushi chef.  Just like everyone says the food is fresh and tasty.  Pork belly is a must try. Love the grill taste to it.  You can also order all your rolls as half orders which is a plus, so that you can try out more rolls.  Tried my first Jalapeno masago nigiri(thanks Fredo) and it was awesome.  Try one with a quail egg and one without.  I didnt get to try my usual hamachi kama, due to being sold out of that and salmon kama (collar). Im sure they are both just as great as sushi-mons.  Make sure you look at the chalkboard to the right of the sushi bar for daily specials. I seen it at the end of the meal and didn't get to try them :(. We will definately go back and we will be bringing more people to enjoy this place.

4uYWTgGnmR-1_hvzbD8tNA.text: Best AYCE I've ever had. Bonus: half size rolls so you can try different rolls without overstuffing yourself.  Came for lunch on Sunday, so I didn't have to wait.  I really liked the quality of the fish and the rolls were so tasty, they have so much variety. Service was really great and the hot green tea is part of the price.  There is a really good selection of appetizers and side dishes (all included if you get AYCE), as well as a large variety of nigiri sushi. Dessert is also included in the ayce and there are daily specials for lunch menu and dinner menu.  Waddled out of the restaurant utterly satisfied and craving to come back when I'm in Vegas again.

Wi6G8DAPe4m_6COQmXsOKQ.text: Came as a direct result of the fantastic yelp reviews and without a reservation.  Four of us had to wait about 45 minutes--but it was WELL worth it.  ~$27 for all-you-can-eat sushi is a deal in and of itself, but what makes this place remarkable are the sushi chefs behind the bar.  The chef asked us what we liked/what we didn't like and took it from there--bringing course after course of some of the most interesting, varied, and DELICIOUS sushi I've ever tried--rolls and nigiri--until we said stop.  Do yourself a favor and take the $15 cab ride from your hotel on the strip to this restaurant and you will not be disappointed.

n-5qUJ3pT0A7D6A5xGNnIQ.text: Came here when it was fairly busy but the service was still fast and friendly. The price for all you can eat was standard. Their menu provided unique selections such as pork belly and shrimp heads in your miso soup. The super white tuna melts in your mouth.

PgRF5IXZN2ZqCYXH2018Dw.text: I have to say that I've tried just about every sushi spot in all of Vegas, and Goyemon is by far the best. They offer an ala-carte menu, or the famous AYCE(all you can eat). The food is absolutely awesome, and fresh. The fish to rice ratio is on point;) The service is just as good. Nice friendly, and helpful staff. This is a must go.

Rq6NiR4Hhn_QX4Uy0WyT1g.text: All you can eat sushi in Las Vegas... What are we getting ourselves into?  As it turns out, you can opt to pay a set price for a meal then order what you want from the set price menu. A few of the pricier items, such as uni, are limited to one order per person. Items include Nigeria sushi, rolls, salads, cooked items and more. The quality was excellent. The service fast and friendly.  Sit at the sushi bar and you may find the chef feeding you treats. And... Get the pork belly appetizer. I'll definitely come back here. Now open for lunch and stays open until 3 am.

Wj2-SFvt1Iyo6DrLWvcd1A.text: Tried this place for the first time tonight.  Will DEFINITELY be back.  The basics that me & my hubby usually get at sushi places (tuna poke, seaweed salad, miso, etc) were very good if not BETTER than their equivalents at the other 5 or so sushi places we've tried here in Vegas. We ate at the bar and our sushi chef (I think his name was Juan, a young Hispanic man) was very attentive, polite and intelligent.  He was taking multiple orders from multiple customers at once and getting them all out quickly and accurately.  Plus, he told us something we've never hear at a sushi place before: that we could add or subtract whatever we want from the rolls on the AYCE menu and he would make them to order.  How awesome is that! And I loved that this place had many rolls with ingredients you don't see every day at the other places in town.  And all the new ones we tried were very tasty.  Oh, and there were some unique items on the dessert menu too which were also delicious! The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is that the servers were kind of slow. But we would definitely return for "Juan" and sit at the sushi bar!!!

jDNVBVhi6x0KjxwfYyObmQ.text: Overall, one of the best AYCE sushi joints in Vegas, but disappointed that they didn't have Kobe beef and toro available for us as stated in other yelp reviews.  The quality of fish was what you'd expect for ayce, although there was a huge difference between our orders of hamachi nigiri.  First order was of high quality--nice white, fatty slices with little blood line.  So good I wanted more, but the secound round was rather poor quality--fish was breaking apart like venetian blinds, little fat content and had a large amount of the dark red bloodline. MEH.  I must say their uni and amaebi were both very fresh though. The pork is tasty--simmered for a while till it's melt-in-your-mouth, similar texture to the pork you'd find in a good ramen place.  The spicy tuna on crispy rice was good if you like yaki-onigiri, if you don't then don't get this since it is more rice than fish.  Special rolls we ordered were nothing special, dessert was nice with the green tea creme brulee & green tea ice cream.  Our server was nice, but not very attentive--we had to wait 15 minutes after our first order to put in the 2nd, even with me constantly trying to make eye contact with her.  Are you trained this way to make us full faster????  Overall, "this sushi-mon #2" is a nice addition to our ayce sushi choices here in vegas. If not for a disappointing round 2 of hamachi, so-so service and lack of 2 special items that made me want to try this place, it would have gotten 5 stars.

TSkmAOcPgkjWqQPn_oTA9g.text: My friends and I wanted to eat at an AYCE sushi place.  There were some debates on which place to go.  My friend that lives in LV recommended me to go here.  He lived here 10+ years and also has a sushi chef background.  With that in mind and the 600+ reviews in yelp, we decided to go here.  There was a 15 minute wait, which we didn't mind because we walked to the mini mart a few stores down and bought a bottle of beer.  We requested sitting at the bar so that we can order directly from the sushi chefs.  The sushi was fresh and made quick.  There were also items that needed to be ordered from the waiter - yakitori, pork belly, udon, dessert, shumai, etc.  Everything I ordered was delicious.  There were also daily specials too.  After we were finished I asked my friends if this was better than the other place you went last time (Don't want to call out the other place).  He said this place was better.

ntWcHN8XWpoXIqUwH-Bzyg.text: My first time here, you can either do all you can eat or just order from the menu.  The sushi s great, not your typical sushi all you can eat quality.  Make sure you allow for sometime since this place gets really busy.  The sashimi(hamachi, amaebi, unagi, salmon, tuna) was very fresh.  I am not a fan of uni and we had some and it was amazingly good.  Too bad you are limited on some items.  They have a special menu and great desert menu.  The green tea crem brulee, green tea cheese cake, and green tea cake is a must have.  Actually everything is good here and they have a good selection of drinks as well.  Can't wait to go back to Vegas and stop by Goyemon for their great food.

hnUW-4dukg-5220PL6fryA.text: A group of 5 of us went to Goyemon last night with all but one of us never being there before. We were very disappointed in the organization of "first come first serve" which is not entirely True considering one guest came in and said they had a reservation and the wait was half the time for a table. I was there 15 mins before the rest of my group and although there was an open table I was told I had to wait for everyone to get there. Even when everyone did arrive, we still waited to be seat though our table was sitting open in front of us. The hostess said she didn't want to overwhelm the kitchen but I thought still you could seat is and have the waitress take our drink order? We finally were seated after 10 mins. I have never be forced to stand in the way of the door with my table open right in front of me for 25 mins. The food was great but service was not. We were all worried about getting our order in before the hour window of eating because our waitress barely came to our table. At the end of the meal, we waited ten mins for someone to come take our payment and ended up walking up to the hostess stand to do it ourselves. Very disappointed in first impressions this place made. Make sure you make a reservation since it works sometimes and not others. How is that even fair?

dzv3EySC4vV4vT_M6gtzzg.text: This place has the hands down best uni i have ever tasted in my life!! + sushi melts in your mouth. So fresh at the perfect temperature. I fell in love with their sushi so much that i still cant forget the taste.. the first place i am headed when i goto vegas :)

nHba6lj27EfVBmRLdbDfsw.text: Wow. Great sushi! All you can eat for 26 bucks! Make sure to get your money's worth! I came her with my girlfriend and got AYCE and we got a lot of half rolls and figured the price of the meal would just come out to the price of AYCE.  We sat at the sushi bar and had Fredo(?) as our sushi chef. Really cool guy and really friendly. He recommended things to use and everything tasted great.  YOU MUST get the grilled cajun salmon! It only comes in a small bit size so order about two for yourself. The chocolate moose was the only desert we tried and it was amazing. Also get the grilled veggies. Whatever butter they put is really tasty!! The server was great too. There's about three that bus the sushi bar and grab drinks and one of them takes your order that doesn't get made by the sushi chefs. Super quick service! If you do AYCE 10 times you get the 11th free! Oh and a Sunday night the wait was about 45 minutes for two people. The place is small and super packed. Make sure to say you will sit in either a booth or table so if either opens up you'll get seated faster

Bc4S74ktlWMmEsXD145LVQ.text: Love the place :)). Green tea creme brulee was awesome..

bNnDaKx3dvXC8ku_MSufhg.text: This place is AWESOME! I was so impressed with the freshness and variety they offer for their AYCE menu. I would definitely go to this place over Sushi Mon for their AYCE. They have variety of gourmet desserts and special rolls. Best place in Las Vegas for AYCE sushi.  It's a tiny place but the staff was very friendly and our food came very quick as we ordered more as we ate. Great Place!

M1EJxww7SAJGzPxz-ZYPTg.text: Sushi house goyemon has been our go to sushi place since it opened.  It's always busy so plan on waiting a while.  Although things have changed a bit since it first opened (no more collar!) it is still a great choice for AYCE sushi.  My one complaint with them is that they are so busy, they can sometimes be rude with service as you are finishing up.  The host once asked us to hurry up with dessert as they were waiting to seat a large party.  No problem, I understand, but we had only been there an hour and we weren't lingering at all.  I know the rules, eat and leave, but this was over the top.   The sushi is always fresh, delicious, and at a great price for what you get so I'll keep coming back.  Our favorite is the salmon belly..practically melts in your mouth.  The big eye tuna was another one of our favorites but I haven't seen it on the menu in a while.  Overall a great place for AYCE sushi with good food at great prices.

WZ1ZciQyQgFRURgOUmZajA.text: I really wanted to like this place because it was highly recommended by a friend. I will never come back to this place because of the customer service. I arrived with 3 friends, and my 2 kids (teenager & toddler). Checked in at 6:00pm and there was only one couple ahead of us, and was told there was a 45 min wait. We decided we would wait. My girlfriend's and I have our monthly get together and decided on this place. By 7:00pm we saw more than 10 groups of people in parties of 2-4 being seated ahead of us. We figured because we had 5 people we had to wait longer. However, we noticed that tables that could have been put together for us was not being used, and eventually people with 4 or less people were being seated. We were very hungry and decided to stay because we waited this long already. By 7:10pm I asked how much longer, and the hostess informed me that they were waiting for the family of 5 to leave, and they were trying to get them out. So....they have only 1 table reserved for parties of 5 or more? Really!!!? Clearly, the family of 5 who had been dining upon our arrival was not leaving. So we continued to wait in the tiny waiting area between the front door and the hostess station. BY 7:20pm the hostess came up to us and said she had to work her magic, and began to open a door  leading to a more private dining area meant for large groups!! This whole time that we were waiting to be seated no one in the restaurant (staff or management) thought of opening this magic door?!! They made us wait over an hour to make the executive decision? I get it if there is a long wait, and people are seated in order of arrival or if staff has to wait for 2 tables to become available (which clearly was available while we waited), but to make us wait that long to decide to seat us, and we felt like our order of arrival was not a factor.  So we were just happy to finally be able to sit and eat (especially the 2 kiddos who waited patiently). Now the customer service...the ladies that took our order seemed rushed to get us out of there. They appeared to be bothered every time they came to take our order and deliver food. Maybe they were all having a bad day or whatever, but the rudeness was from everyone was really unnecessary. No attention at all to waters or tea needing to be filled.  Can you please ask me if I am done before you take my half eaten bowl of sashimi salad away? I am sorry to say that I probably won't return. We should have just stuck to our regular AYCE sushi place on Flamingo & Durango. At least we gave it a shot and I can say it wasn't worth the wait, the attitude, and the food. If you decide to give this place a try I hope you don't have the experience that we did.

R-KL0rWaThUOvVT-LjBl5g.text: A japanese all you can eat place.  The hostess was a bitch, so this place gets a 1 star.  The food itself is actually pretty good, but that doesn't override the bad service.

NNj9uAI_3Csay9rFoD0MYg.text: Definitely one of my top 3 AYCE sushi spots! Every time I go there's a wait, but it's worth it. Service can be slow if they're busy. I recommend the Super White Tuna & the Spicy Tuna Rice Cracker.

bdF7FH-9_QCrvvWOPydzpg.text: I have been here so many times, and well all I can say is that the food is awesome, the waitstaff is great, and the sushi chefs are professionals Every time the food comes out, it is always so flavorful and fresh.  The time of waiting for food is ok, and the sushi chefs are always fast and nice.  My favorites are the sexy gril, ecstasy, and the pork belly.   This place is always busy so get here early if you dont to wait too long.  The only reason why I didnt give it a 5 star, is that the last time I came in the hostess was so cold and rude to my family and I.  She was not friendly, when we asked a question it seemed like she would not want to talk to us, and her body language was down right rude.  I understand it was a busy night, but she should be able to still be friendly.  It made many of my family members uncomfortable.  Everything else in the restaurant was awesome, but you know have that hostess just to lighten up.

_HFtHNrt23um3rKoKRgIuA.text: Recommended by a Vegas Local, for a AYCE sushi place, it's the best I've had. Though a bit more expensive than I'm use to for a buffet (~$26 a person), the sushi was tasted fresh.   They do limit you (not sure if the limit is 1 or 2, don't remember) on Uni Nigiri sushi and Sweet Shrimp.  They did not charge me extra for requesting a Quail egg on top of Masago and Tobiko Sushi.

Qc4hyQwxJ2RiFt60XwsP3A.text: By far my favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant!!!  Hands down Goyemon beats all of the other AYCE I've ever eaten! Way better in selections, quality, and preparation!!  Love all their different fresh sushi nigiri that they offer. From fresh scallops to white tuna to even uni and sweet shrimp!  I also love that they do half orders on the rolls. You can order way more and try all the different sushi that they offer!!   Every Vegas trip, we ALWAYS stop by Goyemon to eat some sushi! So so good for the price and AYCE!

FMHoOa5fpZd-M-G-J34dsQ.text: Nigiri is delicious, but rolls aren't anything special. What gripes me about this place is that service is always so incredibly slow. Each time Ive been here- whether theres only a few people or a full house and long wait- my server is always missing or I don't even have a server at all. Do yourself a favor and sit at the bar. Last time I came here we saw our server once and never again. The hosts had to take our orders. Go to Yama if you want delicious rolls

DhsKmrN9OSrCRZXgc9ifkA.text: This review is purely for service not food related. A group of 6 of us came today to be turned away without a care or concern. They were "understaffed" yet we saw several servers standing around talking. When we offered to spilt the party we were told no again and if our table was even sat we wouldn't be served. I am appalled at this lack of service and unfortunate events. I hope in the the future if the wait is based on not having enough servers that you wouldn't turn away large tables or at least tell the servers to hide in the back when you lie to paying customers faces.

CkTV9qObnV8I8ixCoSUMEA.text: OMG OMG OMG OMG This place knows how to make GREAT sushi! We had the typical Dragon, Spider, Tiger, Ecstasy,  and Poki. We are saving room for Mochi Strawberry ice cream. Happy girls!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PcZNLLWzUKshNUyyx9IBnQ.text: The food was good! The nigiri sushi could've been a little bigger! The white fish was really good!

liwQLeFoalCw9s_uNBlVgw.text: One of the best AYCE Sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.  Reservations highly recommended if you have a party of 10 or more (that is the minimum for reservations). 15 to 20 for the Tatami Room. Check out their daily specials board.  Plum Wine Jelly is awesome, Lychee Sorbet makes a good palette cleanser between orders of sushi.  One the main reason that this is a great AYCE sushi dinner spot in Las Vegas, is that everything on the menu is AYCE (except sashimi).  That includes the daily specials board, the hot apps and dessert selections on the placemats.  All they ask is you finish what you order and not waste food.  Sounds fair to me!  I am not going to review every single item I have tried over the last dozen visits.  But as great as this place is to dine at, the experience can totally be improved if you got with a few friends.  At least this way you can try more things on the menu before you have to throw up the white flag, wiggle your tummy and find a little more room for the desserts.  Even if you are not into raw fish as some of your buddies are, there are plenty of cooked items available for you to order. You can dine here with your foodie buddies without having to feel left out.  The staff here is great!  Even when they are slammed (pretty much anytime after 7pm) they still managed to deliver on good or better service.  Just show up early or have some patience, as the average wait here for dinner is at least an hour.  Food: 4.5/5 The food and the selection is very good.  Flavor: 4.5/5 Overall very very good, although some nigiri are drenched in too much ponzu sauce.  Service: 5/5 I have never had a bad experience here.  Decor:  4.5 Pretty trendy and there are decorative samurai swords in the loo.  Parking: 4.5/5 The parking lot is not super big, but you can usually find a parking spot when you drop in for dinner.  Price:  4/5  Comparable to other local AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  Value:  5/5  Only sashimi is not available as part of AYCE.  Their available selection is crazily extensive.  4.5 stars easily!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Collar/Hamachi Kama. (5-17-2012)
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bowl! Not part of AYCE. (5-17-2012)

ab-rfY4f4TtT1ui4qc00xw.text: Hands down, seriously the BEST AYCE sushi spot in all of Vegas!  Yes, the line can be long and painful, but trust me, it's worth it!  Sashimi, nigiri, robata, and sushi rolls all made to order w/ a great selection of apps and salad to choose from as well.  Food is tasty and the fishes are always the color it should be, they do not serve you stuff that has been sitting out for days.  There is a limit on certain more expensive nigiri items (uni, fresh scallop, amaebi) each person is allowed, but with the great selections Goyemon offers, you will hardly notice the limitation.  Even if you're not a sushi lover, there's still plenty of cooked food options you can choose from so definitely do not be discouraged by this place.  Miso black cod and pork belly are 2 dishes worth trying, along with all their yummy grilled vegetables.  Come after 11pm and you can even indulge in their AYCE ramen from their sister restaurant, Monta.    Be sure to save room for dessert though as they have a great selection to choose from!  They usually rotate their offerings by season, but their green tea creme brulee, green tea cake, and mochi ice cream are almost always available year round.      Service can be hit or miss, but put your name down and have them call you when your table is ready.  If you are renting a car, it's best that you drive here, write down your name, and venture to the other strip malls near by.  If not, taking a cab from the strip is still worth it.  Just be sure you don't come here when you are already starving and hangry, come w/ a light stomach and be prepared to wait at least 30 mins.  Happy eating!

LzentG1r-zlyoNblRZQ3vQ.text: One of the best "all you can eat sushi" in town,big verity,always fresh.Place is small and most of the time you have to wait for the table.

6OP_L4PfYapTWQAHtaQApQ.text: What a way to begin a weekend in Las Vegas. I've been craving great sushi (and lots of it) so man, did Goyemon hit the spot even better than I was expecting after such rave reviews from local friends.  We arrived shortly after opening last Friday (between 11:45am and noon) and were able to get a table for our group of 5. It filled up quickly after that while we were eating. Our drink orders were quickly taken and we started sizing up the AYCE menu.  Here's where I kinda take issue: Usually at AYCE sushi, the table is given a paper where we mark off the items we want with tallymarks for different rounds as we decide what we want, and then we order a second round once we've received our items from the first. Here, the waitstaff takes orders like a traditional sushi restaurant. I don't like this for 3 reasons: I ordered plain edamame and miso soup, which I like to start the meal with (both). I got these items at the very end of my meal, when I kind of didn't even want them anymore. I even had to ask our waitress where the edamame was and she just said it was on the way. We were already on the second bottle of sake.  My second problem with the waitstaff ordering method rather than the paper with the tallymarks is that there were things people wanted to share, and it was really hard to keep track of how many of each thing were wanted - the waitress implied she had a system but looking over her shoulder at her notepad, I didn't see anything that made sense. We happily ate everything, but I would be mildly annoyed if we were missing orders of nigiri or given too many of something, especially something that we only wanted a small taste of (like say, uni).  My third problem with this style of ordering is making sure we received everything and confirming what things are since I like to be adventurous. We had ordered some squid and the folks who wanted it tried what they were thinking was squid. Then something that was much more obviously the squid came out. What had they eaten earlier? The world may never know. But with a form left at the table, we could have figured that out somehow.  Ok! Back to positives. The quality of the food was fantastic. I got a shrimp head in my miso that added to the flavor and gave it such umami, I was in heaven. The fish was so fresh and there was a really nice fish to rice ratio on the nigiri (mostly what we ordered). I hate when places go crazy with the rice for AYCE so you fill up. This place made the pieces like usual so you could really enjoy the fish.  Here's the nigiri we ordered (and my comments if I ate it): tuna (maguro): delicious and fresh garlic tuna: tasty but the garlic sauce didn't really add too much, so I'd skip it for plain super white tuna: OH MY GOD GET THIS IT'S PHENOMENAL yellowtail (hamachi): another great fresh fish here, refreshing and tasty salmon (sake): my favorite, an old standby and Goyemon did not disappoint seared salmon: a new favorite, the searing adds a beautiful dimension and meatiness snow crab meat: meh, it was good but I keep trying crab and keep not loving it as much as other seafoods so I should stop trying fresh water eel: GET IN MY MOUTH so meaty and the sauce is so sweet and perfect  A couple rolls were ordered by the table - I tried a bit of the Ecstasy roll and it was good but I wasn't expecting the "orgasm sauce" to have a kick to it, and I'm not a fan of spicy sauce.  We also got the yellowtail collar that's not included in the AYCE and is hot and eaten with a garlicky sauce and OMG. Without the sauce it's really bland and dry but the sauce brings out a flavor profile that's orgasmic. It's umami and savory and melt in your mouth, the seafood dreams are made of. I just wanted more of it than the small flakes we could pull out with our chopsticks.  The service, besides the weird ordering and waiting forever for a couple of things, was attentive and polite, my diet coke was regularly refreshed and it was never hard to flag someone down with a question. Overall, I loved this place despite the weird timing. I will 10000% be back the next time I'm in Vegas and like every time after, I'll just make sure I request that I get my miso and edamame before any of the fish I order.

l9TCGKtLMohcSsqdDBe5Xg.text: Still my favorite sushi place in the area! The price is a bit higher than other sushi places but this place always has great quality fish. We sat at the bar and the service from the chefs and servers were very attentive even though it was a packed night.   If you want to know that you're getting good quality fish, this is the place to go! They don't just cover their fish in a ton of sauce, you can actually taste it.

Nlc5sneoZi88QmGULtZIUg.text: Felt slightly dissatisfied after my other all you can eat sushi dinner at Hikari, I finally returned to Goyemon. It was overall a much better experience and actually restored some faith I have in Vegas AYCE/buffet meals.  The atomsphere was very inviting and the service was friendly. It was only slightly after 6 but the restaurant was already at capacity. Our server was busy but service was still attentive. We had no trouble placing orders after orders and food came out really quickly.   The sushi was good. Not the top tier out there but above average. Nigiri are authentic and perfectly sized to fit in one bite. Some of the presentation appeared rushed but still excusable. For AYCE standard I think I could consider that stellar quality. The fish quality is decent and the selection is good. Don't forget to ask your server about their daily specials. They had Japanese snapper and white clam that night and those were nice. Amaebi, hamachi, albacore and super white tuna were all quite memorable. The ikura, uni and hotate, however, were just average. The uni, even though it is limited 1 order per person, was not nearly as good as those I had at Hikari. Nothing really stood out among the appetizers and fusion rolls. The pork belly was just alright. Not good enough for a second order. Offering homemade desserts was definitely a huge plus. Love their chocolate mousse cake.  If you like AYCE and you love sushi, bookmark Goyemon for your next Vegas trip.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i-FCK2J05U-nrql2U_-nGg.text: After the Las Vegas Santa Run on 12/03/11, some friends and I were looking to celebrate our victory/accomplishment.  My friends left the decision making up to me on where to eat and I think after this experience, they wont anymore.   The customer service is mainly the reason to why I rated Sushi House of Goyemon low. You can also see from some fellow yelpers about their similar experience. For us, we were hardly waited on. They seemed very annoyed to our requests and questions about what they have on the menu. It's also funny how the server told us straight off the bat we have 45 minutes to order with all you can eat. To top it off, they gave us our checks and it literally took more than 30 minutes to take our payment. No lie we could of easily walked out of the restaurant without paying and they would have not even noticed. I had to walk up to one of the workers near the cooking station to tell her if they would like our money. Sounds funny. But Smh.   As for the food, it was good. I was bummed that the miso soup wasn't even hot, especially with this crazy cold weather! However, I did like the crispy spicy tuna roll, hurricane roll, and the tempura ice cream. That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hurricane roll that cost $13.45
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy tempura ice cream
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy rice spicy tuna roll

lBkHqneShOcY52Mir31OHg.text: Fish portions here seem to be getting smaller and smaller every time I come but the good thing is that the fish is still fresh, servers are nice, they have a stamp card!!!!, really good desserts and you can order half rolls :)

v3KN_FH5JdFtCMtGTeclNA.text: For a late night sushi call I kinda like this place especially since they close at 3am. Pork belly is right on time for a fat kid! It was nicely charred and the flavor bursted right from the fat! The sauce that it came in was a little too good ... I caught my bf with his eyes rolled in the back of his head a few times. Needless to say he enjoyed the majority of this dish all by himself.  The BBQ Beef ribs were also really flavorful and saucy- goes perfect with  the white rice... Has a Teriyaki BBQ flavor.  The Fried California roll was pretty good. Perfectly done. Not mushy at all on the inside.  The Japanese Lasagna roll had a nice little baked crunch under the cream cheese topping. Down to the last bite. Impressive!  The Shoyu Ramen was different.  Should've known this one was going to be a bust after we asked the waitress what different flavor ramen bowls they have and she said "we're not a ramen house so we only have 1 ramen bowl." Ok cool, well then what flavor is that one? She didn't know. Anyway, Wouldn't order it again but it was worth a try. Too many indescribable flavors.  Overall nothing was bad. It was average. The wait was 45 minutes though.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Japanese Lasagna
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly

viTwemA97iFXsB7gFWP7Nw.text: I contemplated greatly about writing this review, because all my reviews have been positive except for one. I went to Goyemon on Thursday August 30th at 1:30am. I was seated and place my order for all you can eat with the waitress. After 15 mins nothing was served except the beer, not even the miso soup. I asked another gentleman for my order and restated it assuming he was a waiter, he was everywhere helping everyone while the two women laughed and puttered around. After I finished my first helping I waited again for them to check on me no one came. At this point I went to the counter and asked can I place my order here, they seemed alarmed and asked the server why she didn't take my order. I sat down and one waitress walked past me looking at me harshly. She came by to take the order of the gentleman next to me and I called out to gain her attention, she ignored me and kept walking. The African American couple sitting the table over pointed at her skin and she said the lady had done the same to her. At this point I got up and went again to the table and told them how bad the service is for an AYCE sushi restaurant. I placed another round and it was served promptly at this point. The gentleman I assumed was a waiter came by to apologize. He stated he was not a server but a busser. I thanked him for his strong sense of urgency and tipped him, I also stated it's a shame that you are out working the servers and you care about the services. I love sushi restaurants, but this place needs to reevaluate how they treat customers especially people of color.

3AqCjmZ98cwN_5z3NuT0pw.text: On my Vegas trip, my friend recommended to try this place out. All you can eat sushi?!! who can turn that down?   Took a taxi here since it was off the Strip, about 5-10 mins.  Went on Mother's Day weekend and there was an hour long wait, not surprised.  The place is small and could be bigger but it is a really nice comfy intimate restaurant. Sushi was really good, I personally recommend J.J, Pete's, Tiger Eye and the green tea ice cream!  Lunch was around $22 bucks, not too bad for all you can eat. Will definitely come back during my next Vegas trip.

j9xys0exRpJS7_3GhxqFzw.text: This is my first Yelp review, although for this particular location I've been here countless times. But the reason for my review & five stars was the sushi chef my boyfriend and I had for the night named Gian. Once we were seated, he greeted us asking if we've dined with them before. After a few moments of looking at the menu, we knew what we wanted to order.   - Ecstasy roll - Lemon roll - Jala Jala roll (1/2) - 911 roll (1/2) - Salmon nigiri - Tuna nigiri - Yellowtail nigiri - Amaebi nigiri - Miso soup - Octopus poke - Baked mussels - Garlic edamame  During us ordering, Gian asked if we've ever tried the yellowtail w/ ponzu & jalapenos or garlic tuna nigiri, to which we responded no. But we agreed to try because he mentioned it was his personal favorites.   Both of his recommendations were great! It took the simplicity of the nigiri and kicked it up a notch. Between my boyfriend & I, I think I can speak for the both of us that if between those two recommendations if you pick just one to try... Go with the yellowtail w/ ponzu & jalapenos. It's a mix of flavors that blends so well & no matter how much of it you eat, it's not an overpowering flavor.   We've been to Goyemon a lot. There is almost always a long wait because of how busy they are and sometimes we don't get checked on as much because of the traffic, but sitting at the bar that night really made us appreciate our dinner & the chef for anticipating our needs. Sometimes it just takes that one person to change your outlook on something so you don't leave with a bitter taste in your mouth.

7BLUfjuJH5XtHAFdr5-3EA.text: Goyemon has been my favorite spot for the past two years and never have I had a bad experience here. I recommend the cajun albacore, salmon, and saba nigiri. And if you get lucky, Monica might be your server. She was very helpful when one of our members couldn't figure out chop sticks and we were terrible teachers. You might have a wait but that's what you can expect from a popular sushi spot.

KOubAzG9APjvRtxoq7UVzw.text: I don't need to add much but that this place is very much worth the AYCE price. The Uni and Halibut alone was worth the price of admission along w/ the Green Tea Brulee dessert which is included. I tried Abalone for the first time here and really hated it and I'm not sure if Abalone is always that chewy and rubbery with that odd flavor but that's the last time I'll have that. It was like eating a tire.   Otherwise, awesome gluttonous experience. I think the key is to make sure to order from the specials on the board as with most sushi bars since it's usually a choice and seasonal offering. It's not "blow your mind" sushi, but it satisfies the craving and there's an abundance to choose from. Definitely on our radar to go to when in Vegas for another foodie adventure.

-M0sOo4tfojJrB5skqh8cw.text: Melted desserts. It's like this place doesn't care at all. All the servers doesn't seem like they even know what table they're helping and no one even check up on us. We just have to constantly wave at them awkwardly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sdVvvbZJk9uHuvHXJcV6nw.text: People know Las Vegas by many names, but to me it has just one: America's AYCE playground. Sadly, like a rusted out merry go round covered in bird droppings, Sushi House Goyemon is a ride worth skipping.  My first experience here, despite the 30 minute wait for a table, was pleasant enough to earn a return trip... And that's where the fairy tale ends.   This time the wait was 1 hour and the service was extremely slow.  Like walking-on-your-hands-through-a-tarpit slow. Not sure if it was due to the fact they only hand two servers waiting on the entire place, and also playing hostess... Or the fact the sushi chefs seemed to lumber behind the bar with the urgency of a toddler on his way to the dentist.   Either way, it took 30 minutes for our first order to reach the table... And 35 more minutes for the second. Keep in mind each order was just 8 pieces of nigiri.  Looking around the restaurant was flat out depressing, every table experiencing the same level of disappointment, and starvation. We waited for our last order, a salmon skin hand roll for 40 minutes before giving up and vacating our table to make room for their next victim. First time I've ever left an AYCE sushi joint still hungry.  One star for the unapologetically bad service, and potentially tarnishing Las Vegas's AYCE superiority.

H6fldLR80Y9aYMQJlLUAug.text: We have been extremely loyal customers to Goyemon for many years dining here at least 2x per month and have always praised this place as the best sushi house in Las vegas. Lately, not so much anymore. We have noticed since Gio no longer works here that there may have been some kind of employee shake up. The morale now seems depressed and it really shows on some of the front of house employees. Tonight I was totally disgusted with the hostess and the Japanese female server with glasses. We were not greeted by a friendly hostess, and the server was not friendly either. She took our initial order and never came back until I had to ask if we could order more food. This is an AYCE sushi house! Or isn't it? When she took our second round of orders it was like we were disgusting her and it wasn't much. She did not even refill our water cups or drinks. Soon after we finished our first round of food, the hostess asked if we were all done? Really? We were sitting there looking around and never saw this place with so many open tables. Maybe people caught on faster than we did. Service has gone severely downhill. Warning to the owner, there's a lot of competition out there. We sure miss Gio. We walked in, he knew our beverages and always came to say hello. He made everyone feel welcome and the place had a happy aura. Not anymore. We got into our car, drove off and we all sadly said, I don't care to come back anymore. Sad. I hope you can repair the great reputation you once had.   Sincerely, A new loyal customer to Soho Japanese restaurant on Jones/Warm Springs.

X_Cv-UcVuV8C0O_qmv1CiQ.text: Been long time customers and loved it before. We decided  to go here again to bring a friend who's never tried sushi before.. when getting there we had to wait 45 min. outside to get our table, finally after getting seated waiter asked us for our drinks very rudely.. through out our whole dinner the waiters were giving us bad vibes and after a few orders told us we passed our limit and isn't going to serve us anymore... not only that made us wait 20 min. for our check... I think they should have kept serving us since it's all you can eat and we were waiting anyways but whatevs.. Really good food but service is terrible.

sM80moS-zcGZWWbX4bKKWQ.text: At the time I got my 3rd seaweed salad,  I was going to give this place 5 stars. However, my eyes can always handle more than my stomach. I took off a star because they don't allow you to waste good, meaning that you HAVE TO EAT EVERYTHING you order. So for those that are greedy, please heed my warnings and DO NOT OVER ORDER. Otherwise I feel like the all you can eat option is much better than ordering individual rolls, unless you're watching your figure. If you're craving sushi in Vegas, come here to get your fill.

IkUVckjD_oZQxQCqTanuwQ.text: I came here because I was in the area. I read the reviews and yes the service not the best but I can put up with a little wait for good food. The sushi is delicious. I was lost about their all you can eat menu but I followed the recommendations on yelp and I was not disappointed. I had the Nigiri Sushi Cajon Albacore and Snow Crab... I could have eaten a mountain of the snow crab. Next time I'm in town I will definitely eat here but I'll just make sure that I have time and patience with the service.

1u94u63_mFDaKJC6NDVL6w.text: So despite my previous review for this place, where I didn't think I'd come again unless I'm in the neighborhood, I retract my statements!! This place is decent and I didn't even do AYCE in the midst of all the surrounding tables where they were just stuffing themselves with rolls!!!  Came here with a party of 4 on a Thurs night and it was PACKED. We waited nearly 1hr+ but the waitress management was very cordial and accommodating. It's too bad the place is so small... but I've heard this place is the 4th restaurant within a larger sushi establishment in LV!   WE ORDERED: 8 orders of Uni, the Beef Tataki (SO GOOD, but beware, the mango salsa looks deceiving but there's bits of wasabi mixed in it!! ahhhh! burned my nose) 2 Yellowtail Collars, Yellowtail Jalapeno and two orders of Salmon Sashimi as well as 4 orders of Amaebi (Sweet shrimp)   but my highlight was the lychee sorbet. so light and refreshing, and after such a heavy meal with the uni and amaebi, the lychee sorbet (with bits of lychee in it!!) was a great way to end the meal.

jzlrmODUMsUwvHOkVIVy2g.text: We had the all you can eat sushi. The sushi was fresh, and reasonably priced. They were very quick to fill our plates. The service was friendly. I'm sure some will get butthurt about my next comment but to me it is a testament to the quality of food. There were a lot of Japanese in the restaurant. Like cops in a donut shop or Hispanics in a taqueria, that's how you know the food is good.

XDDSoy-XTV10c50wHY9F9g.text: Maybe I caught them on a bad day last time or perhaps takeout isn't the best strategy for this place, but I got the all-you-can-eat late nite sushi feastival and loved it.  The inside is clean and modern, service was stellar, the rolls came out quick, and everything was spot on tasty.  Even the hot stuff was legit hot.  I had a completely different experience than my takeout and I will be back to belly up to the bar again.

gimns9tJVPFSySjgy7UUrw.text: Very yummy i got the taylor 10 piece for $9.95. Would def order this again. Next time tho i think ill get another deep fried shushi

Fm8N53NKXfkKtGUwFuW3Ew.text: Best AYCE sushi ever!  The fish is very fresh, hot items are just as good as the sushi, they have seaweed salad, and the best part is.... DESSERTS INCLUDED!!     I ordered 8 desserts.  But I shared. :) My personal fave was the lychee sorbet (has delicious chunks of lychee) but the tempura ice cream was also very good.  I will be coming here and spending my money on this buffet rather than the ones on the strip every time I come to Vegas in the future.  Stamp cards available and you get a free meal after 10 stamps!

MmxoMBfjSwP2ROw8n6pmGw.text: tasty nigiri - you'd want to stick to the nigiri and anything written on the board  must add quail egg on something  order anything from the grill
