sjFzCWlDPwaHKPCu3j9DEQ.text: I WOULD NOT EVER RECOMMEND ANYONE TO EAT HERE!! I'm sorry to say but my fellow Yelpster's were wrong, this place was a joke.  The fact that our waitress only came to our table once to get our drink order and never came back. Had to wave down another waitress to get our food ordered. Once we got our appetizers it was bland n cold, their Nigiri's dry, the rolls were off tasting as if they over cooked the eel sauce & the baked rolls just awful had to return them because it was burnt.  Who serves anything burnt?? Didn't have an appetite for anything they had after that. It was honestly a waste of time & money. Had to eat somewhere else.

c8qpe2kZFW_h0WTzZVFv3w.text: My initial experience was amazing ! The food was fresh and on point (and endless). The last time I went- maybe the waiter was a new guy (caucasian, unsure of the name) - and he basically was like "you can only order 2 pieces at a time." He ruined my and my party's night - b/c we kept waiting for him to come to our table like once in a blue moon. Thank god his co-waitress checked up on us and was more attentive. I'm still hesitant to go back.  Also be warned of a 1-2 hour wait on Friday-Saturday nights

2BNfaRWZluuoDUf24XFr6A.text: I can't believe I have yet to review Goyemon. Since moving to Vegas 7 months ago, my husband and I have filled up not one, not two but THREE punch cards here. We brought my parents and one of our friends here when they visited from IL, on two separate occasions, and were met with rave reviews each time. Goyemon really has the BEST AYCE sushi anywhere, ever!  Sure, we have experienced one or two service hiccups in the past. Yes, they refuse to put wasabi on the nigiri. Yeah, if you come at the wrong time, you will have to wait, FOREVER. But though I tend to be a harsh critic, I can't give them anything less than 5 stars because the food is always SO delicious and I promise you it is worth the wait. Their selection is also huuuge and they always have a variety of specials (we always get really excited when we see salmon belly on the menu), and I have never had fish here that was anything less than fresh and delicious!  If your sushi tooth can only be satisfied by mound after mound of tasty, tasty fish, Goyemon is the place to be. This is one instance where the quality of the fish does not suffer in an AYCE setting. And if you're not a fish fan, you won't go hungry, either! There are tons of side/appetizer items to choose from, including some unbelievably tasty pork belly, and if you come after 11pm, you can have a bowl of hot, delicious ramen. YAY Goyemon. I look forward to filling up my fourth punch card... maybe this weekend...

Suk5wm7aL6YXpuaotGk3QA.text: The Husband and I have been anxious awaiting our turn to check out this newly popular AYCE sushi joint in the southwest part of town and we finally got a chance last week!  (After all, this location once housed Sushi Hana and SHIN Yakitori.)  Open only for dinner from 5:00 pm to 3:00 am, we made it our mission to be waiting when the doors open.  We weren't the only ones on a Sunday night to think of this, but were definitely glad we did.  Beyond the standard sushi rolls and sushi, what makes Sushi House Goyemon a star higher than others?  These were noteworthy in my book:  * Specials board: Oh my goodness!  This is what got me!  They had off the standard menu fish like bonito, kampachi, sardines, and yuzu tobiko that were included in AYCE.  That was definitely a highlight in my book!  Loving the yuzu tobiko!  * Pork Belly - Yes, everyone talks about it and it's good stuff.  We love pork belly - we have marinated cooked pork belly sitting in our freezer ready to throw into the rice cooker at a moment's notice.  We love pork belly.  Sure, the portion is a meager two pieces at a time, but it's AYCE, so order up more!  * Shoyu Ramen is included in AYCE after 11 pm.  Sure, we missed this, but it got the Husband all excited with the possibility of it.  (Why someone would want to fill their belly with ramen and soup during an AYCE sushi fest is beyond me.)  * Dessert included, as in ALL the desserts are included!  I've been to other AYCE sushi joints that may or may not included AYCE ice cream, but they not only have a few ice cream flavors, but four different desserts to choose from.  Uh, score a point there!  We tried them all - Green Tea Cake, Chocolate Mousse, Plum Wine Jelly, and Green Tea Creme Brulee.  * Hot or Iced Green Tea is included.  So, what's with all the mixed reviews?  The major problem here is service.  I read over the recent reviews and took note of the declining service and definitely can attest to what the other yelpers are complaining about.  We were lucky that Chizuru was our primary waitress because she is stellar.  And the rest of the staff, that's the problem.  From the moment we walked in and said party of four and one highchair, the hostess/waitress totally forgot to bring a highchair.  Other staff people were just not attentive, as I was often seen waving my arms around to get their attention.  Waiters who refill your beverages should really put your glass back in front of you, not at the other end of the table and watch you struggle to reach across to get it.  There are just some people who are just really good at restaurant service and others that could use some improvement  Nonetheless, we've been gone so long from the AYCE world that we are happy to go back.  Yeah, we'll be back this week!  4.5 stars.  They offer a frequent eater card, which is always nice.  Looks like they are related to Sushi Mon and Monta Ramen as well.  Good to know!  They also take reservations for their party room from 10-20 people.  Last seating for AYCE is 2:00 am!

BkiAjd_A364SJgNIzX4OgQ.text: This place is THE BOMB!! An amazing value, good food, and INCREDIBLE service! Very entertaining, too!  THE ORDER: Pretty much everything, since we did AYCE. Honestly, I've had much better sushi, but trust me, it was good :) I have never been to a made-to-order AYCE sushi spot, but they hit the nail on the head with this genius way to do AYCE.   THE SERVICE: Great! Our sushi chefs were engaging, hilarious, and fast! THe other servers were very attentive with the menu items not front he sushi bar and water refills :)  OVERALL: This place effing ROCKS! ..... and they are open until 3am!! SCHWING!  I DEF RECOMMEND TO ALL YELPERS!!! I WILL BE BACK!!  xo- andrea

_d1ZeTbzkvQDFCVgBjJgzQ.text: The sushi was o.k.....probably.bevaise it was a sunday and fresh sushi doesnt get shipped sundays....great service thpugh and wasnt bad for how late i arrived...i think ill try this place again during regular business hpirs and not on a sunday.

zx57QJWkm_2Iuui-yeGQow.text: I'm gonna come out right off the bat and say I was pretty disappointed. I had heard this place hyped up by some friends and was really looking forward to trying it out. Even checked out some of the other people's pics and I had to say the pics looked pretty impressive. Well then I got here. With the friend who hyped it up I might add, and I gotta say what a let down.  No wagyu/Kobe beef sushi. No salmon belly. The sushi to rice ratio was pretty sorry as well. I was expecting a hell of a lot more. In actuality, I'm giving the stars primarily for the AYCE mochi ice cream and the pork belly. Those were pretty damn good. But the sushi was average at best. Now I'm not sure if I got there on a bad day, what the deal was but it was a letdown. I'll give it a shot on another day maybe but the sushi I was served looked nothing like the pictures that I seen people post on here.

pD9292Z9oM0_znqR2--wDw.text: I would definitely wont come back here. The service was the slowest service I had in any ayce sushi restaurant. The portions were very small, half the size of other sushi place. Nothing special with the options. Worst sushi place.

MYzQOlbCUASw-g-J-Abb_w.text: This place is great. The rice to fish ratio is insane! If you are a sushi lover like me you know what I mean. The shoyu ramen is really good and its also included in the all you can eat. The grilled pork belly is also a nice addition to the AYCE. This place is the same owners as sushi mon on maryland pkwy, so you can use the same stamp card at either location. I must say that Goyemon is so much better. I have gotten to know alot of the workers there because some of them are from sushi mon.  I think that the service is top notch and the sushi is even better!!!! Give then a try and you wont be sorry. Just and FYI the shoyu ramen is not available until after 11pm on the AYCE... It does get crowded so try to get there early but this place is really worth the wait... enjoy

ODz2mkeJ-DbsAJZDPylzOA.text: Absolutely my favourite sushi spot!For those of you sushi lovers,make sure you get the AYCE. It is about $27 per person for dinner and around $22 for lunch. When we go,we always try to sit at the bar as the chefs are very nice and it is quite entertaining to watch them cook. The only negative is that most of the nights the wait time is at around 45mins or more.But overall great food,always fresh fish and nice atmosphere!

cjOrn5CO05Oad4UOK7M7EQ.text: Took my wife there for her birthday.  The food was good, but not as good as Yama Sushi.  It is all you can eat, but you order and they make it, which is better than making visits to the buffet line.  I read the desserts were the best part.  I only saw ice cream on the menu.  We tried green tea ice cream and lechee sorbet.  All you can eat was around $22 per person.

kWU_IbSRJkbws072A0inKg.text: I LOVE LOVE that they opened up a all you can eat sushi near my house. And a very very good quality one too! This is hands down my favorite AYCE sushi. They have a crispy rice roll which is to dieeeee for! Its a royal california topped with spicy tuna drizzled with eel sauce, spicy yum yum sauce. Thaaat is an orgasm in my mouth!

ahM9ouSGDp4ng8ickrsMZg.text: I have visited Goyemon three times and have never been disappointed. It has always been fresh, fast and well worth the AYCE price. Each time, I try one of the daily specials and those too have been pretty much amazing. The staff is friendly and efficient, they take and deliver orders quickly without appearing rude. I did not think much of the half rolls at first, but after a few trips, being able to sample more kinds of delicious sushi without getting full on just a couple rolls is fantastic. This is my favorite place for sushi in the valley.

nYl8qpLXAgNsBPcXajWd4g.text: REALLY REALLY GOOD PERIOD.  Got here without a reservation before 7 on a weekday and got seated right away.  Decided to drive off the strip to try out some AYCE Vegas Sushi.  They did not disappoint! Sashimi bowl was good, along with most of their other rolls.  Picture menu with most of their rolls is provided! Service was exceptional, they always came out and asked if we needed more ordered after we received all our food.  Dessert service was a bit slow, but all in all I will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Y9hObSSh4yaE7hT2KdretQ.text: One of the best All You Can Eat Sushi Places in Las Vegas.  If you love to eat sushi, Goyemon is the place to go.

E7YAhmof3eZsEEJOIU2pEg.text: Sushi was pretty good.  Loved the fact their sushi bar was high seating.  Only downfall was that it was REALLY cold in the restaurant.  I do understand that it is a trick for establishments to turn on the AC to full blast to kick people out.

PtW5b_pyBmTj1IgU1Aovgg.text: Front desk service is super unorganized. Once you get past that you'll love it. Food was excellent and our server was great. All you can eat is definitely the way to go!!

r8_ZAUAD7bppQRaJFRVnqQ.text: Yelp was right! Saw the good reviews for this place back in February, came to Vegas in may, and the reviews did not disappoint.

0Rd_kLHJn9L4iqgeVp86BA.text: Food was good first time. Second visit I was by myself. Was seated and watched a dozen waitrons pass me by for ten minutes, then I left. Called to tell them why and the lady said she'd comp me if I came back, but my mood was spoiled. Life's too short to give business to a rude place.

d0LtWwLkVQhS7a02-n5vWA.text: Sushi was very fresh and creative menu. Everything was delicious. Only disappointment they did not have the green tea cake I was looking forward to trying. Definitely recommend this place to my friends!

hnt6TA073yKZwMG167hSkg.text: I signed up on yelp just to write a review on this. I used to live in Las Vegas and been to Goyemon a few times, food is pretty good and price range is decent which made me come back to this place. However, I was back in town for a few days, and decided to go and have some sushi. I knew that I had to wait for a bit since I always had to wait whenever I come to goyemon. Waiting wasn't a big deal, but this FAT UGLY HOSTESS NAMED LESILIE out of nowhere had some attitude issues acting like she owns the restaurant or something. I mean, damn almost walked out of the restaurant because of her attitude. Waiting an hour was bad enough but a hostess who doesn't even know how to seat people in right order is messed up. Tried to say something but manager was not there at that time, I complained about her anyways. And they better train her or do something. Overall food was ok like always.

fFuGhUG5pSvSzadv-LVaLw.text: I've been to my fair share of all you can eat sushi bars, and in general they're run by koreans. This place is not run by koreans, but by japanese people. The quality here is outstanding, and maybe the best quality in a all you can eat sushi bar that I have ever eaten. It's not perfect, I ordered 3 orders of halibut but the owner/chef only gave me one order. Maybe he didn't hear me, or was being sneaky, but it doesn't matter, the food was good. And coming here was a last minute thing for me, you see, I was staying at a friend's place in vegas over the labor day weekend. However, he has a baby and set the airconditioner at 80 degrees when the temp outside was well over 100. I couldn't bare another night so I left his pad, and was driving home, but this place was on the way. I stopped by late night, which is fine, because this place closes at 3 am. The best all you can eat sushi in las vegas.

R8JsZv5GyJRwVrGWcqGwhQ.text: 1000th review! Good stuff :D I love their sushi, even thought the wait was long, it was worth it.

zYLtkuFzUbxD9y8G-0k4sw.text: Goyemon is great if you like AYCE sushi. I've been probably 20 times and the sushi is always fresh and very good compared to other AYCE places (I generally avoid AYCE sushi as the quality is generally poor). Rolls are good too. You can order anything off the menu and they often have seasonal specials.  If you go, definitely get the cod appetizer, spicy tuna on sticky rice, baked mussels, salmon kama (collar), moment roll, spider roll, your favorite nigiri, and their nice selection of desserts  I've been quite a few times and have only been disappointed by their miso soup (basic is terrible, the shrimp head miso is ok), and their terriyaki.  Goyemon is always busy but rarely has a long wait and is open late for night owls like me.

j1oYrTBIkINgG6WxeisANw.text: I'm pretty disappointed! This used to be one of my favorite spots. But last night we went there and the stench in the bathrooms really killed it for both my boyfriend and I ! It was absolutely disgusting! Something a manager really needs to address. The sushi was just ok. Sat at the bar, our guy seemed inexperienced. Rolls were all cut in different size pieces and fell apart easy. This place used to be so nice and way better quality.

kq5yJfg0pV76DGjLbzEmNw.text: I only gave it 3 stars because you only get to eat AYCE for 1 hour.  But it's good because it's a reasonable price.

AUUT0JRhkF_vvy0m7LMCkg.text: This is my favorite All You Can Eat sushi place! Their sushi is always fresh and their AYCE menu includes dessert as well!

hUQTqqKpjxq6ZIYR5nvGeg.text: This place is tiny and service is so slow. We were seated for at least 15 minutes and nobody came to take our orders. We had to ask the staff who was our server to get our orders placed.  Not surprisingly the food came out slow seeing only 3 chefs were working at the sushi bar and the restaurant was packed. It was such a chaos in there that I didn't enjoy the meal at all. What a horrible experience. These people simply don't know how to run a restaurant providing that kinda service.

lSvUkr3Gwji-fK65c_nA5g.text: Came here for all you can eat sushi for lunch.  There is a decent selection of fish and the ice creams were really good.  It is difficult to try a lot of dishes though since I had to eat all the rice with the raw fish.   If you get tired of eating typical Las Vegas buffet, this is a good place to try.

m9OoYWU8x35w4tHpphsS7A.text: I had pretty high expectations going in and is sad to say that it does not live up to the hype. I've heard that Goyemon used to be great but here are my honest review while trying to keep it unbiased.  Ambiance: Great and nicely decorated placeyet too small to even enjoy a conversation with my mom without overhearing he next table. (Hearing profanity during a meal is not appetizing) I recommend removing a table even if it means potential loss in profits.  Service: Kind servers but we did have to wait a fair bit for them to come around. Could be due to our party of two or maybe a server short.   Food: Absolutely disappointing. While appetizers seem to be decent we thought some of the dishes were just too salty. (That's coming from a Korean family who uses liberal amounts of salt in cooking) Good sushi preparation does not require a heavy salt use.   Tl;dr - Salty/dry dishes, small cramped ambiance, and average service. I think the best part of the experience was Jaime :) Probably won't ever return as it's the worst place I've been to out of 8 sushi bars I've been to in Vegas

gUVVQDo6lgSRS7XnChNzfw.text: Wow! This place was bomb.com for a AYCE sushi spot!! All I gotta say is UUUNI & AMAEBI!

4zihCO_xMltcSsZyxEhRYA.text: Came with a few co workers one night and it was about a 10min wait at 830pm.  The food was great I'll definitely vouch for the all you can eat items as we have all had most of everything on that menu. The service was kind of slow, waters were not filled unless we asked and the tea came to me luke warm... whoever Luke is... I don't like him.. I would have given more stars if the service was a little more on point.. it was busy so that's always a problem but I feel like our drinks were dry for too long so 3 stars for now.. I will try again later.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZLArl97K_ONIzbLfnDr4zw.text: Management/hosts are terrible. I had a  party of two and when we arrived there were open tables and we were asked to wait 5 minutes to be seated for the servers to catch up. No biggie so we waited. At the end of our meal we were chatting and the host asked us to go because they needed the table for a large unreserved party. We would have only been a few more minutes anyways so we stayed and finished our tea and then she asked again staying fire code violation. So unprofessional and terrible customer service. There are a lot of good sushi restaurants out there that I am happy to take my business to. Will never come back here.

WkAnkt2Chs51CQXxgPxvTQ.text: "Give it to us raw and wriggling. You keep nasty chips." And that's how I like my fish too!   Came here for there all I can eat sushi deal.  The location was clean, well kept, and the staff was pretty decent and fast.  Before I started to take out some of our ocean friends, I went to the loo to make extra room to maximise storage capacity.  There restroom was clean, and well kept.    We literally order everything from their all you can eat menu, and they were all of decent quality, and delicious.  The uni was delicious and fresh and golden, the fresh sweet shrimp was fresh as well!!  The eel was of high quality.  You could probably use it for other purposes if you like too.  The fishes were raw and fresh, finely marbled w/ fat just like a fine piece of steak, definitely of decent quality! This place is a must if you ever visit Vegas.  Overall we had an awesome experience and will definitely be back next time we are in VEGAS again.

gONm_BH_6uwggdi2KXl7OA.text: For all you can eat sushi, it was fine. Most of the rolls and basic nigiri (salmon, tuna, etc) were alright. I was not a fan of sweet shrimp, Spanish mackerel or the daily special jellyfish (which was quite weird and heavily, and sweetly, sauced). Service was pretty quick and friendly, and the price at about $30 per person is fine. All you can eat is not my first choice, but it is good for a group.

D9bWQBwoGUm9QjjrlrcTBg.text: The Sushi was pretty good quality, but the service was not the best. We got all you can eat and they brought the check before asking if we were finished. Waiter  kept on ignoring us we kept on having to flag someone down to help us.

xYzwI2F_8OcZmpf-eHTSVQ.text: If you are ever in Las Vegas, this is the place for sushi. I recommend you get a seat at the bar for the best service. They have a great variety of traditional and non traditional favorites. They have spicy rolls that will knock your socks off! They also offer other entree's other than sushi. But try some of your favorites. You will not be disappointed.

77a9BrqGMz5_DZt4tcFt5Q.text: Perfect place if you hungry and you don't wanna spend a lot of money. They have a huge variety of different nigiri and signature house rolls. Plus a lot of ala carte item included with ayce. My favorites are their maguro, unagi, ebi, karaage chicken and my all time favorite is their pork belly. Its game changing! Try this place you'll thank me later

9L7u_IPjVoMz7DAPh8bcYA.text: Wish I could give zero star. Been dining here for years since it's the only sushi place open after 2 am. For the past 7 years last seating is 150 and last call is 230 just like they're signs on the door say. We called at 1 am to make sure they were staying open cuz it's a slower week and we're in the industry so wanted to be respectful if they  were slow, we were assured they closed at 3 and as long as we ordered by 230 we were okay. Showed up at 1:15 to be sat with 5 people while there were 3 other tables were dining and we were turned away. First said they had to ask the chef for permission and then saying they no longer do all you can eat after 12. So disappointing. We went to Lee's all you can eat Korean bbq we will never be back and sushi mon is less than a minute from our house. So sad so disappointed

T2kXivRvp8nbvuQfxHxSUQ.text: Really bad service   Brought out all the wrong rolls  Forgot most of the orders   Terrible service

uZSsDFjUm9UgWPspU-eGKw.text: Most best sushi in Vegas. Atmosphere is low-key and inviting. The staff is friendly and accomodating--never bothersome. The food is abundant and unique. We've been here four times. It is a fun and special meal.

UsY5E_CknlG8-KVCE2lYBw.text: Sushi House Goyemon is by far my boyfriend and I favorite AYCE restaurant. My boyfriend and I love Nigiri and they have so many wonderful selections. Our personal top three items are Salmon Belly, Albacore and Cajun Salmon. Pay attention to the board in the restaurant as most of the recommendations are incredibly delicious. We would also recommend going for dinner as some of the most delicious items are served only during dinner.  Goyemon can be extremely packed at times. We have never been there and not had to wait but it is well worth the wait.  We love all the nigiri ! We love Goyemon!

xidVb3j-f-0OkHGfP1xUIQ.text: The wait to get into here was long for a table, but when we walked in, the sushi bar had plenty of seats open so we made a beeline straight for it!  If you're going to have more than 2 or 3 rolls, you MUST go for the All-you-can-eat deal for $26.95 for dinner (or $21.95 for lunch).    I'm not sure why there were so many complaints from fellow yelpers about service, but service at the sushi bar was top notch!  I'm guessing if you get the seats towards the right end of the sushi bar you will be right there in the traffic lanes where the servers pickup orders.  Also, as soon as you give the chef your order, it only takes a few minutes before you get handed some beautifully presented sushi delectables!    If sushi is not your thing, they have the dinner combos that are really, really reasonably priced for the amount of food that you get!  A chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura dinner special was just under $11!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy girl roll
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiger roll
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mNo2onJRzna57fN9fNYD3A.text: Sushi Goyemon is a great place to visit if you want to get your late night sushi fix on! While it seems they are best known for their all you can eat sushi, they have a lot more to offer as we learned during our visit.   We decided against the all you can eat for about $26 option since none of us were that hungry and because you only get an hour. I eat pretty slowly, so I doubted I'd be able to get my money's worth, particularly seeing as their rolls are reasonably priced and average at about $9-$10.   I went with the crispy tempura shrimp, teriyaki chicken and a tempura fried roll with salmon and cream cheese called the "Taylor Roll". The roll was nice and flavorful and reminded me of the "Vegas Roll" I've had at other places.  I also stole a couple pieces of my friend's salmon on salmon roll, which was just delicious. The salmon was bright pink, wonderfully fatty, and so soft and smooth.   The crispy tempura shrimp were perfect with a light, crisp batter on the outside and sizeable, plump, juicy shrimp within. The included dipping sauce was also great.   Overall, we all enjoyed our meals and each got out for less than $20, which is incredible considering how much food we had.  I wanted to make room for the tempura fried ice cream, but just couldn't do it. Next time for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki chicken side
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taylor roll stuffed with cream cheese and smooth salmon...deep fried and awesome
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura shrimp were light, crispy, delicious and affordable ($5.50)

eZqe8MQSUqVaJMKXXA3jqw.text: With so many AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, it's hard to say if Goyemon is my favorite but it's definitely up there! I always get nigiri and I find that Goyemon has one of the best quality fish. I recommend the super white tuna, Cajun albacore, and yuzu yellowtail. Their fish to rice ratio is perfect and food comes out quick. They have yummy rolls and while this might not be a lot of peoples cup of tea, my fave is the lemon roll which is really refreshing - a nice contrast to all the other heavier rolls.   My only complaint is service, I just wish the servers were more attentive. When they get busy, it's so hard to flag down your server. One time, we couldn't find our server through the last half of our meal and the next time she checked in on our table, she was telling us that our time limit was up. We didn't even order everything we wanted to order because she was gone half the time so that was quite frustrating.   Other than that, food quality here is great and it's easy to see why Goyemon is busy all the time!

GCo0VWrkU7dBoGB4qRlHvA.text: There's a ton of AYCE sushi spots in town, and Goyemon has been around for awhile. It doesn't make my top 3, but it still serves a good amount of quality items. The thing is, I've eaten at enough sushi restaurants that I've become an "adventurous" eater. I look for unique creations other than your typical rainbow and caterpillar roll, and quite frankly, Goyemon doesn't stray too far from the basics. They have a solid amount of original rolls, but only a small number had descriptions that were enticing enough to try.   What I really appreciate about Goyemon is that they make half rolls on request. I have a bad habit of scarfing down whole rolls and becoming full too quickly, so the half rolls allowed me to pace my AYCE appetite and sample a variety from their menu.  *Recommended items: - Salmon and White Tuna Nigiri (order 10!!) - Moon Roll (eel, scallop, avocado, eel sauce) - Baked Mussels - Crab Meat Hand Roll (simple, yet delish)

B6gXCW5yZyjykQFqTfnpSw.text: A great All-You-Can-Eat sushi place. We have made it a point now to come here when we are in Vegas.   We usually go for the lunch time menu. As it is a few dollars cheaper and the only two things you are missing is the one order of uni and one order of amaebi.   The portions are on the smaller side for the nigiri, but the rolls are a good size. The quality of the fish is good and comparable to other sushi places. However, the reason we like coming to this place is that most all you can eat places don't come with special items for the day and desserts. So we like coming here because we know that even for an all you can eat place, there still will be something new to try.

MDHUEaQQh2VixPHQPjFpjQ.text: This place has the worst service. Nowhere on their door or policies does it say "last seating for all you can eat is at 2 a.m. and all of your party has to be here in order to do ayce." Erving is the worst manager and is not accommodating at all. I was sitting at the table before 2 a.m. and he waited until 2 a.m. to greet me so that I couldn't get the option to do ayce. Then he continued to tell me that I couldn't have ayce bc my friend wasn't sitting with me at the table by 2 a.m. Soooo I asked if I could do it since I was there on time and my friend was gonna do ala carte. He tried to say that I wasn't here on time when I had proof that I was lol. Pathetic.  What's the point of being open until 3 a.m. if you pretty much stop service at 2 a.m.? So worthless. I would go anywhere else if there were more sushi places open late. Starve yourself and wait until the next day when a better sushi restaurant is open haha. Don't waste your time here.  I literally wrote this sitting at the table

ssiowL_XqHXA1vI4KeMGvA.text: How can it be that I never a left a review here? By now, with the number of times I've been here, I should at least get partnership in the business.   If you're an out of towner!!! Don't let the fact that it's a AYCE spot fool you. Yes, outside of Vegas those places are notorious for being awful, but this.... this is the exceptional! Trust me. Please trust me.   The Tastiest.  Freshest.  Great service.  Busy ALL the time.  Super white tuna that melts on your tongue.  Yellowtail cheekbone.  So many different rolls.  6 different types of desserts.   Simply THE BEST SUSHI in Vegas.  The only thing I would say is that between 7-10 there's at least 30-40 min waiting line.

gPAe46fp3OUBLgLhfFqjqw.text: Ordered just a garlic tuna and salmon nigiri, never got it. So I ordered it again and still didn't get anything. What's going on lmao

DOf7fn6lBlV19XluY8EvEw.text: Just a slow Tuesday night, happen to come into the restaurant a bit later than normal. I would like to make sure that Sarah gets recognition for handling a pretty good size group of people like a boss. From the customer trying to make a scene, she kept great customer service and continued to explain why the customers weren't allowed to do what was asked. Go Sarah! I will def be returning to the Goyemon great food good atmosphere!!

PUjx52UCnU5cLImqU_noaw.text: Poor service, poor fish quality, they served me an old salmon collar soaked in teriyaki marinade for days. I should've followed my instincts when i saw the 3.5 stars. Servers weren't paying attention. We've waited a couple of times for them to get our orders.

-rx82vEJPK-B3zUVbi_etA.text: Fantastic AYCE sushi. I love this restaurant because it has more variety than most other ones. You can get any fish from salmon to toro and the ratio of rice to fish is near perfect. It still blows my mind how fresh the fish is considering we are in the desert. Not a single bad item on the menu. Good price for good quality food. What more is there to say.  We got the lychee sake and that stuff is deadly. Not too sweet and delicious. I don't drink often but I had several tea cups of this stuff. Highly recommend to pair it with your meal.  At the end of the meal you get AYCE ice cream and they have mochi ice cream! Can't beat that. Definitely a place I will be returning to next time I'm back in Vegas.

iOhEznXDWtM2ymmPZ53I4w.text: My fav All you can eat place in vegas because the quality of fish is decent compare to other AYC places. They don't take reservation so sometimes the wait time is just killed the mood

4uFXIknHnxFMgbsf-tb-UA.text: Just celebrated my birthday at Goyemon! They don't usually take reservations, but Irving was so accommodating and made sure our party of 16 was taken care of! They even pre-ordered our favorite rolls and appetizers! The food was fantastic which was topped off with even better service! Thank you so so much for making my birthday a great evening!!

jSqBhA8H7MYT9fN6Lf2zRA.text: Our server quit after taking our first order and they never replaced her. The food runner brought our food out and we scarfed it down in seconds.  20minutes went by and or girl was gone. We finally stopped the FR to take our order but she got swamped after the lack of servers left her in the weeds and never brought it out. Not going back. Not worth the $26 all you can eat, if we only get one order.

Tw5iGawduOCLlpZsQgwY0Q.text: My new go to sushi place when I'm in LV!  There are 3 F's I look for when I eat sushi: Foundation - just right amount of sushi rice. Flavor - great taste, of course! Fresh - the fish has to melt in my mouth lol   I must say this place met all 3 + great service and nice restaurant.

vcv7buQgLe8vZgt3VvX_Tw.text: This place is as nice as it's sister store, Sushi Mon but with an even better selection of appetizers fresh from the grill.  Worth the trip to the spooky strip mall it's located in.

mL2uzq3_rnWHzkbfG4SfTA.text: out of all the sushi places this one is Down there. didnt really like the rolls that were on the menu, weird combinations of ingredients, etc.. server neglected us. didnt refill our water all lunch caught myself trying to pace myself in case she would never been back. where are the bussers?? dirty plates stacked up on the table. and they dont have MANGO MOCHI. What? The only options available are vanilla and strawberry mochi. ??? no stars.

AiBJuG3gq6uhuurPLpacZA.text: Was here about a week ago and forgot to write a review   The service was VERY slow. One of the employee needs to wash her hands before handling food! Not coming back here anymore!

9FyUpJpjCj_p1R8H4p2-QA.text: Cousin to Mr Max in Irving Tx my favorite restaurant in the world, Goyemon had to be good. We didnt do AYCE this time, but the lunch specials were incredible and generous. This is definitely Mr Maxs older cousin, we will be back next time were in town.

OFWQMDZTgSE_K31F7vf4Jw.text: First time at Goyemon and only the 3rd time doing AYCE sushi in Vegas.  Didn't have the luxury of Jane K or Nik O suggesting what to order this time but thankfully Chris V made some excellent suggestions.    Lots of parking in the strip mall.  At around 6 most of the tables were taken but the sushi bar had space for us.  Tried a couple of rolls and ordered a few appetizers at first.  Noticed that the hand rolls had proportionally more rice than the larger rolls and that the larger rolls had proportionally more rice than the nigiri so ended up only ordering nigiri after that.  Highlights: maguro ahi, white tuna, and (best of all) unagi eel nigiri.  The shrimp tempura was a good side but the pork belly was too fatty and the fried shumai tasted like the frozen stuff.  Tried the vanilla creme (pretty good) and ice cream tempura (never again) but by then was so full we should have left already.  It probably would have been maybe $10 more per person if we ordered ala carte but honestly we would not have eaten as much so maybe AYCE sushi isn't for me. :(

t71gRqQ9dOCUXqWKN07beA.text: What is wrong with this place? I had come bearing high hopes and happy thoughts with the images of delicious sushi. HOW WAS I WRONG!?   Service:  First of all, the it isn't even busy, yet the front girl is having a horrible attitude. She didn't greet me, just stood there and told me' you can sit after the bus boy clean that table'. ( the bus boy is actually the only one who is doing excellent job! Kudos to you!) The rest of the meal the girl didn't speak any words to me. When I waved to her asking for miso soup, she grunted 'mm' and walked away silently when I said thank you. Everyone's face is like today is a shitty day.    Food:  Horrible food. Undercooked over-sourish rice is jammed pack under warm, dry, skimpy fish. The miso soup I got was basically hot water! I have never seen such transparent miso! Super amazed! The wasabi and ginger maybe had been left outside on the counter since yesterday night. And since I'm writing this review while I'm still sitting here eating, I'm proud to tell you their rice is now even HOTTER! And most of the table left with only few rounds of order. My huge glass of water ( I usually don't finish my water but I had been needing them to wash down some very weirdly strong flavored food) has been empty for 15 min. I seriously almost cried when I bite in to one piece of octopus thing. The only edible thing I got was the mochi ice cream.   Maybe they have change of ownership, or maybe they are training new people. Anyways.... I don't think I have ever had such a horrible meal before in my life.

fnlpdR5N6xywuh4gF2xhpw.text: Definitely one of my favorite sushi spots in town! Not a ton of room but they serve good food and they are quick at bringing it out. Always get the AYCE very reasonably priced!

J63R4wT98MjiiBL8KeXvuw.text: This place is delicious fresh and authentic. I was so impressed that the Caucasian waitress was able to communicate with the Japanese speaking sushi chefs. The food was cool and custom fresh even when I have gluten sensitivity they we super flexible and willing to understand.

35ssRwHg82GND7QGGzm1Rg.text: Best Japanese restaurant that I have ever been too!  AYCE $ is not bad at all.  The freshness and quality of their fish/seafood is a plus!!!  Never a disappointed when coming here!

v22s7pNT3Ai7VZhhuRBlIQ.text: Lovely AYCE selection!  One of the better AYCE places around. Be sure to order everything off the specials chalkboard..  Oh and you can order more than one dessert... whhhaaaaaaattttttttt

5ZKLZHKu_cUph4Bv_lxE2g.text: This place blows anus. Small portions, awful service, and just the worst. If you like sushi come to francisco and I'll take to the best spot in town.

ejSXEzdczp3xaAVWAJ01Og.text: AYCE sushi,  I am a big fan of  AYCE  Sushi and have tried all of the AYCE in Vegas.....  I had high hopes for this place, my friends rave about it, but its okay....  Pros:   Kool little sushi place, atmophere is kool, alot of young people, good service staff, there rolls are good.....  The bad: They have no japanese staff (which may indicate lack of authentic sushi) There nigiri is cut in a weird unprofessional way, the fish is not always fresh, there wasibi is not always fresh, there ginger is not always fresh......freshness is a problem  If they fix the above this place could be a 4 or 5 star....  Fish freshness is a problem....  There miso sucks.....there rolls are good....  Kaya is still king, until I try Umiya.....but thats not saying much...I'm thinking of switiching back to just eating sushi vs AYCE...

XJpPxdf8r6lCuLSU0A4rtA.text: Protip: remember that Sushimon on Sahara and Goyemon both use the same punch card! Make sure to get those stamps!  My go-to AYCE sushi place! Is it the best? Well, that's subjective. If you're looking for a solid AYCE for the quality and price, this is it. Disclaimer: Keep in mind that all-you-can-eat quality sushi cannot compare to the super fresh level of excellence of SOME, real, authentic sushi places. I wouldn't compare this Kabuto or other ala carte, higher-quality joints. This is strictly based in comparison to other AYCE places.  AMBIANCE: Decor is clean, intimate, but without the creepy silent vibes or weird football jerseys on the wall. Low mood lighting, laid-back, and doesn't feel too casual. You don't need to be too dressy either.  SEATING: Try getting a seat at the bar! Intimidated on how to order? Make eye contact with the sushi chef facing you even he looks busy, then say what you'd like!   Service is definitely hit-or-miss once in a while. This place is popular on the weekends especially during dinnertime. Last time I was here, it was still quite busy on a weekday dinner rush hour. Always expect a wait! A party of 5+ can be very difficult to seat! I believe they don't take reservations over the phone, but I heard this changed according to some other diners. If you're just dining with one other person, it's a lot quicker, especially if you say you don't care if you're seated at a table or the bar.  FOOD: I've been here countless times (enough to fill 5 of their stamps cards and a few paycheck's worth!), and the fish has always tasted fresh, crisp. Fish portion is generous. They don't try to load you up on rice unless you're ordering mostly rolls. Love the questionable super white tuna. The ubiquitous, americanized rolls are usually on-point, large, and presented beautifully. My fave is the moon roll!  Try ordering half-orders in case you end up disliking a particular roll. This way, you can sample many types of rolls. Too often do I see the people next to me saying they are not eating their rolls because they had too much of it or didn't prefer it. They end up not knowing you can order half! Ex: say "half dragon" or "half" whatever.  It varies on who your chef is when it comes to execution. A few times, my roll or nigiri has come out looking like a beauty school drop-out :C sometimes, consistency is an issue when it comes to presentation.  VERDICT: Although Goyemon is hyped up, it's really because they try to bring better quality fish to the masses of the AYCE crowd. Service can suffer when it's packed. Last time I was here, our server totally forgot about us sitting in the corner of the bar! When he saw my drink was completely empty, he tried to make it up to us by diligently coming back and checking on us since then.  Fun for a date-night spot or a small get-together. A solid experience and hands-down one of my favorite AYCE sushi spots.

uSAh7BldN0cfUxrUgBUUXg.text: DONT BELIEVE THE HYPE  OK so the reason I came here was because of all the reviews and honestly this place is not all that. First of all you have to wait for an 40 minutes or more to be seated and the service is very slow.  Only thing I liked about this place is the hurricane roll (The extra star is for this roll). The fresh was not as fresh as some reviewers said.  OH and because we were sitting thing there and talking with friends with have not seen for awhile, mind you this is shortly after we paid the bill, they asked us if there was anything else we needed kinda their way of telling us to get the eff out because there were people waiting. I am sorry but if we were at any other place, they wouldnt make us feel that way.   They are never getting my business again. Get a bigger spot!

Cg-aUW67m3nCmfmxFoElSw.text: food here definitely better than your average sushi joint esp AYCE joints.  must orders:  frying Jason - baked scallop and crabmeat with special sauce and asparagus! yes asparagus. complements the other flavors really well  seared salmon and cajun albacore sushi - seared salmon has a nice splash of lemon, and the cajun spices flavor the albacore nicely.  lychee sherbet - best lychee flavored anything I've ever tried.  best dessert item on the menu.  great texture with even bits of lychee. Got 2 orders  Green tea ice cream - also got 2 orders alongside the lychee.  Perfectly bittersweet and creamy and balanced out the mild tart of the lychee.  So after all this, why only 3 stars?  Our server, though she frequently came by to check up on us, didn't smile even once.  How hard is it to smile?  Uses fewer muscles than to frown heh.  And secondly, we were confronted (at least nicely) at the end of our meal that we had overstayed the 45 min limit by half an hour.  No wonder the server kept saying last call.  I guess we should've read the fine print.  At least the hostess  smiled heh.  Anyone heard of a 45 time-limit on AYCE?

SycnsASvd05NJatWGP3DjA.text: This is my hands down favorite ayce sushi spot in all of vegas. I never leave disappointed and I know the menu by heart. The only downside is depending on the time you go their may or may not be a wait, however they have integrated this "text you when your table is ready" system which is actually quite convenient. I mean the service isn't really all that great, but it is also not that bad so i'll live. Definitely one of the better spots to grab sushi in vegas.

b5-XLNGAhDzNRgNmRyYvbw.text: All you can eat, good quality sushi for $27.00? Look no further than Goyemon sushi.

Dz75sVt_pBrsiA216id0Yg.text: Was denied ayce at 2:05 because we came in 5 minutes after last seating. Great food but horrible customer service.

Z-L7BnR2Kvsm6hs5GwBveg.text: I've gone here the last few times in Vegas with my friends.  Must say, quality is good and the cuts if sushi are cute and small, but it is ayce. My favorites are: -Salmon -yellowtail -White tuna  Good selection and service is very fast and efficient. My go to sushi place in Vegas.

3KhcIENlYaDTNMFyi4Y25g.text: Came here tonight to enjoy some sushi with the fiance and her dad. We waited about half hour to get seated which was fine. When we got sat we waited maybe 5 minutes before even getting recognized by our server. Once we ordered drinks which came pretty quick but the rest of the service was pretty slow. We had to keep asking for our food and one order they got wrong and had them correct it.... But never came to the table. Bad experience from start to finish. I see a lot of good reviews on here so I'm gonna try again and hopefully update it with 5 stars.

6uqIZPYEfd1sPiHuaP7Jnw.text: Service here sucks. Don't go in a party of two. They will completely ignore you. Rice cracker was a little too harsh on the teeth.   Grilled pork belly was tasty.  Food lags. Service sucks.  Been waiting for someone to notice us for about 30 minutes.  Don't even bother coming.

XuMDts68BJK1SDRRJKK9Jw.text: I've been going to Goyemon with my partner for over three years and I have to say that they are the best AYCE in Vegas when it comes to consistency and their nigiri/sashimi (I still think the best rolls go to Sakana).    As far as nigiri their best includes their Cajun albacore, Cajun tuna (special only), super white tuna, unagi, and garlic tuna.  Best grill items: pork belly, super white tuna and yellow tail.  Best rolls:  sexy girl, frying Jason, OID, caterpillar, pastel are the ones that come off the top of my head.  Oh and I really like their red bean ice cream for dessert.  Service is usually pretty prompt.  They have a few waitresses that I don't see too often anymore (I'm assuming for good reasons) that will let our food die in the window and take forever to take our next order.  Like I said, it doesn't seem to be much of an issue anymore.   On busy evenings expect a party of two to have a one hour wait.  There are no reservations allowed.  My advice - give them your number and grab a beer at PT's that is up the block.  You have ten minutes to get back to the restaurant and claim your spot once you receive a text.  Right next to Sakana...there isn't a better AYCE in town.

UEb-BlGEuUV8_Yz63gi1sA.text: My new favorite AYCE sushi joint in Vegas... Aside from the hour wait lol. Be sure to come and check in a little before starvation mode before you die from waiting outside in the hot parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh and Delish!!!

xnptdN9Ti1wNBllKrKtAdw.text: From the moment we walked in, there were smiles all around, especially from the check-in girl(Minna). The food came out, pretty fast, hot, and delicious of course! Even dessert was awesome!; Minna shared in my excitement for the ice cream too, "woohoo!" Haha. Another satisfied customer. Thanks guys

YqoLd5ipTPjIfGVSByIaSg.text: BEST AYCE Japanese food in Vegas. The pork belly is soooooooo yummy. AYCE also includes specials on their board and all desserts. Om nom nom. Always a must when I visit Vegas.

IuSKV_vwNrbUQ33GprUEJw.text: Came here with a group of friends when we came to Vegas for my birthday weekend :]  The ambiance is very trendy/hipster like with cute decor all around. The hostess told us there's a wait even though we saw a handful of empty tables that were calling our names to be seated. We had to ask the hostess a few time if she forgot about us, she replied by saying she didn't want to stack the server hence the hold in seating.   Our server was kind enough to inform us that sushi was a bit backed up so she encouraged us to order more kitchen items. We really enjoyed the large variety of items that Goyemon provided and there was no maximum of items each person can order at a time.   The quality of the fish was great, especially for an AYCE joint. One thing that you should remember, you can order HALF portions, which we should have done so we were able to try a larger variety of items [nigiris, rolls, tempura, kitchen, and dessert]. The only downside is, you cannot order Uni or Amaebi during lunch as part of the AYCE menu. Even for dinner, only 1 order allowed per person.   One highlight of the meal is BEWARE!!! of the 9-1-1 roll, my friend and I thought we could conquer this Spicy Tuna look-a-like roll, infused with habanero juice [which the chefs make themselves]. The server already gave us a fair warning that it's spicy and wow...it was no joke. I thought I could eat spicy but O-M-G...my face was on fire and my tongue lost all sense of its taste, I literally soaked my tongue in my Arnold Palmer for a good 5 minutes before it went back to 75% of its normality.  For the price [$21.95], you really get a bang for your buck. I think this will be to go spot for [AYCE] sushi whenever I am in Vegas.

5-MHxvThXbyXNrsVQgERtQ.text: $21.95 - Lunch $26.95 - Dinner ALL YOU CAN EAT! The best all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant I've ever been to. Whenever my boyfriend and I come to Vegas, we plan our trip around this restaurant.. No joke. We pass up on the crowded night clubs and overrated day clubs for Sushi Goyemon.. FAVORITES: White tuna: yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Nom nom nom.. Super white tuna obsession.. Orgasm salad: yelp.com/user_local_phot... They don't have this anymore :(. Sweet shrimp: yelp.com/user_local_phot... Limit 1 order per person.. SO GOOD. PASS on these items: Uni: yelp.com/user_local_phot... Not the freshest.. Tastes worse than uni from Mitsuwa. Limit 1 order per person. Poke salad: yelp.com/user_local_phot... I remember it tasting better the first time I was here.. Went back recently and it wasn't as good. Too much sauce, and the tuna was a little stringy. NOTE: Ask for a stamp card! Buy 10 all-you-can-eats, get one free!

6NiXplPEvlc37pzA1KXgPQ.text: Updated review: After my 4 star rating, I had to go here again & once again they didn't disappoint  Sushi Roll: I'm not much of a roll person but I was with people who loved rolls and they decided to get the "Taylor roll" I wish I took a picture of this but its a deep fried roll of salmon and guacamole and cream cheese with yum yum sauce drizzled on top YUM! I also tried their new roll pink lady which was also delicious.   Ice cream: Which is also on the AYCE menu, I usually get green tea ice cream and tempura ice cream but I must've been in an adventurous mood because I decided to get the lychee ice cream, first off I wasn't too sure how this was going to taste. I love lychee but lychee in ice cream form idk. But I absolutely loved it, it was very tasty. Goyemons the only Sushi restaurant in Vegas that I know that serves Lychee ice cream.  The only reason it stays at a 4 for me is the wait time. The wait wouldn't be sooo bad if they had a bigger wait room, I noticed in the restaurant if they used their space smart they could've at least had 2 more tables put into their layout. The waiting area is kind of odd you kind of just stand on the wall as you watch people who are eating to be done.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IeRRQCnp5YUT9UNgcM705Q.text: Who doesn't love a buffet?....Especially when it's All-You-Can-Eat awesome sushi  After a fail attempt at Cesar's buffet during my last Vegas trip (Oct. 2013) me and a party of 13 didn't want to stand in that ridiculous hour wait line so one of our friends who was with us and a resident of Las Vegas suggested we go to Sushi Goyemon since it's all you can eat sushi and he said the sushi was just as good as Honolulu's sushi...so of course we couldn't refuse.  We got there around 8pm and there was about an hour wait as well but we just walked a few stores down, bought some beer and waited outside by our car until we got called in. We were then seated in their private room. We all got the all you can eat buffet for $27 but with tax it came out to little over $31.   Don't bother filling you tummy with the rolls because that makes you full instantly because we ordered about 2 and yes they were good but they were so filling. I loved all of the nigi sushi...sad that they only allow 2 pieces for the uni (sea urchin), amaebi (sweet shrimp) and the GREEN TEA CREME BRULEE (which is not on the menu). Their hamachi, ikura, ahi, salmon, unagi, scallops, albacore etc is all fine cuts and really freshly delicious! I also enjoyed their baked mussels, fried fish heads, asparagus, tomato salad. I think everything on their menu was great and I was so stuffed walking out...Now I know where to go for good buffet sushi whenever I visit Vegas.  The place is small and busy so be sure to wait and they do offer a punch card so for all you regulars out there.

LXqI61_X5ZBtknZxESaw5A.text: BEST SUSHI EVER! PERIOD.   I lost count of how many times I ate here but every time I crave sushi, Goyemon is the only place to be. There's typically a 30 min wait if you come around peak dinner hours but it's well worth it.   Here's what I totally recommend to try from Nigiri Sushi   - Cajun Albacore - Snow Crab - Scallop - Yuzu Tobiko (if it's on special) - Ikura   I love their rolls too but I'm more of a nigiri sushi girl ;) However, all rolls that I ate there were exceptional! Make sure to try Puffy - Yum Yum!!!   My fave side dishes are Sashimi Salad, Pork Belly and Baked Greens Mussels.   The service is always great and if you sit by the bar you can get your sushi/rolls even faster!  Hands down - best sushi joint in town with consistent quality and freshness of food, friendly staff and great AYCE prices.

TsUgMZ9_1Ceb-GFSXKpQ9w.text: Long wait in Las Vegas is expected. If you're a buddy with the chef or staff, then you can cut in front of everyone who had waited for hours. Fairness ? Not here.

sJlfrGQj9OMIoO6Ew7O06g.text: For all u can eat sushi this is a good place place. Especially the scallop and mussels wete delicious. Also the lychee ice cream is a must try.
