9i3sLsIlKhsDhVyaVPeyzg.text: Been here a few times. The sushi is good and fresh. The best are the lunch or dinner specials. Most of the time is a long wait but worth it. Is small and more cozy with nice ambiance music. Also AYCE desserts, while most places 1 per person.

W_An7TXZNY4j-s1B5G1Y_g.text: CONDENSED IN A SOUP CAN: Goyemon is brother to a family of great restaurants including Monta Ramen/Chaya and Sushi Mon (now both the Maryland AND Sahara outlets are united under the same management)... so it safe to expect greatness. It will not disappoint your taste buds and wallet, but it may test your patience for table wait. THE MEAT: Hubby and I have swung by this place a few times but we weren't willing to wait an hour or two for a table. MAHALO to awesome Yelper friends with hookups to a private room! The sake options are awesome, and for $8, you can have a 3-shot sampler of any sake on their menu. Their appetizer, sushi/rolls and dessert offerings also give you a wide variety with no limits. The must trys - pork belly (lots of melt in your mouth fat that works), salmon belly nigiri, salmon collar (they cook this beautifully - I believe it is a superior part of the fish), the ecstasy roll (albacore, tuna, seaweed, masago, yum yum sauce - all the flavors and textures were lip-smacking good), and yuzu or lychee sorbet. We were underwhelmed by a few items like Cajun albacore (the fish and execution is exceptional in Sushi Koma, which also has a much better version of the scallop dynamite dish). But on the whole, you get a great bang for your buck with quality ingredients, good service and varied quantity. I've tried a lot of AYCE sushi in Vegas but Goyemon still remains the undefeated champion. I'M STILL DIGESTING... the fact that I didn't order more salmon belly. Darn it. WANT TO SEE SOME FOOD PORN? :-) yelp.com/biz_photos/sush...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee sorbet.  This still had strong citrus flavors.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brulee.  Was ok, I prefer the ice cream.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly!!!

CxJ-FOvlSsCRzBo9tl48Cw.text: This place is a True unexpected gem in Las Vegas. We were in the mood for sushi but didn't want to go to a high-priced place on The Strip so we found ourselves here. Upon arriving in the strip mall parking lot, the place is very unassuming, even dive-ish from the outside. The inside is actually quite nicely decorated in a simple yet well-appointed Japanese style.   Now on to the good stuff...  We ordered the All You Can Eat Lunch for $26.95/ pp. You really can't go wrong here. Order from the whole menu and the only restriction is the time limit of 45 minutes. Between the 2 of us we ordered 7 different rolls, soup, edamame, soft drinks and dessert - all included. I was stuffed when we left, to say the least!!   For the quality and selection of the sushi this is an amazing deal!!! Although everything we had was delicious, the stand outs were the Spider, Orion, and Tiger rolls.   When I'm in Las Vegas again in the future, this will be on my places to visit again.

GSzN53K4sCAMbKvm7DeufA.text: Arpi the hostess is a gem. She was very helpful and very nice despite the restaurant being super busy. She keeps running around and making sure all the guest were served. I can understand why there's a wait for the food and a wait to be seated. The food is amazing for a AYCE. It's a good spot to get your sushi fill. If you don't want to wait, you can go to a mediocre sushi place somewhere else. If you want good AYCE, come here but expect a slight wait for your food but it'll be worth it.

tFD7vUltKk7Zsf8utZHRfw.text: Hostess very rude! Claims in costumer service for years! Lol, from the alley! badddddddddddddddddddddd

5Fj8PCmud7-oiriYmbrgZw.text: The BEST AYCE sushi in town! The fish quality can sometimes vary, but I always find that the salmon and albacore are always excellent. They also have a wide variety of standard and specialty rolls. It can get really busy on the weekend, but it's definitely worth the wait!

etzhwOPJ_YRz9ssPPQG8gg.text: This place is really worth the price. Could get really busy at times and the wait can be really long. Environment is really fast-paced but the staff are very friendly. I like to sit by the bar and tell the sushi chefs what I want without waiting for the server. Everything on their menu is really good. My favorite dessert is the green tea brulee. Only part that sucks about it is that you can only get one. Trust me, you're going to want more than one. There's really nothing much more to add other than to try this place.

BcTDGuZseXMZYAU2g1lK6A.text: This is still one of my favorites, we go quite often after work. The pork belly and scallops are my favorite. We Love the ramen and creme brulee as well . It's a great place to go after a busy night at work, I run into many people here too in the industry.

iMHdrhpHwvG-AgmOSIGH-w.text: My review is 4.5 stars.  I still like Sin City better, but there are alot of things to love about Sushi House Goyemon.  Hence the incredible Yelp! reviews for this place.  I would definitely visit this place again.      We sat at the bar.  It was very busy on a Thursday night but there were two open seats, so no wait! Score!  At first, I was a little confused by the AYCE menu and no one explained it right away.  Eventually, one of the sushi chefs explained how it works.    Typically, I eat special rolls and very little nigiri, but not this night.  With the exception of a few things we chose to order, the chefs fed us their picks.  We had a ton of nigiri.  Everything was really fresh and tasty, particularly the mackeral.  The big eye tuna was really good too.  I tried everything Yelpers suggested.  This was my first time having Fried Pork Belly.  Holy crap!  Where have you been all my life?!  Unbelievably good.  A nice layer of charred fat and the mango salsa that accompanies it was the right amount of sweet.  Honestly, everything we tried was good, with one exception:  No matter how much you think you like spicy DO NOT ORDER THE 911 ROLL!  My mouth is still burning!  Thankfully, they offer $13 pitchers of Sapporo to help with the sting.

YuaeZwa29KOk4UGjHVNKeA.text: Great place for all you can eat sushi. Call ahead and ask for the wait time. This place gets packed very quick !!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With my GF

UGD9NPzI5Y14VPqaHJliWw.text: 4.5/5 Daily specials are great Nigiri is on point. Ingredients are fresh... Uni and hamachi Kama  depletes quickly Wish they had BOGO saki or beer but that's being greedy Sometimes service can be a little  hence the 4.5  Highly recommended

2VktN7K1mN5vHZgv_czddA.text: I have to agree with pretty much with everyone else have written already.  Braised pork belly - We (2 of us) had 6 + orders of this most amazing pork belly EVA.)  Spicy Tuna Fire Cracker - 5 orders of this.    Lychee Sorbet - I ordered a total of 4 sorbets, and even after the bill was paid, I had to order another one.  Amber Jack  sushi - This piece of fish tasted so fresh and flavorful.  Good recommendation from the waiter.    The only negative comment is that they didn't have yellowtail collar.  They never seem to have it.  Maybe cross it out the menu?  But other than that, I must agree that this is the best AYCE sushi joint in Vegas.

r0LBwcpQclTKAVBavBqawA.text: This shouldn't even be called a sushi house. Absolutely poor quality sushi. I honestly have had better sushi prepackaged from Albertsons. Bad service bad tasting food. 10/10 do not recommend. Go to Smiths or Albertsons and get a box instead

bBBqhpFvOvJH90WMbtru2w.text: Awesome AYCE sushi dinner ~$27 before tax/tips, drinks extra.  Lots of variety of rolls, nigiri sushi, and other foods, but they do limit the quantity on special items like the uni, which is understandable.  Best to go with a large group to try all sorts of items without overstuffing yourself.  My favorite was the squid (ika), simply light and yummy~  Don't forget to order from the special menu to try new flavors/dishes.  Favorite desserts were creme brulee and yuzu sorbet.

KEfRKz5aVgaGyGfxwHeKVg.text: I had the deluxe combination lunch and it was great! Lots of food. Will try Sushi Mon on sahara next time .My friends from honolulu enjoyed it too. Very reasonable.

76bVtq_IObx4MJRAX9rTEQ.text: One of my favorite sushi places! Quality of fish is outstanding! Every time I come here the service is very quick. & they are open until 3am!

jD02FsbZnlvgd2XjvgnIlA.text: Decent sushi. Their unagi (BBQ eel) is terrible and that's my favorite. The salmon and other rolls are good.

fvTcDCXl1PR2MSM29mVEWw.text: Overall this place is the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas. To me what sets this place apart sushi is always fresh and well prepared. They allow half orders on rolls so you can try more different types of rolls. I especially enjoy the different types of grilled fish. After 11pm u can also order ramen they are the same owners of Monta. Sometimes their are premium types of fish on the specials menu you would never see in any AYCE place. Plus it is always busy and plenty of female eyecandy!

6QJ477upFwP7FftUouEuqg.text: This place has an awesome selection of sushi. One thing i might have suggest... please get a bigger place. Ridiculous 2 hr wait. They don't take  reservations.  The lady informed us that Mondays is not a busy day. Lie..  always busy. . Crazy 2 hr wait. They won't sit your party unless complete. Good food though

c6nkpavoPk_D3qbgyxxiog.text: It's good.. Prices are the same as comparative sushi places here in Vegas, service is good.. Plenty of selections... Conveniently located near Mandalay bay/Luxor they have All U can eat.!!! It's good! I come here a lot because of the late hours and the proximity to my house. It's a great local place and it doesn't have the WOW factor.. Just get your sushi on...! Great Date place, quiet enough to talk to your date and they are not pushy...! Try it a few times and u will see...! It's quaint...

aPs43w8WpVzUWFZhc3nqxA.text: The food was amazing. The fish was fresh and delicious. The spicy salmon took me back to my sushi days in Toronto (it's friggin awesome there). Service is also good.  Would definitely go back if we are in town.

GoVXC8yxx93RG_6g78lciA.text: The all you can eat special is an amazing deal, we did the math and our bill would have been almost double if we hadn't got it.  All of the sushi was fantastic but if you get drinks - get the sake; the wine wasn't very good but the Japanese drinks were all great.  The mochi ice cream was AMAZING, make sure you try it.

Ijzn4m58RaEuQtB3b9uKGw.text: Went with a rookie. Got seated right away....I know right and it was a Staurday night 8ish. Did the AYCE. OMG really! They just keep bringing more. The pork belly is my favorite and tonight it was a bit off. Everything else was super. My cohort enjoyed the first time experience and said it would not be long for a return visit. Service was great! Sushi chefs were busy ,busy ,busy and it all came out great!  Help me out to the car, need to get home before I pass out. Good job folks!

UxmyumQ_tQqw8Bz0Mr4BmA.text: I'd go 5 stars but this is only the second AYCE sushi place I've been to so far out here, and it's slightly above the other one I went to (Sushimon).  Service is generally forgetful and I've only eaten at the sushi bar (3 times) so can't speak on table service.  When I order sushi, obviously, it's easy, he's right in front of me and the things I order are timely from the sushi bar and depending on who is there I might get some friendly banter back and forth, but the kitchen food, hot dishes wise, is consistently lengthy waits, but it's not like it really ruins any experience.  You're going there to shovel food down your pipe like a caveman and you will and it will be delicious, but that might be the only flaw.  For $28 you won't get your socks blown off but, it's not top of the line quality but damn good enough and it's WAAAAAAAY worth the price.  Go and enjoy.  The money you'd spend on a la carte sushi....put it into sake...get drunk, eat a lot.  You win.

BXMUiTQRbs_vD6lwWvGDDw.text: Our favorite sushi place ! I'm a vegetarian and found plenty of yummy options, my favorite roll is NATO hand roll with added veggies. The cucumber salad and seaweed salad is amazing and I love the lycee ice cream !!

Ed3OWN6H4wi3bhABivHHeg.text: Sorry Elites...I was not as impressed as I thought I would be.  1.  We arrived to find out that there was a 45 minute wait to sit.  As we contemplated if we should go to our favorite sushi place that we both know that we will enjoy the fresh fish and not so over bearing rice on the nigiri's OR stay and try something new...so, we stayed.   2. The rice on the nigiri's were thick, hard as if it was pre-made and sat out on a buffet line .  So, I ate everything sashimi style as I magically made the thick rancid and hard rice disappear.... :-)   3. Fish quality wasn't bad. I really enjoyed that they have white fish on the menu and the scallop nigiri was amazing.   4. Pork belly! Normally, I am a pork belly fanatic. However, I feel indifferent.  The meat and fat was really good and had a sweet flavor.  I think the skin could have been crispy to have that WOW factor.   5. Crispy rice w/ spicy tuna was good.  I enjoyed the crispy texture and the spicy kick to the tuna.  6. Calamari was really good. This was one of my favorites.   7. I was disappointed that they ran out of hamachi kama....but wait...they are owned by Sushi Mon so they always run out of hamachi kama!   8. Overall...it was ok. I don't think I would frequent this place. It felt like it was more of a newer Sushi Mon with nicer restaurant materials.

eMrOiod8Qn-SsR_jp0y3Tg.text: Only open for dinner/late night 5 pm - 2 am   Specials on a chalk board  Sushi chefs that actually like working there and talk to you at the counter and explain everything.   INCREDIBLE appetizers that I haven't seen anywhere else (crispy rice tuna is sooo yummy)  I love their mahalo roll (spam roll basically) but it's very popular, sometimes I see several rolls of that go out in less then 10 min.    Their desserts are incredible and they don't limit you to just 1.  They are ALWAYS packed.    Their fish is definitely very fresh (remember if a place is busy, the fish is actually being served and is fresh, not just sitting there in a fridge waiting for guests to come in)   I have been back several times and I HIGHLY recommend this place.

b5ABVRCVu_NryJ1gNRG4RQ.text: So disappointed with my most recent visit. The service was awful and they weren't even that busy. It took us only 10 minutes to be sat but It took 45 minutes for us to get four orders of NIGIRI and It took an hour to get one roll. The server never gave us the time of day even though she was in plain sight the entire time. The food was good but the poor service and the incredibly long wait time for the food has made me decide that I will not be returning.

uzs0YanhUQv1wJ7xe5NDXQ.text: Bomb sushi. Always busy, so get there early. Ecstasy, Lemon and Spider roll are the favs!

OntguD1eNjqf2ZE3Bz0flg.text: This place has the worst customer service. I come I'm at 10 pm and ask for a table for 5, since I'm the 1st of my party to arrive they tell me they can't seat me until the rest of my party arrives even though there is 20 seats available in the restaurant.  I finally tell the host my party will be here in 10 minutes.  So he seats me, I ask to order then he says my 60 min ordering time starts when I first order. So he's basically punishing my friends. So I guess it's worth pissing off a customer over 10 minutes. Never coming here again.

vB8CKFsrQk2jHrS8MTjAsw.text: It was my first time here but heard a lot of good things about it. I love sushi so of course I did the AYCE. Service was pretty fast, very nice, and the interior was pretty average for a sushi house. We got the crispy rice, ecstasy, and pastel roll. ALL WERE AMAZING. They also do half rolls which in my opinion is the best thing since sliced fish. We got the pork belly which is a must try unless you're on a strict diet. It's super fatty, melt in your mouth, all around amazing piece of marinated pork. They're known For it, so try it! Their nigiri is fresh. Fish to rice portion on point. Get the toro and the uni! Super white, garlic tuna, salmon, all fresh and yummy. The wait can get super long, it's worth it though! Reminds me a lot of sushimon almost identical in their rolls. No reservations so call in advance to see the wait time. Loved this place!

no48rubvHhVIgyHyHTV4_w.text: Excellent! Fish was fresh and appetizers were delicious. We were there early on a Saturday and the wait for a table was already 30-40 minutes. We sat at the bar and the sushi chefs were great! It was harder to get the attention of our waitress who we ordered kitchen food and drinks. Overall, very yummy!

locDCxyjr0NdEfCpJ467Sg.text: All you can eat sushi. In Vegas. Revolutionary!   Or not.  Owned by the same people who own Monta and Sushi-Mon, this is another addition to their Japanese cuisine monopoly. As such, the resemblance to either restaurant is no surprise. In fact, just like Sushi-Mon they offer a small selection of special fish options for the day. When we arrived the only option they had available was their in-house smoked salmon, which was alright.   The highlights:  * Braised Pork belly. Pork belly is gelatinous, fatty and delicious by itself, but given the right TLC and it's a porky palate pleaser. This is no different, but it's best eaten in small doses. The portion size is meager so that takes care of that. Flavors and textures are great on this one.  * Raw scallop nigiri. Not the "scallop dynamite" smothered in mayo, this is real, tender scallop. It's delicious and rare to find in an AYCE place!  * Uni was fresh, not murky tasting.   Lowlights: * Baked green mussels. Blah! Bluefin's are better. * Orgasm Salad. I'd take a hundred screaming O's over this any day. Boo. Weird medley of assorted fish-chunks doused in a puddle of ginger-sesame dressing and a few wilted greens doesn't bring orgasm to mind at all- unless you mean that wet spot in the bed nobody wants to sleep on...  * Masago & Quail egg- I'd asked for Ikura but the chef assured me it was usually made with masago. Didn't float my boat OR sink my submarine.   The interior is nice, with lots of warm wooden tones throughout and low-hanging lamps.  The service could be spotty. There was confusion over who was actually taking our appetizer/drink orders and a lot of shouting back and forth from the sushi bar to the servers.   I'd rate this a 3 and a half star place. The food isn't awful and the service wasn't consistently bad, it just didn't blow me out of the water. I was tempted to go for a 4 star, but I figured rounding down will help counter the ebulliently high prior ratings.  I'm willing to give them another chance and try some of their specialty rolls, but it's a bit out of the way and didn't make me want to do a dance of belly-joy at the end of my meal.

u-NzIQntOQLoSJJGrfMabQ.text: In agreement with other reviewers, AYCE was good. (Solidly good, not rave-about-it-great). Service was, however, great. The two rolls that stood out to me were the Ecstasy roll and the Pixie Roll, the latter is from a super-special section of the menu from which you can only order one of the five options. That's it. One. AYCE with rules, of course. Always with the rules...  Two things I liked is that they offer half-rolls or whole rolls. And, when I asked for "easy rice" aka "diet rice," they definitely accommodated.   Pass on the tempura ice cream. Very meh.  We had a 1:30 lunch, and there was no wait, so nice and low-key, with prompt and observant service. $22 for lunch AYCE.

8DcQMlup9bUs3l3AzvwMaA.text: Listen, you can never get better quality sushi at an all you can eat price or quantity, let's get that of the way.  Now, being the foodie that I am, this place gets as close as you can get to as I can ever expect any restaurant can.  It's the best AYCE sushi place I have ever been to. Rice is not mushy, it's cooked perfect. Rice to fish ratio is solid and comparable to a normal sushi restaurant. Service is excellent. Selection is solid and diverse. Go for it, it's a long wait but it's worth it in my personal opinion.

OaTp5WLxeFz3T20Z4XLckw.text: unbelievable. this was such a great experience for me. i have no idea why the other people complained about service.. it was top notch all the way when we were there from 4-5:30 on a friday. the all you can eat is a bargain. all the sushi/rolls etc you want to try but were "too cheap" to order can be had here. out of everything that i tried i was only disappointed with one menu option.  when people say "all you can eat japanese food" i think of todai. Todai sucks so this place is quite a delight. although, some reviews complained about it not being 100% authentic ignore them. doesn't matter "authentic sushi" or somewhat authentic it tastes great

SdWz_MTG3PB5xm8gnI90fw.text: Great AYCE sushi. Not on the menu: green tea creme brulee - I can probably eat 20 of them. DEE-LISH!  It's so good I was inspired to buy my own torch and start making my own - I just haven't gotten around to actually making it yet.  Oops!  I've been to many AYCE sushi places that serve the same thing.  Goyemon has a lot of items that you won't find at any other AYCE places.  For example, the pork belly.  This is probably the shortest review I've written for a sushi restaurant but the best tip I could give you about this place is: whatever you can't find at other sushi places, that's what you should get and you'll be surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brûlée
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi dinner

igPXg-ZMeohNG4QCHbBuPA.text: My family went here based on my sister's recommendation for all-you-can-eat sushi for lunch. At $21.95 per adult I thought that was a reasonable price.  One of the great things about this sushi place is you most likely won't waste of food. Why? Because if you order something and don't eat it by the end of the meal, they will charge you for what you don't eat. This is smart business, and makes customers only order what they can eat.  We ordered, and we ate a lot between the four of us. We basically had everything on the menu. Tip: be careful when ordering. I believe I ordered four of one thing and I thought I would get four pieces, but each thing had three pieces so I ended up with twelve pieces of sushi.  Everything we ordered was made fresh for us, and I think they started taking their time getting us later orders because we may have been relatively eating too much. The sushi was more than fresh enough considering you're in the middle of a desert.  And when it came time for desserts, which is also included in the meal, we shared some mochi ice cream and matcha green tea ice cream.  In the end, all four of us were stuffed and there was not a single piece of rice left on our plates. Recommended.

Zza_Fvr386cIIahqkKJc5Q.text: This place the food quality and service are getting worse, the fish was not fresh and rice are big, the server said will charge extra for just two pieces of rice, just let them charge it and take it off from the tips!!!

kYi1M85VepumV8c-PE0A4g.text: One restaurant, 5 words: ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI for less than $30 a person? I'll book my flight back now.  Ok back to the review. Sushi House Goyemon is a small sushi restaurant outside of the Vegas strip (but not too far). This is how it works, they have a la carte options but they also have their all you can eat option. If you like sushi, the all you can eat is a decent deal. It's about $27.00 for dinner and you can order as much sushi as you want. It's not just sushi. You can also order soup, salads, and even desserts are included on the menu. They do charge extra for leftovers so be mindful of what you order.   The sushi itself is delicious. It's fresh, made to order, and comes out in a decent pace. I would recommend keeping track of what you order, especially if you're in a large party. We were in a large party and our orders got mixed up. It was an accident and they apologized but definitely something to keep in mind.   Like I mentioned, Goyemon is small and there is a wait on weekends and holidays. So be prepared to wait. It's worth it, but definitely factor in wait time when you come to Goyamen. They also have a time limit of 1-2 hours if you decide to do the all you can eat option.   Factoring in everything, it's still a great deal and delicious food. If you like sushi and are in Vegas, definitely stop at Goyemon.

dU4uXcseJUiH6v7CG65fQA.text: Boy, this establishment has certainly gone downhill in service.   The sushi chef showed annoyance in having to interact with me.  He only had two sets of customers to serve and he made me wait until he finished making someone else's order before taking mine.   Really?   You can't take more than one order at a time at a sushi bar that's all you can eat?    They didn't bus away the dishes for a long long while.  No one came to ask if I wanted more side dishes.  And of the side dishes that I ordered,  they got one order wrong.  If it wasn't for the fresh fish and variety,  I would have given them 2 stars.   In a town where we have so many competing sushi establishments to choose ftom, they must do better.

j3Pn1m-iNz1UxQKNVi1wWg.text: I've returned and found that the sushi simply is not as fresh here as other good sushi restaurants. The yellowtail I had recently was a questionable color and the overall look of the rolls was messy. The service is still good but without all you can eat the prices are not really well matched to the quality of food you're getting.

VZI-Qv_flG5qiEauqR-FBg.text: My new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Japanese food is my all time favorite cuisine, and if it is an all you can eat restaurant, even better! No, it should be THE BEST!! This place combines my two favorites, how could I not give it a five star!   The price is affordable, the food was awesome, the service...um....is okay. Anyway, food is the main character here. I've ordered three rounds, total fifteen different plates. They all came in a very small portion, except the rolls, so don't be afraid to try different things, you won't get stuffed by only four plates. I really want to try everything on the menu if I could, but my food baby told me not to, that's why I've to stop at the number fifteen. But don't worry, this place has become a must on my Vegas List! I'll be back pretty soon, and this time I'll  tried everything on the menu trust me! If not...I will come again duh!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right: Squid nigiri             Left: Smoke salmon nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni nigiri

voyHSRQmzAsKnvO8I1rC1w.text: EDIT another visit on 7/30/2016 : Went to goyemon last night for another try .  I definitely regret my decision . As I got there I put our names down for a party of 6 . We're waiting for over 30 minutes when there is clearly tables available to be moved together . I seen 6 seats at the bar opened so I asked the seater lady if we could sit at the bar . She had to go ask the chefs if it was ok to sit at the bar ??? The chef said "no because it will be too busy for them"  .. Wtf ? That pissed me off . After that  a male server walks by 10 seconds after and says , " if you sit at the bar, you better tip BIG ." Wtf again ..don't tell me how I should tip. We go back outside to the hot and humid waiting area and wait for another 10 minutes .   Finally they call our group to sit at a table . We sit down. I can recall the server coming to our table to get our order about 3 times .. With 30 minutes in between each visit .. The great thing was , our original server had clocked out of work  Inbetween taking our orders , we seen her walk out of the door . Why on earth would you have your servers and sushi chefs clock out in the middle of serving someone ? We had to flag a different server down to help us out . Annoying .   The toro we ordered was not even tasty . Fish quality still went down since last time . They put my and 1 other group members all you can eat orders  on the same plate when they were sitting across the table from me . It was so annoying having to divvy out our sushi when they were sitting so far . Service sucks here . That was the final straw . LATA Goyemon .

G_L2k4g8wB8ELaOFeEZ7aw.text: I wouldn't say this is the best sushi I ever had, but I thought it was pretty good for an all you can eat. The selection was amazing!! There were so many things to pick from. I literally could try everything I wanted without being scared of seeing the bill. I will say it's probably better to come here with a group of people who also choose the all you can eat option (so you can share) otherwise one or two orders of sushi rolls will fill you up quick.  I haven't eaten that much in a long time, I def think it's worth a try!

lkJ9obUrJu-TMorortw6KA.text: This is our go to, absolute favorite sushi spot for AYCE. I love the half rolls option, the super white tuna is off the chain good and the tools are delicious. Everything I've tried on the tempura side is amazing. The lemon, jala jala, red dragon, and ecstasy are a few faves. I've never tried anything I could not eat though like other places. There is nothing worse than being stuck with bad sushi for ayce.   Great service and food plus they have a stamp card you do for a free meal... Been enough to earn a free one, I'm on my second card.

z53uIYmFKvzPWS8CLenI2A.text: It's passable, but overall, I'm not impressed. I got the sushi lunch combo instead of AYCE. Sadly, the meal that I got was just slightly better than buffet quality. The nigiri was TINY (less than the size of my pinky), and a few of the pieces of fish were slightly mangled. The CA roll was ok, but the avocado slice was paper thin.   Given that they do an AYCE, perhaps I shouldn't hold them to the same standards, but if I had to summarize the quality of my food in one word, I would choose "cheap". One last slightly snobbish criticism: the nigiri came out arranged in an improper order.....this didn't affect the quality, but it's not a good sign that the "chef" didn't know how to do it properly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very small, slightly rough cut pieces of fish, not arranged in the correct order.

FR-FG9mpwFzwYc62z1hsNg.text: ZOMG amazing. maybe i'm just deprived in landlocked midwest, but this was amazing. my friend and i got the all you can eat. i really don't understand why anyone would get anything else. pretty much all the regular menu is on the all you can eat menu and it's only $25. you'd spend more than that on sushi anyway!  there's a lot of reviews and i pretty much tried everything but there were a couple of standouts that i definitely got more of. clam nigiri and scallop nigiri- so so delicious. perfect chewy texture, not fishy as all, seasoned just slightly. so perfect. our waitress also recommended the black lobiko, which was a special nigiri that day. i was kind of terrified from the description - black roe - but it turned out to be delicious, even though i don't normally like roe. it was less fishy and greasy than normal roe. they also had some little side things like sauced up mussels and poke, which were also delicious.  we gave into temptation and got the udon, but it's not worth the belly space. my friend also got a bunch of rolls and they were all pretty good, but i usually don't like the rolls so i'm not a good judge.  our waitress was really awesome, always took our next order promptly, and answered all our questions. the only weird thing to me was that the nigiri came as a set of two. i asked if i could just have one at the end since i was so full, but apparently that was not allowed. they are smaller pieces, but two still seemed extreme haha. anyway, go here. you will be sad if you don't.

NPgSOGwozNoJfwk32f5IQA.text: I love this place. It is way better and has more option than Chicago ayce sushi.  We landed in Vegas at 3pm and we were starving so we drove straight to this ayce sushi for dinner.   We didn't order too many rolls since rice can fill us up easier.  Love the salmon collar!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BqmPZryIk2lXTX0J_VTOCg.text: Always good sushi at goyemon. The line is usually long to get a table but I was able to get in there within 2 mins. They usually have the freshest sushi and services was decent enough for a full house at an ayce

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good uni. No fishy smell here
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nicely done salmon nigiri

01NlHSzKq3oSToszNhHQzQ.text: Well... I would say the food was good but it didn't "wow" me. Since I've been trying most of all you can eat sushi all over Vegas. I pretty have my favorites! I would point out lunch all you can eat is $21.50 (something! Make that $22) while dinner is $27. I have goyemon 3 STARS :)   Oh and the service was great! Very approachable and friendly environment

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna poki and salmon nigiri

ucjMQLyGLiOmiNARv81LwQ.text: The nicest thing about this place is they offer you half rolls instead of full rolls as part of AYCE.  This is great because it gives you the opportunity to try a bunch of items without filling up or wasting excess food. The not so nice thing is most of their rolls really aren't that good.  In addition the pieces of nigiri just kind of looked, well, beat up, although the Tuna hand rolls I ordered were delicious.

b8KXiJmtOhL8ZlFGjVEREg.text: AYCE was a good option here. There are some items where you can only order once and those items are worth trying. I stuffed my face with so much fresh fish it was ridiculous. Nothing really popped in my mind there that was worth remembering.   The server did warn us about the rice being left on our plates and that the next time we will be charged for it. To be honest it was barely any rice in our defense. Be aware of some of the rice left on your plate or else suffer a stern warning!

mJUlHTANPYf3fyg3swMGAw.text: i usually like this place but my last experience was pretty awful. my coworker and i decided to sit at the sushi bar because we didn't want to wait for a table.  as soon as we were seated, a Spanish gentleman came up and sat next to us.  the 2 Spanish sushi chef immediately said hi to him and from that point on it was a nonstop conversation between the three of them. 15 min in and i had to interrupt thier conversation to place a sushi order. after i place my order they went back to thier conversation and 25 min later i had to remind them about my order.  thier buddy next to us tried to cover for the two chef and said that i order from another guy that left when clearly the 2 chef hasn't move from thier spot. do they think people are really that stupid? if you go here you're better off sitting at the table because the service there is much better.

EIO7480uB_Lqko4vmE12nA.text: This is definitely my go-to spot before I leave Vegas. $21.95 for AYCE at lunch?! What a steal!!! Everything is fresh and they don't pile on the rice on the sushi! It still is a little more than most places in LA but I'm not complaining.  What I Recommend - ALL THE DESSERTS! Seriously, we ordered 1 of everything. Sooo good! - Sashimi Salad - Supreme Salmon Roll - Tiger Roll - J.J. Roll - Salmon Sushi  I highly recommend the Lychee Sorbet!! It was refreshing and had lychee bits in it! They go a little heavy handed on the crab meat sometimes on the Sashimi Salad but it was really good overall! I love salmon so Supreme Salmon was my kind of roll! The J.J. Roll is heavy but soooo worth it.   TIP: No Uni or Ebi for lunch. You would have to pay the dinner price of $26.95 instead. This place is always crowded on the weekends so try going at an off time or make reservations!

89B_P60_HHGVGjt4rRTqVg.text: Amazingly good quality sushi for an all you can eat place!  I got to Goyemon on a Monday at 8pm with a party of 3. The wait was 50 minutes. The hostess takes your phone number down and sends you a text that updates you when your table is ready. My party and I were able to wait outside until our table was ready. Although there are tables set outside of the restaurant, drinks can not be served while waiting which would have been nice! This place is quite busy and as told by the waitress my party was seated within the 50 minutes. This place is busy so if you are wanting to eat by a certain time I would plan accordingly. I assure you, it is well worth the wait.  My top favorites on the all you can eat menu are: 1.) The Hurricane Roll 2.) The Lemon Roll 3.) OID Roll 4.) Jala Jala (like for Jalapenos) 5.) Seaweed Salad 6.) Garlic Edamame  I also recommend that you try the sparkling blueberry sake!   This place was great and I plan on returning soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

auciBEhANxG8syfyjRFBKw.text: Our first time to eat lunch over here but we've been earing dinner here. I don't like the service and our server PARAWI  she's down or what. If you're feeling down, sick or yired or even not in the mood. Then don't go to work! And i think the people are not morning person. And you expect a good tip?! Ok some people will say that i exaggerate cus they're living wit tips but hey you better get your attitude done in this kind of business. Our server's name is PARAWI !!!

1Z8_aSfQYHJcozf_Vc3fMg.text: $30 cab ride here to get some good sushi and pork belly salmon for lunch and was told most of them aren't available . No tobiko, no white fish, no toro, no pork belly, etc. we ordered from regular menu and the portion was sad little thing that was like half of the size what you see in any of the dinner AYCE pictures. I guess they don't have sufficient supply for lunch so most of the good stuff comes around dinner time . We ordered some tampura plate and the fried shrimp and veggies were so soggy and tasteless.   Service was bad. Waiters will stand around doing nothing instead of coming to you to order or offer you help. Had to wave in the air many times to finally get someone to attend us and it was not even busy at lunch .  Hands down. Another sushi fowl on this trip. Can't wait to go Raku sushi !  Tip, don't come for lunch. Dinner may be better

ckyRRrmAaedfQES9jez1GQ.text: All time favorite sushi place. Staff is fast and accurate when taking your order . They make sure that if you don't like the roll that it's fixed . This place is awesome for large parties as well just call a head of time to make sure they have the room . The only complaint I have is that you can't make reservations, that would make life so much better!

OUDtuJ5omDWIdBs_cMf4Dg.text: 2/10/18 @ 5:46 pm : Placed name on the list, but hostess didnt take phone number for when table was ready. When our party arrived and we went to check in but the hostess advised that the name wasn't on the list and now there were 3 people ahead. When we asked for the previous hostess she already left and the manager wasnt available until 7pm to help remedy the mix up. The hostess just kept insisting that the name wasnt on the list and wouldnt make any effort to help or understand. She then said we could cancel. She clearly didnt make an effort or care to keep the business.  This was just our interaction with the hostess. Being busy is not an excuse for poor customer service. Especially in Las Vegas. Plenty of AYCE competition elsewhere that we can eat at.

h9bEkem9cBR1z_7ReXDGjQ.text: We stopped in for lunch and got two lunch specials. I got a 2 sushi lunch special with the salmon and shrimp tempura roll, it also came with a salad and miso soup for $8.50. Quality was good and everything was fresh. Our server was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely come back for all you can eat, 21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. Lunch specials run until 4pm. If you are in the area, this place is not bad to stop in and try.

04GDQ_41udZ-YkEmqIRyLQ.text: I have more stars to give and wanted to give more. I was torn between 3 to 4 stars but in the end it was just mediocre. I went in thinking it wasn't going to stack up at all next to my beloved local sushi spot. I was pleasantly surprised at times and at other times I wanted to be teleported back to my sushi spot.    There were 6 of us who ordered the AYCE option. The stand outs were the super white  tuna sashimi and the garlic tuna sashimi.  The spicy tuna on crispy rice was good however our spot does it better and brings the heat with the addition of a jalapeno slice. Speaking of heat, the 911 roll was talked up to be incredibly spicy. It had some heat but I've had spicier and this was their only spicy roll which was a bit disappointing. The other rolls left me wanting more, more flavor, more combinations, and better presentation. They all tasted very plain to me.  Clicks heels three times ::: I want to go home, I want to go home, I want to go home.  The garlic edamame tasted like it was sauteed in olive oil and garlic, it too left something to be desired.   The options of deserts were a nice ending to the meal. I typically don't do desert at our local spot but it was part of the AYCE so why not. The chocolate mousse and green tea creme brulee were both good. However not outstanding.   For everything I ate spending only $30 before tip was a good deal. Sometimes you do have to spend more to get more.

31JFCNPfvyQVZlomg_UZtg.text: One of the best sushi places in LV. This place is always super busy and after eating here I now know why.  Seating: Fortunately when I did eat here, I was seated right away. I went on a Sunday around 1pm; it was busy but luckily there was a table for two that had just opened. I foresee the wait time definitely being an issue in the future because even just 20 minutes into being seated there was a good 10 people waiting for a table. The place is smaller than most sushi restaurants I've gone to so that doesn't help.   Service: pretty good. I saw a lot of reviewers saying that the waiters aren't attentive but I had no issue at all with it. My water was refilled more than a couple times and the food was brought out in a timely manner (about 15-20 minutes for sushi and 5 for the soup and salad).  It was pretty busy at this time but I imagine that if it was even more busy, service wouldn't be as quick.   Food: my sister and I did not have the AYCE and believe me, it is STILL WORTH IT. The lunch specials are really a highlight of the menu; if you aren't hungry enough for AYCE or you don't feel like spending the $22 it's a great option. The rolls available on the lunch menu aren't the most intricate in flavors but for a basic roll it's a win. We had spicy tuna and shrimp tempura rolls; spice level was on par with other sushi bars I've been to and serving size was a little better than average. Lunch specials also include miso soup and salad! A total win for a complete lunch without breaking the bank.   Would absolutely return and plan on it in the very near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, chicken teriyaki rolls

qhzpLuCPXMwFtwNzjrfwZg.text: My group came in after bowling our sweepers and we were greeted by a lovely hostess named Minna. Throughout the entire time we were there, she would occasionally come in and check on us, which was amazing. As for the food, it was delicious. Even though we came during the dinner rush, there wasn't too bad of a wait for certain items, as may be expected.

Ujq-h1FaRC2yYksuVcuKww.text: While I must contend that the sushi here is definitely better in quality (fish-to-rice & freshness) compared to other joints in town, the service here fails in comparison.   From what I know, the point in a timed AYCE restaurant is to get full before the time limit is over. We were given our food at a slow pace, which wasn't necessarily a bad thing as we were allowed time to digest the food and thus try more on the menu. Then we saw food on the specials menu and realized that it was also included in AYCE.  I am warning you from this point on that the dishes from that menu may or may not come at all. We wanted to try the items from the menu after our last round was over and thus ordered everything listed. We waited for over 30 minutes (can you believe it??) and the food still didn't come even after constant reminders to our waiter (he was new at the time but this is still a very costly mistake even for a newbie). It didn't take until our 4th reminder to the manager at the time for our food that she apologized to us saying that the chef at the time who creates the specials has left.   This is what I don't understand. If that certain chef at the moment is the one doing the specials, shouldn't all the chefs know of how to make it. On the other hand, if it is entirely a chef special dish only, then those items should be erased from the board IMMEDIATELY. We had our hopes up, waited an extremely long time, only to be disappointed. Because of such a long wait, all the food we originally ate all digested and we were hungry once again!!  The manager told us that we are free to order as much as we want and we will not be penalized for time. However, some people have places to go to and cannot sit down at a restaurant all day and wait for food to come at such a slow pace. This is definitely not an all-you-can eat experience where you will be left full and pleased, even with quality food. Quality service is just as important.

rWwfLsxdPpqredTzcyh0cg.text: We had the AYCE... which was good and not so good.  Sushi quality could have been upped slightly... The fish could have been fresher. The amount of options were definitely 5 stars but I'd definitely rather spend a bit more and have a la carte at a better sushi restaurant.   Seared salmon was delicous and I loved the skewered items. Uni was definitely not fresh on our visit.   Definitely look on the specials menu to see what else is available for ordering!

hCXYVYrcHya4nGCNgp6viA.text: I have gone to goyemon about 5x . But this time food wasn't that good. The new menu item pork belly was waaay over cooked & chewy. The last time I ate it, it was tender & delish. They asked me if I wanted to get another one made but it ruined my appetite for another piece. The sushi chef wasnt as nice as the last time. He just wanted to get off of work. And now they only give you one order of amaebi instead of all you can eat. I only like certain sushi & amaebi is one of them. Oh well, maybe next time.

HtkT8TbwCvlBOtS8WbExZw.text: Goyemon has all you can eat sushi and with that I think that's probably why this place is always busy but I hate coming here now BECAUSE it's always busy ): like the wait is always literally 30+ mins and even if I call ahead of time it's still always busy lol the customer service is ok it's not the best. The food now is not that great of quality either, the baked mussels are pretty chewy here and there's really nothing too special about this sushi restaurant but I mean if you want QUALITY go to umiya sushi they close at 2 am AND they're not busy all the damn time and the service at umiya is really nice and they're somewhat fast

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon roll and mussels and nigiri and rolls as

6hB8bEIRHH4uBR-CS0hQgg.text: If you are looking for AYCE Sushi then this is a must. Very reasonable priced around $25-27 I believe. I was turned on to this place by one of my training partners. The rolls are all pretty good and my favorite is probably the super white tuna nigiri (pictured below) I could eat that all day.   The only down side I can give it is the size of the restaurant. It is small and more than once I have had 45 mintue wait times. I've never actually waited 45 mins though, maybe closer to about 25-30 minutes and they get you in.  I usually attend with a party of 3-4 people. I imagine if you had a large party you should call in advance and set something up instead of just showing up and having to wait.   Customer service is solid for how busy it is. Another good thing is it is open until I believe 2am or 3am with last seating about an hour before close. We always have a good time hanging out at this place. Obvioulsy we also always make sure to get our moneys worth!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super White Tuna is the bomb!

4BSEbqJNyD9Re15Gd2MAwQ.text: Fredo is a SUSHI GOD. I sat at the Bar and it wasnt busy as it should be for a Friday. After being seated Fredo informs me he will be a few minutes. I appreciate the heads up. He makes small chat about if ive been there before. And before i have a chance to Order off the AYCE menu, he says I will delight you with treats for your tongue. From the Spicy Tuna to the Grilled Tofu Salad which i felt a little Misti Y in me for eating it. BUT HOT DAMN it was delicious. Made me Negrito Toro and Regular Toro. Ohh Man. Blue Fin Sushi ahhh delic. And even served me a special that wasnt on the menu. Also get PORK BELLY NOM NOM NOM NOM  The Customer service was excellent was always. Never did my Soda get on the south end of the levy. And I finished my meal with Green Tea Cake(always a good choice) And Green Tea Creme Brulee. Fredo is also a Sports Fan, and will tell you about Sushi Chefs he has worked with in the past. Even one who moved to Colorado and i will be checking in to see what restaurant he went to, because Fredo couldnt remember :(. And i left my stamp card at home, and they stamped and dated my reciept so i can bring it back with my card and get caught up. AWESUMMMM

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate mousse

-l3yWvhxH3qIGLR6lJ4TgA.text: Good food and price but servers need to be more happy with their job. You can tell with their body language as they get your order. I think the management should address this.

8xGupa8OUL86vZ2kA31TXg.text: I eat here all the time to be honest. Why do I still give it a 3 star? I think their all you can eat is ok. I generally come here for the bento box. I have actually gotten sick twice from their all you can eat so I don't trust this place with fish. Their bento box are great. That is what I would suggest.

h-r5ShButaUCYA_goQAbzw.text: Personally, whenever I go to sushi houses, I never eat anything but the AYCE. I feel like the value of the price relative to how much you can eat will surpass the value of the sushi itself, but that is dependent on the person. They have a normal lunch menu as well as AYCE during lunch, but I'm not so sure about dinner.   On my various visits, I've been satisfied with the service. My first two times I came to Goyemon when I ordered, I ordered a lot the first time and the server gave me this warning of a sort that if I don't finish the food, I have to pay extra. Personally, I don't like people telling me stuff like that just because I know I wouldn't order more than I could eat, but I understand a lot of people don't finish their food and they just want to be pre-cautious.The servers are busy usually, but I also feel like they try not to make eye contact with you or something so you don't order more or something, for obvious reasons. So when you need something, you have to raise your hand and speak up.  The food I would say is quite good. I am very satisfied with the quality of the rice and fish they serve. I personally love rolls, and so I am really satisfied with the rolls that they serve. I only wish they had a wider selection. Their nigiri is delicious as well. My favorite is the super white tuna and I recommend that to anyone who is new to eating sushi.

5q9jFu9Nw1wmDq1iEvgxNA.text: We are definitely coming back here again!  Despite an extra long wait (we were told 45 minutes and actually waited about an hour and 15), it was completely worth it!  If anything, the wait time is a testament to the quality and value of this place!    This ain't yo' regular AYCE sushi joint. Everything here was top notch -- fresh and flavorful. Save yourself the trouble from ordering the rolls (unless of course, that's your thing), go to town on the nigiri and grilled items. The blue and white menu,   though not a secret, is a hidden gem!    Hubby and I have talked about coming back to Vegas just to eat at this place. Seriously! Fredo, one of the sushi chefs, is super friendly too and will recommend the especially tasty items on the menu. We weren't lucky enough to get him, but heard him making recommendations to the diners next to us all night.  A for sure spot the next time we are in Sin City!

QATMMFRuGD4T6I0Gq_Ta0g.text: Soooooo goood. The quality of sushi is simply amazing. My boyfriend and I come here once a week for the AYCE lunch, and it is outstanding every time. They are always packed, so you might have to wait a little to be seated. I see people giving bad reviews for having to wait but I never see this as a downside at any good establishment. I would rather wait a few minutes at a place that is so good people line up for it then get stuck sitting right away at a place that can't keep it's tables full. I am sorry if you can not handle a wait, but this place is sooo worth it.   Be warned if you go for the 911 roll...it...is....spiiiicy....I LOVE spicy rolls, and although it was super tasty this one knocked me back a bit hehe.   I LOVE the nigiri so much. Perfect little bites, not overstuffed with rice at all. The staff always seems happy to be there, even when super busy, which is another huge plus for me.  I do not normally fill up on too many appetizers but their miso soup is sooo tasty, not too salty!! and their fried dumplings have an awesome crunch without being overly fried.

81wBaWN9KgcxGdeicDxoTQ.text: Five stars all the way from the seaweed salad, spam-filled Mahalo, Dynamite, negi toro, octopus poki, frying Jason, Cajun Albacore, finished with Lychee Sherbet and mochi strawberry ice cream.  Good value and fantastic taste for AYCE.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dynamite

AiZpfTIol9-2J-ugzuCxuw.text: BEST sushi place I've been to. ALL you can eat, the quality is top notch, and I love the size of the nigiri.  You get to sample so many different types.  The service is quick and friendly, and the deserts are TOO good. Green Tea Crembruleeee is so delicious, and their special Yuja Sorbert was very tasty.  I try to come here every time I visit, and I never leave unhappy.  Definitely quality sushi for a great price. I think they lose money when I come here with my family because of the amount we can eat!

rwAzDvqjVEwBB8Oy72jmqw.text: This place is probably the one place off of the strip that I recommend everyone come to on their Vegas trip if they have a car.  It's delicious, fresh, and all around great service!    We came here on a Saturday night, and it was really busy.  There was a 45 minute wait, but this is one of the few places where their seating estimate was actually fairly accurate.  Luckily, one of our group lived nearby, so we just went and chilled at her apartment for a while.    We sat in the little room to the side for groups, which is usually a death sentence for good service, especially when your group isn't huge (we were a group of 5).  However, the waitress was really good about coming out to check on us often, and refill our waters, etc.  They have a lunch and dinner AYCE deal, for $21.95 & $26.95.  There are about 50 menu options for each item, ranging from  nigiri, normal rolls, and special baked rolls.  It's really nice because anything on the regular menu you can get in the AYCE option (including the $12-13 specialty rolls).  When they bring out your orders, they bring out half an order instead of a full order, so that you can try more options.  Not having prepared my stomach for AYCE, I ordered the Sashimi dinner, which is 12 pieces of sashimi w/ soup & salad.  Another in our group got the SS dinner, and the chicken katsu curry.  All were delicious!  The portions are generous, and all of the fish is really fresh.    I had a really great experience at this restaurant, and I can't wait to go back and have the AYCE next time!

Ib0HcPEt8thMMLtMAjaw7w.text: Great service, quality sushi...worth the wait!! This is the best AYCE sushi restaurant in Vegas! The nigiri selection is great. Our favorite rolls are the Tiger, Chubby and Andy rolls.

MQ8VAFpZrGy27d3EqZXcbQ.text: Most nigiris are not as fresh anymore. No more Hungry Beef rolls. Pork bellies are pretty dry now,  and the salsa on the side tasted really old. The ginger too...tasted old and DRY.    Chocolate mousse now comes in a mini cheapy plastic container.  That's fine and all but...  NO MORE GREEN TEA CAKE????? Why???????

LLiED2L4K0MG0jMKN_TGoQ.text: Take all your vega$ winnings and splurge it here, folks! The QUALITY of the sushi was SUPERME.  For $25 a pop, you are granted unlimited amounts of sushi including their specials of the day.  in other words, AYCE!  I won't hit every single item I consumed but some of the key ones that I enjoyed personally were:  + Salmon Belly: If this is listed on their Special of the Day menu, do not hesitate to order this! Smooth and Yummy!  + Tempura Shrimp: I know what you're saying, how can this be good? The tempura was light and crispy.  Shrimp tasted as if it was just taken out of the water and cooked to perfection.  + Tempura Ice Cream: pretty good, light tempura shell and soft ice cream.  Do not feel overwhelmed as you can spend a couple of hours digging into every single Nigiri item.  Their AYCE also included Appetizers (all), Dessert, and Special Rolls.    I recommend sitting at the counter so you can socialize with their Sushi Chef who will charm and enlighten you with his culinary life and knowledge of the sushi world.  Plus, you can place your order on the fly.    A QUICK TIP: Ramen served in the Evening.  I would most definitely make a return when I'm back in good ole' (third home) Vega$.

Za-dR-AG3255Lxde0G5eyg.text: Best all you can eat sushi place in Las Vagas in my opinion.  However, the ice green tea is basically like green water... :(  Other than that, the food here is amazing.

jl7CiaGzeakvJllAtNOdDg.text: Amazing sushi and customer service. Lychee sorbet was to die for. Highly recommend!!!

FkZYxZTF5ranIgi9a_rlvA.text: One of the best Vegas options for AYCE. Comes to $29 and change per person for dinner before grat.  Usually fresh Uni, but sometimes its a fail. Must try the pork belly (super fatty!!) and the spicy tuna rice cracker. Fresh fish, good selection of rolls... which I usually limit to get my fill of sushi. Finish with unlimited ice cream (my choice is always red bean and tempura ice cream) and their other desserts that are limited to one.  Downsides? Service isn't great. Can be a hit or miss. And no RSVP unless it is a party of 12 or more for the private room. Usually a wait. But for the most part, worth it. Plus it is a good location for me. If you haven't been, it is worth trying.

Gehr8mIM6J2GZQiVpRkESw.text: Their lunch eat-all-you-can menu is wonderful. The sushi pieces are small but the variety is good. They even allow half set rolls instead of one full set so you actually can try more rolls!

urMLNV3pnkn3qRpGfc-d4g.text: Best Sushi house I have found in Vegas. Expect a 1 1/2 hour wait on the weekend. The all you can eat is a great deal @ $27 a head.

l09FzEBC8rruRB9dAAeSAw.text: Restaurant clean Sat at sushi bar as I would at any respectable sushi restaurant "Chefs" none of them I think are at all qualified to be cutting and serving fish All the Hispanic "sushi" chefs were chatting among themselves about management and personal stuff to care about the customer in from of them. I have been to other restaurant owner by the same owner and have enjoyed them.  THIS ONE NOT SO MUCH. I am Not an  connoisseur but   I definitely know that the rice is not supposed to be warm enough to cook the fish

AKziM3U3bK3tRjiSbE_GdA.text: Horrible horrible service!!!! What happened to this place? Food is good and fresh. I refuse to go here during normal hours but if I'm craving sushi at 2am then I'd stop by. Otherwise I will drive way across town to Yama Sushi for excellent service and food! So sad to see this place fall apart..

x4esYBH-ztE0SUeb5KEfPQ.text: By far the best sushi place I have tried. Everything is so fresh and yummy. They have a huge selection and their ayce  is very affordable. The staff is very friendly except for the seating hostess who always seems to be having a bad day, the other reason I gave them only 4 stars is because they have very limited seating, if you go during peak lunch/dinner hours, be prepared to wait about 45 minutes to an hour.

tLo95lsF0jUgEx9Y6AWIyg.text: My fiance and I love sushi and this place earned our five stars, with their excellent service. Our waitress Odelia  (forgive my spelling ) was very sweet and persistent-- as well as our sushi chef. Definitely coming back.!

lw1eDUepwY9nneJzVHXwrA.text: Good sushi, when busy service is a little slow. A great deal in any town with high quality food for the price.

emOsPgKHlOTqjZCt0yKn9A.text: It used to be great, but they've been skimping on portions and the quality of rice they use is subpar at best.   Hopefully they will change that because this was our spot to eat whenever we go to Vegas.

SFySr3uI9M9tuC1efws8HQ.text: Went back a few weeks ago. Not sure if the owner changed or what. The service is not the same, the menu have complete changed. It takes about 20 minutes to get 1 order out to us, and the sushi chef always give you attitudes. (Mind you that I sat at the sushi bar). Will definitely not be returning.

k3vgmsTnKYMXr6j6iagp6Q.text: Baddddddddddddddddd service !!! They used to be nice and great food but I guess their business got really good so they don't need customers . They treat Customers like shit !

regc5bnakKwQP3UyjciN4Q.text: Portions are so small. Really skimpy on fish. I would not come again. Also waiters are rude.

PK0hqBKgswnW0DSRGBhGVg.text: I gave this place a second try (my first time was very bad)...But I give it a try again because my friend recommends the fish here is very very fresh.   SO first we arrive and wrote our names down and waitress told us it will be around 1 wait but they will give us a call 10 mins before the table is ready. SO they called us and we told them we will be arriving the restaurant within 5 mins and waitress says OK...NO PROBLEM and we got there and told the waitress we had arrived....AND she confused us with someone else and say that "OH I ALREADY GAVE YOUR TABLE AWAY BECAUSE YOU DID NOT PICK UP YOUR PHONE, SORRY YOU HAVE TO WAIT AGAIN" SO we were all kind of mad...with the attitude that was given to us. We showed her our phone call log, that we were on the phone with them for 1min 16 seconds. then the waitress did not apologize, she jsut went "OH, COME OVER HERE" and sit us down.   Just as we thought we can finally eat!!!!!!!!! I ordered the yellow masago (not sure what the real name is) I ate the sushi...then I felt something really pointy/sharp was in my mouth and it kinda cut my gums in my mouth. I spit it out and realized it was some hard broken plastics. I showed the waiter and he immediately took our dishes with no explanations or whatever and not even apologie. After 10 minutes he came back and wanted to offer us a new order so I was like HELL NO...and he explained that the people in the kitchen accidently broke a plastic container and he apolgoized.   It keeps me wonder whether the it was the container that contains the yellow masago broke or was it another container that broke becasue it does make a differences, if it was the container that contains the yellow masago that broke I could be eating un-clean food. :(  I Guess i wont come back again.

yWeKMdnSMwL09xwKTV8pGg.text: I love their sushi here for ayce. They offer half rolls for almost everything so you can try a variety. I love the uni with quail egg, super white tuna, their udon soup, grilled yellowtail, shrimp heads, fried tempura ice cream and many many more items. There's always a long wait because it is a small and popular place. They've also been out of uni the last few times I've been here which is my favorite

6kp9l2HKgiEwF-V2UvzuBg.text: I think it is a sin not to order AYCE, so this review is only for that portion of the experience.  This restaurant is by far the best AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas.  The rolls are delicious, and the option to order half-rolls is VERY helpful is you want to try a vast variety of rolls. The servers are usually attentive; however, they can seem a bit surprised if you can eat sushi like you're a human vacuum.  I also enjoyed the side dishes. My favorite is probably the pork belly. The dessert is also unlimited (surprise, surprise), and you cannot go wrong with Mochi Ice Cream or the Lychee.  However, keep in mind that this restaurant does not take reservations. If you are with a large group, you may have a long wait ahead of you, even on a weekday. If you'd like to make a reservation for AYCE, I recommend Island Sushi in Henderson.

mOJW3DLbacBE8M8yqQq-bg.text: My gf decided to try this place on her last day here in vegas worst idea ever! We both had the runs after eating here. We waited about 15min before they made our order which wasn't even that good! How can rice be so dry n hard?! Only edible thing was calamari. Only reason why I have it a 1 star coz I'm required to lol. Wouldn't recommend this place. Staff wasn't that friendly either. Ignored us when we asked for a refill on our drinks. Charged us an extra item that we also didn't even order.

a_sgDxjEfhSrQ4-IfQLWlg.text: One of the best sushi places in town, the sushi is always fresh and they have a wide variety of specialty rolls. Parking is plentiful but it gets packed quickly here, even at first opening in the morning the place usually gets filled. Atmosphere is modern and clean and their prices are decent. Ayce lunch is about 22 and dinner is $27, service is usually always good as well despite being busy.

_I-Bj6GBgDnQOgGyKK9pOA.text: I'd go somewhere else. The severs don't know what they are doing. They knew their card service was down but they kept asking me for a different card anyways. Here's cash, and yes, I can pay the d@mn bill. Poor service. Very, very, VERY POOR SERVICE.

jxGPceF24SokeztzrsqzlQ.text: Excellent AYCE sushi!! Good variety and flavor. Will definitely return for our next sushi fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

USpmZWszZlWNY1V_EOrGoQ.text: AYCE option is a no brainer, the choices are amazing and they bring the food quick, no waiting around here. There were so many great dishes, I'll try to list it from memory:  salmon albacore yellowtail surf clam salmon skin handroll ebi uni fried shrimp heads pork belly  I'm sure I missed a lot of items, but these are the ones that standout the most. Gotta order the fried shrimp heads & pork belly, absolutely fantastic.

UCtvP1vFaZyPoZE7lwwasw.text: The wait is terrible. Great food, horrible service, I don't think it's worth going back.

YP4GkWQqOUOY4SaznWFyqA.text: Love love love sushi Goyemon! My friends and I always do "all you can eat" and we like to sit at the sushi bar. Sushi chefs are doing a really good job. We have been there many times and their fish is always fresh and tasty. Lemon roll is my favorite along with salmon & avocado hand rolls. This place is always packed and they don't except reservations, so my suggestion is to go there, put your name down and come back. It is usually 30-45 mins wait.

juHQ19Dv0ITDyxno7-VjJw.text: 1A of my favorite AYCE sushi places. 1B being Fuji Sushi in Sacramento because of their AYCE Sashimi. Let's start with the bad though. It's True the wait SUCKKKKKKSSSS.  A party of 9 people we had to wait an hour and 15 minutes. It is only because their is only two tables that can accommodate groups that big in the entire restaurant. Let's get to the good. TORO, Salmon Belly, Wasabi Octopus, and SNOW Crab Nigiri. THUMBS UP!!!!. Pork Belly appetizer lives up to the hype and then some.  Rolls were the same as anywhere else. Also the deserts. SAVE ROOM FOR THE DESERTS. Lychee Sorbet, and Green Tea Burlee OMG Service was great. I knocked down a star for wait, the sweet shrimp being only okay.  If I were compare to Yama sushi, better nigiri here but Yama has the sashmi salad and better sweet shrimp.

K9R1fj7IeCyc50DOvYvh_A.text: Four words!  GREEN.  TEA. CREME. BRULEE.  Another four words...ALL.  YOU.  CAN.  EAT.  I've been here a couple times and I was full both time!  I will make some suggestions and give some advise when you visit here:  * If you don't want to wait at least an hour you should during their off hours (i.e. lunch or dinner times).  This place isn't very big, just be warned. * They are open late with the last seating at 2AM (yes that's 2 in the morning) * If you have a small group or even just want to try something new, don't be afraid to order half rolls (if you like that type of sushi) * Most of the sushi is all you can eat with the exception of the uni (sea urchin) and the sweet shrimp * Small groups (3 or less) opt for the sushi bar because it maybe first available (i.e. you get seated faster and you get your sushi faster) * Look at the chalkboard near the sushi bar, this has specials and in-season items not found on the menu  I tried so many of the rolls I don't remember which ones I had, but I remembered I liked them all.  My mom loves the white tuna here.  You wouldn't expect fish to taste so fresh in Vegas but it does!  You must get the green tea creme brulee!  I will be back soon!  I hope I don't forget my stamp card!

-FvRjNRK_Bo9QAJjr5q-5A.text: Tried this place for the first time on Christmas, it was insanely busy, had to wait two hours to get seating, howevr it was well worth the wait. Although I didn't see that much variety of rolls as I do on other AYCE sushi joints, however the amount of Nigiri options on their menu is extensive and worthy of boasting about. With the quality of their sushi and items on their menu, this place is reasonably priced.   Like some other sushi restaurants, some items are only available for dinner and not lunch.

Nb6Twx_izVZm7kSwfNDTDw.text: Dishonest!!!  BAIT AND SWITCH!!  Specifically asked when we were being seated if they had salmon belly. Was told yes.  Immediately upon being say ordered 10 salmon belly for the table and a few rolls and apps. After a few minutes the rolls came out but not the salmon belly. I asked again, they said it was still being made. After we ate the rolls and apps, still no salmon belly. I asked again for the salmon belly and was told they were now all of a sudden out.  I told them that was unacceptable and didn't want to order anymore. I also told them I wasn't going to pay the full AYCE price for the lunch because I didn't get what I ordered. I offered to pay for the rolls we ate but the manager told me no, I had to pay full price. I told her that wasn't going to happen. Either accept that I would pay for the small amount we ate or not. She said no, full price, no discount. I told her I would walk out and she could call the police if she wanted to and she said I couldn't leave. I told her I was leaving. My son and I got up to go and she GRABBED MY 9 YEAR OLD SON BY THE ARM. I immediately told her if she touched my son again I would knock her out. As we left, she called the police and tried to block my car in. Other patrons came out to help her but when I explained what happened to them, she let us leave.  Be VERY careful what you order. It might end up with the manager physically detaining your children.

6WaePkOAVB5R59mlxwx40g.text: It seems like Goyemon has fixed their staffing problems, but I've also switched to mostly just ordering takeout instead of trying to have a sit-down lunch. The food is still wonderful and the staff are very friendly, even when the place is slammed and there's a line out the door.  Every once in a great while, they still have an off day. Maybe someone doesn't show up for work, or someone who works in the area decides to bring 20 of their coworkers out for a meal. But these are the exceptions, not the rule.

zhoOeFLlfbvNBVeVrMJWvw.text: This was basically my group of friends at this place. Mine. Mine. Mine. Mine. Mine. Mine. youtube.com/watch?v=p-3e... Basically, my group of 7, devoured every sushi plate that was set before us. For $27, I've had arguably the best sushi I've ever had and it was AYCE! The venue is pretty small and space fills up really quickly so I recommend getting here pretty early. They do have a 1 hour eating maximum but like I said, if you're devouring sushi like us, 1 hour is plenty or else this place will run out of fish. The menu has all kinds of nigri, salmon, tuna, yellow tail, they also have rolls but we didn't really touch those. Additionally, they have seared sushi as well such as the cajun salmon. Furthermore, the pork belly just melts in your mouth. Moreover, the appetizers like miso soup, garlic edamame, and sea weed salad are great side dishes to much on while you're waiting for your orders to come. The dessert here is amazing! I rarely, order 2nd servings of desserts but this place made me order 3rd helpings! This place has arguably the best green tea ice cream I've ever had. It was rich, smooth, and did not have that cheap flour taste that other places have. Furthermore, the Yozu sorbet was delicious. I think it was the greatest ice cream dessert I've ever had and I crave for it all the time! I honestly, felt bad for our waitress as my group became a hungry pack of piranhas. Have you ever seen a pack of Piranhas devour a fish? I would love to add a youtube video here but I rather not give people an upset stomach... My group has been to most of the popular sushi places in Vegas, Yama, and Koma, and Goyemon is heads above the crowd. Hands down the best AYCE sushi. Once you come to this place, no other ayce sushi place can ever compare. Extra Note: According to my friend, this place is so amazing that he beat 3 levels of candy crush within the hour... XD

eyAIAPUh1o5G_-hKQr-NZg.text: OK, it's a 5 star review, but was almost 4 stars.  Came here on a Saturday night, and it was of course busy, but there were two tables of 2 open that I could have been seated in way sooner.  The staff were trying to wait for the table between them to get up so they could seat a party of 6, even though there was another table for them opening up shortly, so my party could have been eating sushi sooner.  But whatever, I won't hold that against them.  The AYCE sushi was awesome, as all the other reviewers already covered.  The toro was just out of this world, and so was the sweet shrimp.  Everything else was pretty well above average, except for the salmon, which was nice and big but just wasn't as delicious as a few other spots I've been to around town.   Oh yes, the hamachi was great as well.  Kept ordering "one more order" at the end of the meal.  Had a couple 1/2 rolls that were ok.  I'd much rather eat nigiri.  Also tried a few of the unusual (for AYCE at least) items like the crispy rice with spicy tuna and the grilled pork belly.  Again, everything was delicious.  Also was offered a punch card when I paid, which I wasn't sure if they'd have or not.  Kind of rubbing it in my face, because I had a fully stamped card from Sushi Hana, the place that used to be in the space Goyemon is in, and then they shut down.  OK, let's try this again.  8 meals to go!

f0f7LISS16GOIR-4-26wfw.text: Probably some of the best all you can eat sushi in Vegas. However, note that the wait is usually quite long, especially for large parties. If you do have a large party, you'll likely be seated in the private room on the side. This sometimes causes service to be rather slow due to difficulties getting a servers attention from this area. Also, if you do have a large party, I would recommend not ordering too much food at a time, as it can cause some delays in getting the food. Maybe even ordering some appetizers when you first get seated would be a good idea.  Aside from their main menu, they have some menu items on their paper place mats that you may miss out on if you're not careful. One the side menu, I would definitely recommend would be the Pork Belly (only on the dinner menu though). It is amazing. That is all. As far as nigiri and rolls, just pick what you think you'd like.   Definitely don't forget to leave a little room for dessert! I would recommending trying the lychee sorbet (which is amazing), mochi, green tea ice cream, and green tea creme brulee.  Come famished, leave full and almost unable to move.

TARG5kcgbX0JN8Mg-Kx6pg.text: Quality is probably the best I've tasted for AYCE. Service isn't the greatest, but it's all good in the hood. You got drunks and people trying to stuff their faves, can't expect to be treated like kings and queens.  So stop complaining about the service or go to the strip and pay $400 for your meal.

5ys5psGh7G2Irh9vpGhG_w.text: Like most I was weary of AYCE places, I'm glad I took a chance and stopped in for dinner. I was very impressed with the quality of the fish and wide selection of sushi they make.   Must try's:  Tiger Roll Fried Jason  Pork Belly Salmon Belly  BEST MOCHI VANILLA BEAN EVER! :)

AIE7Jwn42FTtd6-CxBiozw.text: Okay I am currently sitting here at Goyemon and what happened...? Goyemon used to be my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant but not anymore. Quality of sushi is consistent but their service is not good. Not good at all. I ordered a spicy tuna roll extra spicy and boy it was wayy too spicy. They have a roll called 911 which is beyond spicy and thats what they made me. I wanted a spicy tuna roll with a spicy kick not a ghost pepper spicy roll that I feel like im gonna die after one bite... Anyway I sent the roll back and I can overhear from sushi bar something about they wanted extra spicy and this is extra spicy why are they complaining blah blah blahjhhhhhh  Also, all of the sushi was coming out so slowwwwww.... When its not even busy at all. There are only like three tables as you can see in the picture... I mean are they making sushi with their feet... Cmon... Then we tell the manager that it is way too slow and she tells us that shes trying to tell them but they are not listening or something. What kind of management is that?  Overall experience is bad.
