Ii8S5WXRSrxsUFQj-wwxeg.text: Seriously yelpers.. How many times do I really have to tell you.. GO TO GOYEMON! BOOK A TICKET! RENT A CAR! STEAL A TRAIN! RIDE YOUR BIKE! Work up an appetite before you come immerse yourself in sushi greatness! Remember not to ignore the specials!

S8vu2MbzASiC0q9h-ys4hQ.text: Really like this place and it seems to be the go to place for my compatriots and I...but out of the half a dozen stamp cards that we have finished for all you can eat...we have left hungry and angry. It's no secret that we are fat kids and can be truly glutenous at times but that is no excuse for the lack of service and being ignored. Twice this has happened,but we still are not just glutenous for food but maybe also for punishment. We have been back a few times since and it was pleasant...so we will wait.

GvnT7Lr4jn9mACB95B_ttQ.text: Poor customer service.  I was baffled to learn that because we ordered a roll that we didn't like, therefore we didn't eat, we would be charged the a la carte price on top of having to pay for the all you can eat price --wow!!!  So the customer is penalized for disliking the food...that's enough for me not to return to this place.

J4pgM_Js5g0fk9FzCLZktw.text: The sushi is amazing. But can't say the same for one of there hostess. Brunette, maybe Hispanic. After waiting close to an hour for our table, when we were done and had paid. Maybe 10 minutes later, just finishing our drinks. She asked if we were done because she had people waiting. Thought that was rude figuring we waited close to an hour to be sat and was finishing up... Then a customer came to the table and asked how long we would be because this was there table. Clearly she shouldn't have told them which table they were waiting for. Then to hear her and the group waiting conversing about what had just happened. Very unprofessional. Everyone in my party works in the food industry and that would never have happened at our restaurant.

QVTTRlQ2us01gcYGMLT9fg.text: I checked Yelp for a good Sushi place in Vegas and ended up here after reading the reviews, Good Choice! The food was great, tasty original rolls, very fresh fish and yummy appetizers, all you want for $26.95? Sold!!!! The chefs were fun and made several special things for us to try that weren't on the menu, we had a party of 4 and were seated promptly at the bar next to a couple from So Cal who found it on Yelp as well. Thanks for the spot on recommendation Yelpers!!! We will be back.

7UtXkv2xDuN1z_1otmZVAw.text: I yelped this place and noticed that Goyemon got a good review so I went with my family to try it out. However, the wait was so long. We ended up waiting 80 mins to get seated and once we got seated the service was terrible.  They were very understaffed and the fish quality wasn't fresh. The quality of the fish from the 1st order and our last order was so different. At first, fish was cut clean and about the same size. Later, on our last order order felt like the worker wanted us to leave so the fish was all different size and cut all messy. I do not recommend this place.

tWDdLm3iD3E0nbIjW-rMtg.text: this was by far the worst place i have ever gone to in las vegas for sushi.  1. we had a party of 11 people and they refused to take a reservation. once we got there the wait was to be 30 mins - which turned into an hour and a 45 mins. the worst customer service i have ever experienced.  2. our server was so over whelmed and unorganized. i did not have a re-fil until i had to ask for it. he forgot half someones desert and decided to bring it after everyone else was done with theirs.  3. i also go food poisoning from the food. i felt like nothing was fresh and it took forever for us to get our food. i was up sick all night long.  i will never patron here again and i will never tell anyone to ever waste their money there for such terrible service!

BDT6arWX4gP6ox-UjRu6qQ.text: Well worth the wait. Price was decent the nigiri is out of this work great fish I can't wait to go back this Sunday

c1vpUnpcAp4ItM3ERxnr9A.text: My wife and I stopped in for dinner and we both were less then pleased with both the food and service. The salmon skin rolls were horrible and my wife could not even eat two. The nigiri looked as if a first time sushi maker made them the cut of the fish was a joke. I would avoid this place at all cost as the price does not match the quality.

glFr_ko5m31Y2LdrmaD77g.text: 2 stars decent rolls but other than that very understaffed it took like 35 min for 3 rolls to come out!

JEEk5z1XMtruCQhNoJLmJw.text: The sushi is excellent, and the all-you-can-eat option is a very good value if you can eat a lot. The biggest problem is the lines. Any time after 7 PM (even on a weekday) you can expect a 2 hour wait time to be seated, and they don't take reservations.

jjAVJQnjsG7cEfJ8thmz4A.text: So i realized that they have the same exact menu as sushi mon on maryland pkwy and silverado ranch. same owner. Same price. Great rolls. Everything came out fresh. But they had great specialty rolls just like sushi mon. It took a lil long for rolls and ahi poke was so-so. People reviewing it talked about green tea creme brulee. But they didnt have it on menu. So i was a little dissapointed. But generally happy wit the whole experience.

w-7dMJmAymhYXj_2fzfB7g.text: wow, this place is amazing!!! they totally do all you can eat sushi right. everything about them is stellar: the staff, the decor, the menu, the FISH. our new fave time to go to restaurants it seems is around 4pm. we miss the lunch crowd completely and beat the dinner crowd. we walked in, were greeted and seated immediately. then, our waitress for the night promptly took our drink order and we started ordering and our epic saga of a sushi dinner did not stop until we were one hundred and one percent satisfied.    let me start with the restaurant itself: impeccable. beautifully decorated with dim-ish lighting. the whole restaurant itself is not very big. it is very clean and comfortable, the private bathrooms (one for men, one for women) is big and clean as well. then our waitress was excellent. she refilled our waters before we could even finish the cup. she always took down our large orders of food with a smile and gave us recommendations. and the food came out fast and fresh!!!!  we tried the specials on the board, which were short rib nigiri (just okay), conch nigiri (excellent), amber jack nigiri (one of the night's faves), and the star of the night: THE SALMON BELLY, or basically thick slabs of fatty salmon (!!!!!!). I LOVE SALMON.  we ate tons and tons of nigiri, from scallops to crab, to salmon, of course, to ebi, to sweet shrimp, to uni. we sprinkled our nigiri craze with some great sides. the grilled calamari, shrimp tempura, seaweed salad, cajun salmon, pork belly, baked mussels, and mochi ice creams were amazing. the orgasm salad, super white tuna, lychee sorbet, green tea creme brulee were so-so. next time i come back, i want to try some of their rolls! can't wait!!!!

Bx8-rP-QFMpVB8_ywH3G9A.text: I'm giving this place 4 stars because my uni was a little on the browner side and the salmon in the rolls were not super cold. However the customer service was fantastic and so was the food. The ayce option is awesomw, you can fill up on nigiri and hot food options as well, such as the salmon collar (delicious) and the pork belly. All the rolls were super tasty as well!

gjIIFFnmrqL0HmlsH2_-2w.text: This is the best kept secret in Las Vegas. There are plenty of "all you can eat" sushi places but this is the best and easiest in town. There are plenty of choices and half orders available. It is open late for after the show crowds. The best tip is eat at the bar, as the chefs explain sushi and make great suggestions that you cannot get at the tables.

0ymZdC4eXKIHC4qzAiZGMQ.text: Lot better than I expected. Love sushi and these guys get a 5, half a star more for exceeding expectations. Fish was fresh, rolls were perfect without 100 pounds of rice. Even though we didn't AYCE it for those that are hungry it's a bargain, do it. Salmon, yellowtail and white tuna sashimi, bomb. I love hand rolls with no rice, chef refused to make my hand rolls with no rice but made them a cut roll instead and he hit it outta da park all, great rich fat rolls with no rice, great job. Those of u that love Philly rolls, try this it's hella worth it, order their Supreme Salmon roll and ask them to add the cream cheese, it's a buck more, but worth it. Next time in LV, would def go back.

nepWwbG3pvzHMnDFclw2Mw.text: Food was amazing. I went on a Monday night and had to wait a bit but that's a good sign to me. Only thing was, food was a little slow to come out or order at times. But everything was delicious once it did.

QTJ_dBzqdzghtD3bVF4JJQ.text: do the all you can eat and order the pork belly its a must! i dont care if you dont like pork! the place is always pack so be prepared to wait 20-30mins

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork belly! tender af!

iy_0QD4veygjs4MY9Z9fXQ.text: Good service,fresh food,cheap price. What else can I say? P.S I will be there tonight!

TwnyehkjdF37orQqrO5WKg.text: Best all-you-can-eat sushi ever! It's ridiculously amazing sushi for very reasonable pricing. I personally loved all of their special rolls like their Red Dragon, Sexy Girl, Crispy Rice, Hurricane, Volcano, Pixie, Spider, and a bunch of other ones! I go to Goyemon each time I'm in Las Vegas.

pIyFypa22x6zj4K_QcIQ4A.text: Pretty good AYCE sushi. We waited for about 15 minutes on Sunday around 6:30pm. It was surprising since it is not a big place.   We ordered a lot! I mean everything at once. The nigiri was very fresh. The sake and white tuna were the best. The uni and sweet shrimp (only allowed one per order) were very good too.  It was hard that you have to eat all of the rice. I would recommend not get any of the rolls. None of the four that we ordered were that good. The 911 roll was good but very very spicy. The spider roll was not authentic at all.   All the side orders are very yummy. The shrimp tempura, spicy chicken teriaky, seaweed salad, etc.   Would definitely go back next time I am in Vegas.

5c05rhLE_gDGojjiyhvaHQ.text: We went here for our anniversary because we were tired of steakhouses.  The waitress couldn't smile to save her life.  We had all you can eat sushi.  The portion sizes were the smallest I have seen in a sushi restaurant and the rolls had no flavor.  We had to ask for refills and in the middle of our dinner our sever switched.  There are so many better sushi options in town.

N2_mPARdGJ8SHmMkv1XifQ.text: This used to be my go-to spot for AYCE sushi...  I even suggest it when people ask where a good sushi place is. But now I'll probably suggest elsewhere because of our experience here last night.  Our server, Pa gave us the lowest quality of service I ever experienced at Goyemon.  When our party of 8 sat, we waited for about 15 minutes before we got greeted for drinks. She came to the table without a hello or anything. She had no personality no enthusiasm and the only thing she had to say was that my 6 year old son can't eat the shrimp.  Please take Po to the back to mop the floors and clean the bathrooms or something.  She doesn't belong at the front of house.  She ruined Goyemon for me and now I'm gonna ruin Goyemon to anyone who asks me what sushi restaurant I suggest.   Bye Pa.

LJOpbzCxv_WbJyajFJQisA.text: Food - GREAT Service - GREAT Ambiance - GREAT  Everything is perfect right? There's just one thing.  I'm a regular customer here and I'm still waiting for the moment when I can drink with the sushi chefs. They're so diligent and easy to make conversations with. Unfortunately, I'd prefer not to drink alone. This might be the only sushi restaurant that doesn't let the chefs drink with their customers.   This is pretty underhanded of me, but you'll get your fifth star when I'm able to finally drink with my favorite sushi chefs in town. (Shoutouts to chef Hieu and chef Andrei & server Timmy)

EI9WD2AeaasI_OiDS9Tlmw.text: 1.) horrible service, the wait took forever for refills and sushi roll. They do that because AYCE has a time limit.   2.) horrible waitress that makes customers feel uncomfortable with her vibe and tone.  3.) food was okay, not all sushi were fresh. Again, wait took forever.  I wouldn't recommend this place, preferred DOH or other ayce sushi.

TJ1q7iNlyL1TfC5cGcf9qA.text: This place is so good. Sushi is fresh and they have so many wonderful choices. Only feedback is that they should charge less for kids. My son usually eats 2-3 shrimp tempura and rice. I don't think 6-7 year olds should be charged same as adults. Most buffet charges half price for kids.

_wKf5ufvE7IxVklsqT22Ow.text: When it comes to AYCE sushi I have a pretty simple list of items that I must have to satisfy my experience and I'll usually order them all a few times throughout.   - They must have shrimp tempura, which they had but it was pretty basic and wasn't as crispy or meaty as I would have preferred.  I also would mind it being a little different seasoning wise.  Also I might have been spoiled by the last AYCE place I've been to which offered golden crispy prawns.   - They must have uni, which they had, nothing bad about it.  I loved the uni.  It was fresh looking and very tasty and come with a quail's egg different but perfect. I must have more of this next time.  - They must have poke, which they had in tako or ahi, tasty but it was just OK.  It was more of a salad as there were a lot more seaweed and other ingredients then tako or ahi.  Little too.  - Specialty rolls and dishes.  They have the pork belly which is tasty but I would've liked it with more meat or just cooked longer, firmer and crunchier too.  For special rolls I've tried the pixie roll and sexy girl roll, really liked them both. I'll try to do more specialty rolls next time since I only tried 2 and since I'm thinking I'm going to love those rolls the better.   - They must have oysters, preferably grilled but I'll do battered and fried which is what they had. It was good or OK but still loved to have the grilled ones.   Based on my list it was just OK for me a 3.  Away from my list, they have conch nigiri which seemed cool but I found it not so good since it the first time having conch, it rubbery and tasteless.  They have baked green mussels which I liked. They have AYCE desserts which I loved, most places only offer 1 dessert with AYCE. Here I had the lychee sorbet, green tea creme brulee, and mango mousse shot. They were out of the tempera ice cream which was a bummer since that was the only dessert I really wanted.  For service they did an excellent job.  It was a UYE and we did not have to wait for a table to be setup, only for the yelps to show up.  We had half of the VIP room, shared with some other loud party but it was all good since they left half way through our dinner. We stayed 3 hours and was not bothered "Hey you gotta leave". They also were cool with separating the checks for each of us.  Goyemon is very good.  They have items that stood out like the pork belly and the uni with quail egg nigiri but there were also some misses.  It was also my first time here so I will have to give them a 3.5 or 4 for now with the possibility of improving after my next visit, hopefully again with my yelp posse or if that doesn't happen I'll just have to try everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brulee, lychee sorbet, and mango mousse shot
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fresh wasabi
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sweet shrimp, uni w/ quails egg, pork belly

tYYOZocGLKtVJ0OhzX2kEA.text: After our patience and hunger got the best of us twice before, the third time we were ready to wait...and wait we did. We waited for about 15-20 minutes-not bad compared to the est. wait times we had seen in the past. Anyway we ordered: #14 Lime Roll #?? Red Dragon (eel) Nigiri Sushi: squid, salmon, tuna & Spicy Teriyaki Chicken  Service was pleasant, everyone was nice and polite. However the food was mediocre, at best. I was sooo disappointed because I had such high hopes-I mean have you ever seen this many damn reviews?!   No but seriously, the Lime Roll had pieces of lime that overpowered the overall taste of the roll, the "spicy" teriyaki chicken was super salty and not spicy what so ever. The Red Dragon isn't even worth mentioning.   Again, staff is really nice, love the set up and ambience of the place-but the food is just not worth the wait (or the money for that matter).

U1Bvb-Oj_s7bpDf_TON14g.text: Finally returned to Goyemon earlier this month. And of course the food was delicious. No wait this time, servers were very attentive and constantly checking on us to see if they could bring some more sushi. The Lemon roll is always my favorite, such a fresh citrus taste. If you like sushi there's no doubt when it comes to the actual sushi (and that's what we care about right?) that Goyemon is top notch in Vegas.

0I05Mx4ChZWJuWOKfqkQhQ.text: My dad is only in the country for a few weeks out of the entire year. We tried to go to Goyemon several months ago the last time he was here and the wait was ridiculously long and the hostess was not too friendly so he got mad and we left without eating.  Fast forward to today and we decided to give Goyemon another try. There were way less people and the wait shouldn't have been long but we were left standing and unattended for quite a while. My dad tried to talk to the hostess but he was pretty much brushed off. Again, we left without eating.  I don't think my dad is down to try a third time and now my credibility with him when it comes to choosing restaurants has greatly diminished.   I'll still eat here with friends though.

sgaUdkSUEvCqQUid0hnUHg.text: This is the third time that I've done AYCE sushi and this was very, very good.  Tremendous selection of nigiri sushi and they had some specials on the board that were good.    I sat at the sushi bar and almost immediately Freda, one of the sushi chefs, started to ask me questions and to suggest things.  I ordered the first three nigiri selections and then he made some recommendations from there.  Throughout my dinner, he was very helpful and very pleasant!  Here's a list of what I had.  All are nigiri except where noted:  Garlic tuna Hamachi Octopus Conch Cajun tuna Masago jalapeno (forgot the quail egg, Paolo, but I'll remember next time. Crab (snow) meat Sweet shrimp  Salmon belly Spicy shrimp and Scallop yum yum hand rolls Cold tofu with 3 condiments Grilled salmon and grilled white tuna Green tea creme brulee Green tea cake Chocolate mousse Tempura ice cream  Chef Freda saw how much I enjoyed the grilled white tuna so he made me the sushi version of it nigiri style.  Service was great.  I felt very comfortable for my first time here, and I started to learn more about how to order and what to look for.  I also took his suggestions several times especially when he recommended the heads be removed from my sweet shrimp nigiri and then eaten in the soup they make.  The shrimp heads and soup were superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea crème brulée.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea cake.

dqe9RbNwKg_4l58p7_Ql1Q.text: Just felt like doing AYCE sushi. This place was not too bad.  I'm glad they did not overpack the sushi with rice. I gave 3 stars because I'm comparing with highly rated (Michelin rated included) sushi places all over america. If you were to ask me if comparison to other AYCE I would say worth a try.

FNdiZaVlLisWTSLp_ATSTw.text: The quality of the fish and food is extremely fresh. My only problem with this place is that the waiter would never come by to refill waters or take any extra orders. I had to wave down a busser who I thought would get our waiter for us but ended up taking our order and it took 20 minutes for the items to come and missed one of our orders as well. The restaurant is small so that made me more irritated as to how does a waiter not come and do their job more often? Im just glad they didn't push the time limit disclaimer. Food was great, just step up the service please.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, seared tuna and seared salmon nigiri

0praSzCZlLeCH2b3xREPcA.text: Hubby and I dined here last Sunday.. 30mins wait but the food was amazing! Very fulfilling specially when craving for a great sushi. We took a bar seat. Service was okay could be better. Overall, it was a good first time dining here! Oh and the bunny sparking sake was so good. I can't wait to come back..

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This sake was really good! First time ever

BpbVLr6BKBOzflNDWAgqUQ.text: 4/5 times I've been there I haven't had a problem with their cuts.. I usually go for lunch - I get the all you can eat deal. You get what you pay for and sometimes a better bang for your buck.. solid sushi joint

haGLbdGign0NvBTEniETGA.text: Very delicious; much too good to be called a typical buffett. Excellent value. Ps. Just make sure you finish what you order or otherwise you get charged extra. Perfectly fair. And, yes, leaving behind the rice and eating the fish only, for a nigiri, does call for a penalty, as well. A bit subjective.. But, not being explicitly told about this before being served; not fair.  However, "not charging us extra this time" & being very nice -- well played!  Yellowtail and seared tuna nigiris, as well as the green tea and black bean ice cream are all a "must try"

PdAaB_H-79TylHlkyv2F4g.text: Our go to place when the lines at the Casinos or Resorts are too long. Although the wait at this small restaurant can be long as well. I recommend going at an off peak hour. Try to call beforehand to get an idea of the wait. Don't waste prime real estate on salads, appetizers, etc and just go straight for the sushi. One of my faves is the Salmon Skin Hand Roll, yummy! They supposedly charge you for things you don't eat, but we haven't had that problem yet. Maybe because we clear our plates each time? Not good for groups due to the size of the tables and wait time.  Happy eating!

vIa37y6imkjEdZestDkRGA.text: #500 Sushi House Goymon, you now have a new fan! And as a fan, you will have exponentially more fans than before because I will bring the whole family to your location when I'm in town. Yes, the AYCE is worth the $27 price for dinner if you come with a small group of people. If you like some food porn, here's what I have: Appetizers: Grilled Pork Belly-THE BEST DISH EVER! Had 3 of these. Does not taste fatty and cuts well with the mango salsa on the side. MUST ORDER yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Crispy rice roll-Their take on crispy rice, it was really good, and beautifully presented. Another must order yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Calamari-This wasn't fried like the description but it wasn't bad, and it was cut lengthwise. yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Poke Salad-Believe it or not, it tasted like it was from Hawaii. Has seaweed, onion, sesame oil dressing. I didn't taste octopus but it was tons of tuna. Must order! yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Sashimi Salad-You would think it's the leftover pieces from the nigiri but the cuts are pretty uniform. Has a mayo dressing up top. yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Cold Tufu Dish-Sorry about this pic, I was a bit hungry but I just wanted to let you know that the 3 little dabs of sauces that it came with was a great idea. One of them was more salty than what I can remember. yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Yellowtail Jalapeno-Interesting dish, still a subtle dish but with only a slight kick. Its grilled with ponzu sauce. Not dried, very good! yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Super White Tuna-Just awesome! Melts in your mouth. MUST ORDER! Cajun Albacore-Too spicy for me, could not taste the fish yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Anago-One of the best dishes, you must order! MUST ORDER. I had 4 of these! yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Surf Clam (Hokki)-Actually I did not try this, but my friend said it was good yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Salmon-Above average, I actually prefer the cut a little thicker Cajun Albacore-Too spicy for me, could not taste the fish Smelt Egg(masago) and Tuna -Good stuff! Pretty average and must order item for me. yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Crab Meat-Tasted a bit salty and a bit frozeny. Hmm....but hey, at least they use real crab! yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Uni and Amaebi -A little watery, but it was good. Not a must order for me but the shrimp fried heads were terrific! yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Rolls: I only ordered the spider roll (5 pcs). This was not one of the rolls that can be ordered as a half roll. It was quite big, had softshell crab, cucumber, avocado, crab meat, wrapped in soy paper with eel sauce. It was more rice than I can handle, but I did eat it all. yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Dessert: Lychee Ice Cream- creamy , flavorful, I had 2 of these, need I say more? MUST ORDER yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Green Tea Creme Brulee - Awesome, matcha flavored. Can eat this all day, but couldn't because I stuffed my face with Nigiri earlier. MUST ORDER yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... Green Tea Cake -The worst item in the restaurant, but I'm glad it was this item not the sushi or other entrees. DO NOT ORDER~! :-O yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... All and all one of the best meals I've had in 2012. Oh, I know what you're saying, it's only January? I can honestly say that this place does deliver on quality and presentation. I have been to other places where the food does not come out as fast , nor as pretty, or as hot. Thank you again, and I will come back and contribute to the wait time.
