blhsP3E8DufSGU3_Hxq-hQ.text: I will still give it five stars even after waiting for about 30 minutes. The place is a bit small for a buffet restaurant. For a small place that can only sit 60 people, they have many chefs. The food comes put fast after ordering. They won't give you stuff you didn't order.  Lunch is $22 and dinner is $27. It is about same price as elsewhere in town.   The sushi was great and they have everything you crave for in sushi. They dont skimp on the fish and make the rice bigger than it needs to.   I had been to many sushi buffets, this is one of the best. And yes, this place totally beats Sakana sushi in terms of decor, food quality and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just the right size
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No name roll
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri

VIVS_H8p0dgqbfumh79nTw.text: I love this place...the sushi is so fresh and tasty! I would recommend any of the nigiri while you are there and make sure you do "all you can eat." Well worth the price. My favorite is the sweet water shrimp and sea urchin followed by a 911 roll. Be careful...it's habanero hot!

Ttk9184fepX2-cBIRL_l7A.text: Love this place! Excellent quality, masterfully crafted. If you like sushi, definitely try them out. AYCE is definitely the way to go.

qeOHLffrWyn_co29Ai9v3Q.text: Great fresh sushi here. Make sure you sit at the sushi bar though so you can interact with the sushi chefs, who are all very cool and like to talk. A wide variety of rolls makes for some very interesting and intriguing options. You have to go with the all-you-can-eat deal as well. For $28, you can go to town on anything they have on the menu, which includes appetizers, nigiri, and rolls. Sometime the place is really packed and since its kinda small, you have to wait for a while, but it is definitely worth it. The location is kind of hidden on the end of a strip-mall, but there is plenty of parking available. I have eaten here many times and its great every time. Plus they have a loyalty card program as well after 10 times dining in you get a free meal. Definitely one of my favorite sushi places in Vegas.

KP2XWCUCLUJz1Xxj6OezsA.text: My cousin who lives in Las Vegas recommended this place.  I stayed at the MGM and took the taxi out.  I think we got there around 1030 at night after the Jabbawockee show. There was no wait and We sat at the bar.  I'm glad we did because the sushi chef were hilarious. I love this place because I was able to order on the Ayce menu amaebi And uni!!! And I also ordered some yuzu tobiko, Kobe beef, ramen and a couple of other things I can't remember. Everything was superb as if it wasn't all you can eat quality. The creme brulee was delicious!! I wish we have places like this in the San Francisco area, because I would be here every day because I love sushi!!!!  Definitely my number one stop every time I go to Vegas!!

sCjpY6whp0BlA1sse0qRww.text: If you love sushi mon, then you'll love this place. I mean damn. Now I know a lot of people who hate on sushi mon. They are the "any good sushi place worth a damn is not going to be all you can eat"...whatever, get your hoity toity ass out of here. If it's good to you it's good the theory is simple. Anyway, Goyemon, is Sushi Mon on steroids. They have the same rolls/dishes/nigiri, etc. but with several added new dishes, more individual sushi bar space and it definitely hits the late night spot especially since they don't close until 3am. Generally my visits go like this:  Pork Belly with a little mango salsa on the side you say? Mmm yes please. I'll take 10 more plates. More Cajun albacore rolls...Um of course. Oh and what is this? All I can eat Tonkotsu Ramen after 11? Why no, no I don't mind going Kobayashi on this place. Wait? What?  No, I can't read so I don't know about any time limit on eating....love it

pYSP7H0-thoyzss8wPae0g.text: best quality AYCE sushi place we have been to anywhere so far. in terms of variety, portion, quality, and selection it is excellent. and quality is as good as some a la carte sushi places. on my next trip to vegas i will go back for sure. just be warned like others have said here that there can be quite a wait at night if you have a large group but it is worth the wait.

XAGwWteD6u6wrltwxhwhEA.text: Was super hungry and was feeling sushi was going to go to try Sushi Mon, but after taking a look at each of their websites it was pretty much the same menu and layout. So since  Goyemon was closer and I was getting more hungry me and my g/f came here and good thing too. I pretty much ate myself into oblivion. I recommend getting the spicy eel sauce on the side cause its freaking like an orgasm of flavor in your mouth =D. Also I should state their desert is also AYCE cause my g/f indulged herself on multiple mochi.

hy21zYaiZfmsAK3aUJ6F8A.text: Desperate to find great sushi off the Strip, we yelped and found Goyemon. Knew we were in the right place when we saw 75/% of the people in there were Japanese. Delicious, superfresh, good portions, nice ambiance. Lovely place to get your sushi on a realistic prices in Vegas.

K1m3oaBsRxkD-7KZQyQZ7w.text: Amazing sushi!!! Fast and attentive service!!!! The fish is fresh and the flavor combinations are perfect. Definitely one of my favorite sushi joints in Vegas.

d0JneOZIdJZFk2uH_POu3w.text: Freshness of fish is there; but the quality of sushi is not quite there. The rice shouldn't be breaking apart when you pick it up with fork or fingers.  Their special was the toro when I went... but it definitely wasn't the real thing.  It was chopped and stuffed as a maki roll, but was definitely mixed or wasn't the real thing. However, I give it 4 stars for the service from the kitchen.  Very good meal for the price. I would start with this place before Yama.

lcZdrZMFqevl998KWbi2RA.text: A SUSHI HOUSE I CAN CALL HOME!!! YES, it was absolutely delicious....blasted all the other "so-called" Sushi places I've visited - Service was great, server was really attentive and the food was fresh, well prepared, well presented and well worth a visit!

vd8BS5yulh2qje0_TMHwWg.text: Normally when I hear "all you can eat" sushi, I'm a little skeptical on the quality of sushi however this place went above and beyond my expectations. Every time I go here I always get the all you can eat option and  the price is really not bad at all. The sushi itself is really fresh the quality of the fish is pretty good. I like to order the uni, ama ebi (sweet shrimp), snapper, and halibut sushi. Also on the menu is the grilled yellow tail collar. Add a squeeze of lemon and voila it's ready for my taste buds. There is also a plethora of specialty sushi rolls on their menu with cool and funky names.  The appetizers and desserts are also included in the all you can eat option so I have to have the deep fried oysters (which are always fresh and deep fried to perfection), seaweed salad, and edamame.  As for the desserts they are all pretty good. Not being a sweet tooth I have to say the dessert options were better than I expected and not too sweet either.

kvV1q5Uro1CAPGEtVPXHmA.text: I normally don't hand out 4 star reviews for Sushi in Vegas, but this place deserves it and here's why. 1. price was great, $26 for all you can eat including Uni and sweet shrimp is truly a bargain. Also compared to the costly Casino options this is a great deal. The service was very friendly and was a big help in offering options. The food was very good and why all the rolls weren't the best the majority of them were very good. If I had to rate the food it would be a 3.5 but the extras raise this up to a 4. Fish was fresh and they had a nice selection of Sake. We did have to wait an hour because it is a small place but it was worth the wait. I would suggest getting there early as all you can eaters can take up some time at the table. Also a short ride from the strip it makes it worth it. Looking forward to coming back.  FYI- there's a great liquor store a few stores down in case your waiting. He has a nice selection of beers and we started with Sapporo.

YhUr-apwtqW-G4CjSJDCdQ.text: All-You-Can-Eat sushi in Los Angeles is, in my experience, more miss than hit. Well, this place in West Las Vegas hits it out of the park, on the first try. Really though, I do not see how any place in this catagory OR price range (Dinner, all you can eat, is $26.95) can offer such a diverse selecton of FRESH food, period. EVERYTHING here was very high quality, and stood up to the most expensive and the freshest selections I have had at so many, many other "high end" sushi restaurants. The Latino guy behind the sushi bar did not stop smiling and offering me tidbits and Ohhh Sooo Good morsels of anything and everything --"Hey Sir, how you doing here, I have a small piece of Yellowtail Belly, wanna try some?, and 'Hey, you like Pork Belly too?'.... it was non stop like that. Perfect Yellowtail, a nice dollop of Uni (only one order per person on the AYCE Menu, and I thought that was fair), Salmon Belly, Escarole (White Tuna, oh yeah they got 'em), FRESH Albacore.... I looked up a few times and met the eyes of the aforementioned Latino guy, and got more smiles, and more offers, until I started tugging on my belt and lamenting my recent small weight loss was just that, lost -- but wait, there's more! The small deserts are to die for. Whoever heard of Green Tea Brulee...?? Not me till now, and I had 2, thank you very much. :) The Chocolate Mousse, and the Lemon Sorbet were a tiny touch from God himself, really I mean it. This place gets my business every time I'm in Vegas, for fun or work, and I don't mind telling everybody, even though it might cause an extra 15 minutes of wait time. It is very well worth it. Plus, they close at 3AM, I believe. 5 Stars, 10 if I could give them that. Go try, be happy, leave full.

pAp-zxfU2GKPkVCXcsZC2Q.text: Goyemon is my go-to sushi place.  The quality of fish is fairly good and I enjoy the creativity of the different types of rolls that are offered.  I have a great experience every time I go due to the service (fast), food (delicious), and wait time (not too bad- even on Mother's day).

Dl5Mp7LBNsJuTYL86474Ow.text: My favorite AYCE sushi restaurant. I would recommend to come early to avoid the long line.  Since they told me that they will have Blue Fin Tuna Cutting Show on 10/21, I'll go there and have AYCE blue fin tuna & sake tasting because they are my favorites!

8kPm2hnNzXyl32jYhR0o3Q.text: AYCE Japanese Cuisine - Best in town and the best menu served. Hubby and I thoroughly ENJOYED this place and cannot wait to go back again! Girilled White Fish Miso, Hamachi collar, all of the sushi...all super good food.

NACvHHN0GAlSwVEad_vPrQ.text: Amazing sushi!  Went here with some friends.  Sashimi Salad and Cucumber Salad were good.    We also ordered a bunch of stuff and just shared:  Rainbow Roll Maguro Hamachi Dynamite (seems like it should be served differently...like on rice) Shumai Sesame Chicken ...and a bunch of other stuff I can't remember.  Also, I had the green tea creme brule and it was amazing!  Definitely coming back here.  So glad my friends brought me here.

4qlQSrG66mxqEqzPx8fdNw.text: Very very good sushi. All you can eat for $26 makes this place an amazing deal. If you take a trip to Vegas make a detour from the strip its well worth it!

O_WUkUtjSMYXv_NtKG6z2w.text: Incredible sushi, friendly chefs and wait staff.  I have never seen quality like this at an all you can eat restaurant.

aZMyK2ZIYAZGDg13hyYhgg.text: The hubby and I have wanted to check out AYCE sushi since our maiden voyage to Vegas. We finally made it happen on our fourth trek there from Nebraska. My one and only gripe was the fact that we were told that there was 15 minute wait--yay. Unfortunately, it was closer to 45. I expected a wait but was disappointed that the estimate was so far off. Oh, well. We were seated at the bar which turned out to be amazing. I finally got to try uni (yum)! The sushi chefs were all extremely helpful and funny. They were super quick to make suggestions without being pushy. I think sitting at the bar helped for faster "refills". We had several half rolls which were all delicious! We tried the pork belly and LOVED it...we had at least 4 orders. The freshness of all the sushi was outstanding. I'm a little afraid that this place will ruin all our local joints for me but we will definitely be back on our next trip!  Oh, and we were stuffed for hours afterwards so we might need to work on our timing... Either way, it was SO worth it!

OJGnMHzSguZZFrhYW2alMg.text: Haven't been to this spot for over a year and nothing has changed. Except for the specials maybe. They have awesome items on the dinner special board btw. My boyfriend and I were happy to see that you can order the salmon belly as much as you want and same goes for most of the desserts on the specials. I also tried the grilled shishito pepper which was simple but delicious. Our go to rolls are usually the hurricane, the moon, the ecstasy, the jala jala, and the crispy rice roll. Try at least one of these rolls and I promise you won't be disappointed. Their nigiri is also very fresh and cut well, but I do feel like they could use less rice. Hands down, this place has the best dessert compared to all sushi spots I've been to in Vegas and I have been to quite a lot. I ordered eight desserts for my boyfriend and I but ended up eating most of it. I am a total fat girl trapped in a petite asian girl's body. I got the green tea creme brulee, two orders of sesame mochi, green tea mochi, two orders of tempura ice cream, lychee sherbet, and green tea ice cream. I do wish they would put more sugar on top of the creme brulee so it could have the thick, crispy layer of torched sugar that I'm used to. Other than that, you must try it. The tempura ice cream was alright, but I wish I would have ordered like 10 sesame mochi's because it was that damn good lol. They also have a yuzu sherbet that is one of my favorites from here but they ran out before I could get to it. This place is awesome. Give them a try if you haven't yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was easily one of the best items on the dinner specials. Next time I&#39;m doing AYCE sesame mochi LOL
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I do wish they would torch more sugar on top for that crispy layer, but the flavor was on point.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I already didn&#39;t order enough dessert, but I hated myself for not ordering more sesame mochi lol.

KmNAF9pr5HL2ZA0Lgb9RwA.text: The only thing I like better than super good sushi is unlimited amounts of super good sushi.   [enter Goyemon]  While it ain't Sugarfish (LA), its pretty damn good and the service is killer. In fact, I might go so far as to say that its the best AYCE joint in the world and the fact that its located in Vegas only adds to the magic.    For $26.95 you can get some of the best sushi available in good ole Las Vegas, plus unlimited appetizers, daily specials and wait for it...DESSERT!  Trust me you won't want to skip dessert because they have an amazing green tea creme brulee and s super sweet selection of mochi ice cream.   My only recommendation would be to get in early and to sit at the bar so that you have your chef's full attention.  The rest will take care of itself because Goyemon does it right from start to finish.  DEFINITE MUST EAT!!!

Ljz8eMWW9U4tp-tPcA7dcA.text: My favorite thing about this place is that you can order half rolls for AYCE!  They are open late and they always seem to be busy.  In fact, I can't remember ever going there and seeing empty tables, I always need to opt for the sushi bar.    The sushi guys are super friendly, ready to chat up a storm, or leave you be if you're not a talker.    I have taken many friends with me to Goyemon and introduced this restaurant to them for the first time, and every time the experience is top notch.  Way to go, Goyemon! :)

2_ifpM7qZbJavzSd2NJJ4Q.text: This place is one of my go to AYCE sushi places.  It has great quality fish, reasonable price, and if it's not too busy the service is not bad.

DVi4ox-H1_SIDdavoPWQGQ.text: I keep giving this place another chance. I should just stop. Waited about 10 min to be seated with my family of 3 total. We waited bc there were two tables about to be cleaned and since there wasn't anyone waiting ahead of us we thought we were next. The hostess didn't even mention a wait time. So after they cleaned those two tables the hostess goes outside to get people outside to come in. Wtf. I then ask her why how long is the wait? ONE HOUR! I have a hungry 4 yr old with me and you failed to mention this to me before....why? I understand, it's not your hungry family or self sitting there waiting for nothing. This place never fails to provide you with the absolute most terrible service ever.

rGTN-4AzQC2Fipa817D_Rw.text: My favorite sushi in vegas is Sushi Mon . And this looks to be the same ownership, only service here sucked. At least when I went. Sorry if it was an off day. But still, both Sushi Mon locations are always on their A Game.

dWzvPXnpwkcNRIpg6Q1FDA.text: Goyemon is the place to be for fresh sushi. Been to many places this ones my favorite. Great customer service and amazing chefs. Busy but definitely worth the wait. Go try it you won't regret it!

BQiA5lQPQ4WxrK1Va-WWDw.text: Recently moved to Vegas area (~10 months ago) and was fortunate to have found Goyemon early in my search for sushi glory!! I have been to many sushi bars in the vegas area and a could not find one that compares to the quality of fish and service. I would recommend sitting at the bar, especially if the head chef, HIEU, is working!! Hieu concocted a pickled wasabi and suggested that I only use it on "fatty" fish, but I didn't listen and used it on EVERYTHING and even took my friends' pickled wasabi (sorry, not sorry). I loved all the specials that day from the Aji, Blue Fin, Aori Ika, Toro (1 order per person), SALMON BELLY and so much more!!! I dont think I can ever eat normal salmon ever again... Hieu even created some amazing off the menu/specials for us... then he put it on the menu 10 seconds later so we had the VIP experience for 10sec (better than nothing)... All of the sushi chefs were awesome and gave good vibes and made the experience that much better. If you ever find yourself going to goyemon, sit at the bar and order all of the specials. You will not be disappointed!! Hope this help :)

asveZ7DIKN7dy3WKXVCTXA.text: My favorite sushi Las Vegas has to offer. Off the charts delicious everything. Spicy ponzu, fresh wasabi with an orion roll is off the hook. Canjun albacore is excellent. One cannot miss item is the ecstasy roll.

Xv3AZFGa01ovuo5sg8afEA.text: I love AYCE sushi here. I think this restaurant is better than any buffet in Las Vegas Strip. The food here is good and fresh with reasonable price.

bo-e4u7agEfl_er7TlhOXA.text: I've been going to this place ever since it first opened. I used to live in Las Vegas and it was my go-to place for AYCE. I visited Goyemon during my recent visit to Vegas and I was so disappointed. Nigiri quality was the worst I've ever seen anywhere, even worse than what you see in local casino buffets. I couldn't believe that those horribly made nigiris were served at a place specializing in sushi. Half (maybe 1/3) of the sushi size it used to offer; fish was not fresh at all (i was really scared I'd get sick after eating). The photos on Yelp are misleading because they show the old, awesome sushi Goyemon used to offer, but now, it's not even worth driving there. I would never go back.

qZdWT-htPqx9A9MIcaQewQ.text: This was my second visit to Goyemon. My first one was about two years ago and at the time I wasn't too impressed.   I was in the mood for AYCE and was in the neighborhood, so I thought I'd try it again. $26.95 for AYCE with a nice sized menu.   I got a few orders of Nigiri: cajun albacore, garlic tuna, seared tuna, and super white tuna. All were cut nicely and tasted fresh. I got a few orders of baked mussels and a tuna poki salad. Both of which were great.  Probably my favorite thing about Goyemon is they allow AYCE patrons to order half rolls, score! I ordered a half ecstasy, a half pastel and a half calico along with a pixie roll.   The pixie roll was my least favorite, it was wrapped in soy paper and the seaweed paper, but the seaweed was too chewy, I had trouble breaking it up. It wasn't like that on the other rolls however.   My favorite was the ecstasy roll, I ended up ordering another half of that. Then of course tempura ice cream for dessert.  I should note that I wasn't alone, so don't go thinking I put all that away on my own :)  I gave it 4 stars due to the space alone, really crowded and it feels like your on top of the tables around you, not for the food. Overall this time the food and the service was great, I will be making many return visits.

wS7YdRb-ktWTyjlwMCFEoA.text: I love dessert and i love green tea soooooo green tea brulee got me! I went there before for lunch on weekend, we had to wait for 45 mins. It was ok. and i just went there again on monday night, no wait time but service was a little slow maybe they didn't have enough servers. but after we ordered, food came so fast. thumb up for the chef. Pork belly is amazing. sushi is good, small portion of rice. Uni is not fishy like other places. I also love garlic edamame :) and yeah all you can eat dessert! :) they limited the special dessert though but still good enough to order one each from the special ones

gD-Ewdqj0cmj81NRC69iIg.text: Hands down the best sushi I have ever had.   My boyfriend and I drive from SLC so you know it's worth it. We opt for the dinner all you can eat. We tend to order more nigiri pieces than rolls.   If you go in a larger group, order a set of nigiri first. Then, order sushi rolls. Don't order too much at once or it will take forever to get your food.   The dessert is also so good. I love the lychee sorbet, mochi, and the green tea creme brulee.   We always make a stop here whenever we're in Vegas. ALWAYS.

wrAfTFi3cf4rCFwKc5P1ew.text: I love this place sometimes service is a hit or miss. I really like the Mexican girl with the brown hair she's so nice. If it wasn't for her I'd probably knock down a star for this place  for service, the Asian girls always have a snooty attitude  Anyways food here is amazballs. I love the pork belly, salmon collar, almost everything. However, the spam in the spam sushi is always over cooked ;( the four different times I went there this summer. There is so much variety with the rolls from chicken, beef, and to fish. Plus if they recognize you they're usually accommodating to whatever kind of roll you can dream up. I did a spider roll with salmon skin and fresh scallop, I'm literally drooling thinking about it because now that I'm back in the bay area I can't have it :(. Ahhh don't even get me started on dessert, chocolate mousse, green tea tiramisu, and yuzu sorbet always hit the spot but lychee ice cream trumps them all. I can't wait to hit this place up when I'm back in vegas.

GMjdrzBD4ragb5TCzz_ZOg.text: Sushi was just OK. Sushi chefs seemed very unhappy. Ordered a side of garlic edamame which never came. I did not find it necessary to complain about this. I had just hoped it wouldn't be on the bill once I received it. To my surprise, it was.  They did take care of it immediately and apologized. I am giving it 3 stars for the overall experience not because I felt like the sushi was bad or not fresh. My experience could have been because of how busy they were at the time of my visit.

u086EFoUuW-L9jKwKS4Wkg.text: The food is not bad.  However, their service is super slow and they have time limit for AYCE.  The servers don't come back even if you are done with your plate.  You have to grab their attentions.  And I agree with someone said the chef is kinda rude too.  My friend and I wanted to sushi bar and it was wide open but the chef got angry with us because we didn't sit right next to the customers he already had at the sushi bar.  I would understand it if it was busy but no.  There are so many AYCE places in Las Vegas and I have no doubt that there are better sushi places out there.

phEpemcjFv49nbQOroRGDQ.text: This place is my absolute all time favorite for AYCE sushi in the Las Vegas area.  Wait times to be seated can be a bit long on a busy weekend, but it is definitely worth the wait.  I have been coming here since 2011, love their food and service!  My favorite include the Hurricane roll, Crispy Rice roll, Pixie roll, and Yellowtail Nigiri.

bzFvYqTW3GerllkVNno1zQ.text: We chose this resturaunt from the reviews. Very glad we tried it out. The sushi and Bento Box were delicious.  Very happy with our lunch today. Will definetly come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bento box lunch

EtXYeFZu5JM_GaEs6tW9RA.text: Here's the deal:  $26.95 per person for all you can eat sushi.  It's not one of those typical crappy AYCE places, either.  There's 2 menus full of sushi, apps, salads, skewers, rolls and desserts that you can order from.  Get the super white tuna sushi!  I had the waiter bring me 4 orders. I wouldn't fill up on rolls, stick to sushi/sashimi to get your monies worth.

NZgeoYaQqWY19yRzKFAcng.text: Can I start by saying I hate when places run out of uni! I feel like it's a rip off, considering you're only allowed one per person anyway, so don't run out!  This was the first place I actually waited an hour to eat. Sounds stuck up, but I don't typically like to wait, but I thought hey, all the good places should have a wait right? Wrong. I was really underwhelmed by this place. I felt kinda bad because I went with my boyfriend's family and I chose this place and we had to wait and then weren't impressed at all.  The sushi was typical. They didn't offer anything different or new. The only compliment I can think to give is, I believe it was the cajun albacore? That was really good here, probably the best I've had. Also, the rice to fish ratio was nice. It wasn't loaded with rice. Other than that, this place was meh :/. I probably won't be back.

vYWse8pOjATZzUSr8JJ2Og.text: Food was good. Seated quickly but confusing wait staff situation- different person has taken beverage order, appetizer order, delivered bill and picked up payment.  Cash registers stopped working and was asked to pay with cash...what??? They rebooted and were able to take card. Sushi chefs are nice & efficient.

VHWly1N1iJAV7-Ars90uKg.text: Got there last night with few friends for all you can eat, midway thru I was told no Uni cause it's out of season ( bull shit) just had Uni 3 nights ago , ok I'll live.. Time for deserts, I was told no deserts either ( fridge is broken)  Asked for the check, we get full price bill..  I'm sorry but if you go to a restaurant and they don't have staple items in the menu ( on AYCE)  At least give me a discount or a rain check for free desert when u do have it !  Or at least tell me when I sit down to order, don't pull the bait & switch bull crap. This is a restaurant not a car dealership !!!  Simple business practice!  Got tons of attitude from the server , manager was nowhere to be found.  Will never go there again , especially when there are so many great sushi places in town !  Simply put, spend your money where you get treated fairly ! This place is not the one.

9bTaaCxy2KBBKu6VcyL7RA.text: Awesome Sushi, can be purchased as All You Can Eat or Ala Carte. We chose the Ala Carte as it made the most sense for two people. We had the Ecstasy, the Lemon & the Sexy Girl each with 8 pieces per roll listed in order of favorite. The service is spot on, they are very attentive and food is very fresh. They don't take reservations and won't seat you until the entire party is present. We saw wait times in excess of 1.5 hours for large parties so get their early. Definitely worth the wait.

aNJbmw-x23_CF22476gfdg.text: Food was subpar. The presentation was nice and the only thing that I really liked was the appetizer mussels. Subpar would still earn a three star however. The one star comes from the extremely long wait time if you are eating all you can eat. 30 -40 minute wait time for only 5 rolls. Like wtf. Never coming back. Go to Doh sushi instead. Same level of quality with 100 % better service.

kovIIbXXKt_ATMDS9JwqfA.text: What an incredible place! The owner who greets you had the most infectious positive attitude and personality. Our server was quick,  super nice and helpful with the menu.  She did warn us the 9-1-1 roll was very spicy, but we being from Texas figured they didn't really know the definition of spicy and ordered it. O! M! G! We couldn't two pieces down.  The server shared my inability to eat it and the owner came over.  We shared a few laughs and she allowed me get another roll.  I went for something much casket and included cream cheese.  Forty-five later my tongue has not regained feeling!    The food was great, the environment was comfortable and the service was superior! I will definitely return over my next 4 days while visiting Vegas.

MA-Vn2XlJgdbeBn6ijT6Bw.text: Never even got in.  I imagine with such a line at 7pm, and me being the only round eye in it, the place must be good.  But since I was falling down hungry, I had to go someplace else.  Maybe next time.

M8TOPjdo8zMOtg3a5EzWDA.text: Fresh,  good atmosphere,  ask me later I'm busy eating!!! We sat at the bar this time,  food and service was/is excellent!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assortment!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s time!!!

6atfq_YttfmD5gc0N5VJoA.text: One of the best sushi places I've had! Location is a little strange and out of the way but well worth it. Yelpers were spot on with their raving reviews of Goyemon. The inside was very nice and clean and didn't smell :) It was a packed house which is always a good sign of a great establishment. We sat at the sushi bar and Ivan, our sushi chef was amazing. Of course we ordered the AYCE. Loved the fact we can order 1/2 rolls so we could try lots of different items. The nigiri was the perfect bite size. We enjoyed the Hurricane, garlic tuna, masago with quail egg, and I also tried the 911...spicy habanero HELL! We made friends with nearby patrons & started sharing but none of them dared to try the 911. I couldn't feel my face after eating it, thank goodness for the nearby sugar packets to help put out the heat. To finish our meal, lychee sherbet...refreshing and light. Definitely at the top of our list for sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love shrimp heads
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 911...habanero sauce...holy $#!&amp;%!!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. JC...chef&#39;s special

rHYL5lta9ivGEWhIC4qhkA.text: Wow, I'm impressed! Dinner AYCE $26.95 + tax.  I'm in Vegas yet again and wanted to try a new sushi place! Yelp app directed me here, and I was certainly grateful. Fish quality very good. They have uni, sweet shrimp, conch and white Tuna! Service is super fast - love this! 20+ variety of rolls, 10 appetizers. Must order the pork belly. Tempura ice-cream and green tea creme brulee are both well made. Presentation is superb, service is very friendly and attentive.   Oh, they have punch cards. 11th dinner is free!

CoFUuIc7FDNlJb0FXfL11Q.text: I love this sushi place. The staff is always nice (with a few exceptions) and the fish is the best quality. If it's just two of you I would say to do the bar, the bar chefs are so funny to just hang out and talk to. Be warned though of you go  after 7:30 on any night there's a good 25-40 min wait

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our bar chef hiro is the best!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon belly nigiri!

8jDDZTGcB6-FpMibFXfKWw.text: The best thing about this place is that it stays open late. Definitely wasn't a good experience and a good reminder to stay away from All You Can Eat sushi restaurants. Quality and service were very poor.

iaSGu68yRx4mIcayD96vVA.text: I was going through and cleaning up my bookmarks when I came across another review I somehow missed. *Gasp* For Goyemon of all places!  You can probably already guess that I love this place. Vegas has a sea of sushi spots, so I imagine it's hard to stand out and really impress. Somehow, Goyemon manages to do so. It's hard to explain, but I think it's just the intangibles that put Goyemon in a special place in my sushi-loving heart.  OK so the truth is that I've only been here twice. But both times were with a large group of fantastic friends. So maybe that has something to do with it. Both times were in the private room off to the side and we had reservations, so I've never had to wait for a table. And most importantly, both times, the sushi was top notch.  My favorite memory of this place was when my cousin and I decided to order every single nigiri item on their AYCE menu. Yep. We simply told the server, "1 through 27." Doesn't get any easier than that! They brought out our nigiri in batches of 9 pairs. It was like nigiri heaven. Probably the only negative I can even think of is that they don't have tobiko. I need my tobiko with quail egg! Oh well. Masago with quail egg works too.  Goyemon also has a good selection of non-sushi items. Did someone say pork belly? Don't mind if I do. And their dessert. Maybe I should have started the review with dessert. Hands down, Goyemon has the best selection of any AYCE in town--lychee sorbet, plum wine jelly, tempura ice cream, and much more. And you can have as much as you want! That's certifiably insane.

wR1BKAPP-Sv1ElZSRAJDRA.text: We brought two kids to this restaurant yesterday and they charged 3 dollars for 3 years old and full AYCE price for 4 years old. Doesn't make sense.

ZIJ33vf74flGwUnmCbpz-Q.text: Being a SF Bay Area kid that also spent a few years on the coast south of Santa Cruz, I may be a bit spoiled when it comes to sushi. I mean, sometimes I'm just plain hungry and grab a platter of sushi from Trader Joes but I know what I'm getting for the price I'm paying. Now, this being Vegas and it being an AYCE place, I wasn't expecting superb and super fresh stuff. I was pretty sure I would've been better off ordering rolls but I had been watching an old Japanese drama of mine that focuses on nigiri so it's what I was craving. Anyhow, my impressions were...  [--- Pros ---] - Pretty nice to have a sushi place only a short walk from my place - Pretty good price for AYCE (We went for lunch) - LOVE that the AYCE isn't limited to sushi but includes appetizers & desserts. - Baked mussels were pretty awesome. - Lychee sorbet with little lychee bits. Yep, my mouth went to there. - Miso wasn't overly salty which sadly so many places get wrong. - Tamagoyaki was a bit on the sweet side, which I love as I consider it to be my 'dessert' sushi. =) - Enjoyed the seared sake/salmon enough. - Food came pretty quick and servers were generally attentive. - Definitely ordered enough to justify the $22.  [---Cons---] - Nigiri serving size. Now, as it is AYCE, I can kinda let this go as I'm sure they're just trying to make sure people are/can finish what they order, especially when it comes to the sushi but the nigiri were pretty itty bitty. Again, I probably should've gone with rolls over nigiri.  - But even the appetizers came in pair servings. The baked mussels I can forgive but tempura? Gyoza? Eh...can throw me 3-4 pieces at least, especially for the actual size of them. - No inarizushi? =/ Isn't that a standard for a sushi place? And it's tofu pouches so it's not overly expensive to make so I don't know why they don't have it... - Also, futomaki is a 'special' 5 piece only roll? I would think it's more of a standard than a California roll, which is under 'Regular'. Sadly, by the time I noticed it, I was already pretty full. Oh well, next time. - Teriyaki sauce on unagi? Tsk tsk... Unagi = unaju  All in all, it's decent place to fill your belly on the cheap but I wouldn't recommend it for their nigiri unless its the tamagoyaki, then go wild! Definitely order some appetizers along with your sushi to get your monies worth in more protein than rice. Again, the mussels were delish. And save room for dessert. When I go back, definitely gonna try out the rolls... I figure that it's at least a step up from the sushi that's served at the buffets that's just sitting out there for who knows how long.

G11hEVRhEMWD1Xp2S9LmcQ.text: I'm a local here and I finally got a chance to stop by Goyemon sushi house. Had this hilarious server, think his name was Kevin, awesome synergy and quick banter with the chefs. He got them fired up to make me my damn sushi! Fish was fresh and delicious, highly recommend Kevin as a server!   PS: I was looking at some math problems on my phone and he even helped me solve some of them, now that's what I call customer service!

iBaNuToseHLt4vwExyM0CA.text: I only eat sushi here. It's always busy which means the sushi is super fresh. Go for the nigiri and try not to fill up on rolls. Order large amounts at once or you'll be waiting for awhile after each dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared salmon up top, eel in the bottom left and seared tuna in the bottom right.

1aQtXcFMW7GnbeS7ZUqRUg.text: This place would easily have earned four stars if not for their lack in service.  It's surprising how small this place is for AYCE.  We arrived around 5:30pm, expecting to have to wait at least an hour for my party of eight.  The wait was as expected, but what killed me was that we were placed in this little "secret" room off to the side - a room that had been closed off and EMPTY since I first arrived!  Um, why weren't we just seated here to begin with instead of having to wait?  As we prepared to sit, two friends called to let us know they'd be joining as well.  I let the hostess know, apologized for the change, and said that we totally didn't mind squeezing in together.  The table had plenty of space, and all we needed was two chairs and place settings.  That's when our main waitress started to get snippy.  She was short when answering questions and had an air of attitude about her to a point where my friends and I found ourselves staring at each other in awkward silence on more than one occasion.  Thanks for a lovely meal (yes, you can sense the sarcasm).  Lastly, I didn't learn until after we had left that Sushi House offers a loyalty program - one stamp for every visit, and ten stamps to earn on free AYCE meal.  They probably didn't even offer me one on purpose, since I'd have earned my free meal during that visit.  Shady.  Food, and the variety if it, was fine, but if I were to return, I'll come back with a much smaller group.  Hopefully service would be better then.

9b78aq5wy45yV-dJsCE2Tw.text: Hotate Hotate Hotate!   My favorite! The fish is so fresh and yummy! One of the best places to eat AYCE and includes Nigiri! Hotate, fried shrimp heads, hamachi, ikura, amaebi, hirame makes me a happy!   Sit at the Sushi bar, Ivan will take great care of you. He was great!!!!! Thank you Ivan you helped me convince my cousin why Goyemon is better than the rest!

3NgtimYowmARXUTFPmTk5g.text: Goyemon, not sure if it means something in Japanese but in my dictionary it means "never ending deliciousness".. Everything is fresh and so finger licking good (yes, put down your chopsticks and eat with your fingers). Love their "melt in your mouth" white tuna sushi, salmon and yellow tail kama, always always order the pork belly and oh the desserts are just so om nom. Chocolate mousse , vanilla mochi, green tea creme brulee, delicieuses, keep it coming !!!  Seat at the table or at the sushi bar, either way you'll get a great service. If anything, the amount of time waiting for seats to open up could be quite long since it always so crowded for dinner but then again it is worth it.

99NrSwDrKsGJxK-NJIrLZg.text: I Love all the sushi here!! Their shrimp tempura is my favorite in all of vegas so far as well as their Mochi ice cream.

6_yDRY16Vow0A52hv6aXYg.text: We came for uni. But it's one order person. Small letter write on menu. hard to notice:((

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We came this restaurant for uni. The uni is ok and it&#39;s one order per person. :(((

6yMcVdRRBo8HHPJCxfghzQ.text: The all you can eat option is amazing! What I really like is that the chefs will do half cut rolls which provides the opportunity to try a lot of different food without getting too full.  The sexy girl roll was my favorite. Watch out for the 911 roll, it should come with a more extensive warning.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g2fk30t3oqxpjiY6jxnY0g.text: My sister raves about this place and insisted that we come here. For me the food was ok, just ok. I was not really impressed with their flavors. Service was ok though, nothing memorable, it's nice that they have a room that can fit a large group. Would I eat here again? Yes. Would I recommend it? Hmmmm.. if it was the closest and most convenient one... but I would probably recommend other AYCE's before I recommend this place. Would I crave to eat here? Probably not.

ygeV2hbRJEccQDvx5c4vpA.text: It went down at Sushi House Goyemon.  I put in work at the AYCE sushi dinner buffet.  The sweet shrimp is the best.  The super white tuna is a winner.  I tried so many different rolls, I won't bother to even list them.  The dessert was on point (strawberry Mochi, lychee sherbet, and the creme brulee).  Service wasn't super friendly, but they showed up frequently and kept the dishes coming out fast and in this case, that was all I really needed.  The value is there, the food quality is there, the selection is there, not sure what else you really want for an AYCE sushi buffet.  Maybe I'm easy to please when it comes to ayce sushi, but I was a happy camper.  Give them a try.

n-zo_sWlkjUFiRua2Vet-g.text: Hands down best AYCE sushi spot in town. Service is great. Fish always fresh and delicious. Do expect a long wait during prime dinner time. They don't do reservations so anticipate about an hour or so wait if during rush lunch or dinner hours.   They do not stuff nigiri or rolls full of rice to fill you up. They also have specials on the board all time with Toro and other delicious items.   We've tried many other places in town and Goyemon is our go to AYCE from now on. You won't be disappointed.

GUb5B-auPSq3un8t-YsphQ.text: My favorite all you can eat sushi spot! Service is always pretty quick and fast. Their fish to rice ratio is perfect. Fish quality tastes very fresh. To accompany my nigiri, I always ask for a side of yuzu citrus, jalapenos, and sriracha. It goes well with the scallop, yellowtail, and salmon. Their salmon skin handroll is crispy and delicious. I love that they have daily specials including different toros and exotic fishes from Japan. The green tea creme brulee is so delicious! Great deal for such great quality food!

avzfDuhhim8-a53PNKXNYA.text: Still experiment with the sushi life and I love this place. Went there with a bunch of co workers and really enjoyed the food. The servers and service was not the best but the food made up for it.  Don't remember the names of the rolls but the yellow tail Nigiri was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

na-0-4BrlNMZO-27HqfVgw.text: I've been here many times before, with each visit the quality of the sushi has gone way way down.   Decided to come here tonight, because my daughter wanted sushi and it was late and we're closer to this place then heading to Chinatown or anywhere else.   Bad decision. Waiting for a table, no problem. But being seated and waiting almost 40mins for our first roll to come out...horrible!  Will never ever be back. And you can bet I will let everyone I know not to come. Your excuse is, so sorry we are busy! When are you not busy, this is not am excuse! Hire more sushi chef's or train them to be quicker!

Lp54xJEiSgaL2iXMvLh1dw.text: One of the worst all u can eat sushi places in Vegas. So many things are wrong with this place. The food quality, pricing and customer service. Sushi rice was cooked with less water and rice vinegar which made sushi taste worse. The most of fish we ordered weren't fresh. Fresh scallop we ordered had too much lemon taste and I believe the chef try to cover the dated fish smell by squeezing lots of lemon. Albacore we ordered had faded color. Little Tokyo roll had absolutely no flavor which my wife and I just had one bite and left them all there. Server was very unprofessional and rude. She kept complaining about us leaving he rice even though we told her about the problem of rice. We had to just walk out from the restaurant. Stay away from this place.

f3ObZamCohyxSmud5DGugg.text: The food does not disappoint! Just make sure to come in early if you don't want to wait. We had 3 girls in total including me, and the wait time was one hour! It was a busy night, and expect a tight squeezed restaurant. Not that it was a bad thing or anything.. Overall the food was great and came out FAST ! We sat at the sushi bar, so our sushi man was taking our sushi orders and they came out faster than I thought. The only reason why I didn't give this restaurant 5 stars because some of our side orders didn't come out until later. I'm assuming they had forgot about it. For example when we pretty much finished all of our food, they brought out the steam dumplings but the steam dumplings were room temp to cold already.. ):  NOTE: If you are doing the all you can eat, they will not give you a bill until everything is finished off your plate. At least that's what happened to me when I asked for my bill when we were almost done eating. We sat in the corner of the restaurant and our servers didn't check up on us too much so I didn't feel like waiting on them for the bill. (Hence why I asked for the bill.)

cOxJaSWJUC-WlL5dyon3qA.text: Horrible service  I come over here cuz i saw a video at you tube, but it was horrible, all you can eat is good, they seat us and after 10 minutes a lady come to my table asking if everything was ok, no way for real, they dont even offer us a drink went they seat us, not even the server come over, and then they come to ur table with  large faces, they either get mad if u ask them for something u need,  other tables  that come after us got service first, i mean whats wrong with them ?  I order a dessert they bring me something else,  IF YOU APPRECIATE YOUR MONEY DONT COME OVER HERE, go someplace else

w0Amm0eGQDHT3BEDCSgtlg.text: Lychee sorbet is the most important thing on the menu! But the Sushi is also very good and fresh! They have very unique rolls which is nice to have the option to try something not so traditional. Sexy girl is top 3.

ZN-3HcAqa0jOEMe9WXqfUg.text: Great place for some AYCE sushi. One of the few places in town that will let you order fresh scallops (no limit). I usually do quite a few orders of the scallops. They put some fresh lemon juice on top which is a great compliment to the scallop. Make sure you check out their blackboard for their specials. Sometimes you'll catch some bluefin tuna on their specials. My favorite is when they have salmon belly. One of my favorite cuts of fish. Another great thing about this place is that they let you order half rolls. Gives you a chance to try lots of different rolls.   This place does get busy. So expect a wait during prime times. They do open late. Until 3AM. I usually try to come during the off hours. Never a wait and you get your food fast. I try to sit at the sushi whenever I can. The sushi chefs are great and friendly. Also the fastest way to get your food because you can order right there with the chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh scallops and Salmon belly

wcwpjiYRHk0HEHg3JZIVCg.text: I love Miguel , the sushi chef he is super friendly and amazing! He makes outstanding sushi and wow I love coming here the service is outstanding and I always get the buffet. Although the sushi takes awhile. Miguel always gives us quality and awesome sushi! He needs a promotion!!

yx6A1mfsowKr7Y5EOoj9Iw.text: Tonight was the best experience we have ever had eating here. We ordered mostly nigiri - garlic tuna, salmon, salmon roe, whitie tuna, tamago. The staff went above and beyond our expectations as they caught the fish and prepared them all on the spot! They even milked the salmon for the eggs. They took time to grow, harvest,  skin, and slice the ginger to perfection, which is also why it took 30 minutes to get a small side of ginger. FYI, I did some research and did you know that ginger takes 8-10 months to grow! We got it in 30 minutes! AMAZING!  The staff was so great that they saved the best for last. After we got our dessert and the check, they brought out the unagi. They already took away our chopsticks and plates, so we had to eat our unagi with our dessert spoons. It's a bit unconventional, but very creative.  We expected a normal, 1 hour dinner. But instead, they took the extra time to make sure we received the full blown 8-course meal style, 5-star, dining experience for 2 hours. We were impressed with their unforgettable service!

gQaSSqrikhZBXpyITl87Kg.text: The quality of nigiri here is great.  +1 to the chefs.  However, the customer service here is HORRIBLE every single time I'm here.  My friend and I both work in the food and beverage department, so we understand what they go through.  We provide hospitality to our servers hoping they'll reciprocate the same gesture to us.  lol..  Our waitress was monotonous, lethargic, inattentive, and forgetful of our items.  She didn't greet us with a smile once we were seated.  I'd say more, but I'm sure you get the point from here. There were only six tables seated that night, and it took roughly 25-35 minutes for our server to help us.  Please take notes from Timothy (other server who was working) because he knows how to properly do the job.  The management here needs better judgement when hiring their servers.

dBUJ5F-q41-hxoPR3Z72BA.text: This is my go to place for ayce sushi. My boyfriend and I go here almost every month. It's the only place in town that has snow crab. Other places serve imitation crab. They do have specials that change out almost every week. What I like is that they also do half rolls, this way I"m able to try more rolls. The restaurant is a bit small so expect a wait during dinner time, especially weekends. They also have a stamp card. The only thing I wish they had were oysters. Other than that, great service and fresh fish!

SLtPolbu9NLx-WkWTzdNgQ.text: This place isn't as big as I thought it would be, and the long wait time was also another surprise. We arrived a little after 2 and the host advised us our wait wouldn't be longer than 30 minutes, but we ended up waiting an hour. If I had been in a party of 2 instead of 3, we would've been seated a lot quicker so keep that in mind...  As for the food, I really enjoyed the nigiri and the rolls. There's a ton of options and you can order half sized rolls for most items, so it gives you the chance to try a bunch of different varieties. As for appetizer/small plates, there weren't a ton of options compared to like Oyshi or Sushi Kaya and all that I tried wasn't too memorable. I did like that they had Lychee ice cream since that was a first for me, and it was super good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rWPvrfDbZLtzgeISOuT1BA.text: Horrible service!!! They didn't want to service us because my 5 year old who is EXTREMELY picky brought French fries from an outside place. The server told us that he could not provide us service because we had brought outside food and then proceeded to tell us that the only way this could be solved is if my child sat outside and finished his food. They handled this very unprofessional and really, who sends a child to sit outside like an animal to finish their food? I have never been turned away at a restaurant before because of this. Never going here again and if you have picky kids like I do who will only eat from certain places DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME GOING HERE. Never going back there. Trust me there are many amazing sushi places that provide exceptional service in this town other than Goyemon.

uYjocSH7hrzRf5-3LFUS7w.text: This is one of my go to ayce sushi joints whenever I'm in Vegas. The fish is always fresh and the piece of fish and the rice are just in the perfect size.   You would get 1 hour to eat for dinner which is actually plenty of time. The food would come out pretty quickly. Just depends how busy they are.   They have a late night dinner special for the lunch price. The only difference is you wouldn't able to order uni or sweet shrimp and the items with a red dot  next to the items.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni &amp; sweet shrimp
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail belly

f-nwQMP_d6D5hXMnalMABA.text: This sushi house is always a place I find myself coming back to.  They always have the standard rolls you'll see in most places, but sometimes they have nigiri specials each day.  They also have other options for those people in your party that are not into raw fish. That's what's nice about the place. It's just very versatile in what they offer their customers. Most sushi houses serve the same items, what makes a sushi place something I keep returning to is he service. The staff was very attentive and coordinated as a team.  They were able to get the rolls out at a reasonable time.  Overall, if you're near this place and crave sushi. You should stop by.

L4DFDqW_bkTt9xbixVuG0w.text: We sat at the bar and waiters, waitresses and chefs went by without even greeting us. After almost 10 minutes without being greeted or served we decided to leave.   This is the second time we left this place because of their bad service and we won't be back.   It's sad to see this place go down, it used to be good back in the day.   We ended up going to Sushi 21, right on the corner. Got there;  we're greeted by everyone; we ordered and I went to wash my hands. 3 minutes later, when I came back, the first roll was already at the table. Service keeps customers.   Bye Goyemon.

1YGIvbGr8CuDm-dgOp8jXA.text: The dining experience here is okay, but could be better. Firstly, after being seated our order was taken as per usual in an all you can eat sushi restaurant. The first thing that was noted was how long it took for our orders to come out. I understand that sushi is something that shouldn't be rushed, but I think the service here is somewhat slower than other competing sushi restaurants! The rolls and nigiri itself were good, I appreciated the bigger piece of fish to rice ratio. Also, the first thing we ordered was miso soup and it got missed in our order, so we had to remind the waiter of our soup not coming out.   I wasn't able to get a picture, but my boyfriend had some ikura, which I'm pretty sure was spoiled because he said that it tasted very fermented as well as it looked foggier than usual. Kind of unsettling with the quality.   Lastly, I'm huge on making sure water is refilled, and they didn't come by once during our entire meal to fill up our water. In the grand scheme of things, I don't mind asking for water if I need to, but it's nice when I don't have to!   Overall, dinner here was alright. Nothing out of the ordinary, so if you're in the area and wanting sushi, it's good for the stop. But if you're looking for somewhere to take your family or for a more satisfying experience, I would consider driving somewhere else.   BUT if you do come here, get the lychee sorbet for desert. You don't find this at a lot of sushi restaurants, it was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea ice cream and lychee sorbet
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna, salmon belly and tamago nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso soup

7IE_Rggfpvr5sdwphkVgJw.text: Compared to other AYCE this is one of the better ones.  The fish was all fresh, they were heavy on the rice which is expected, but most of their rolls could be ordered half rolls which was great.  In order to be seated your whole party has to be here so don't make that mistake.  Even coming on a Wednesday night, around 7pm there was a slight wait.  We didn't have any problems finding a waiter/waitress to take our order and they were extremely efficient and nice taking our order, picking up plates etc.  What was not efficient was 2 sushi chefs on a busy night.  We couldn't tell if it was strategy or not but it did take awhile to get some orders.  One of my favorite things about this place was the fact that you can busy fresh wasabi.  It's always a game changer if you ask me.  Good spot, good sushi, come when it's not as busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared salmon
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6bfa_JSMN9FomXWd5qmE6Q.text: I've been going to Goyemon for years now and it is one of my favorite AYCE sushi places in Las Vegas!!  The service here is always very friendly and quick, even if it's very crowded. If you come during peak hours or on the weekend, expect to wait a little bit since this place is pretty well known. The orders of sushi come out very quickly and you usually don't have to wait longer than a couple minutes to re-order.  The food itself is high quality. Last time I went was two days ago, and the fish to rice ratio was great. They don't stuff big balls of rice in their nigiri like many other places do. Personally, my favorite things to order are salmon nigiri and unagi nigiri. My friends also like the super white tuna and the seared salmon nigiri. The appetizers here are also very good. I love the garlic edamame, fried calamari, and shrimp tempura. Last but not least, this place has unlimited dessert!! The fried ice cream is my choice but the matcha green tea ice cream is also great.  Overall, I love coming to Goyemon. Their food and service keeps me coming back and I can't wait to eat here again

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super white tuna
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared salmon nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon nigiri

E7TFS3f8yAAMu4d5ODWDcQ.text: Fast service and good food. Went during a Sunday lunch rush and the service was prompt and we disnt wait too long between rounds of food.  New favorite spot.

bHgW-TgHnqd9EPiMMIcfYw.text: So between that time when their service started to tank along with the fish to rice ratio tilting towards the latter, we decided to avoid Sushi House Goyemon for a while. A friend made a recent visit and cited that our favorite sushi place has made a complete turnaround. The new staff is noticeably better and attuned with their patron's needs and requests. But the biggest surprise is the quality of the sushi. We now get big slices of the fish, even the yellow tail roll has visible chunks of the fish making up most of the roll unlike before where you'd need to wade through a lot of sushi rice. Nice job Goyemon, you won our hearts (and stomachs) back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Hamachi Roll
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet shrimp, uni and &#34;candy crush&#34; sashimi plate
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Shrimp (ama ebi) Sushi Nigiri

5IRTh2VYhpkoUTPSTabWbA.text: Another favorite sushi spot of ours, we don't come here as often because it is so far from us but it's definitely worth a trip every once in awhile. Be aware that if you come during peak dinner hours the wait time will be around 30 min. They take your number down and they text or call you when they are ready for you. The service is quick and the food is so fresh.  They also have a nice specials board that changes often and it gives you the chance to try different things you may have never tried. I tried sea cucumber for the first time here. Our absolute favorite is the uni (sea urchin) and the amaebi (sweet shrimp). It's so delicious here it's just a bummer you can only get one order of it with all you can eat, but totally understandable since it would probably be gone after my girlfriend and I came in.  Everything is reasonably priced and the atmosphere is very casual with dim lighting so it would be pleasant for a nice date. One thing that Goyemon stands out over any other sushi is that it stays open till 3 am. If that doesn't say Las Vegas then I don't know what does.   The service for all you can eat sushi is never bad. We aren't paying for a fine dining experience. They just come by take your order and the food is brought out shortly after. You can't complain.  One of the best All you can eat sushi spots in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni (sea urchin) also delicious!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid, scallop, surf clam and salmon roe (on left) Jala Jala roll (on right- not a big fan it was pretty dry)
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi (sweet shrimp) delicious!

60-Kx_IZ6tmq83aE5XF0ig.text: We can't stop going to Goyemon, last night was visit #12 in about 3 months. The all you can eat is much better than one would expect; there Is a wide variety of choices and it's always fresh and tasty. The price can't be beat and as a vegan, I have no shortage of excellent dishes to choose from. The service is fantastic with Tommy, Sanae, Roxy and Ulysses providing outstanding service! We're already looking forward to visit 13!!

4vnWcjyuTpGc4hR0wIST9A.text: My friend took me here after a show around midnight, and we ate until 2 am in the morning. For all you can eat, the quality is quite amazing. We had so much food and it was for a very reasonable price. However I personally thought some of the rolls were on the heavier side. I don't think it's necessarily the restaurant's problem. Could be what my friend ended up ordering.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hRQ_ZJfCRA_66pEUbwwRFA.text: This is my go-to sushi spot now. I don't waste my time visiting Genki or Kuru Kuru back home anymore. For about $25 you get all you can eat sushi including appetizers. If you go for dinner, you get some deluxe items too like the pork belly (it is so good, it melts in your mouth!)  When I go, I like to sit at the sushi bar so you get faster service from the sushi chefs. There were two when we arrived and one helped us the entire night, the other one didn't say a word to us, or any other customer for that matter, even though he was standing directly in front of us at the sushi bar. It felt like he didn't want to be there, or was not the nicest person. We heard him make some inappropriate comments to another worker under his breath, but only we could hear since we were so close.  The sushi was all delicious, my favorite rolls are the Sexy Girl and Hurricane - I could eat those over and over again. For the appetizers, the tempura is well made, the calamari is good (in strips) and the dynamite is dynamite!  I know there are a bunch of AYCE sushi places in Vegas but out of the handful that I've tried, nothing's been able to top Goyemon, especially for the price.

01SPumIhR6iOWw8e7Q1Hlg.text: This place is so delicious. As a visitor from SD and lived in Hawaii-I'm always sketched out about eating sushi away from the ocean. But you know what they say, Las Vegas is like Hawaii's 9th Island so let's eat sushi in the desert. It's located in a small strip mall center and plenty of parking in front. The doors are blacked out so I didn't know what to expect. It's nice inside, clean, cold AC, and the staff was nice. The sushi bar seating was fun and the sushi chefs were hustling through rolls but they made them with perfection and not too spicy for my liking. I love an easy menu with photos so you know exactly what you're ordering. Everything looked so incredible and I didn't know where to start but the chefs were recommending between decisions. It wasn't too busy during my visit and it was just after lunch time. I hear they have all you can eat which is nice if you have more time than just a work break. The rolls were super fresh and melt in your mouth. I would go back to this place next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frying Jason
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X931C8YlA1bO3aq-efYdMg.text: @sushihouse_goyemon is a hitter when it comes to AYCE sushi in Las Vegas! It's located off the strip in a poorly lit plaza but worth the drive. There is typically a wait but it is also worth the wait.  Their AYCE menu includes about 20 types of Nigiri all super fresh, a large specialty roll selection which you can request to order half portions (enables you to try more without having to commit to big servings), so many side dish options such as my faves pork belly and crispy fried shrimp heads OH MM GEE the best thing on the menu (which they are quite smart to limit), they have daily specials such a toro and belly, and are open until late late.    Can't forget their ice cream for dessert!   It is a go to spot for my family who live in Vegas and definitely a must stop whenever I am in town! Its honestly the best quality and bang for your buck in terms of AYCE.

81u_-AyT9YxGk6xrfoIzZA.text: Not as busy as before but food as great.  Not talk about any regular sushi that other sushi restaurant can do. Futomaki is my favorite, I crave for this roll when I was pregnant 10 years ago. I came here to buy take out order every other day. Till today, they still keep the same good quality !!! No other local AYCE restaurant can make this better than you do !!!  Love it !!!!  Thank you !!!
