FbR60S39jgJw4plkswzTgQ.text: By far the best cost and price sushi place I had in years. No reservation can be made and it's a bit small, so be sure to come in right on opening time to avoid long wait. Definitely order the dinner all you  can eat even if it's noon, the two sweet shrimp and uni nigiri is absolutely amazing! Don't forget there's special menu also included in the all you can eat on a black board.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V9Nhpg2ynIqzeNdHSuZwmQ.text: This was our favorite ayce sushi place, but im sad to say that it has gone way downhill. Service is exceptionally poor from refillimg water to taking and bringing out your orders in a timely manner. We waited around 20 or more minutes from placing an order to receiving it. Most of the nigiri is fresh and of good quality, except for the seared tuna, which came out dry, like it had been sitting out for a while.   Im not sure if they need to hire more servers or the sushi staff is undertrained or just slow, but we will probably not come back since there are many other ayce sushi restaurants in town that offer just as high quality dishes and does not have serving issues.

Tr54SKZMJzkh2BpKNv1JBg.text: Food was far none the best I have had in awhile. The sake was on. Nice and warm. The sushine mouthwatering good. The half rolls high fives all around. I spot perfect for groups. You will not leave unhappy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pgRNeHGEJYzAT8uvkSIaVQ.text: This place is still too good to be True for me! Can`t wait to make it back to Vegas. While writing this review I have the sudden urge of driving 5hrs just for this!   Goyemon had me at "ALL YOU CAN EAT." - Smart Guy  Write it down son

eLi_2ipdryxro6rZb2UUSA.text: Just in....OPEN DURING LUNCH for AYCE NOW!!!!! I can now happily go into food coma for the rest of my afternoon work day!    Good quality fish for an AYCE and they don't pack the nigiri with big blocks of rice....but no sashimi available here.  I honestly don't know much about the rolls...since I tend to be a pure fish lover....versus the cream cheese/avocado/mayo/etc mixed into the rolls. My favorite nigiri is the salmon belly, white tuna, unagi, and toro...don't forget to check out the blackboard near the cash register...it has the specials for the day!  Similar menu to Sushi Mon off Maryland Pkwy...with the exception of special dishes like the spicy tuna rice cracker and the seared pork belly....I literally will eat 2-3 orders on my own to the disgust of those around me...but I think buffets should definitely be a no judgment zone .....I will gladly admit I wear my "elastic band pants" for all you can eats...don't want any buttons holding me back =)  Dessert is awesome with selections of tofu cheesecake, green tea creme brulee, green tea cake, red bean/green tea ice cream, mochi ice cream.  Only minor complaint...some items have been "unavailable"...specifically  the lychee sorbet and the yellow tail collar which is succulent morsels of fish with ponzu suace, A MUST TRY that is if they have it....so maybe leaning towards a 4 star rating compared to the first time I went there....due to some missing items.

9ZhR6L5atPJAgntOpL4gOQ.text: The food was ok, but the service was terrible! Our check was $57, but we were charged $68 on our credit card. When we asked why, we were told that the server forgot to add couple items we did order. I think the server should had let us know prior to charging our card. 10 minutes after we signed the credit card slip, we were asked to leave since other guests were waiting for our table.  There are many sushi places around the Valley, so small places like Goyemon Sushi House should appreciate business and treat guests more kindly.

Spx3afiLsEbyOWtejYjsfw.text: I really wanted to like this place. But after having lunch there, I couldn't give them more than 3 stars.  When you find a red spoon with miso-soup, that's a very strong, bad sign. No wonder, the bento box came with multiple items that are only offered at non-authentic Japanese restaurants. It looks like they decided to optimize their business to go the fake-but-catchy sushi bar route... Yeah, I can't blame them for pursuing lucrative clientele. It's business. Just that the restaurant is not for me.

bsW1fxfAF_VMMJV7oAHx5A.text: The best all-you-can-eat sushi bar in Las Vegas! Sushi House Goyemon is busy, and you can't make a reservation. I recommend getting their early because this is a small restaurant. I loved my meal and stuffed myself to the gills. It was easy to do because the dishes are prepared right in front of you. I really felt entertained watching the sushi chef, and I think I felt hungrier because of it. I ate so much, I could barely move. Guess what? I'll come back again soon!

u_6u_sJJLQzb_Xlj_kHlsA.text: After reading all the wonderful high-rated reviews, I bookmarked this spot as our final cheat meal for our stay in Vegas during the Olympia 2011 weekend. Hmph...it was not the best idea and here are the reasons why:  1. When we got there around 7:45pm, Saturday night, the place was packed...and I mean packed as in it's super small and doesn't have much seating available, so when you include the AYCE option, I can tell why the wait here is always LONG. We waited for over 45 minutes before a table finally decided to get their bootays up and leave. Even though, the waitress was kind enough to offer the 3 of us seating at the bar, we opted to get a regular table and let the bar be available for the couples/singles.  2. The AYCE menu is quite confusing. You can't have everything all-you-can-eat...meh?? There were certain items on there were you were only allowed one order per person. So the math did get confusing for me. I'm no bueno with numbers here people!  3. FOOD: The pork belly that everyone raved about was MEH for me. The sushi rolls were also A-OK, nothing too crazy besides the nutso 9-11 roll we ordered. That habanero sauce they used on that roll had my mouth feelin like Angelina Jolie for a good 1/2 hour. OMG! The sashimi and fresh fish was very fresh indeed and those orders always came out the quickest. The chicken skewers were...what they were, just chicken skewers with Teriyaki sauce all ova em, again...nothing special there. The ONLY thing I really did enjoy was the AYCE option of DESSERTS! Mmmm, mmm bombalicous! I had 2 of the green tea creme brulees (which were sooooo decadent and perfect) and 1 red bean ice cream, how can you go wrong with anything that has beans in it? Yes, I'm Asian and I love my beany desserts! =P  4. SERVICE: It got kinda confusing who our server was. There were some dudes that would come out with our order but didn't take our order and then we had about 3 waiters that did take our orders back & forth. Major minus? Food came out WAY too slow-momo. I know there are only about 3 chefs working, but the place is tiny and I've been to plenty AYCE sushi spots and never had to wait about 15 min between each order. I'm ALWAYS hungry! Especially now since I'm still in precontest season for my fitness competition, so if I'm looking forward to a cheat meal, it better be top notch and the food better come out FAST. Sushi House Goyemon did NOT do this job well.  Would I come back? For the desserts? Yes. But even that's not really worth the trip there.  P.S. We had to hit up Jean Philippe Patisserie at the ARIA (since it's the only thing open super late and close to our hotel) right after we left this spot cuz my ass was still HUNGRY as EFF!

9zYeg-dayhUaJ76OmHpFSQ.text: I love this place, close to home, the fish is always fresh and the staff is great. It can be very busy depending on the time you come but it is well worth the wait.

_ZBCzBetHu-SLU-McnKn7Q.text: This is now my favorite sushi spot in town.  It is the same company as sushimon in GV, which was my previous favorite.  It's pretty standard for AYCE sushi, with the prices and selection.  But what makes these guys different than every other place I've tried in town is the grilled fish menu on the AYCE.    These little bites of grilled fishes are some of the best food I have ever had.  It is just as fresh as their nigiri, but marinated and sauced up, and a nice cooked flavor.  Definitely try the pork belly and the cajun salmon....but even the grilled tofu is good, and I don't usually like tofu.  Service is hit or miss...sometimes they are really busy, and you will receive orders over 20min later, so make sure you remember what you ordered during each round...they don't really forget, just takes a while to the table on certain days.  Other days, the service is pretty good, so again, hit or miss.  Also, they have an extended dessert menu on the AYCE, which includes a chocolate mousse, a definite must have if you come visit.  Bonus, this place is much closer to the avg Las Vegas local and tourist, being around 10-15min from MGM.  Go!

zUd0-Odrs0nF7D3fNv8V8w.text: Very disappointed.... Fish r not as fresh,  Rice portion is way too much and fish slice thin as paper.... Speechless. Haven't been here for a long time since my pregnancy, this trip really disappointed us. Also you should order a lot during ur first order cause when u order the second time all fish r not as fresh as ur first order and it takes forever for them to get to ur table!!!! I don't think they deserve a high rating....

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Difference between first order and second order.... Both yellowtail
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sigh.....

Ehy1hrHvYVK2BS124TIvTg.text: I have been here twice and both time I was completely satisfied with their service and food.  I will definitely be back here every time I come back to Vegas!!! Good job, Goyemon!

HC4rfWQ3rUQZGN1q91UHEg.text: My top AYCE place in town when I want sushi at odd hours. If it's prime eating time, I always call ahead or else will end up waiting in 1h lines and I hate waiting for food. Love the double salmon roll because it's light and salmon and rice YUM.

cZuwPY7YonE6IjR1PK3i0A.text: My go to AYCE sushi spot!   Tuesdays is when they get their fish deliveries, bet you didn't know that one!   Try the jalapeno masago with quail egg. DELICIOUS. Also, miso soup with shrimp heads, haha sounds gross but makes the soup 10x more flavorful.

BLneSz8aIZU5p_GNzcV2Vg.text: I haven't tried all AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas but I've experienced some pretty bad to mediocre ones. With that, I'm pretty confident that my opinion of Sushi House Goyemon being one of the best AYCE sushi in Vegas holds water. I like my sushi simple, fresh and nigiri-style. Not really big on sauced-up rolls (which they also serve). Because of Goyemon, why would I go and overspend at places like Blue Ribbon Sushi? Most of the fish that comes to Vegas is frozen, right? They also claimed one night that their uni was from Santa Barbara. One order of uni per person for AYCE is still a steal!  The service is a bit slower than some local AYCE restaurants and the wait time can be ridiculous if you're there at peak dinner hours. But I take busy as a good sign that people are recognizing something special in Goyemon. They also offer other delectable fare like grilled pork belly and desserts you should definitely make room for. There are the cutest tiny servings of green tea creme brulee and chocolate mousse you must try, also part of AYCE. Make sure to check their board for the specials of the day. And don't forget to get your stamp card if you're planning on becoming a regular.

o9QMVvWSzjCtz0M_T512kQ.text: Very much disappointed to their ahi tuna looks old and when I see the sushi chef are Mexican not Japanese but the rest of the fish is ok not the best

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7A_10v63ZvQYwgIyvcm5Bg.text: The food was great. They were all in small portions. You can get a taste of everything on the AYCE.   You have to get there early otherwise the place is packed. I can't wait to go back. The price is also very decent for AYCE.

CIF6_t2fwDds7J8SkS76CQ.text: Good they open late, closes at 3am. Bad thing was hubby craving noodles and they have no udon but they have ramen but they don't do noodle soups Togo. They claim they only have small containers for miso soup :( so I ordered 3 miso soups and a dinner entree and some sushi togo - hope it helps fill up a hubby expecting noodles to be brought back. We'll see..  As for sushi, everything came out ok. The dinner which had teriyaki chicken was beyond dry and the sauce didn't cover the entire chicken ;(   Place looks clean, servers seem nice and it was more than half packed at 11:30pm on a Thursday night. Must be good or convenient but than again I'm in a city that never sleeps.

Dvzqjy6RzlQZqE8MMC05cQ.text: Awesome sushi spot with their all you can eat it definitely hits the spot.  I tried their halibut sashimi and it was sublime!  Also, don't forget to order some sake and beers or both to enhance your all you can eat experience.

ZPyNZ8HnKqDUWzmJ_ONr_w.text: Bad customer service ! Super bad and not attentive at all . Didn't even bother to order ... just left bc it took them 15min for them to assist me

cu1du2T7anY3qh5d2Qa3MQ.text: Long over due update.   After so many horrendous experience i decide i will no longer support Goyemon.  I tried to introduce this place to so many different people in my life only to be let down on so many different occasions (4 times in a row) by the quality of service and above all the food that they provide.     It seems to me that this place doesn't care to TRY anymore ever since business has bloom.  And that's a shame because they shouldn't be so jaded with all these other competition in the valley.     To the person that picked up my stamp card out front, may it bring you better luck than it did for me.

voHbb2GXOInh0H4FSbrfSg.text: The crew forced us to finish 3 rolls that were left. We were so full and they said they had to charge. Will never come back. I always go to sushi places but was never forced to finish a couple of rolls that i left. Would rather go to yamasushi or a different place that has better service.

Z_6om34EZS0oC_BEr__8Xg.text: Taste: 3 Value: 4 Cleanliness: 3 Atmosphere: 2 Wait time:2 Overall:3 1 being the worst, and 5 being the best  I came here with some local friends late night while in vegas. It seemed like a good idea for AYCE but the quality still felt like AYCE, the only other places I been which was Yama in vegas and Keanyama in Fremont that their all you can eat still tasted like a traditional sushi.  There was a bunch of locals that got off work and drunk people here, the wait time was over 30 minutes and there was only one person in front of us.  The staff was pretty rude, when we asked for more water or utensiles, they didnt have any expressions or any saing just brought it over, no thank you, or how is the food, can I get you anything else, Also We made eye contact quite a few times but they ignored us.( people I was with were all sober locals) so I dont see why the service was so bad.  We had the talked about pork belly which was good, Should have ate way more of that than the sushi.  I would go back if yama isnt open.  also there is a one hr limit and anything uneaten you have to pay for.

rxJMBgsE4mrBBBIhau97Mg.text: With so many delicious restaurants on the Strip, I usually don't take the initiative to venture out and explore other restaurants off of it.  But, since trying Sushi House Goyemon, I realized I've been missing out.    Now, let me tell you.  This place is truly one of the best sushi places I've ever been to.  I mean it's hard to imagine that at a city like Las Vegas where Sand and Cactus Trees predominate, you'd find a place like Goyemon that offers its patrons one of the freshest sashimi they ever experienced.   So, a group of my friends came here for dinner on a Thursday night.  We all signed up for the AYCE dinner special, which was a little less than $30.  My friends mostly ordered the Special Rolls, but I stuck with Nigiri.  I really enjoyed Goyemon's Garlic Tuna along with the Sweet Shrimp (too bad it's only one order per person).  I still got to try some of the special rolls that my friends ordered, and they too hit the spot.  In conclusion, I'll definitely come here next time I'm in Vegas, or will make an attempt at the other restaurants off the Strip.  Heard Lotus of Siam is also a must go to place...

xRiZPvY-qNCkGb9gODUZOw.text: Went here for the Sunday lunch AYCE for $21.95. It was all it was cracked up to be according to most yelp reviews. Sushi was fresh and brought to your table fast after ordering. There was nothing we ordered that wasn't excellent. Would definitely suggest heading here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QogESveMapC65Tt399OCig.text: Another great restaurant by the creators of Monta. This place doesn't open until 5. Makes the place seem a little more exclusive. Dont you think? I had high expectations for Goyemon and they did not disappoint.I was pleasantly surprised to find that its actually a very nice sit-down restaurant. A little classier than most hole-in-the-wall sushi joints.  NIGIRI: They served large, dense cuts of fish of the freshest quality on their nigiri sushi. Good fish/rice ratio.  ROLLS: They do half-rolls! Take advantage of this luxury!   SIDE DISHES: I'm addicted to the baked mussels. Unfortunately, the only reason Goyemon isn't 5 Stars is because of the poorly made mussels. Not enough sauce and not enough flavor. The mussels are usually a bit fishy as well. :( Be sure to try the salmon collar, melt-in-your-mouth pork belly, & the tuna rice cracker.   DESSERT: Goyemon has the best dessert selection out of all the sushi joints in Las Vegas. I had the tofu cheesecake and my friend, the tempura ice cream. You know how most places put a limit on just 1 dessert? Goyemon will give you as many as your heart desires.  TIP: Be sure to show up early! Gets crowded very quickly! Call 1 week in advance to book the party room if you have a group of 10+ They have a private tatami room.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mussels, Ecstasy Roll, Tofu Cheesecake

6vHcVtH-PhMO-lEyKkJCmg.text: _Service is chill _Atmosphere is live with conversations & a mixture of music. _The fish though, SLAMMIN' (That Magma Roll) _AYCE is 27 bones for dinner time but well worth it. only thing negative about this is the wait time. It's always busy here so be prepared to wait at least 30mins.  Shout out to our waiter too. His make-up was on fleek   "Asahi dreamin' , sushi schemin'"

R9eTCYDpDOt0SdfdwLYxag.text: I'll keep this brief as I always enjoy their food, but I did not have a good customer service experience on Saturday 3/12. Waitstaff seemed annoyed by us ordering a lot (it's all you can eat.. why be upset, we are paying customers like everyone else). They brought us orders that werent ours and didnt bring out some of our actual orders, of which we had to remind them. What ticked me off the most was the blonde host with glasses, did not get her name. She approached our table after we paid saying "It's been an hour, I have another party waiting for this table, we're gonna need you guys to leave". I've never had anyone tell me/us that in my 6 years of eating sushi lol. I told her we would have loved to have left 20 mins ago if our desserts came out on time! She then asked us what we ordered and I assume she told them to prepare it right there and then. It shouldn't take 20 mins to make mochi or take it out of the box for 3 people. She then stood by the sushi bar and not by her post, probably feeling embarrassed. 2 of the desserts came out while one did not (we waited another 10 mins for it). We just walked out and had ice cream elsewhere. I'll continue going to Sushi Mon (their other property) instead. 5 stars for the food but 3 for the customer service skills.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, garlic tuna (yum), and mussels

1ZGVPcYrd6ObD4ywL--M_Q.text: Service was extremely fast, almost too fast! Sat at the bar and had wonderful customer service.  Hot sake is great,  9-1-1 HOLY SHIT. I'm still chugging on my water.. I love and can handle spicy, but this is by far THE spiciest I've had yet.   RECOMMENDED  The Mingus  -- even if you aren't a fan of fish or sea food I suggest you give this a shot to break into the scene. Absolutely delicious for anyone.   Only thing I would say is I wish there was some environmental music in here, some gentle Japanese or something for environment factor.. Rather than the crying baby!

2lXgBQPWW5srN4By76SX-Q.text: Worst service ever. Hostess was amazing but the server was horrible. We kept having to remind them and ask them about their food and even asked them to accommodate us for forgetting our food which they gave us it anyway and was WRONG. It tasted bad. Shouldn't have to wait over an hour for food we put in and to keep reminding them about it. This place USED to be good but they fell off. NEVER going back again. Couldn't accommodate us.

yfDsfBW-M39ERL-4u_20dA.text: I came here for the 2nd time. I had a much better experience this time!! All the food we ordered was BOMBBBBBBB. The Fried shrimp head, the rolls (Crispy Rice roll with spicy tuna on top was my fave!!), the baked rolls are good too. I loved the baked  mussels!! They also have UNI (2 per person)! And the Scallop sushi.. i can keep listing!! It's a must try!! The best part, their dessert!!!! The green tea tiramisu is BOMBBBBBBB. Also, they have unlimited MOCHI ICE CREAM!! And lychi ice cream YUMMMMM.   I WANT TO GO BACK ALREADY!!  ps. there might be a wait (sometimes up to an hour!) but just wait, its worth it :)

pdxnWoLwah5VYv2BSjC4sg.text: This is a review of their a la carte options. The Skinny: Although we didn't partake of their AYCE, their a la carte items and bento were below par. FYI - if you do not have their AYCE, the menu and pricing can be confusing (2.5) Service: messed up bill which my hubby had to actually grab a menu and show the waitress that she was wrong (2), Value: given the experience here, I wouldn't come back.(2). I was enthused to see a highly rated sushi place. So I nagged the hubby to come try this place out. When we arrived. we weren't hungry enough to try their AYCE option. Instead we ordered their deluxe bento (with a side salad and miso soup), katsu curry and a side order of the grilled pork belly. FYI - if you order a la carte, the prices are all on the actual fold-out menu NOT what's on the AYCE sheet or the supplement page on the placemat. Make sure you check your bill because we were charged for the more expensive price for pork belly (ie, supplement for the AYCE add- on) instead of the a la carte price. The waitress asked the chef instead of checking the menu and didn't believe us. My hubby had to ask for the menu to show her the difference. The deluxe bento suffered from many problems but let's just start off with the baby upchuck masquerading as some sort of misguided egg salad they put in the top right hand corner. (see pic: yelp.com/user_local_phot...) Or perhaps the completely anemic "teriyaki chicken" which didn't even have grill marks on them. The fried salmon and tempura were both soggy. We had to ask for tempura sauce. Sashimi - the fish was cut into thick chunks but isn't cut in the proper matter allowing the fish to melt in your mouth. For what it's worth, the California maki was okay. There was little to no katsu with the katsu curry. (FYI - the cutlet in the photo represents about 40% of the entire cutlet which is rather small for $8 see pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH... ). The curry itself was overly thick and bland due to the addition of perhaps too much potatoes. Finally, the grilled pork belly. While the texture of the pork belly was nice, the flavour of the pork was overly smoky for our tastes. The addition of the rather oddly sour tasting mango salsa was a deteriment to the dish. Certainly not something we would order again and we found it expensive for the price. Overall given our experience with a la carte, we probably won't be stopping by for AYCE. But certainly check your bill if you do decide to do the a la carte tasting.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry - where&#39;s the katsu?
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deluxe combination bento: potentially baby upchuck in the top right hand corner, anemic looking chicken (yelp limits my rant)
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly with really weird tasting mango salsa

fv8yYGMT5GREEIg2Yaffsw.text: I enjoyed it as a first timer. I got the all you can eat and my favorite so far was the hurricane, spicy rice and moon.   Yum yum sauce whatever it's made of (I even asked the waiter) is amazing.  I'll definitely be coming back

BQhHD2m0B296tXERgfrJjw.text: I swore I already wrote a review for Goyemon but since it disappeared....  I love love love Goyemon! They deserve 5 stars because of their consistency and the overall experience. You get the best of both worlds! Quality and Quantity!  Don't expect sashimi or the best sushi in the world though.  You pay for what you get.   Their fish is fresh and they don't stuff their nigiri with rice.  It's a good proportion.   My favorite at Goyemon is the Super White Tuna - melts in your mouth *O*.  AYCE (All You Can Eat) Dinner is $26.95 but expect to pay about $35 per person for tax and tip. You can choose from appetizers and desserts.  They have ramen late at night.  BTW, they are open til 3am. YAY!!! (exceptions to AYCE: limit 1 order (2 pieces) of Uni (sea urchin) and amaebi (sweet shrimp) per person)  Tip:  Always look at the Specials Menu on the Blackboard before you order!!! Toro or salmon belly are good must-trys.         Expect to wait if you're rolling in during traffic dinner time or if you have a large group.  If you time it right, they have a private room that can seat a large group. However, they DO NOT take reservations.

48Q94c_pvpnffvxFpnlWVQ.text: Excellent, fast, respectful service down to checking  ingredients of the wasabi for me.  Had multiple sushi plates produced just for us and little delay. Finished off with Lychee ice cream (mango mochi for my husband) and we were pleased with all.

W0p8IasS1rEGPWr3-hpzHA.text: I'm seriously considering going back to all my AYCE sushi reviews and moving them down a star. THAT's how good it was.   I can't believe this is the 3rd Japanese restaurant in this location in 5 years. To go from Sushi Hana to Shin to this. Goyemon has by far the best decor of the three. Sushi Hana just had these gross green painted walls and an old ass TV showing ESPN for chrissakes!   Along with your usual suspects for nigiri and rolls...they have a ton more including daily specials. Highlights included their inhouse smoked salmon (smokiest salmon ever!), big eye tuna nigiri and "kobe" beef nigiri although the beef being kobe was highly suspect. No big deal. Pork belly was like the best piece of bacon ever.   I also like how yellowtail collar (1 order per person) is on the menu. So good! Its like a super meaty fish chicken wing kinda sorta. A must.   We were pretty lucky to be seated around 6pm since there was a bit of a wait for tables about 10 min later. Not that many seats so definitely be prepared to stand around for a while.   I love how this is so close to my place. No more drives to Sushi Mon on Sahara for me. I'm actually ready to go back here...like...now.

VnF5c9gsrV4qkR3UGl0gKA.text: Awesome AYCE sushi!  Everything was good, but the pork belly, dynamite appetizer, & desserts were omg good!  Our desserts were green tea creme brulee, yuzu citrus sorbet, & azuki bean ice cream.  We ate here on a Monday around 400pm & we were seated immediately.  To make the most of it, we saved our appetites to combine a late lunch/early dinner, & I'm glad  we did...we left so stuffed!  Can't wait to eat here again & try some other menu items...lots to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuzu sorbet, azuki bean ice cream, green tea brulee.

z8KwBr8P6LWUc837Cpi6Wg.text: It's a nice little spot hidden down Decatur. Honestly the best California roll over had however, they were a little stingy with the sauces. I like that the menu is kinda simple. We can't in at 330 on a Wednesday and it was pretty busy. The only draw back was that the service wasn't so great. They weren't ride out anything it just took a while to get stuff but other then that I'll be back.

I5yLiD7O1DxwUWZnwpXAVQ.text: YES, it's as good as what everyone says it is!  They don't try to rip you off with too much rice or sauce and the sushi is all quality!

8MpLZBAPQ0sYKtMkGmmYRA.text: Can I have 3 Orgasms and a side of green tea creme brulee please?   Oh yah. 4 stars for the minimal amount of rice on nigiri, orgasm sauce and just a wide selection of menu items.    Orgasm salad - seared chunks of tuna on a bed baby mixed greens in a creamy yet not too sweet sauce. OMG heavenly! Grilled Tofu Salad - Cubes of firm tofu nicely charred. Not bad. Poke salad - standard Toro - Limited to 1 - A little chewy but not bad Big Eye Tuna - Melted in my mouth, a must try if available Super White Tuna - Can't go wrong with ono! Heavenly Sweet Shrimp - Slimey! Pass Pastel Roll - Good, not as heavy but little on the cream cheese (if you like that sorta stuff) Udon - I wanted Ramen but it's not available till after 11pm, standard noodles in a broth. Good thing to eat if you are hung over. Green Tea Cake - A little dry for my taste Green Tea Creme Brulee - Standard processed   Service was good.  Usually we'd stuff ourselves more, but we had a white party to attend to and eating ayce sushi and trying to fit in a tight white dress isn't cute lol.  For the price, it's about $1-$2 more than Hikari but the last few timves Ive been to Hikari have been disappointed and rather much go here even if they have only nigiri.  Try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amber Jack &amp; Yellowtail
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Collar
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (T-B) - Big Eye Tuna, Super White Tuna, Salmon

yWkhB3JxAuh_xp48cVgF0Q.text: Came here with my family of 16 to celebrate Fathers Day. We were seated together within minutes of arriving. Our server was Irving, he was top notch! Prompt, efficient, attentative and professional. The nigiri was delicious. This will be our sushi spot on this side of town.

O1CsMtWHgKYLBH4yvFl8DA.text: I have been here a few times now to eat. I have to say with each experience it just gets worse each time. I am not a huge fan of all you can eat stuff because the quality is generally low and this place fits the bill. I went yesterday and ordered the Beef Terriakyi and the girl ordered the AUCE.   My beef dish was terrible. The quality of the meat was so low I sent it back. The meat was so fatty and the smothered in sauce as if I might not know. I was grossed out and tried to eat the salad.. seaweed, the deep friend veggies, the terrible California rolls, and the rice. The rice was the highlight.. It was overall so bad I sent it back. No offer to comp anything or do anything about it.   Overall.. I wont be going back.. I keep trying but it is just not happening..

pjcCiuKWIOglQ1ZeuBYcLA.text: AYCE sushi... There really isn't much else to say. I sat at the bar and put orders in every couple of minutes. I definitely got my money's worth.

ZTZwK3o0wYjFEu1XZcTESw.text: Open til 3am?  Was this place MADE for me?!  My hubby and I stopped in here last night after the movies.  We made the choice to come based on the fact we'd heard they stay open so late and seeing as it was already close to midnight, it sounded perfect.  When we arrived, we were greeted so pleasantly by the host.  There wasn't an empty table in sight as I've experienced with most AYCE sushi places, but geeez, even at midnight?!  I shouldn't have been surprised :)  We were promptly seated at the bar where I had a great view of the chefs preparing yummy sushi masterpieces.  Unfortunately (for me), I'd already eaten before the movie (and boy did I EAT!), so I didn't feel prepared for AYCE.  Their menu has a lot of variety, however, so I didn't feel left out and deprived for long.  I decided on the ahi poke salad, which was great!  My husband, of course, went with the AYCE and he was pretty impressed.  His favorite was the rainbow roll.  I've never sat at the bar of a sushi place...crazy, considering how many times I've eaten sushi.  There is something VERY pleasant about watching the rolls being prepared and interacting with the chefs (who, by the way, are so ridiculously friendly and attentive at Goyemon).  By the time we were getting ready to leave, it almost felt like home here.  Everyone was so pleasant and the food was incredible.  What more could we ask for?

qLXNpi-r3mbMcUP39-Vdcw.text: Best ayce sushi I have had. One reason is the amazingly fresh fish... Two.. The variety and daily specials.... 3.... Small quantities of rice, baby! No one wants softball size balls of rice with paper thin sushi... We are smart enough to see past that and goyemon respects the customers in this way... The uni and sweet shrimp one order per person rule is crummy but most ayce don't even let you get one order, it's usually extra so I'll let them have that!  Fried shrimp head isn't on the menu but it is all u can eat,too! Yesssss...  The daily specials are great and make it so every experience is different. They have a lot of great homemade desserts too like tofu cheesecake, green tea crime brulee..so good!  Also the pork belly appetizer is yummy!     We come here every trip to Vegas because you can't beat the quality, portions, variety, and freshness.  Also love sitting at the bar so the chefs can make their own fun creations for us!! Can't wait to go back. They will call your phone too if there is a long wait so we can drive away and do other things instead of sitting and drooling over everyone's sushi...

9tBZPe9iV09QZo-xwwkWcQ.text: My friend took me here and I was a little hesitant because I already had a favorite sushi spot. But right after that first time and then after coming back it became my favorite. I really like me some sushi rolls, but my favorite thing here is definitely their dumplings and the nigiri I could eat it all day. Also a great thing is their extended variety of sakes and beers. They have tokyo black which is one of my favorite beers and they also have some great cold sakes. Love the place and I love their variety.

S6mgKZHfJ4qxL0WT2PjFjA.text: The only place where you can eat as many shrimp heads as you want..pork belly appetizer is awesome..everything is pretty decent and all you can eat deserts are cool features about this place..but its a super small place and gets packed everyday..

YFnz2rDWOmqJiEMEQaCFbg.text: You could fit this restaurant in my living room. The pictures I saw prior to visiting didn't quite represent the real space.  They take NO RESERVATIONS. So, we bet on arriving early. We were seated 10 min later and we opted for the bar, otherwise the wait would have been longer. Looks like this place is packed all the time, well, it's Vegas, baby!  As far as All-U-Can-Eat-Sushi option, I would only go for it if I were that guy from Food Network who swallows 10 giant burgers as one meal. Also, they charge you for left over food, so don't even bother.  There's a very nice selection of sushi rolls, very creative and imaginative menu. Started off with Dynamite app: Baked baby scallops with mushrooms and onions. Yum! The menu features Baked rolls, Tempura rolls, Deep fried rolls and Specialty rolls (about 40 varieties all together). Fish was very fresh and rolls were delicious!! The chefs behind the bar were extra friendly.  Well worth visiting.

8bXTDPf1eV1SLDaTlmwIGg.text: Very good sushi.  I think the best in town with a great selection for dinner.. For all you can eat you have 5 menus to choose from.  It's the only sushi place I go in town anymore..

-mPwg7HhG-7ZvkzYj7YjjA.text: up to about four months ago this place was top-notch but since has gone downhill fish is still fresh however I think they have new or less experience chefs and the service was absolutely terrible. Trust me when I say this review hurts me more than it does the owners

dSAE6XGlMJUTfxFRFH8Tzw.text: AYCE in which you order off a menu, so it's all fresh. Stick with the nigiri (it's the perfect bite sized portion). The rolls will just fill you up.  Come here right when they open on a weekend to avoid waiting. *To maximize your money, DON'T BE SHY when ordering. The server never put a limit on how much food we could order at one time.

YcJWvJFHFmF2umrfkur4-w.text: Thanks to the staff at Goyemon for two amazing adventures in sushi-dom on one weekend. As a special thanks to Fredo who made these two visits not just satiating, but thoroughly entertaining for my local and visiting friends alike.  this place has the freshest and most delicious sushi of any AYCE place I've ever seen. the Uni, the blue fin, the Amaebi...all to die for. As for the special creations made at the bar (PS: SIT AT THE BAR IF YOU CAN)... the creativity and variety of the dishes are a wonderful change of pace from places that just fill their special rolls with sweet mayo and cruchies and call them "unique". The baked mussels were also amazing. better than the fried oysters (we ended up ordering the mussels 3 more times).  And the seared pork belly app, also on the AYCE menu, was sinfully good. I tried to stop ordering it, but I gave up trying to stop after my third.   also, if you like something different with your amaebi, instead of the fried heads, try them in the spicy miso broth instead.  This is a place I already came to at least once per Vegas weekend and now will try to come to at least 2 or 3 times.  Ideally, I would come here 11-times in a row. (wink wink)

bO-PngheMg41VrIn6OCwhQ.text: Amazing sushi...ALL YOU can eat for $22...Trick is to order every time the waitress comes over...portion are smaller as you order more....I think they figured out us Hawaiians can grind....service got slower as we kept ordering. EXCELLENT food would do again...WAIT Time is about 1 hour......GO FOR IT!

x5J8nfW-Y7uoLpWySpPFzQ.text: Was absolutely wonderful. It is a small place but even if you have to wait .... It's well worth it. Their selection of AYCE is way better than a lot of the places around here and you can substitute soybean paper.... The garlic edamame was amazing and every roll was fantastic. I like it because they don't overload the rolls with rice and you can order half rolls!!  Definitely recommended!!!

yWxMlAB796GTOEaXFTqF9g.text: They were super nice while crazy busy at the time. Enjoyed the food and thought it was good.

yyrurTpSbz5sLzNGgRqF5g.text: Been here twice so far. Hands down the best sushi buffet I have ever had. The only downside is the long wait and no reservations but I think it's worth it. Better eat fast because you only get an hour.

_mi0FdZSVhBWfcevtG3pWw.text: All u can eat is very good! And it's even better when we ordered half size of everything! The price ($27 for dinner) is very reasonable compared with the buffets in fancy hotels with waiting time for 1-2 hours. As the first time visiting Las Vegas, going here for dinner was a wise and perfect decision!

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dPojDg-2fPAHvN7ouKJpZQ.text: YES YES YESSSSS.  I've been looking to fall in love with a sushi place and I finally have!!  Everything is amazing: the sushi, the ambience, the servers, and the chefs.  On.  Point.  Never going anywhere else again.  And there's even a frequent flyer card for all you can eat??  Um ... yes please!  So happy that I found this place!

oqdFFZdEVLfCmM8gTvkk1A.text: Whoever would have guessed that I would be reviewing 2 sushi places in one day?! Let alone visiting 2 in one day :P   After my epic experience at Yummy Grill, I enthusiastically accepted an offer from Taylor T. to try Goyemon, later that evening :)  Upon arrival, it was pretty packed & seemed to live up to that aspect of the reviews. Fortunately, we didn't have to wait too long. We passed the time by people watching and funny commentary. Taylor T. was adamant about trying the AYCE & obviously, being a sushi noob, I was a little iffy about the whole AYCE eat thing. But, after being made fun of by the hostess for not being sure of the AYCE & that usually it was the guy getting AYCE & not the girl. Oh really?! The gauntlet was thrown & the challenge was accepted! Take that hostess!  So, thus began the AYCE madness & the 60 minute timer began :P I started off with some gyoza & yakitori, just to ease into the whole thing. My first sushi choice was a half order of the Hurricane roll. It was pretty good & I would order it again. Taylor T. had the half order of the Taylor roll (go figure) I actually thought it was really good & enjoyed it more than my choice. Next up was an order of the mussels. They were a little chewy, but sweet & very tasty. We followed up with half orders of the 911 & 007 rolls. The 911 was a little too spicy for my liking & the 007 roll was a nice simple roll, but kind of chewy. We finished the sushi portion off with the Domingo roll. This was definitely a good choice. Basically, a sushi roll topped off with some pico de gallo. What a great combo! Finally, we had the green tea creme brulee. It had a very subtle flavor, but really creamy & delicious. I just wish it was bigger, and AYCE though ;)  I will definitely be coming back for AYCE! I enjoyed my first AYCE experience here & look forward to more visits. The staff is very nice & really helpful & accommodating with suggestions & omissions of certain items.  And last but not least, shout out to the Goyemonster himself, Nelson Q! And thanks to Taylor T. for the invite!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Creme Brulee. (Object in picture may appear larger than actual size)
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taylor Roll...very befitting of my company ;-) Also, really delicious!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hurricane Roll...Yum!

RUtWZN-UBZ4TfoL5w9Te0A.text: Side dishes were good and ample choices of them but the sushi (white tuna, yellowtail) was not good. Uni was not available. Had better sushi in other places.

CRvPvF3B3zNpBsyMX7cw1w.text: Great sushi restaurant.  Best one my wife and I have found in Vegas.  Won't visit another sushi house unless referred by a friend.    Fish is always fresh, I have never had a bad piece of fish.  Love the pork belly, the sashimi salad, and the crispy rice tuna.  All u can eat menu is big. Everything is good, never had something I didn't like.    Will always eat sushi here when I am hungry for it.

-5YJvACKgYWE3gYBBU5QMA.text: Not many people fancy raw fish, but those who do enjoy fresh sushi or sashimi have their favorite go-to place.  THIS WOULD HAVE TO BE MY FAVORITE SUSHI RESTAURANT OF ALLLL TIIIMMEEEE!  No joke.  I've been to so many all-you-can-eat sushi places and tons of Japanese restaurants in my lifetime that I feel confident saying that Goyemon has one of the best sushi's in the States.  This would probably be a whole different story if I've been to Japan, but that has yet been crossed off my bucket list.  In the meantime, this place is my #1 spot.  So why do I love this place?  Although Goyemon currently has 4 stars according to Yelp, I feel that it depicts this place so wrongly.  It should receive 5 1/2 stars. That's how great it is.  Being Asian and all, I have come to love rice.  White, brown, sticky, broken...I LOVE rice, just ask the boyfriend.  When it comes to sushi, the way the rice is prepared makes all the difference in the world.  Trust me, I know.  If the rice is too sticky, you'll be sitting there all day chewing on sticky rice.  If there's too much rice vinegar then the sushi rice just falls apart once chopsticks come in contact with it.  This place does it right.  They "cut" the rice in such a way that it's one with the sashimi/raw fish.  The portion between the fish itself as well as the sushi rice is perfect.  Some places either put so much more rice hoping it'd fill you up faster, but that just takes away all the trust a customer has in the restaurant as well as the sushi chef.    Bomb dynamite.  A lot of sushi places are starting to add rice at the bottom of these delectable appetizers, but it's really taking away the taste of this delicious dish.  Goyemon thankfully doesn't do that.   Mussels.  Can't go to a sushi restaurant without getting mussels...   If they ever provide this option as a part of the all-you-can-eat-deal, then I say get it.  This is the salmon belly.  What's great about it is, is that it's very much like salmon, it just melts so much more in your mouth.  You've got to try it if you can.    And the one fish I can never cheat on, white tuna.  My absolute favorite.   Generally at all-you-can-eat places I leave a little room for dessert.  Goyemon's lychee sorbet dessert is one of a kind (to me).  It's not your regular sorbet, a little bit more on the sticky side as if you were chewing on mochi, but not as chewy as mochi.  That may not make any sense, but in a way it melts nicely in your mouth, sort of like soft, snow that is just falling down.   If you plan to eat there, make sure to head there early in the day right before they open.  It's a little slow at first, but it quickly gets busy 15-30 minutes later.  It's so packed, people are just waiting out the door.  What's even more interesting is that the location isn't even that great.  It's a little off the strip (15 minutes away), but I love that about it.  It attracts locals and very few tourists go out there so you aren't bombarded by tourists even though you may considered as one.   Already missin' you....  Lina Chen

IRdVkL5jTVwx4CtzKqh5tA.text: I used to think I loved Goyemon, and it was my favorite sushi place. Lately, service has been really slow. I understand service being slow when it's really busy. The last few times we went it was pretty slow, and service was slow. The time between our food just takes forever.   The last time we went, the server messed up the order as well. We ordered a full Sexy girl roll and half a moon roll. They came out with half a sexy girl roll and half of a random roll.   The only reason why I put it as 4 stars instead of 3 was because of all the dessert options. I love desserts, too! I'm getting really disappointed with Goyemon. It might be a while before I go back there.

CDdnQBxPeCx8aNXYLdt3RA.text: The wait was almost an hour long just for 4 people, but the wait was worth it. I would say best sushi I had in Vegas. The decor made it feel more like a dinner instead of a sushi house.

TJhUUn73njabdp6CCtSFKA.text: I always sit at the sushi bar. Gian is my favorite sushi chef. He is the best sushi chef!!!! Happy every time when I come here.  Food is great. Above the AYCE average. Can't wait to go back again on every Wednesday and have Gian as my sushi chef.

sHzexU26ZmkPmSyugDTclw.text: (It was yelp rating that brought me here) Greeted by friedly staff.When I order AYCE  I mainy have Sushi not Rolls. I had the Super White Tuna, Salmon Sushi, Tuna, and Seared. My favorite was in order Super white A+  Tuma,Seared Tuna , Salmon. The salmon was my least it was a little to fishy. Caped it off with  Fried ice cream Yum:) I must say it was well worth it.

ZlhaQkkqKl9051q4NW2t4g.text: I was excited to try this place after going to sushimon for years. Had the all you can eat and it just wasn't up to par. The rolls were mostly rice and fell apart easily. Quality was ok, but everything we had was mostly rice and a tiny thin piece of fish on top. Specials were good, but again fell apart from someone not rolling them correctly. Overall it was basically a letdown. Don't think will come back.

V6kU1OBOftWcEdT-TE8lvQ.text: I'm dreaming of the day when Atlanta will get a restaurant like this. Sushi House Goyemon is a sushi lover's heaven unless you're bougie and only eat at fancy sushi restaurants. All jokes aside, I really enjoyed dinner here. The choices were wonderful for AYCE. I love that it's not set up like a buffet; instead, you order rolls/nigiri/items from the grill/desserts with your server. Be mindful of what you order so you don't end up with a lot of leftovers; they'll most likely charge you extra for wasting food. You can order 1/2 a roll so you can still enjoy different sushi rolls without getting too full to try everything else or end up wasting food. I saw that there's a time limit of 60 mins for AYCE on the menu... not sure how strictly they enforce it though. We were in an out within an hour. Everything we ordered was really good.  Great service. Parking lot shared with other businesses in the same shopping center. Open til 3 AM (crazy!) Check out daily specials on the chalkboard that you can also order if you're doing AYCE.

csFKzZBHywA-I-V24KM0mQ.text: The best all you can eat sushi spots I've ever been too! Basically all you can eat on anything on their menu and also on any specials (catches of the day kind of thing).  Can't wait to visit Vegas again to go!

A5oeA40kO0tHLQyl1NfLxA.text: Something wrong with this place. Sell more alcohol beverages to make good profit on food business. We were at the sushi bar and having AYCE and having beer and some cold sake. Less eating and more drinks make the restaurant should be happy but not this place. After exact one hour they told us to leave because people are waiting and dinner limit is one hour. I never experience like this. The waiting customers were waiter's friend I guess since they were smiling and shake hands. We were not eating crazy with free ice water. Also food was bellow average sad...but beer and sake were good! Still same owner Segawa San? Shame on you!!! I wish there is no star for this place!!!

_tWHLfqnvFQyYKHmW9EEVQ.text: We came on New Year's Day, it's always packed but they try their hardest to get their customers in as fast as possible. The usual wait time is about 30 minutes. I don't mind waiting because their fish is always very fresh. My favorites are garlic tuna and Cajun albacore. I never mind waiting because their food is always so fresh. They are busy for a reason !

xTrwIHrSWjvI8hTcxpr4HQ.text: I think the AYCE sushi lunch was around $22.  The dinner is around $27.  We came around 12pm on Saturday and we didn't have to wait.  However, we came to Vegas during the off-season.  It's located in the corner of a strip mall, not too far away from the Vegas Strip.  Plenty of parking.  The service was good and fast.  The food was really good.  I like this place more than SushiMon.    Definitely will come back again!

Sb9zqZ_wOeKzupzzDD4y8w.text: Not worth the $35 per person after tip. The service was good, but most of the sushi was not fresh. Why do I know this? Because I've been to enough so called best spots in Vegas now and this should not be on there. Jjanga has the best,fresh, sushi so far. Why am I being so critical on freshness? Because I've been food poisoned by enough restaurants that claim they have the best sushi in the city. Go for the appetizers. Their appetizers are worth the all you can eat. Stay away from the ramen. It taste like tap water.

M6P0natbax40TDIvdIRmsQ.text: Go here all the time with my boyfriend. Every time we're always greeted friendly and given excellent service. Today the chef that made our sushi was the same one that helped us once before and his name is Andrei. Before we could even say anything he already knew my order from the last time (which was probably a good 2 weeks ago). The food is fresh, fast and delicious and is my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. If you're looking for quick service and a fan of AYCE, sit at the bar and hang out with Andrei.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andrei is a great chef

SwLu2nTEShD3tQlj28jqqQ.text: Came here for an AYCE sushi lunch after hiking at Red Rock.  AYCE lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95.  I think the main difference is that you can't order sweet shrimp or uni for lunch unless you want to pay the dinner price.  It was so easy for us to get our money's worth here, and the quality was great for AYCE sushi!  They have a huge menu filled with nigiri, specialty rolls, appetizers, and dessert.  One caveat, you have to finish EVERYTHING or else they'll charge you a la carte prices.  Do not leave the rice behind.  The nigiri we ordered: -  Super white tuna (ono) x6 - my favorite!  We ordered 6 orders of this.   -  Salmon x3 - it was ok; kind of mushy. -  Seared salmon x1 - good sear, brought out the flavors/oils of the salmon. -  Albacore x1 - good -  Yellowtail x3 - very fresh. -  Unagi x3 - good  The rolls we ordered (the great thing is - you can order HALF orders so you can try more varieties!!) - they were also really generous with the raw fish they put in the rolls: -  Moon roll x1 - if you like unagi, get this. -  Lemon roll x2 - our favorite!!  if you like yellowtail and salmon with a citrus ponzu sauce, get this. -  Supreme salmon roll x1 - if you like salmon on salmon, get this -  Dragon roll x1 - if you like unagi, get this. -  Volcano roll x2 - if you like baked scallops and mayo, get this -  Moment roll x1 - if you like crunchy rolls, get this -  Chubby roll x1 - if you like shrimp tempura, avocado, and salmon with a slight kick wrapped in a gargantuan roll, get this.  Sides: -  Vegetable tempura - came with 5 pcs - I got carrot, sweet potato, onion, asparagus, and green bean. -  Miso soup - watered down.  We didn't have room for dessert, but they had red bean ice cream, green tea ice cream, tempura ice cream, and ice cream mochis on the menu when we came.    We came so hungry, and left SO stuffed.  I can't believe we ate all this between 2 people.  Totally got our money's worth though!

R0G4wlzqH0nZ10uq1cT0Ag.text: My friend who has been living in Vegas for 2 years took me here...and WOW....although there was about a 45 minute wait (they don't take reservations) it was well worth it! Probably the most delicious tuna I've had in a long time and the rolls were amazing as well.   I had:  - Tuna poke (small but delicious)  - Domingo Roll (tasted like sushi with nachos or salsa)  - Super White Tuna (tasted like butter!!)  - Seaweed Salad (small but delicious) - Chocolate Mousse

6jyNX9N9Trd2PwkccWJDNQ.text: Good food. Although I'm not a big fan of sushi but I like this place. Only one thing, their service is just ok. They did not look friendly. However I realize they are busy but it's not an excuse.

XUTLzOO9OLsKRJvVIonpkg.text: Good quality sushi and selection, but no sashimi. Had the AYCE with our group. Sushi rolls and nigiri were good. Ratio of fish to rice on the nigiri was perfect, not too much rice like most other places. Had to knock down 1.5 stars for the service. For just a small place, very slow and had to check to make sure our orders were coming. Not very attentive either. Once we placed our first order, had to flag a server down to order again.

5n4uSjSbLx7EPnf8e6BaKw.text: y'all know i love sushi they have the best variation of shrimp tempura rolls! great service and chefs.

-KvbJN02Aw3XYsl47T0Lag.text: This is definitely my favorite place for ayce. they are always busy, but the wait is worth it. the sushi chefs are all attentive and helpful. They also have a lot of daily specials; the kanpachi is awesome! I also recommend the pork belly, cajun albacore, and garlic tuna. The pork is always so juicy and fatty, while the albacore and tuna taste so fresh and perfectly salty.  Con: they dont take reservations so be prepared to wait, whether its for lunch or dinner.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N4UMDaGlk3Nnel0TRFlnkA.text: Came here 7 hrs ago and I'm still so full!! AYCE for lunch is until 4pm for $21 per person- so worth it!! The only downside is that you have a 45 min limit, but it was plenty of time for me to get stuffed. If you have a fairly small party (we came with four people), I highly recommend sitting at the bar. You get your food a lot faster so you can eat more =P AND if you get nice sushi chef like Gian, he will recommend different things for you to try!   We got yellowtail, salmon, halibut, eel, and some rolls as well. First of all, rolls usually come in 8 pieces per order but for most of them, you can request half orders. It's nice because it saves you room to try a variety rather than just a few. I also got a crunchy hand roll- but you can pretty much customize it however you want, just ask :) As for nigiri that we ordered, fish is very good quality and they give you a reasonable amount of rice. My favorite was the yellowtail, I probably had 10 pieces of that by myself if not more! Halibut was also good and that was chef's recommendation, wouldn't have gotten it other wise. They also have a good selection of sides that you can order. From calamari to gyoza to miso soup to seaweed salad and many more- you get the point. I enjoyed all the sides that I tried except maybe edamame. I liked that it's hot but it's too buttery to my liking. Moving on to desserts...omg all you can eat dessert too???? We got mochi ice cream, tempura ice cream and 3 scoops of red bean, lychee and green tea ice cream. Needless to say, we were all stuffed!!!!  This place was worth every penny and definitely will be back again! Unfortunately I was so busy stuffing my face I didn't take any pictures =\ meh oh well. Until next time! =D

zY9Lx3-aiQWahlYoE68otg.text: We dined here during our vacation over a week ago and had to write a review about the excellent service we received from our server, Monica. We had the AYCE and Monica was prompt with our order, very knowledgeable, checked in on us from time to time and made excellent recommendations (even took the initiative to order food for us from the AYCE menu since she wanted us to try the variety of food). We dined with our 3 young children and our experience was excellent. And the food was delicious too!

3a0N4yQfwTOFo5ASvbZb8A.text: Had a 25min wait on a Sat night at 10pm. Not too bad. Service was great, our waiter was attentive and took time to explain some items I wasn't familiar with and gave great suggestions.   Quality was great and food came out in a timely manner. Soda and water refills were handled quickly which is a huge thing for my husband. I like the large selection of rolls WITHOUT crab salad. I don't like mayo so this is a huge plus and hard to find at most sushi places. For dessert we had fried ice cream and chocolate mousse. I wish I had ordered two of each because my husband doesn't usually like dessert and he ate most of them! Being so late I was ready to head home so decided not to order more.   Only dislike is the seating. It's such a small space and you sit soooo close to people, feels like you are almost joining them/vice versa. This time we sat in a corner so we had a little bit more privacy than when we have sat with people on all sides.   Overall we had a great time and will come back!!

fkyNJ2yPD9a7zD9_PhVI_A.text: So delicious. Awesome all you can eat (which I've had a hard time finding in Vegas) and the host played peekaboo with my daughter while we waited to be sat which was so sweet!  The place it's self is small but she accommodated us with the car seat while they were packed.  Great experience! Yummy food (extra kudos for the extra yum yum sauce on the volcano) and the staff is super nice.

x4Drtl6vJHUylyCQdcYkGQ.text: Yessssss. All you can eat sushi! My favorite thing in the world.   My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after seeing very good reviews and pictures about the quality of the sushi here. For AYCE sushi I would expect shitty quality for sushi but nah I was wrong. Their menu was so extensive for all you can eat! And the crazy thing about it is its $25 per person! So you have to come very hungry to eat the all you can eat.   Service was decent. We didn't really need a server since we sat at the sushi bar but the sushi chef was okay. He was very attentive and helpful about choosing the sushi. Plus sitting at the sushi bar for all you can eat is a good thing because you get more attention and you get your food right away.   Overall, my experience was great. I haven't been to an AYCE sushi place since I last been to Las Vegas. They need to open one in Houston!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More sushi :)
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon roll &amp; Athena Roll
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat Lunch!

lU5oFdDK4WY82IVjUMJh6w.text: I went to high school in Las Vegas so I'm not a stranger when it comes to AYCE sushi. And this place, is still my favorite after I first discovered it.  I live in Seattle now, but since my parents still live here I still come to visit ALL the time. And each time, I'm like "maybe I should try a new sushi place" and I do! But then, they never quite stack up to Goyemon.   Here's the thing, I don't think that Goyemon has the best side dishes. Maybe not even rolls. But if you're a raw fish or a nigiri lover like me --- Goyemon is the place for you. By far the freshest tasting raw fish I've had at an AYCE place.  ---albacore and salmon on point. As any sushi restaurant should. So fresh. And doesn't overdo it with the rice. Omg. ---fresh scallop melts in your mouth and has a hint of lemon. Omg. ---halibut has a slightly thicker texture like squid so it has the perfect amount of chewiness while not being overwhelming. Omg. ---super white tuna is just so melty and wonderful. Not overly fishy. Perfect. Omg.  I'm like dying. Can someone just take me to this sushi restaurant already?  As for rolls I like to get: -sunrise bc it has so much flavor to it. It's not heavy. It has a light citrus taste to it, and you can really taste all of the ingredients including the rawfish. -Goyemon style lasagna bc I like to eat some heavy food too. I like variety and if you get a half roll of this, the melted cream cheese isn't overwhelming. -sexy girl if you're a shrimp tempura person, this one's a goodie.  This place is BOMB. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pure bliss.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg those fresh scallops on the side. Could eat a whole plate of those...
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum.

24hWpXDR-R1m-M-qQp3kWg.text: Great sushi at a great price. We eat here every time we are in town.  Busy but sushi bar was open. Great sushi bar service by the chefs.   Don't tell tourist about this great secret.

QACTvsQ6cg-cxj26ISE7Kw.text: I would like to express my dismay about how this place treated me and my pregnant friend tonight. They sat us knowing we have a party of 3 since that's the first thing they ask, and our 3rd person was 2 mins away. As soon as the server walks in, the first thing she asks was if we had a 3rd person instead of greeting us. And proceeded to tell us that until our 3rd person arrives she cannot seat us, when we were already seated. Mind you there were tables right next to us who were parties of 2 who were seated at table that were meant for bigger parties, and then I saw them sit a couple who still had to wait on their friends. Way to lose loyal customers who were just looking to eat some food and have a goodnight. Instead was spoiled by a "policy" that they choose to enforce when they want to. I would love to give negative stars, unfortunately I cannot. From the hostess to the server and the manager, service was just bad and unorganized. We all have one job to do in customer service and that's to keep CUSTOMERS HAPPY! Unfortunately, that is not something that was attempted this evening, and as a result, this establishment will no longer be recommended nor frequented by myself or my many associates.

R98IBJa0AgxM41xchR-6Jg.text: This is a really nice restaurant. They have all you can eat sushi at a really good price. The place is small so they do get busy, I do suggest you get there a bit early they tend to have a waiting list. I  have been here a few times and the waiting list is usually 30 min to an hour but worth the wait. The food doesn't disappoint. My favorite thing here is the salmon belly I can't enough of it. The last time I came here me and my friends sat at the bar and the food came out faster than I thought. The staff here is pretty friendly. They do have specials on the board along with different items on the menu other than sushi. So if you do come here withb a group of friends there should be something for everyone to enjoy.

n36gb1WSKScGXzTFiWJBoQ.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places that I have been to so far. The fish was fresh and that's important as not all AYCE places serve the freshest fish. This is one of the very few gems that do but before you come here, be prepared to put your name on the list with your phone number so they can text you when your table is ready! It's pretty awesome.   The wait. Up to 2 hours if they're busy but I tell you what.. It's totally worth it. You can pretty much order anything and everything from the several menus plopped on the table. There's quite a few selections so look through them carefully. From appetizers to side dishes to the nigiri, rolls and desserts. It really is a True all encompassing AYCE experience where everything can be ordered. I did notice that the uni and amaebi nigiri can only be ordered once.  My favorite thing of all was actually not the sushi (that's not to say the sushi wasn't good) but the pork belly appetizer which was incredibly fattening, moist and insanely well flavored. If you like Salmon, the Salmon belly is available and sampled both the standard and the belly. If you like fatty and tasty fish, I wholeheartedly recommend the belly. It's got so much flavor! The uni was fresh and quite tasty.  Service was good and efficient. Being that it was me and my brother's first time there, we were kindly informed about the whole process. Our waiter was patient and answered all our questions and we had a few! By the end of the night, we were so full, we still opted for desserts. So yeah, try to pace yourself. Don't just order everything at once. Order in waves!  We came here during EDC week and this place was packed and with good reason. Service is good and so is the food. For $27 per person for dinner, this place is hard to beat and I look forward to coming here whenever I make Vegas my next stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea ice cream, green tea Mochi, yuzu sorbet, and green tea brulee.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi and shredded scallop
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jellyfish and some more salmon belly

ey0egnaZea3SGFeHC4a6MQ.text: All you can eat sushi establishments don't exactly inspire great food. Rather, cold, odds, flavorless, old, and even bad come to mind. Yet Goyemon bucks that trend and I have to say that it was pretty darn good, and even better for less than $30 bucks!  Who has uni on an all you can eat menu...crazy right!? And the best part, it was pretty damn good and fresh. The maguro but decent, and well...tuna, so it definitely didn't disappoint. The salmon was pretty damn fresh and full of flavor. The dynamite definitely packed some punch and be sure to check out the items on the specials menu.   While we waited a long time for a table at 10:00 pm, we definitely didn't wait long for our food to arrive. We sat at the bar and were able to watch our order made in front of us. Also, felt inspired to try a few new things that were being made for other parties.   Location is definitely a bit away from the strip, but well worth the journey. Set in a strip mall, parking wasn't exactly in short supply.   Was it worth the journey and the hype? Yeah, I would definitely give it another go!

ATSWtHCaYwkp0ZyzlKtGYQ.text: If you have followed my previous reviews closely, you will have known who is MON group and their powerhouse japanese restaurants in Las Vegas. This is another of their brainchild. This place is an All-you-can-eat Japanese buffet restaurant. You can however, order off the menu ala-carte, but I've never seen anybody actually do that.   First off, understand that this place DOES NOT take reservations, it is strictly a first come first serve basis. Secondly, understand that they have very limited seating. At most 50-70 people would be a overestimate from what i could observe.  Thirdly, understand that all your sushi and dishes are prepared on the spot for you. Basically you place your order with the waitress and the sushi chef will prepare your sushi on the spot for you. It is a small kitchen and fourthly, understand that your food might take a while to arrive at your table.   The food here, however, is one of the best value for money sushi restaurants in town.  Each individual sushi is probably half the size of what you would normally see outside, so take note, although the size of the sushi does not determine its quality. Every single sushi is prepared for the freshness, from the ingredients to the sushi rice, everything is of a high quality. The quality of the sushi here definitely beats those found in the international buffets at Caesars Palace or the Wynn.   The choice of raw fish is extensive, they have all the common sushi you can find at most sushi joints in the states, from salmon, tuna, albacore, white tuna, octopus, scallops, sweet shrimps and even Uni(sea urchin). The number of special rolls is off the charts. So many different types to choose from. Even the desserts like the tempura ice cream can be found here.  Why spend 50 dollars a person at a regular sushi joint if you are a hardcore sushi lover when you can spend half of that eating to your hearts content at this place?  Just come earlier with an empty stomach and you will leave a happy and satisfied person.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail buffet!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special rolls. So many to choose from.

AVjS9JQGJFd7QJh9MdNueg.text: The food was great, and I loved the fact that they are open til 3 am.  However, the service fell below my standards.  Our server was not too kind, and she seemed reluctant to take our order when ever we wanted more food.  We did the all you can eat dinner which is $26.95 per person.  The menu is vast, with so much variety.  Every roll you could possibly want is on here.  I would also like to add that the grilled menus are also part of the all you can eat menu.  That part was not clearly written on the menu.  Keep in mind that the grilled items are good, but tiny, only coming in one or two pieces.  They limit the amount certain premium fish you are allowed to order, such as uni.    Our server was really anal about making sure we ate all the rice from the sashimi.  We wanted to order more because we knew it would take time for the items to come out from the kitchen.  But before she took down our order, she noticed we still had some pieces we had not finished yet.  She decided she would take on the roll of the Rice Police and yell at us to finish our food.  Lady, we did not ask you to the plate away.  Don't assume.  You make an ASS out of U and ME.    Anyways, I would like to reiterate that the food was good.  The service, not so much.  I would definitely recommend this place just because they are open so late, and have a lot of food to choose from.

GdEmnzGzVsqKn2H6wn4diA.text: The food here is delicious and the service was great. Especially Chris the host! He made sure we were accommodated during a very busy lunch hour and my party was extremely grateful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5TzJK2xmRAvCC_QbwHliBA.text: SO YUM FOOD! They are veggie-friendly. I especially loved the shiitake mushrooms on the grill. Veggie supreme roll was also so yum! Also I enjoyed the seaweed salad.  Improve: service. They didn't pay much attention on us, food took SO LONG. All you can eat recommendation at this point: 26,95$ and you can eat ANYTHING

Pca18glbdIKfyYLlh3-lHA.text: Phenomenal sushi every time I go. Been there about 20 times. Sometimes they don't have uni, so expect that. The amount of items they have for all you can eat is unreal. Soups, salads, tempura, sashimi, nigiri, desserts, specials and many more.   I would definitely recommend to anyone to try it and get addicted just like me. Timmay is excellent and the rest of the staff are amazing.   Prepare to wait, they don't take reservations. But you can put your name down and they will call you when there is five minutes left on your wait.

dOG_eP00DAZ6SZnbM68zgQ.text: Came here with my brother. To be honest, we came here a lot and we like the food here always. However, I had to give a two stars today because the horrible service. I understand today is Friday they will be busy but I think no matter how busy they are they still need to make sure the service is not this horrible!  Our server's name is PA.  she never smiles to us and always ignore us when we need something. When we ordered the ice cream, they put the green tea ice cream, red bean ice cream and the lychee sherbet together on the same bowl and they all melt together!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t believe they put all the ice cream together and they melt.

nPpRcZzoMEBJ0JY2MpXIbg.text: Came here about a year and a half ago and I'm still thinkin' about this place!   I loved that they were open late! However, they do run out of some of the good stuff! Don't get me wrong though, they still had a lot of fresh, fatty, juicy fish! My FAVORITE.   I really liked the salmon belly! From what I can remember, the yellowtail nigiri had sauce on it, but I didn't know so afterwards I just asked for no sauce (I like my fish plain). Yummy desserts after your meal, what more can you ask for??

4TEi_6ke8BRP4v7nwjcD5w.text: DO NOT EAT HERE! ---- Yes, I just said that - DO NOT EAT HERE!  Over the years, I have posted positive things about Sushi House Goyemon! We have eaten here MANY MANY MANY times - have recommended Goyemon as the best of Vegas to MANY MANY MANY people. However, they don't care anymore.  We went in for lunch and several times they tried pushing us into dinner prices ... then the sushi started to come - extremely small pieces of fish with very large amounts of rice. The rolls looked sloppy and drenched in sauce. I asked the waitress and she said our chef was new - OK, maybe he shouldn't be preparing food yet ... so be it, then more slop arrived - I called over a "manager" to show him. He said they do not have a General Manager, there was no boss and there was no way to contact anyone anymore with all their locations. However, he said he would try to locate a number for me to follow-up with.  I went to the bathroom and was even more bothered - the bathroom has gratify in it that was there a year ago (with profanity in Spanish). I asked this "manager" about it and he said the management don't follow-up on anything (if your bathroom is not clean, then you have to wonder about the kitchen). He said he would have someone contact me, but my best bet would be to write a review and they would see it. Well, we have posted good Yelp reviews in the past ... sure, I could tell of my True recent experiences.  Not receiving the phone call that I was promised, I commented on an ad that popped up on my timeline (FB). I said "when was this picture taken, it was not recently based on my experience". Someone commented and asked if this was correct - so I posted a picture of our food. Sushi House Goyemon removed the picture and comment AND blocked me. Blocked me? Why not reply and say "sorry you had a problem" - no, blocked me. I can't revise my 5star review as I get this message "You are blocked You are not allowed to rate or review the Page because you are blocked by the Page admin." DO NOT EAT HERE - the pictures on this page are not accurate ... food, quality and service are pathetic.
