6QwE6wUTj1S7A1geZwkJoQ.text: Lately, I haven't been here as my go to AYCE, but they never disappoint. Until recently, I will NOT come back again. We came here as a big group. We sat down and boy their service has gone out the door! All but one waiter had something stuck up their *ss. It seems no one wanted to work there. We couldn't even order. Food was coming out sooo slow, can't find waitresses to order, and couldn't even flag anyone down because we were ignored.   As for the sushi, it was sub standard. Have been to better places in town. Sorry and sad this place I would not recommend anymore.

W1CyCXk28fhOeRqlmuEMBQ.text: I was here about a month ago. A couple of my co-workers and I finished work early and decided to go out and have some sushi. We decided on this place since this was a couple miles down the street from the office. None of us had ever been here.   We just missed the lunch rush so the restaurant was not as busy. We ended up getting seats at the sushi bar and ordered AYCE. Good selection of different rolls and many of them could be ordered as half-rolls. They also had sides such as tempura veggies, pot stickers and small servings of poke. I tried the poke and the pot stickers. I tried a couple of their baked rolls and I usually order whatever unagi dishes sushi places have. All the rolls I had were good as well as the tempura and pot stickers. The staff was friendly and service was good. The sushi chefs got our meals out in a timely manner and even lightly joked around with us.   As for the building itself, it was nicely and tastefully decorated; inviting and warm but not distracting. It was a good first-time experience and I will come back soon.

0idjKuQFy7uMhYrcyn_QIg.text: I like this place when I have the craving for AYCE.  I love the pork belly and the sashimi salad.

8lRxbJqWNMUQOymMMoKPzA.text: Fresh sushi with fast, friendly service. They have all you can eat appetizers, sushi and desserts for lunch and dinner. Everything is made when you order it! I highly recommend Goyeman!

ZvEBhYva4EKDpVEq4kIpjA.text: Mediocre food, snotty lunch hostess & rude service made for an unpleasant lunch experience. I ordered the lunch special box that came with Teriyaki chicken that was way overcooked to the point where it had the consistency of leather & wood bark. 2 stars for their thick cuts of sashimi.

rvDpN4Y_JILS6rCbT69xog.text: Horrendous customer service (very slow, unprofessional, inept, and down right rude)! Mediocre food! Dismal portion sizes for the price! DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE!!!

74fy8wRrTdRxltQCXdqBNA.text: This is one our first stops when in Vegas. If you love Sushi this is the place to visit and enjoy the All-U-Can Eat menu. The price is right and the sushi is great along with customer service. We will return again.

5LzxO72yyRXGWQg0UP2abw.text: I have only been to Sushi House Goyemon for all you can eat, but it is fantastic!  I am usually skeptical of all you can eat sushi since often times the quality and selection will suffer.  This is absolutely not the case at Goyemon.  Their nigiri menu is the typical selections, but they have a huge number of very inventive and tasty rolls.  Their version of the 911 roll is the spiciest I have had anywhere since they add habanero pepper as well as the typical chili sauce.  Another pleasant surprise for their all you can eat menu is that there are items available from the grill.  I have had the grilled yellowtail and pork belly and both were very tasty.  The service has always been good with multiple servers handling each table which makes it go much quicker with a large group doing AYCE.  I try to show up before 6 since they get busy for dinner, even for weeknights.

NA-HGEWw1OYDab7WOr6zQw.text: Unlimited sushi for 30 bucks. I did it in a heartbeat and I do not regret it.   The waiters don't really wait on you hand and foot you have to track them down just to order more sushi but I had such a good time with my friends but I didn't really pay attention.   Tips:  1. Make a reservation! 2. Go with a group of people (I went with 7) who like sushi that way every one can have the unlimited sushi and you're able to try more dishes.  3. Their mochi ice cream is DELICIOUSSSSS

EiNinhgN7zATd87ouuZ7sA.text: I was invited to eat out by several of my co-workers, all who of which are Japanese.  I first asked if they had eaten at Goyemon prior to our visit, which they confirmed that they had, multiple times.  So that was my first indication that this place wouldn't be too shabby.  We arrived at a modestly decorated space with a fifteen minute wait for six people at 1AM on a Friday night.  The interior has mood lighting, with a gorgeous, clean bathroom and an overall generic but pleasant decor.    To get a good sampling of what the restaurant offered, I decided to spend the 26.95 to get the AYCE which isn't just sushi, but included all kitchen food, entrees, and dessert.  That way, if the sushi was mediocre, I could pig out on entrees and kitchen food.    Thankfully, that was not the case as the sushi was pretty good.  I ended up eating a lot of the Americanized rolls which as a whole I generally don't care for, but every once in a while I do end up finding a roll that has a ton of goobledegook on it and enjoying it.  I for one like my sushi to be light and have a distinctly smooth taste to it.  So this place worked for me.  I had two orders of shumai (steamed/fried), gyoza, eight half orders of sushi, 1/2 order of ramen, and Green Tea Cake, the latter of which was my favorite part of the meal.  And yes, you read that prior part right: You can do half orders of sushi, which I loved, since this gave you the ability to a variety of sushi rather than get stuck with a roll that was so-so in your ranking.    In terms of sushi: Sexy Girl, Cynthia, and Dragon all stood out for me.    The only thing I really didn't care for was the service.  It started off fantastic.  Speedy, tons of refills on my iced green tea.  And then, towards the end, I was waiting and waiting and waiting to get a refill of water.  The staff was pleasant, and the food was good, very good for an AYCE.

EgGRcEuZHdYfm6SImeZrfg.text: All you can eat sushi! It's a pretty decent place. The rolls are really good but after awhile the flavors start to taste all the same with all the cream cheese and stuff.   The nigiri is what I would go for. The tuna here isn't the best. (Especially after eating  the Toro sushi at Angotei, but I didn't expect much from it since it is ayce). Salmon is really good though. I would avoid the Seared Tuna nigiri at all cost. I expected them to sear it on the spot, but I received the fish cold and hard. Nothing compared to Tokyo Table seared garlic tuna.   This deal includes desserts as well. The green tea creme brulee is alright. The flavoring just doesn't seem right. I prefer a regular creme brulee over this one. However, the mochi is good, but how could you go wrong with that? Green tea and red bean ice cream are good as expected.

BzxQfh6eI5wNt2l2DrVqQg.text: Came to Vegas for my birthday and we were craving sushi. All the Yelp reviews for this place sounded great and we liked that it was all you can eat. The whole experience was great. It's a small place but we were seated right away and the decor is beautiful. The nigiri was incredible. We also liked that you can order all the rolls in half portions so we were able to try a bunch. The Pastel roll was probably the best sushi roll I've ever had in my life. The Lemon roll was great too. Rice to fish ratio was perfect and the service was great. Their baked mussels were very tasty too. Definitely recommend this place if you're in Vegas and want delicious all you can eat sushi. Lunch was 22.95 I think, not bad.

xQGxRGGv-Ty11k1FdGEU0w.text: This is my go to sushi house out of all the other AYCE sushi places that I've been to in Vegas.  The quality of the fish is so good, I actually don't even bother with the rolls and tend just to get nigiri.  Be warned, this place does get extremely busy at night, so if you're coming in with a party, be warned you're probably going to have to wait for a bit.  Non-sushi wise, I also like pretty much everything that comes off their grill.  The cajun salmon is just delicious, excellently spiced with just a little bit of kick from the pepper.  You can't go wrong with the pork belly either, it's just a rich piece of meat with really good and smooth flavors.  It usually has a great mouth feel to it as well.  And finally, the super white tuna, it's just delicious, little sweet, but very well balanced.  Now for the chili-heads out there, this place can hook you up if you want some heat.  The 9-1-1 roll can definitely get your taste buds going, and if you want it spicier, just tell them to add more of the habanero sauce.  They can also kick most of their rolls up another notch if you ask them too.

C4zg2ckjkLMdbYJAHclTpw.text: I've been coming here for years and each experience is awesome!!!  Delicious food, great service and a relaxing environment...and this is why it is always packed!!!

ODS0r7V0lkbYFQ3bDE_ffw.text: My first sushi experience. Which is funny because the bf went to sushi school. He liked this place too. We had all kinds of stuff somethings i liked, some not so much. We did not do the all you can eat so we just ordered alot of random stuff. The ones i remembered for sure was the Pork belly dish that was amazing. And the super white grilled tuna was another of my favorites. 58$ for two people with tip. and thats without the AYCE price which is 26$ a person. The staff is good and the service is quick.

f7Pp8yP9Odk1-0WhsRimfA.text: I really liked the really fast service! The small portions were great! I really liked that since most people at other AYCE sushi places load up there rolls with a crazy amounts of rice in it the meal is hard to enjoy. I dont feel as if they do that here. The service was awesome and so was the sushi. The only thing I did not like was the salad and the dressing.

AemQu1aefEpCL3wqmq1VKA.text: Delicious sushi!  We took a cab from the strip and although that added about $20 the experience, it was well worth it.  We took advantage of the AYCE sushi. I was worried that they would bring them out slowly or the rolls would be small but they were timely with each serving and the rolls were stuffed. They have so many delicious rolls to choose from as well as many non-sushi items included in the AYCE.

ieWnRNsj9J6D4LsG0evcUA.text: Fresh sushi!!!!!!  the only bad things is the size and wait of this place. Come hungry . Nom nom nom nom

_Don-Mvr8chAsXny_DJofA.text: I have to admit that this place is worth the hype. Now, I'm not a fan of AYCE dining in general, much less when there's raw fish involved.  However, if you're not a sushi snob (cause let's face it, if you're looking for bargain fish you ain't gettin unlimited A-grade stuff) and hate spending $18 per roll (I'm looking at you, Yellowtail @ Bellagio), then this may be the place for you.   Take my advice and take a look at the pics on Yelp before you go so you have an idea of the first few things you'd like to try.  I didn't and went into panic mode when it came time to ordering.  Nothing's worse than sitting at the sushi bar and furiously scanning the double-sided menu and going, "....ummm....uh....er....." while the uber-busy sushi chef is waiting for you to respond.  I have to admit that after a while I just stuck to ordering whatever the stranger next to me ordered, cause he seemed like a regular. Thanks random stranger for not calling me out on copying your style!  You were right on point with the sashimi salad.

o2jEuiGFs9Rjgiyf8AslZw.text: Most sushi bars have some barely passable fish, but Goyemon across the board is at least great, and some are fabulous.  Salmon belly, for example, is a treat.  All U Can Eat is a bargain considering the quality of the fish.  They also do some interesting roles, but order 1/2 roles so you can keep enjoying the variety. Goyemon gets crowded at times, but it's worth it; sitting at the bar is fine.  This is the best A-U-C-E that we've had...anywhere.

nM3R4Llwa-4eCxuFdu4Upg.text: The quality the service is top notch. As an ayce sushi it seems we are limited in our location selections and this is one spot I would travel from the very North Pole to eat at. Hands down mine and wifeys favorite.

jyvG0j992XqBSKQ03AkSjA.text: since i found goyemon i dont go to any other sushi joints...EVER!  if i do...i always end up leaving saying" ill just stick with Goyemon"  The sushi is fresh no matter what time of day i go. The staff is friendly and very attentive. I ask for something and they get it for me without me having to say " why isnt it coming"  Sushi's freshness is very important and they never disappoint me.   Yeah there is a long line sometimes but it worth the wait  The side orders are my favorite. I always get me miso with shrimp heads, green mussel, steamed goyza, pork belly, and my favorite GRILLED VEGGIES!! YUM  This place is a MUST if you have loving for sushi. TRY IT OUT you will be back.. trust me.. you will get addicted to it lol

udCidg6WxT-vcof3UH8Z4g.text: Honestly don't know what I'm giving two stars for.. Maybe because the host was extremely welcoming and eager to seat us even though it was jam packed at 5:30pm on a Sunday and did so within the first 10 mins of arrival. We, among several groups were told 30-45 or even 45-60min waits, but we just got lucky with the bar. Our first server was quick and so was out busser... But like many other AYCE joints, once the first order or two has been taken, they don't come around anymore. Our chef seemed disgruntled the entire time as he served our sad sad looking nigiri. Barely any of it stayed intact when it was picked up. He seemed better at forming rolls. All the food tasted fine, but could the presentation just at least be ALMOST decent? (See pictures below) can't complain about dessert since Mochi ice cream is pre-made. The bf ordered the tempura ice cream which would have been great except it took four, I say FOUR waiters to bring a spoon that the tempura was already soggy. He was still kind enough to tip generously where I admit I might've not been so kind. Other than that, the place looks clean. The decor is inviting. Beyond that, I can't say anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ate two pieces before taking the pic so don&#39;t mind that.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hamachi.. Seriously?

c0gsOPQNyWWSHwHGPc-I_g.text: 4.5 stars  Dined here for the first time tonight with the family, and I gotta say this place trumps sushi mon as the best AYCE sushi joint in Las Vegas. And that's saying a lot, because I've been been a big fan and a regular of Sushi Mon for the past six years. However, at the end of the night, I get a stamp card (buy 10 ACYEs and get one free), and it has Sushi Mon's  E. Sahara location on it as well. I came to the conclusion that Sushi House Goyemon has the same owner?  I was impressed with the quality of the fish and the relatively small portion of rice that came with the nigiri. Many ACYE places give huge portions of rice and miniscule pieces of fish. I may be exaggerating a bit, but you know what i mean. The ploy of most of these places is to get you full quicker by giving you bigger chunks of rice. Not at Goyemon.  Some of my highlights: -Uni nigiri (very fresh) -Since I'm a huge fan of spicy tuna, I have to try every sushi joint's spicy tuna roll. The spicy tuna had a tarty/sour kick to it giving it a very exotic flavor, which I thoroughly enjoyed -Crispy Rice Roll (Fried Cali Roll with spicy tuna on top drizzled with eel sauce and spicy mayo) - Seared tuna (perfectly seared and very fresh tuna) - Hirame sushi (delicate, melted in my mouth) - Green Tea Cake (creamy and not too sweet) - Lychee ice cream (Heaven)  I deducted 0.5 stars, because we had to wait about 15-20 minutes for the rest of our sushi and rolls to come out. However, the restaurant was packed, so it was understandable. Our waitress apologized to us several times. (She was also very nice and pretty :)

_b9YtEnCAvZmfgyWiqOuKA.text: Sushi House Goyemon was the second sushi place my fiancee and I tried when we moved here a year ago and we won't go anywhere else ever again! The all you can eat is a great deal and every roll we have gotten we loved. The sushi chefs are friendly and very good at what they do. Every time we go we can't wait till the next time we get to indulge in the amazingness that is SHG.

oFfjb1lu1cUaRg_2Az1uwA.text: Don't go here at 2am. They obviously leave their fish out the entire day. Their AYCE portions, while fairly priced, are laughable. Almost gagged at their version of Super White Tuna, absolute no melt effect whatsoever.

LcVT8efjlHdA9wouYeBQhg.text: Best AYCE sushi on the SW end of town!  There's not much else to say, but i had a great time dining with 18 other people in their party room!  Service was a bit slow , you have to expect when in a big group. I didn't realize it and thought about it until after the fact.  But the food was yummy.   BEWARE:  The spicy tuna roll is NOT for the weak. This roll has got some serious HEAT.. It lingered for a long time, no tea, no amount of beer or sake washed away the HEAT of the spice!!!   Will I go back again? ABSOLUTELY!

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot the name its a Mexican name though!

xbhwy9qfysjQ5S8zNY548A.text: All you can eat sushi!   Yes!  This isn't a buffet bar rather table service with full hand rolls and more.  There food was fun and started many discussions about ... Food..  Even though I got the buffet / all you can eat my servings were great.  More fish than rice!  always a plus.

3Z0AGXuSiHh_n-OcovcuPQ.text: No customer service at all. Service is really bad. I will never go there anymore waste my time n money.

He42_eRBYc5L-rZPAifDWg.text: of all the ayce sushi places in town, this is one of the better ones. their nigiri is well portioned and isnt roided up on rice. i like how theyre smaller than some other places so you dont get full on a few when you want to try a variety. their masago presentation is always a little sloppy though.   only minor gripe is for an employee. dont bite your thumbnail while you go into the kitchen and promptly bring me my miso soup with the thumb that you were biting on the inside of the bowl as the soup sloshes over your thumb. if you want me to taste your thumb, we can arrange a more private meeting.

T9BNumRSnxTCA6OHfSRQ3g.text: Love this place! My to go to for all you can eat. Sushi is always amazing and taste fresh, service is great! I definitely recommend this place if your looking for some good sushi that's all you can eat.

Xw1fX22XJ-A621zreTtc5Q.text: PSA - the yelp hours are wrong. Goyemon opens at 11:45. You wouldn't think that 15 minutes would make a difference, but I'm here to tell you that showing up at noon was the difference between an immediate table and an hour long wait. Still love this place, just wish I could ever get in to enjoy it.

9EBOx41titFZtzYVkWyl4g.text: My husband and I's favorite sushi spot. The staff are friendly, food is great, the sushi chefs are fun and personable and they remember the rolls we get, we enjoy sitting at the sushi bar best for fastest service. This place is always packed so we usually go pretty late to avoid the rush. I hope one day they expand! Sushi Mon on the other side of town is same owners and menu I believe, but the service is not nearly as good. We live right by Sushi Mon and still drive all the way to Goyemon every time, it's worth it..

cfrnDQymEIivDfmErLG74Q.text: 5:00 we arrived here, we told them we have 3people, after 45mins. They tell us, seat is ready,but 2 only. Are u kidding me? We told them 3, even u can Count number how many people we have, 2?! So we have to wait extra 10mins to get seat. 1 star more because chef is good.

hJMtCYmsFFFch_X-NT_SMw.text: Visited for dinner on a Friday night, July 6, 2012 (sorry, long overdue review!)  One of my local friend's top choice (Arvin T), but unfortunately, nothing too spectacular in my mind.  I'll leave it to the other 500+ reviews to clue you in.  I will say that there is sometimes worry that these AYCE sushi places pack on the rice and skimp on the fish to get you full off the starch, but I didn't find this was the case here.  Enjoyable (most likely due to good company), but probably not worth the drive off the strip for tourists... unless you were very hungry and really craved sushi.

MSH52NESu1_cC421ttb0zg.text: I went this place yesterday. Sunday around 2pm. And i bring some my guest to this place becuase goyemon was my fav sushi place. So we sit on the sushi bar. And i had horrible experirnce in my life. It was only second round we do the AYCE. 8order only and i order to old sushi man for salmon 30min ago and he never serve to me so i ask him to can i have 1order salmon then old sushi guy told me "finish your plate first." Wow. We order only 16pc AYCE. And his attitude like don't want to make it or serve us. So i leave this palce right away. I stayed there only 30min. Owner should change the sushi man or do something.

3rqFXNqDKLwVKmaQlMEhFg.text: 3.5 stars  Been to this place a few times that I've already got through a couple stamp cards with friends and family.  The last visit was probably late last year with group of friends.  That was the last time I fully enjoyed this place. It used to be my favorite sushi spot in Vegas.  AYCE is the way to go when dining at Goyemon. Tried the seared salmon salad and it was delicious but a little too much dressing for my taste.  Specialty rolls galore. I'd have to say my favorite is the Sexy Girl.  Salmon skin hand roll was blah, no flavor but the right amount of gobo.  It's nice because they do do half rolls. I took my bff from Boston here yesterday and sat next to a couple who ordered many times but all half rolls. Smart couple.   I LOVE their spicy tuna rice cracker but unfortunately it's only on their dinner menu.  Pork belly is hit or miss for me there (also only on the dinner menu). I love it when it's super tender but have had orders when it's more on the chewy or burnt side. Bff and I ordered nigiri which I don't normally order.  We did enjoy the garlic tuna, super white was OK, she enjoyed the cajun albacore. I was sad that my green tea ice cream which I always look forward to was half melted by the time I got it and BFF didn't expect her tempura ice cream to be soggy as opposed to the crunchy outside she expected :(  The reason I didn't give a 5 star rating as I would've last year is that the service went downhill. I remember staff being more attentive with filling my water and more friendly upon entering the restaurant.  Might be a while before I make another visit...

5xdAh1M2BXM2qMuhqUkQCg.text: This place has so much potential and would definitely get 5 stars if it wasn't for the average service and shortage of servers and sushi chefs.  I was in Vegas with my family plus family friends about 3 weeks ago. My dad had wanted to try this one sushi place my aunt recommended. After searching through Yelp, we decided to go Sushi House Goyemon instead of our original dinner plans because of the high rating on Yelp.   Since we had a larger party (about 15 people), we waited a little bit over 30 min. Most of us did the AYCE which was $26.95/person (no discounted price for children). The menu is HUGE! They had so many appetizers, salads, rolls, sashimi, and desserts to choose from on the AYCE menu. I was impressed and wish I could have tried them all. They had a lot of items that I usually only see on the regular menus that are not for AYCE. Since it was a while ago that I went, I can't remember them all... but some that popped out were grilled yellowtail collarbone, cold tofu, wakame (seaweed salad), green tea creme brulee... just to name a few. The sashimi was so fresh!! DROOOOOL! it makes me hungry just to think about it! hahaha  Although the food selection was great, the service was so so slooooooooow. Half of my party got full just from waiting for the rest of their food to come out and ended up not eating that much. It seemed like they forgot some of our food so we would ask them to check up on it. As a result, we got double of our order, which is a plus except when you don't feel like an having an excessive amount of the same thing. There were 4 servers the night I came, but only two sushi chefs for a full house?? The delicious desserts kind of helped compensate for the wait and they let us stay longer than the 1 hour maximum sit time.  I would try this place again but with a smaller party.

v5MP52dNxihVQRaP_RgAYA.text: My absolute favorite all you can eat sushi place! Fresh, delicious, great service. .   Try the ecstasy roll, my personal fave :P

mAVsWFnszBYSqgOKX_sZJg.text: The food is good but so not worth the hour and a half wait time. (They originally had told us 45-60 mins). For how busy that place is, they should really consider a bigger location or start allowing reservations.

20B5-toHP_ekBklgz4yaPg.text: This is 2 years later. Before you read my review I'd like to point out some things. I'm not a complainer, not hard to please, I'm very easy going, I don't think first impression is everything, I give multiple chances, and I'm so understanding. Even when I find hair in my food, I don't even complain or tell the server. Now that we got that out of the way and you know what type of consumer I am, lets continue with why I went from giving this place 5 stars to 2 stars.   I had been going to goyemon for few years loyally since it first opened. Introduced multiple friends and family to trying there. My boyfriend and I ate here regularly, at least once a week and we always did AYCE, I did couple a la carte for lunch to go. Quality and cleanliness were over the top. Waiting up to an hour or more for dinner everytime was always worth it. The service was always so amazing. Until recently, I had a (new) server that got sassy with me one visit, didn't say anything. Went back couple more times after that and the service and food kept going down hill. Servers were not as attentive and it seems to be almost a new crew except for some that has been there awhile. One bus boy was awesome, don't know his name and the sushi chefs are cool too. Apri, the hostess is sweet. Other than those mentioned, None of the other servers have any personality.   Last time my boyfriend and I ate here (which we almost went back for one last chance a week later but decided to go to our other favorite sushi place. More on that later) I was so disgusted by how dirty everything was and the quality of the food. The plate of wasabi and ginger had dried  up food still stuck on it (somehow, the server missed that putting wasabi and ginger on it). I scraped it off and let it go. More plates came with food, all the plates had dried up food still stuck on them. My beer glass had lip stains around the rim. I didn't say a damn thing about any of those dirty dishes. Food came, everything had smaller portions than before. All the nigiris had a tiny piece of fish on them. Amount of food from side dishes were cut in half. I get it, it's AYCE smaller the portion the more you can eat or less food you may waste. But what the restaurant started with and what people grew to love should be priority and that's the quality of the food, that went down hill. I'm so disappointed, I'd love to still go there but after all the past experiences the last few visits we won't be going back ever again. Umiya is closer and has always been our other favorite when goyemon is too busy or when we don't want to make the drive. The quality of the food is amazing. The servers actually have personality and actually acknowledge the fact that you're a regular. Way better vibe.   So there is my first "negative" review. Management : whoever is running goyemon now needs to prioritize before you start losing more customers. Clean your dishes.

60CkCTik_zb9oMx3ibaDcg.text: As this was my 1st experience of All You Can Eat sushi, there are a number of words that I want to use to describe to you how I felt at the end of this meal.   Words like "disgusting", "bloated", "obese" and mainly "self loathing" were the ones I was tossing around as I wondered how I would write this review. But you know what word REALLY sums up surprisingly delicious sushi in quantities that would shock a Sumo wrestler?  Glorious.

_IXCNzo0B8aD7CoA4k2DiA.text: See Phil!! Awesome Sushi!! Awesome service and the best Sushi!! Everything was delicious and savory.. Service was attentive and on point.. Must try the lasagna and tempura ice cream..

Js1W1DrERu9zVdA5WW1ZoA.text: I want to give this restaurant more stars but service today was just terrible. If I could I would give them 3.5.  We have visited this place at least 5 times now. Usually for dinner.   To start the food is good. Fish is not fishy at all. Most Ayce places don't have good quality fish but this place stands out. Their pork belly is pretty amazing as well.  Now of course this place isn't better than a la carte places like soho and other places that you might find on the strip. But if you are looking for ayce this is the place to go.   Trust me it's not perfect nigiri pieces are smaller like cut in half per order, also their rice is a little hard for me. But still we come here because the taste is pretty good. They also have a lot of good hot food options. Like their baked mussels is a must as well as the garlic edamame.   So why the 3 stars?? Ok so usually when we go here we do have to flag down a server to order more food, not sure if they do that on purpose so we don't order more?? And the food does come out slow. But today was just the worst. We got food before we got our waters ! And then the server forgot the hot tea so I had to be the annoying person and have my hand up to get her attention. We saw several of our dishes go to the table next to us. And then when we asked about it she said it's on the way. We got our second round of orders before we got our missing shumai and edamame ( first order). My bf seriously loves their  garlic edamame so he was getting a little hAngry  and annoyed with the server. When we got the edamame it was regular edamame and not garlic,  so now we are just mad. I ordered 4 orders of yellowtail nigiri and one toro. We got at our table one yellowtail and one tuna. I figured she just messed up the order but turns out it was someone else's order. Then I saw them run our 4 orders of salmon belly to the table next to us again! ( seems to be the theme of the day). We over heard tables on both side of us complaining that they were missing orders. So it wasn't just us imagining things. The lady from the other table orders ice cream before me. They gave me her order of ice cream by mistake. Every time we ordered food there was some sort of mix up even down to the dessert.   We spent a lot time waiting. Waiting to get our drinks. Waiting to order. Waiting for our food. Waiting for refills. The only thing we didn't wait for was the check.   I like this place and hope that the next time our  experience is better and I will be sure to update my review

wV2iLFQCGvst0WzTHx3iDQ.text: I was a regular here but now that changed. This place is trash for many reasons. First reason, do not get seated in the room that's parted outside and says it's VIP.  Their service is garbage, noting at our table when seated not even a waiter at our table. We have to ask for one. You guys shouldn't even have that room that you guys so call VIP.  Second reason, food quality this time was horrible. Fish tasted like it was sitting out for hours instead of keeping it well maintained and fresh. Main Reason, we was trying to ordering again but no server or waiter around for at least 15 mins so we didn't want to wait another dam minute for them to show up, no refills on drinks also, these guys are running a circus here. I had to get up from my own seat and ask for my check. If yelp was able to give 0 stars you guys would tottally get one. But 1 start for noting because 0 stars isn't optional here.

vZ0gj-fyQyGAqYoM_W0niw.text: Umm AYCE tempura fried ice cream (yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH...)? Screw the sushi! Give me some more, give me some more! And the mochi ice cream too! But still, the sushi was pretty damn good as well. Really liked the ono (yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH...) and the almon (yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH...) they both had the taste of butter, delicious sweet butter of the ocean. Also found the hamachi and the cajun albacore (yelp.com/biz_photos/JyxH...) to be just as delicious. The cajun albacore was an interesting dish considering you won't find it at most sushi places, but definitely had a smoky, spiced up flavor that matched well with the fish. Can't really go wrong with what you order, just don't order a lot of rolls with a lot of rice or fillers, cause it does fill you up quickly. Then comes the dessert, mochi, lychee and other fruit sorbets, ice cream, and tempura fried ice cream. If you're an ice cream person, this might be worth the whole price tag of the lunch or dinner itself. Enjoy!

i--DPjnKmWRon3vTUBh8ZQ.text: I really wanted to give it 5 stars.   Based on all the reviews, I was super excited to come. It took 20 mins to get a very modest order. I'm not sure if it's because I did AYCE, but the portions are about 1/2 the size. I've never seen sushi so small... Placed my order right away, but then we waited, and waited...  I left feeling hungry.... Good thing I didn't have too pay for this meal.  :(

k7-YD8JrXKPUzAiT3Gypfw.text: This is by far the best sushi place I've been to.  Their Buffett can't be beat.  This is now on my Must Stop places when I'm in Las Vegas. If you like Lychee and ice cream, get the lychee ice cream for dessert. To top it off, their service set the standard.  Empty plates where removed from the table quickly after moving it to the side of the table, in seconds at times.

2NKHwyYfCFGZcqLJ6LZluQ.text: Goyemon is literally the best sushi place in town. You can taste the freshness of each sushi in every bite. My boyfriend and I always go for the all you can eat of course. We usually go for dinner. Our favorites are the salmon, tuna nigiris, and Pastel roll! We go here around two or three times a month. If you're looking for the best sushi experience, then this would be the place for you. Only downside is the wait, it usually takes an hour or two hour wait but hey, it's worth it!

DBvYEfE-4J06V5kZtJQxCQ.text: The AYCE  is such a great deal. They offer the special rolls in their AYCE menu. Top service. Super nice waitresses. Definitely coming back.

8kxa09lth4ivb3VF1MqHNg.text: This may be the one time that I wish I could give six stars!!!  Quick reasons why: -Menu is expansive and amazing  -text service for waiting list -you can order half rolls!!!!!  Holy Nigiri!!!  I don't think we can eat at our AYCE place at home. This place puts it to shame.    Andre is an amazing sushi chef.   Friendly, fast, and fills you up with great food.   The menu is overwhelming in the most positive way.  I'm not a fan of salmon, so on any rolls I wanted with salmon, he switched it for any fish of my choice.   This place is open til 3a, and the mood here is fun and festive.   For people that often complain of fish sizing in ratio to rice, this is your place - good cuts of fish with small amounts of rice.    service is awesome here too.  Wait list?  No problem.  They text you and you have 5-10 minutes to get back, where your table is ready.    I cannot compliment this place enough.  They must have 25 options of nigiri and 50 different rolls.    They got hot rolls also and the Baked 428, is BOMB!    And probably the highest point, they will make you half rolls.  It allows you to sample more rolls, and this is important for my wife.

-6q8Q8ibLmNOD7WP6XKd1w.text: I've heard so many good things about Goyemon and I finally had the luxury of trying it!  When my party got here, they seated us right away "probably because we came around 3pm". It's nice that they have two tables outside for parties waiting rather than standing.   When you walk inside, the place is very cozy, but not overly crowded. The service was very fast and we hardly had to wait for our food to come out. That was a definite plus. When you're here, you gotta get the baked mussels, salmon belly, and all the sashimi. Also try their green tea ice cream... It's bomb!    Goyemon is a great place for a all you can eat sushi. I'll definitely be coming back here again whenever I'm in Vegas !!

ebkNbquxw0Z0-zUjtWBh0g.text: Goyemon has the best quality fish of any AYCE sushi I have been to thus far. What sets them above everyone is also their rice:fish ratio, which I prefer to be very small. We ordered a ton of menu items, but some that stood out were:   Salmon Belly: Basically salmon at another level. If you love salmon, you will love this extra quality fish.   Super White Tuna: So fresh with the right amount of sauce/seasoning. Could have only had this for the whole meal and been satisfied!   The waitress was attentive and understanding. The other sushi and roll items were also great. I love Goyemon and after years of not really liking AYCE, now I love AYCE sushi!

3MQzN-RznTC8aG4Ze16h0A.text: Horrible service! Totally diappointed. I know they probably dont care negative review because so many people come here. I know they are busy but doesn't mean you can ignore cuatomers who wait in line for over 20 mins just try to put the name down. And some people just cut the line and go up to put the name down and totally got ignored by the lady!!!

gJm170H0fy6ETnkwcDvO-A.text: I have to say I was disappointed when I came here for lunch on Saturday. Goyemon has always been my favorite go-to place for sushi until now. They portion sizes for the nigiri and salads seem to have become smaller, and the quality of the fish seemed pasty, like it had been sitting out for a while. However, the rolls are still pretty tasty. The service was a bit slower, but maybe that was because my server was also training a new hire. I will reconsider coming here in the future.

CKBfnqxFZKJMTURE6se3IQ.text: Goyemon is great. My other half and I come here on a biweekly basis and sit at the sushi bar with Chef Gian  and Chef Andrei, who both take great care of us. This place gets crazy busy and it's understandable why. Goyemon offers the best quality all you can eat sushi at a great price. As far as nigiri goes, ask for the fresh scallop with yuzu, garlic tuna with garlic chips, salmon belly (it is usually on special) and of course, uni!  The only thing that doesnt make goyemon a 5-star place is the wait.

SFPsqFdmpbs0-SPmW8-oeQ.text: I went back first time in several months to this restaurant. Having only good memories of good quality sushi and well put together flavors construction as well as good portioning. Last night that memory was completely shattered. When ordering the nigiri I was appalled at how inconsistent the fish was cut and the fact that the rice was horrible. They know more practice the art of making a quality product, the evidence to that is a machine that lays out the rice for them so I can slap a piece of cheap nori on it and turned into a very substandard role.  You might think I'm being somewhat of a snob or a total dick to this place, but after having worked for three years in high end Japanese cuisine and seeing what is possible and also eaten at several other aw IC e. Sushi restaurants honestly have to say in my opinion this restaurant has slipped very very far down the ladder in quality presentation and caring.

HOhsPZZkjuPe3ADhNd7dQw.text: Gosh darn it, why do I love sushi so much.  This place is no exception.  Take my money!  Lunch is $23 and dinner is $27.  The only difference is for dinner you get one order of Uni (Sea Urchin) and Sweet Shrimp.  You also get a few more "specials of the day" items to choose from.  Definitely worth it if you eat those things, otherwise try for lunch.    I've tried eating here before but left after we heard the wait was 2+ hours.  This time, we came at an odd hour (3:30PM) on a Saturday and were luckily able to get seated for 10 people without issue.  Note, NOT everyone in your party has to eat AYCE, which I was surprised to hear.  This worked out great for us.  Everything we ordered was amazingly fresh and tasty.  Definitely not the cheap sh*t. Love the ton of options and the grean tea creme brulee was a nice touch to end it all.  Service was also attentive and quick.  However,  the sushi to rice ratio is not that great here, but the freshness kind of makes up for it.  Just looked at my thumb and that's about how much rice you get per sushi (I have a medium sized thumb).  The fish on top is just a small sliver.  While I liked this place a lot compared to the other 4-5 AYCE sushi places I've tried in Vegas, there's still another AYCE sushi place in Vegas I enjoy a tad bit more.  A better sushi to rice ratio and even more options make me like that place more.  Check out my reviews to find out which one.  Hence, 4 rightfully deserved yelp stars from me, Goyemon.

2jksGp1ASNuoTgYHZf8tVg.text: We came here at around 11:30 on a Monday to beat the crowds, and we're pretty glad we came early (they open at 11:45) because very soon after we got seated, the entire restaurant was already full. They say that the maximum time you can spend here is 45 minutes, but I don't think they enforce it because the food came out very slowly for us. They have a huge selection of rolls, sashimi, and appetizers. You can order as much as you want, and they then bring it to you. Nothing really stood out to me, but I really enjoyed the dessert selection-- green tea ice cream, lychee ice cream, red bean ice cream, and strawberry/vanilla mochi. Mmmm. I think I ate more than I spent and got my money's worth. I'd come back to this place.

REm8tBfFgeype5LO14pY8g.text: Worst sushi place ever!  I came in last night with my friend and husband. We usually come in every month but this time we will never return.    Normally, when your eating in a sushi place, the first thing everyone notice is the food, service, and waiting time.   The food was horrible. I come to a sushi place to eat fish not rice. I only ate the nigiri because there wasn't much good selections on rolls. The nigiri was a disappointment. All the fish had humongous rice and the fish was not pressed down properly. Once you see the rice portion is bigger than the fish than that is an insult.    So we complained about it to our server. He said he'll talk to the manager. The server came back and said I'm sorry we CAN'T do anything about it. The manager didn't have the balls to stop by our table and talk to us. The manager has seen us a few times and he knows we tip 30% or more. Back then, the manager usually greet us and takes our table. Last time he offered comp bottle of sake but this time he acted like he barely knew us. Anyhow, we ordered a few more to see if they would fix the problem but instead the rice gets bigger every time and the cut of fish just gets smaller. We are not asking for them to put extremely less rice but balance out the portion of the fish to the rice.  Over all the server/manager sucks. Poor customer service.    Waiting time was great. There was no line, finally. Usually, goyemon is always packed and i would wait 30 mins to an hour to be seated. Thats how much I use to love goyemon. It use to be worth the wait.      Food came out on time as expected. But our server was always missing. Server just clears out our table and runs away. We always have to wait or ask the attentive host to call our server. So ordering was a pain.   Overall 1 star is what they deserve.  Goyemon you just LOST 3 valuable customers.

Z0LWnMeOAwfoWRFTFDyXbQ.text: Wow oh Wow! We are only visiting but I would consider moving here for this place alone. Sushi Dinners, Miso Soup and an Ecstasy Roll seems simple but it was honestly the best I've had. They had the All you can eat menus on the table but I asked about the regular menus and ordered from it. Fast Service, attentive waiting, I don't have a bad word to say about the place.

mmH4V3Wl4xMA9NWHUxngxg.text: Great sushi place, service is fast (most of the time, other days can be slow) but overall I love coming in here for all you can eat! Highly recommend this place.

Ohbya3v8YgsMKk3nKovYeQ.text: Wherever you go, there you are.  After several years, Sushi House Goyemon still has it! All-you-can-eat sushi is its own category. I would typically rather pay more for less sushi of a better quality than AYCE, but a few times each year I inevitably end up in an AYCE joint. Goyemon has been the standard for a while now. Recently I ate at a couple other AYCE spots due to convenience and exploration, only to come back to Goyemon with my love when I had AYCE Sushi-loving family in town.  Goyemon's selection of options, quality of product, and freshness of sushi items make them the best in Vegas. Unfortunately, the word has been out for years now and they are very popular. We came in on a weekday at 2pm in the afternoon and experienced a 45 minute wait for a table of 8. The service can also be hit or miss. We started off with attentive service and several rounds of food. The longer we stayed the more active we had to become in order to place the orders we wanted.  I love that Goyemon has a specials board that usually has some premium items on it for sushi as well as for grilled items. In fact, they have one of the largest selections of non-sushi appetizers and small plates for AYCE. If you are a fan of Uni and Ami Ebi, both items can be ordered on the dinner menu, which they will serve at non-dinner hours as long as you are willing to pay dinner pricing.   Whenever I've been in we have always ordered aggressively--starting with a lot and continuing to place orders early on. I have only ever encountered the issue of finishing all the food. I have friends that have complained about difficulties in ordering food or how long it takes for some items to make it out. I can see how this might be an issue, but I also think it can be easily avoided. They have a one hour time-limit, and if they are busy enough to enforce that one-hour limit they will usually asked for your last order with around 15 minutes left. Again, be proactive, keep a general sense of the time and order anything else you might want with about 20 minutes left. They will let you stay a reasonable amount of time to finish your food if you do this and the final orders are brought just before or even after the one hour mark. If you're reactive in life things won't go as well for you...not just in AYCE sushi, but in everything you do...after all, everywhere you go, there you are. I can certainly understand if you would prefer a less hectic, more relaxed setting to enjoy your AYCE sushi, but just know that the sushi won't be as good.  All-you-can-eat is admittedly not my thing. There is no where else I would rather go for AYCE, so is Goyemon deserving of 5 stars?...I don't know...for me I'd rather spend my money at other sushi spots in town that I consider 5 star places.

BK4art5fUdMqoJBLCbxdmA.text: When I first moved to Vegas, my family and I constantly went to Sushi-mon. Then when we moved away, Goyemon opened so whenever I visited Vegas, I always had to go to Goyemon. It was amazing. It was probably my favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas.   The sushi was yummy, they always have some type of specials on the board, and they have other things on the menu for non-sushi eaters. So if you were to come with a huge group of people, you can get a mix of things.   One of my FAVORITE items from Goyemon has to be the salmon belly! It is delicious, fatty, and never a disappointment whenever I get it. So why, in heaven's name, did I give it 3 stars? Well ... let me tell you a story.  Goyemon had their 3rd Anniversary Customer Appreciation event and it was supposed to last 2 days. They had a list of special items for those days, which included blue fin and toro. With that, they offered the ability for you to make reservations. My friends and I decided to make a reservation for the 2nd day of the event since the 1st day of the event didn't work out with our schedules.   The excitement built up even more after we found out that on the first day of the event, they did AYCE toro and AYCE uni! OMG! Like, I can't even WAIT.   So when we went in for our reservation, my excitement turns a little bit sour. Why? Well, we had our reservation for 7:30 pm. We get there a little bit early but we have to wait for a table. I'm sorry .. I thought I had a reservation. So what we find out is .. they are still accepting walk ins and because they're typically a walk in restaurant, they don't quite grasp the reservation concept down that well. We actually didn't get seated until maybe at 8 PM.  And then they tell us that there is no AYCE toro tonight, only AYCE uni and waygu beef. Well, gee, thanks. What's the point of having a reservation then? Why would you give AYCE toro one night and not the other night? I wanted to flip multiple tables but since we waited for the table, sat down, and were ready to order, we just stayed.   So my experience from that is just really really sour. So I learned to just walk in on the days they have yummy specials. That way, I won't be missing out REGARDLESS of what they say.   So Goyemon gets an average from me. I still like them and will continue to go to them for AYCE sushi. Service can be slow sometimes though and the servers will look at you funny when you order 20 orders of one thing.   Oh and LOVE their yuzu sorbet (:

5AKluK5L8ROEprS6c6SNNg.text: AYCE Sushi!  Let's do it! I'm probably still considered a newbie when it comes to sushi determining what is good and what is great.  From a newbie standpoint, this is great!   We met up with some friends to dine on their delicious creations.  Since it was AYCE, I was going to take full advantage and try a variety off the menu. It was busy but there were open seats at the bar for immediate seating.  When you sit there, the waitress will handle sides and drinks.  All you have to do it tell the sushi chef's what you'd like. It was pretty great!  They were so quick on our orders and just fun watching them.   I ordered half rolls of the Baked 428, Pete's, Sexy Girl and Frying Jason. The 428 is baked with grilled chicken spread with yum yum sauce, cream cheese, eel sauce and spicy sauce.  Love Love Love this!  I would have been happy with just ordering this.  Can't stop there! Pete's is deep fried sushi with white fish, crab, cream cheese, avocado and eel sauce.  The light texture enveloping this masterpiece from being deep fried made me fall in love with this roll.   Sexy Girl was filled with shrimp tempura, crab and cucumber.  It was then topped with tempura crumb and a spicy garlic sauce which made it totally SEXY! Frying Jason is a baked roll filled with crab, cream cheese, asparagus and avocado topped with spicy yum yum sauce.  Yum Yum indeed!!  I absolutely loved everything I ordered.    I am definitely a fan and will tell anyone who is in the mood for sushi to go here.  Fabulous friends + Fabulous food = Happiness!  Yelp Challenge 2014 (150/365)

YaOpzpuvMZw0Opou9v5Ecw.text: So everyone I know RAVES about Goyemon. Whenever someone asks for the "best sushi" it is always mentioned. I came to realize this place has the same menu as Sushi Mon. And all the rolls taste the same. So If you LOVE Goyemon, then you should LOVE Sushi Mon too, amirite? I wonder if they are the same owners?  I met my friend Jessie here for lunch on 1/21/16 around 12:30. It was busy, but not packed like it usually around lunch time. It did take us a while for us to receive our food though. This was mildly annoying because I only had an hour for lunch, but in that time I was able to try a decent amount of items:  garlic edamame super white tuna scallops garlic tuna lemon roll lasagna roll domingo roll  The garlic edamame is really good. It doesn't have diced garlic, but rather a subtle garlic flavoring on top of all the beans. The super white tuna was melt in my mouth delicious, and is always one of my favorite nigiri items. I also got to try the scallops and the garlic tuna that Jessie had, both were very good.   The rolls were next. I already love the domingo/lasagna rolls so I knew what to expect and they were delicious. But the lemon roll is definitely a new favorite! It is just a california roll with lemon on top but it's so light and refreshing. I ordered 2 of these but we only got 1 due to time constraints. AYCE also includes dessert but I didn't have time for that either. For AYCE lunch it was reasonably priced at $21.95.

Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Domingo roll, my fav

pbbCUBrTuPtqA7TqoYlHZw.text: Sushi is my favorite meal and THIS IS MY FAVORITE PLACE EVER!!!  TIPS:  Come for dinner to get the good AYCE menu!! Menu encompasses one order of uni per person. It's nice that not everyone at your table needs to order AYCE.   Came early for dinner to avoid the rush. There's not many tables inside so if you get here later, you'll be waiting a while.  FOOD:  Oh man. So much good nigiri! -- YUMMY Nigiri: Tuna, Uni, Yellowtail, Salmon, Seared salmon, Albacore, Unagi, Fresh scallop aka hotate, Salmon roe aka masago (and we added quail egg on top!), Amaebi aka sweet shrimp (came with the tails, which was a little awkward to eat). They also have a specials menu written on chalkboard so make sure to check that out. We tried the salmon belly, which was a little too fatty for my taste. -- Wasn't a big fan of the Super white tuna   -- I didn't do any of the rolls, because I just wanted all that fresh nigiri!   -- Hand rolls: Salmon skin roll was okay, not much flavor.  DESSERT: Liked the lychee sherbet. Green tea ice cream was okay, I've had (and made) better.  SERVICE: Ugh. Service pretty much sucked here, which is why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5. It took foreeeeverrr to get any of our orders and sushi, and the waitresses didn't come to check on us so we had to wave and hunt them down to get more orders in.  Also, the sushi chef made one of my friend's hand rolls wrong TWICE!!! The waitress tried to argue with us until we showed her there was a shrimp inside instead of scallop. I'm really not sure how you mix up scallop and fake crab / shrimp....  OVERALL: I'll be back when I'm in Vegas again! Hopefully the service was just a fluke (the waitress said one of the sushi chefs was new and so that's why it was so slow).

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi, scallop, ikura with quail egg &amp; salmon belly nigiri
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni, unagi, and sweet shrimp nigiri

x20CdK8pbxhoUD4lrHJJyQ.text: AYCE Lunch: 11:45am - 4pm $21.95 per person (time limit 45 minutes) note: uni and ama ebi not available. AYCE Dinner: 4pm - 3am $26.95 per person (time limit 60 minutes).  We ordered 2 adult AYCE lunches. Lunch Total With a coke and Tax: $49.35 (not including tip).  Taste: 3 stars - They are only on the radar by a mere passing grade. Nothing was memorable or great. Everything was either average or not good at all. Even in the beginning of our lunch, we refused to eat one of the rolls we ordered, since it tasted like chemicals and left a foul aftertaste in our mouth. The fish to rice ratio was less than average - the fish cuts were short and thin with a dense ball of rice. In the world of AYCE, Sakana wins the match - they offer a waaaaay better fish to rice ratio, better selection, and more explosive flavors.   The good: 1. Salmon nigiri - slim cuts of salmon, but it will do. The fish tasted sweet and fresh.  2. Halibut nigiri - it wasn't bad, the fish tasted fresh and had a nice texture 3. Yellowtail nigiri - also a sweet and fresh tasting fish 4. Magma roll (half roll/ 4pcs) - we enjoyed this roll. It was simple, but all of the flavors and the texture went together nicely.  5. Miso Soup - we loved how it came out piping hot. It wasn't too salty which is a plus in my book.  6. Lemon roll (half roll/ 4pcs) - it was simple, light and refreshing. Be careful with the lemon slices, some of them were sliced too thick and left a overwhelmingly bitter taste. You might need to just squeeze the lemon. 7. Green tea ice cream - very creamy and had a light green tea flavor. We loved how it wasn't overly sweet.  8. The stamp card- I love the idea, it might be the only thing that could bring me back.   The bad:  1. Tuna poke - only 4 small bits of tuna cubes! it was really bad. I only tasted salty soy sauce and nothing else.  2. Baked green mussels (2 pcs) - it's just a lot of sweet mayo, nothing special  3. Takoyaki - it's all dough! There was a tiny dot of octopus in each one.  4. Sunshine/Or sunrise roll? It was horrible! The sauce they used tasted like chemicals and left a foul aftertaste. We couldn't eat it. My boyfriend felt sick after he ate that roll. 5. Strawberry mochi - they used some knock off mochi brand and it tasted like fake bubblegum. It wasn't good.  Value: 3 stars - It's a little less than average. It's a lot pricier compared to Naka Sushi. The fish was fresh, but definitely thin baby cuts or not consistent. Also their AYCE menu selection is noticeably smaller than that of other places. It seems like they focus on rolls here. Their side dishes (appetizer) selection is very slim and basic compared to Naka Sushi or Sakana's selection.   Service: 2 stars - The hostess was very cheerful and energetic. However, our waitress seemed like she was over her job and like she was dragging her feet. She seemed annoyed that we wanted to order more food. Many times she would disappear into the back and we would not see anyone on the floor for a while. On a good note, it didn't seem like we were on a timer at all for the 45 minute lunch and we didn't feel pressured.   Would we eat here again? I doubt it. Only if we're in the immediate area and wanted a later lunch that ends at 4pm. Other than that, we preferred Naka sushi's value and selection and my personal favorite Sakana takes the crown in selection, flavor, and quality!

c1M7FpDDqjVgwNHClk41GA.text: AYCE is always a must with my group of friends when they come to Vegas. Everything they do here is out of control. Excessive gambling, drinking, and partying. To finish off the weekend, there is also a need for excessive eating since they didn't get much nutrition in their bodies all weekend.  Food: $26.95 for All-You-Can-Eat Sushi Dinner. This is probably one of the best AYCE sushi spots that I've tried. The nigiri portions come out small, which isn't much of a problem since it's AYCE! The menu is really extensive. There are plenty of options including the kitchen items. The only items they limit per person is the uni and the ama ebi (Sweet shrimp)  Dessert: It even includes AYCE dessert: Green tea ice cream, lychee sorbet (AMAZING), tempura vanilla ice cream. They also have green tea creme brulee, but they limit it to one order per person.  Service: Wow the staff here are quick! I came with a group of 9 and they brought out everything with alarming speed. I guess it's expected because they only gave us a 1 hour time limit on the AYCE.

uJwauuEq3tvqeH1x08rIzA.text: I had to update my review as things have completely improved.  The host which I cannot remember by name but if you have been there recently you'll know, she gives the best hugs and smiles. She is one of the biggest improvements!  Sushi is back to its yumminess and quality and hope to continue to make this our regular go to sushi spot. Thank you for the changes made!

19AEj14xAvxxXhT2dnseNA.text: I had a loyalty card that needed a few more punches prior to expiration for the freebie dinner so I ate here a couple times over the last month and can confidently say there are much better options in the carnival of AYCE Vegas sushi joints.  From the quality of the fish to the inadequate wait service to the novice work behind the bar, this place has totally slipped for me. The red snapper tasted a bit dry and dense as though it had been left out and everything else was just so-so...I did get to top off my underwhelming experience with their melted then refrozen freezer burn mochi.  Side note: In talking about this place with other sushi owners at places I frequent, it's widely known that their fish quality has taken a hit...they said there's a specific reason why but they declined to elaborate...sad as I've been here more than a dozen times.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piled up plates. Empty water for 10 minutes

1Y4awkSap1YuryIcAOboRg.text: All you can eat sushi for $26.95! Let me repeat that, in case you didn't catch that- ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI for $26.95!!!!   My brother who visits Vegas at least once a year highly suggested that I venture off the The Strip and give Sushi Goyemon a try. I was very skeptical being that it was all you can eat and at such a crazy low price. But being that my husband and I love both sushi, and a deal, we decided to check it out.  We may have not hit the jackpot in the casinos, but we hit the jackpot at Goyemon!  This was by far the best all you can eat sushi joint for it's food and it's price! There was a large selection of nigiri sushi, sushi rolls, side items, and desserts, and ALL of it was included in the AYCE price! Salmon, ikura, hamachi, toro, ebi, saba, uni, shrimp tempura, salmon kama, poke, gyoza, shumai, teriyaki chicken, green tea ice cream, creme brulee....and I could go on and on and on.  It's basically a full menu that's AYCE.  Though the nigiri was small, the fish was fresh and I didn't mind it being small, so that I could try lots of different things without getting too full.  Rolls were full size, but you can order half a roll so that you don't get too full on rolls.  This is to your advantage since you will be charged if there is any leftovers.    My favorites of the night were the lemon roll and and salmon belly.  The ikura tasted really strange though.  The only reason I'm giving this place a 4 instead of a 5 is because on the night we went, the rice was inconsistent.  The first order of sushi we had, the rice was seasoned well.  The second and third round of sushi had a very strong vinegar flavor, and if there is one thing that I don't like in my sushi, is an overpowering vinegar taste.  The last round of sushi that we got, the rice was back to normal.    Sit at the bar for a better experience.  It was so easy to order our sushi in small batches since the sushi chef was right there in front of us. If you sit at the bar, order the sushi from the sushi chefs, and the sides from your server.    The wait for a table at 6:00 was initially 1 hour 20 minutes, but they called us after 45 minutes.  They conveniently text you a link when you put your name in, and you can see where you are on the waiting list by clicking the link.  We put our names in and drove down the street to Trader Joe's and got called while we were there.  They graciously saved our seats and we were seated as soon as we got back.   I don't know when I will return to Vegas, but when I do, Goyemon will definitely be on my list of places to eat!

av4SWQlffrpZigkCN_gPZg.text: One of the best AYCE Japanese in town. We arrived around 6pm and there's a line already, the wait will be 30 mins & i left my number for them. I received a text from Goyeman immediately and we can check how many people ahead of us by noshlist.com, very convenience! We got seated at the sushi bar area, that is the best seats if u have a small party. We ordered sushi from the sushi chef and appetizers from the server. Our server was very attentive and patient to explain the menu to us, the chef was great too, he kept feeding us (lol) and made sure we got all our orders. Quality of the sushi is superb! Fish is fresh, sushi had the right portion of fish and rice, and chefs did great jobs on the presentation as well. Salmon kama was very juicy and not dry at all. Grill calamari, shitaki mushroom, gyoza, tofu were delicious as well! Sadly we can only order 1 sweet shrimp & 1 uni suchi per person, because they are really goooood... And if u want soft shell crab, it has to come with a roll, cant order just by itself. No oyster on the menu either. Green tea creme brulee was good but hubby preferred the coconut mochi.

m9HWU_C3EUzCDsaRUaacDQ.text: Who knew that ayce sushi would be so delicious in vegas! I'm from LA and we have a lot of ayce places but the ayce sushi here is good! I was surprised because I can't think of where their fish comes from haha anyway, jokes aside...their fish tastes pretty good and I love their special daily fish menu. Most ayce places do not serve premium fish but their daily specials have fish like toro, salmon belly, red masago, etc.. they even have yuzu sherbet (like a mix of fruits) and lots of diff flavors of sherbet to choose from with unlimited orders! Who doesn't want more than just one green tea ice cream at the end of their meal :) that's a PLUS PLUS! The only thing I didn't like was the rice to fish ratio. The rice overpowers the fish and in the rolls, it feels like you're eating a mouthful of rice and tiny amounts of fish. I understand that sushi places just want to fill you up with rice but it's seriously overdoing it and much too obvious. The servers are nice but it's hard to get anyone who isn't your original server to help you out. They aren't the type that comes to your table and ask if you need anything else.

hcCPEnxLaMSeOGCHw_ncJg.text: I wouldn't recommend this place. They have definitely gone down hill in service. The past few times the staff seems like they are miserable to be there, not friendly, just zero customer service overall!  They charged my friends family who had a 4 year old the full dinner ayce price... that's a bit extreme

19uqG2bcYQa7fIkPOZgOcA.text: This is my third time here and the service has been consistently horrible and disorganized.  Tonight was the worst service I received and I usually am forgiving as I do have friends and family that work in the restaurant business.   I have dined all over Vegas and around the world from hole in the wall restaurants to Michelin star rated restaurants.  This will be my very first review I feel compelled to post.    I came with a party of six and we all ordered the "All you can eat."  My menu was sticky and dirty and wasn't cleaned or wiped thoroughly.  I ordered 3 half orders of sushi but only received 2.  My third sushi was taking awhile so I asked the server if it was arriving soon and she said yes.  Waited about 30 mins more and I asked again and then she said she would have put in the order again.   Long story short, I never got my third sushi and I was just over the wait!  They have also failed to explain the name of the sushi being served  and also combined some of our orders on the same plate which left our party guessing who's sushi is whose and what sushi is what.  My 2 sushi's were mediocre and bland.  My other friends sushi was drenched in sauce and one of the sushi had avocado that was turning brown. I spoke with the manager and all he could say was sorry, made up an excuse and lied saying they did serve me my order thus accusing me of lying and did not offer anything to make up for it.  They still charged me full price and I left the restaurant hungry.  NOT SO "ALL YOU CAN EAT!"    Mediocre food,  horrible service, disorganized, bad management, a complete rip off.  I really don't get how they attract a lot of patrons.  Definitely not worth my time and my hard earned money.

RHU0yMgOZ_NeT7qh7_I5EA.text: New favorite spot in Vegas!! This place is a hidden gem and i'm so glad I got to try this place.   PROS -Everything is made to order, so the sushi is fresh!!!! -Good sushi selection and menu -green tea ice cream is SO TASTY -plenty of parking -fast turnover bc diners have 45 min limit at "all you can eat" menu -$21.95/lunch buffet and $26.95 dinner buffet -closes at 3am!  CONS -waitress missed a few items when i placed my order, so make sure you doublecheck it

7s3X0IqMHE5WZ_ABNUjz9A.text: I wrote a 1-star review long time ago and thought I would never come back here but my husband and I really liked the specialty nigiri here so we have been revisiting. Nothing sparkled during the previous visits until today, we asked about the stamp cards out of blue and the manager on duty accepted the old stamp card! I feel like they have changed management. Now, there are still flaws. For example, when we were placed to sit at the sushi bar, the chef never greeted us or asked if we wanted to place any order. We noticed that this was odd bc we were waiting for 5-10 min. But apparently he was at the end of his shift and didn't want to take anymore orders. Understandable. I always get the impression that these guys work really hard and never get a decent break. After his shift was over, a new guy took over and immediately took our orders. Yay! They also encouragingly ask customers if they have stamp card, which is a new, good practice. I feel like a lot of restaurants out there do the stamp card but don't like to promote it. Wish I edited my last post instead of deleting it, but great positive changes!

cR4mlOFTddLhYaniHdCB8A.text: My friends begged me to come here and I wish they hadn't. When we walked in, there was trash all over the floor. It was so bad that one of the employees asked us to give her a second to clean it up, whatever ignored it despite my instinct to walk out. We did all you can eat and ordered a ton of rolls, all of which were absolutely terrible. The fish quality was very very bad, everything was cold when it was supposed to be hot and vice versa, the service was poor, and this place reminded me of one of those typical cheap sushi bars that you see in the news getting shut down for poor health conditions. Avoid at all costs.

XAUWcwgI80wOrS3Pp8cggA.text: I've been eating sushi, sashimi, and AYCE over 20 years and this is my 3rd time visiting this place within a year and I'm disappointed to say that their quality went down.  Fish quality: was above par but nothing to be wowing over.  Service: was great and our server Phil was very knowledgeable of their menu items, chef's skills and experiences.  Sushi: were inconsistent and sloppy, ratio between rice to fish was outrageous. They ran out of Uni on early Friday night.  Rolls: were pretty good due to sauces but sauces and amount of rice were overpowering the main ingredients.  They do count the hours down, try not to go over hour limit.  Overall, ehh.... I will not come here again. There are number of better sushi places in Vegas. Do your reseach and you will find a better AYCE for your money.

The hostess said we were next, then proceeded to seat three parties that had arrived after we had. We waited ten more minutes then left to go to Sushi 21 up the street, which had no wait.

DClEx1DvMjSTeR9gZkZV1Q.text: First time there and after reading so many reviews, both good & bad. I went to see for myself. I guess everyone has their opinion of every restaurant in town. Well it was not so busy and we got seated right away. Our server was an Caucasian guy which is not a problem, the problem was that he never smiled once. Yes he did his job but a smiling face goes a long way towards customer service in making you feel good dining at the establishment.  The asian waitstaff was much better in the fact that she smiled and actually help a conversation with me, wow can you believe that!!!!!   Now for the food, it was good and for sushi per say how can you really screw up on certain items like Ikura (salmon eggs), massago (fish eggs), pretty standard items that you buy from the wholesalers and you don't do anything but serve it.  For the Fresh fish, well it's another story, had the poke hahahaha it was good tasting but really, 4 pieces of fish at this size 1/4" x 1/4". Now I know it's all you can eat and trying to control waste but I think it's a little too skimpy on the fish for the poke.  Over all it was good, love the fact that they do the sushi correct with the correct amount of rice and not try to fill you up with oversize rice portion.  The only issue was the seating, which is always a challenge at a small restaurant. The tables are very close and the one next to us had a family with a whiny young child who would screech loudly for no obvious reason.  I would definitely return - hopefully there will be no screeching children on my next visit.

ZardfOG9MLvhXNphkRvgNA.text: I was visiting Las Vegas with some friends and we had planned for a lunch of sushi.  One of our friends who lives there recommended  we go here, but to get there right when they open, which was 1145 am. It is located outside of downtown and the Strip, so the prices are very competitive.  One thing I have learned about dining in Las Vegas, places outside of the tourist areas have the best value for your money.  We were a party of 8 and were seated right away.  We ordered all sorts of sushi; white fish, uni, soft shell crab, California roll, spicy tuna, I lost track of all the types we ordered. The orders came out very quick and we ate them as fast as they came out.    I have recommended this place to several friends who are headed to the 9th island.  Believe it or not, a few of them have already heard of it from other people.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When traveling on Decatur Blvd. this is what you should look for the west side of the street

-lwAFuRmavY56kIGpksxfQ.text: Fantastic service from all staff members regardless of time and date of eating. Been here various times and it has been a great experience. Most importantly, the sushi tastes good. Never comes out dry or stale looking. I drove from phoenix to eat here. I will continue to frequent here and I urge anyone who likes AYCE sushi to try it.   Updated review: I last reviewed this with only good things to say, but for some odd reason I received the worst service today.  First off, I live in Arizona for nursing school and I finally had a break from the work and decided to drive all the way out here for this place alone. I always had a great outlook on this place til today. After arriving, we got seated and our order taken ( I usually order everything at once because I know how much I can eat and what I want ) but the server already seemed dismissive but I figured she was probably tired and worn out so I thought nothing of it. After that first encounter, that was it... no refill on tea, no plate to eat on, no side dish plate for soy sauce.  As the night went on, I stayed patient hoping she would notice we had nothing... I had to ask someone else for plates and other stuff. This worker dodged us the entire time ( older Japanese lady ) and the sad part was that we made eye contact numerous times but she served everyone else but us. After 30-45 min has passed, another worker asked if we needed anything. I asked for a manager but he stepped out and I just decided to pay the bill and leave without causing a scene.  Tldr: service was balls that haven't been washed, Discrimination was present from the server, first time I have not left tip at all and I usually do even if service was bad. I will continue to come here as my experience was tainted by an incompetent worker but she is not a reflection of the entire establishment.

AJIuZpAq-72cMQxyneVlbQ.text: I find it quite ironic that there are many AYCE sushi restaurants located in the middle of a hot desert. That just makes me wonder where they even find all these fishes ...  Sushi House Goyemon offers $21.95 45-minute AYCE for lunch (11:45 AM to 4 PM) and $26.95 60-minute AYCE for dinner (4 PM to 3 AM - last order @ 2:30 AM). Sea urchin (aka uni), sweet shrimp, and pork belly are only available for dinner. I will say that 45-minute is enough time to try whatever rolls or appetizers you want to order on the menu.   Our group came here 15 minutes before opening time and there was already a small crowd  eagerly waiting to get in. Luckily there were enough tables & seats to accommodate every customers. We placed lots of various sushi & appetizer orders and the staff only got 80% of our orders correctly. It was a minor hiccup because we just ordered for our missing items again. Oh one good thing to mention - I really enjoyed my complimentary hot tea.   *** $21.95 45-Minute AYCE Lunch ***  Nigiri (white tuna, seared tuna): Pretty fresh fishes, but the ratio among rice, vinegar, and fish were not very balanced.  Eel hand roll : Generous portion with lots of eel. One of the items I would definitely recommend.  Scallops: Not bad, but too much vinegar.  Spicy tuna roll: It can get VERY spicy if you ask for fully loaded spicy level. Ignoring the spicy level, it was a very solid spicy tuna roll.  Steamed Shumai: Meh ... would not order this again.  Lychee Sorbet: Tasted a bit chewy and icy ... could be worse, but didn't blow my mind.  ***  A solid 3.5-star for me, but I will round up to 4-star due to somewhat decent fish quality. Overall this is a good quality AYCE sushi place with lots of missing orders. If you ask me whether it is worth the drive off the Strip ... I will have to say that this is not an absolute must-visit and you will have to ask yourself how much do you crave for sushi.

I've never experienced a sushi house that included so many appetizer selections in the cost! Score!!!!  AYCE is $26.95  I ordered Calamari and the strips were nice and thick fried perfectly.   I ordered tons of seaweed and cucumber salad and two rolls before tapping out.   Highly recommended!!
