w74EWdkw02uwiGZnCXwkZw.text: This is actually our go to place for AYCE sushi. Based on overall experiences, it would deserve a 4 star review mostly because it's consistently good /above average for AYCE sushi.  However, I had to put in this ranking to hopefully get the attention of the management/owners.   Eating there tonight, it was the first time I almost spit out my amaebi nigiri. I had to fight through how slimy it was, the whole time thinking I really hope I don't get food poisoning!  :o  Then for dessert, I ordered a vanilla ice cream mochi and the first bite was really terrible. :( I was horrified. I've grown up eating regular mochi, and I know that the ice cream mochis you buy in the store generally aren't soft like the "real" mochi...but this outer mochi was almost like eating plastic.  I figured, ok, I'll just eat the inside ice cream. That was gritty - like eating sand (not even crystallized sugar or anything).  I debated over telling the server that it really shouldn't be served to anyone, and to suggest a manager try one of these so they might pull it from bring served tonight - but they were slammed and I didn't want to make a scene to ask for a manager / have to get someone's attention in the crowd.   Yes, I'll still come by here at least one more time and hopefully it'll be back to normal. But please please pull the vanilla ice cream mochi until you can get edible ones in (and check on the amaebi quality also).

J_YQ-L8PvG2oXG37zLl-Ig.text: Long time drive by first time sushi.  Went with a small group (3) AYCE.  Place was hopping.  We ordered a variety of dishes to share.  All the dishes that were ordered were delicious.  The food preperation and presentation was spot on.  Golden knight, spider, and pastel rolls were the bomb!!! The restaraunt was clean, staff was attentive, and the ambience in this place was excellent.

P9E6oWa0iGmPyCt81C1-AA.text: This place is amazing! Did the AYCE for like $26.   Just to be clear, I don't really like sushi so now you might be wondering how the heck did I give this place 5 stars? Well the other food was on point and so good. There's a pretty good variety of non-sushi foods so I was all good.  I really liked how they even noted the sushi that didn't have raw fish. So considerate.  The best thing is that they don't overload on the rice if you do get sushi. I think other places load up on rice to make you full faster but this place went light on the rice and heavy on the good stuff.  I was stuffed leaving this place and a few hours later I wanted to go back, it was that good.

WFJPv_8eo3oEPOaNzUYTMQ.text: We came in to eat here because my friend recommended and I really like this place, My friend doesn't make us disappoint! This place is some of the best AYCE sushi I've ever had. The side selection is great, the sushi was fresh and service is quick.  Expect to wait to be seated, but it's worth the time to wait.

yAejnkFJQA0eiI6JhrlY5w.text: This place has really slipped in its service. It used to have lines and lines of people waiting but it's gotten quiet, and for good reasons:  1. The wait staff weren't taking our plates off the table, and the tables are small so it's really needed.   2. By the time they served us food we still didn't have a plate setting. How we're we supposed to eat?  3. They weren't reaching out to see if we wanted to order more. I felt like I was pulling teeth to get an order in. I had to raise my hand like a first grader.  4. This is probably my least favorite thing about my dinner. The food took soooooooooooooooo long to arrive. My first round was 2 orders of salmon, yellowtail, white tuna, and albacore, each. That's 8 pieces of sushi total. It should not take 30 minutes to make.  5. This is unrelated to service but their uni sucks. It was really fishy and almost bitter tasting. Thus, their quality has dropped too.

O9iRzonqSNzueNw9u6B-VA.text: Had it when it first started business, was pretty good but haven't been here for a while now. Today was just totally disappointing. We sat down and ordered a bunch of dishes and nigiri. They told me they ran out of uni. So we go ok fine we'll get two orders of sweet shrimp instead of uni + swt shrimp then? They go no they can't do that. I'm like What??  They constantly mess up the order like bring out things we didn't order or totally forgot about our orders. more importantly, they put SO MUCH RICE IN EVERY NIGIRI!!! The fish slice is so thin, like sheesh I might as well eat a bowl of rice. See my pictures for reference for the amount of rice per fish ratio. After today's experience I can conclude that I WILL NOT come back agin.

1TGYq-tQgbErfbU_jizRTw.text: Amazing!!!!! Just went after work. They offer all you can eat! I took a few half rolls, and loved everything about them. The fish was fresh, the soup/ appetizers were so tasty and the service was amazing!! Thank you so muchfire

WVpnmihOs3Ra2H1R-fs9tw.text: I don't even like sushi and I really enjoyed the sushi here.    Visited on August 26, 2016 around 6 PM.  $62.08 got us two AYCE sushi dinners.  It was only $3 to share with my toddler, which liked.  Some places try to charge you half price which is horse crap because my child eats like a bird.  A dead bird.  He doesn't eat much.     First off, lemme say, I love that they allow you to order half rolls on the AYCE menu.  This means we can order a large variety of rolls and if we don't like the roll there's not much of it to choke down LOL   They have a decent selection of appetizers and cooked items and the best desserts I've ever seen at a Sushi place.  We had chocolate mousse, yuzu sherbert, and creme brulee and all were delicious!   My favorite rolls were the lemon roll and the sexy girl roll.  Neither of them made me gag, which I consider a success because I hate sushi.  Both were delicious and I was left wanting more.    I would have given 5 stars but everything took FOR-EV-ERRRR to come out and they forgot one of the rolls we ordered.
