74eJ39xSgpSPuIeiAmy0ZA.text: They have a good AYCE here. Fast friendly service. However, I prefer YAMA sushi - much more variety.

u1Y8veTIDaqCFM0waodlkQ.text: i must first preface my review with this fact...i typically don't like ayce sushi!!! in my universe, there's just something very, very wrong with ayce sushi. usually, the quality suffers enormously. however, i do believe that goyemon reigns supreme over any of the other ayce sushi joints in town, and boy do we have the market cornered on that here in vegas! the cuts of fish are quite fresh, the rice is cooked well and their selection is wide.  the daily specials menu is where it's at here at goyemon though. ranging from conch to salmon belly, they offer some rare and tasty items.  we've dined here 3 times now and all with large parties. we've yet to experience less than stellar service. each time, we've received prompt and courteous service. my glass of green iced tea was always full.

Wg6aSgBjaeuRYLS-OoWVug.text: I am a big fan of sushi... And this place has an amazing fish quality! Their super white tuna is to die for... Must try

v6PIxKzqf6kgy--FxdFmzg.text: I had heard from several people that this place was one of the best AYCE places in town.  It was very good, but I wouldn't say it is the best.  I live right by Sushi Mon, and we ventured out to Goyemon expecting something better, but it was pretty much the same.  I did like how you could order off the new item menu and it was included in the AYCE price.  They are pretty strict with kids eating any of your food here if they are not paying, which is understandable, but kind of hard to explain to your 4 year old when they want a bit of your roll and you just can't justify spending $26 for them to eat it.  It would be nice if they had maybe a reduced rate for kids.

NY6KyWApn_6jwXeZJfhTIQ.text: brought my bf here when he was in town because we don't have all you can eat sushi in houston.  it's a small restaurant (right by my house!) and i would expect it to be packed during dinner time as it was busy during lunch. there is a time frame as to how long you can dine in on the all you can eat menu -45 minutes. it's $23 bucks per person.  now, keep in mind you can order HALF ORDERS on everything. we didn't know until later and made the mistake of ordering whole rolls and was stuffed by the time we finished our fifth. it makes it more worth it if you are able to try many different rolls because they're all really good!  i personally love the nigiri menu, i had about eight pieces of the yellowtail- try it with ponzu sauce and jalapenos and you have yourself a mouthwatering dish!   i loved their lychee sherbet dessert, it was delicious!   overall, i highly recommend this place. though we did come out of the restaurant way too stuffed and on the edge of throwing up...at least we were satisfied.

3PLYIYDhLHenuq5U1HTxgA.text: Great snow crab n albacore n spicy tuna. Urchin n squid was wack. Poki was meh. White tuna was surprisingly good. Sushi chef was a bit rude. But the Latino sushi chefs were way cool. Found a hair in our roll sent it back and Latin dude sent us urchin. It was a kind gesture but I didn't like it.

mAHJAijMdd6S3nzC7QkNLA.text: A great deal for an AYCE sushi joint. They have a great selection of rolls that are a little more exotic than most. The service was great, but the food was better.

_XeNbxVaZWCx6nk6q6blOg.text: Goyemon is my top AYCE sushi place to go to in town. Their sushi is pretty fresh for being in Las Vegas with no ocean and their service is always up to par whenever I go. The only down part about this place is your full party has to be there before they will seat you.

elVxrYxHwHlF2dCUkjL4NA.text: Average Service.   good place for AYCE. I don't feel pressured when i eat AYCE here. sushi rice is small, and speed is fair. However tables are small and they are very close to each other. I would not recommend for private dinner. There isn't a personal or private space in between tables even though it is a full-restaurant. The restroom was very clean and unique/pretty.   Sometimes I had to wait but not a long wait. Tried few other dishes other than AYCE and it was pretty good.   For the fast, not the top 10 but overall, very casual but pleasing place to go.   fishes are good but I personally didn't feel freshness to it. (very soft texture for raw fish)   No wasabi inside of sushi.  It could be a decent place to go with comfortable friends or family. Not really a place to empress anyone. It is Very Clean and Neat but no private space nor not a fancy looking place. ;)  Quite as well.

vBN5gpEQXzon9rK5qN895A.text: By far the best AYCE sushi place I've been to!! Pretty much every roll I had was great. I ordered a lot of nigiri to get my money's worth and my favorite had to be the blue fin tuna. I wish there wasn't a limit of one order per person bc I would have ordered another 5 orders for myself!  Besides sushi I also tried the mussels and pork belly. I was disappointed in the pork belly after everyone talked so highly about it. I thought the pork belly at Bachi Burger was way better. The mussels were great. Only had one order as I couldn't stop eating sushi.   Also if you like really spicy food I would recommend the 911 roll. It didn't start off spicy but it gradually built until my tongue was on fire. I felt like I was doing a Man vs. Food challenge!  Overall it was a great experience. I didn't leave much room for desert but had the lychee sorbet and it was great. They even had small pieces of lychee in it (nice touch)

1FyF2ZBPW3TFodoBWoOMHA.text: All you can eat menu is amazing! Quality of sushi totally surpasses the price we paid. Coming to Goyemon has become a ritual for us while driving to the strip from LA. Favorite dishes are: uni, sweet shrimp, cajun albacore, super white tuna, mussels, and poki. If I HAVE to pick on something about the place, it would be their service. Sometimes, their staffs come off a bit cold and distant. But all you got to do is to focus on the great food and forget about these minor unpleasantness.

XoSzmfSPiVPvVL7Nk6un9Q.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places! Came here around 11 pm with 4 people and there was still a short wait. I could literally sit there and only eat 3 things: seaweed salad, super white tuna and conch (on the daily special menu). Sushi must be order with the rice & like most AYCE, rice must be eaten. The fish quality is quite superb. Downfall is that your dining time is LIMITED to one hour!! This is difficult if you are dining with a group.  I will definitely come here again!

TU5e5R08ArIkes5XBAyzdg.text: I'm a frequent at Goyemon and nine times out of 10 they deliver.  The service more times than not is quick and efficient.  There is one waitress there that I'm not very fond of, but most of the other servers bust their ass on a daily basis.  Food is churned out a consistent rate, but don't be afraid to be on top of the servers...there have been a few times when our order was misplaced by the chefs.    The wait times during peaks hours are LONG.  Expect on Friday and Saturday night to be waiting up to 1.5 hours for a seat and they absolutely do not take reservations.  However, the wait is very much worth the experience.  I'd recommend heading over to PT's a block down and grabbing a beer while you wait for them to call and tell you that your table is ready.  They're pretty flexible and understanding that it may take you five minutes to get back to the restaurant to get to your seats.  In addition, I would highly recommend going here for dinner, than going during lunch.  The service and food has always been better in the evening than during the day.  The overwhelmingly majority of the time the fish is as fresh as it gets in Vegas (there was a good two visits in a months time during the past year and a half that my partner and I have been going their where the freshness was questionable.  However, it was temporary.  The next time we visited the quality was excellent.).  They will often have some very beautiful cuts of tuna that are just to die for.  I find it quite impressive for an AYCE restaurant to be serving this quality of meat.  The range of items you can an order on the AYCE menu is insane, but I love the variety.  I would recommend the following if you're going to be doing all you can eat for the first time:  Nigiri: - Yellowtail - Garlic tuna - Super White Tuna (melts in your mouth...so good!  My absolute favorite!) - Cajun tuna or cajun albacore (cajun tuna is a special and they run out quick, but I find cajun albacore to be a great substitute). - Red snapper  Grill: - Steamed edamame (I find the the garlic edamame to be far too greasy, stick with the steamed!) - Pork belly - Super white (it's a special) - Yellowtail  Rolls: - Magma - Sexy girl (the cucumbers pair so well with this roll) - Crispy rice  - Yebeisu - Salmon skin  Dessert:  - Red bean ice cream!   - I'm not a big green tea fan, but everyone tells me that their green tea creme brulee is excellent.  If you just want to try a bunch of different rolls, than you can order half a roll for the large majority of the items.  Trust me for the tempura and especially the baked items...you may want too!  For a quality sushi dinner (that just happens to be AYCE) at $26 for dinner...it's hard to be beat.  You just have to know when to go and hope you don't get the one waitress that will drive you nuts!

IeHAIYt4HgtBLwTFOcZglQ.text: i give them 5 negative stars we had sushi that tasted like dirt. when we said something got rated like crap. had to wait 20 minutes for the check and they hadn't been done making are sushi when the check came they pt it to go and tried to charge us for it i told them i wasn't going to pay for it  and yo don't treat customers like that it was like that they forgotten what we order and then tried to charge for there mistake we treated very rude. and the customer at the other table herd how we were treated i said i was going to blog how bad and what happen and they didn't not seem to care  worst serves ever had in my whole life is this how you treat people who make sure yo stay open. i sure if i was chief Ramsey he be telling you what are you trying to kill people who eat here and that service is rude when you point that something taste bad like sushi you have to be careful

lHFa2TpZASErOd1cRBAbcQ.text: good quality sushi for AYCE.  staff isn't always nice. i almost want to give them 3 star rating for the staff issues.

UwbqXn7paHq4Ke5KmwYX2Q.text: My friend recommended this place, she said that this is a must-try AYCE in Las Vegas. Umm, I do not agree at all. Turns out this restaurant is the sister to Sushi-Mon, I was kinda surprised whether my standards have changed over the years or the quality has gone down since my last visit to Sushi Mon.   To start, nigiri did not good.. Some fish was not fresh n rice is packed loose. I know I should've given more attention to rolls since they look artistically pretty that i dun wanna eat it. but these rolls have all the same ingredients to me. That's why I opt for nigiri and taste the freshness of the food. But there are some props abt this place. at least salmon and unlimited halibut made me very happy. I also like the half order option where u can order just 4pieces instead of 8.   It's surprisingly busy during lunch in a Tuesday. Only 2 waitress and 1 bus boy. It's quite hectic for an AYCE place to place order by telling the waitress instead of customer writing on an order sheet.   I probably would sample other AYCE restaurants off strip next time I go to vegas.

n5qYwx-v_LvL4G2RdjZYrw.text: Okay, in for a convention with the kids.  Waited for a table, but while waiting was treated to the most beautiful eye sushi.  We don't eat seafood-learning, but we almost did because everything we saw looked so good!!  We had the pork belly for an appetizer, lucious yum.  The California rolls that came with our teriyaki combos were so incredibly fresh!!!   The teriyaki chicken and  beef were delicious.  My youngest, 6 really enjoyed the orange chicken.  And we all enjoyed the gyoza.  Will pass on green tea creme brulee next time.

-utJPnFahxKjYd_nxBQwjg.text: I've been here twice because I love it!!! I love all you can eat, and I love sushi so it's a real no-brainer. For $28 for the all-you-can-eat, it's not a bad value.

oBZ-wV1D-cVgxHKEWp34GQ.text: The fact that this place had a 30 minute wait at 1AM says a lot. I came here in a group of five for a late night sushi run. While 30 minutes is a pretty long wait, we were hungry and there weren't many other options that would be open so late so we stuck it out. Three people in our group got AYCE and two of us got the regular option (I like to take my leftovers home and don't mind the extra expense in doing so). Between the five of us, there were a lot of appetizers, sushi, rolls, and dessert. I myself had the crunchy spicy tuna thing (I never know what it's really called, I just know that it's delicious), the shrimp tempura roll, and a scallop yum roll. They were all great and tasted especially fresh. I really wanted to try the wonton chips but they were sold out which I take as a good sign (next time). I'm not a fan of green tea anything (I'm Chinese... I know, it's sacrilege) but the green tea creme brulee I ordered was devoured in minutes (by me). Yum. We all left, full and happy and I have permanently saved this as my go-to late night (or possibly any time of day if I'm in that area) sushi place.

U4s60dbqW7Ogc1jPDjHmrQ.text: Frist couple times I went it was great. And now the last few times I have been going the service has been really poor. I had to get up and give my plates to the bus boy becuse they kept bringing food out and not clearing other plates.. And haveing to stop them after having an empty glass of water several times The server forgot my card at the cashier.  Food is great! but I dont think I will be frequenting this place as much.. I will drive farther and go to the sushi mon on silverado ranch.

pAtHS8NqDjtn7GACZyfyIw.text: I do not have enough good thing to say about this place. From the moment we walked in we felt like we were apart of their little sushi family. We sat at the bar and were greeted by teo of the coolest sushi chefs ive come across... well ever! Hiro and Tony ( I hope i got the speeling right). I wish I could name some of the highlights of our meal but I couldnt even tell you because they just kept handing us different things to try. I do recommend the pork belly if you are not on any type of diet and could care less about your arteries, and the wonton chip dish was awesome. Wouldnt have minded it being a tad more spicy. Overall the fish tasted fresh and delicious. The highlight of my sushi meal is that you can order everything in 1/2. The smaller the dish the more I can try! Last but not least we tried the chocolate mousse for dessert which was of course amazing and I left this place fat and happy. Now if only it was closer to home I would be there all the time.

5dS_mmRkYdiY0yG9l6YyYg.text: After eating here hundreds (literally) of times, I got myself a serious case of food poisoning.  I was with my daughter and both of us got deathly ill about 36 hours later. We were there on December 22, 2012.  I noticed several reviews that stated they also got food poisoning right around that time so I decided I needed to write this review.  I did go in there and tell them about it.  I was told not to come back if I was concerned about the food (needless to say, I have not been back since).  They did not apologize and they apparently knew there was a problem because several other people (based on these reviews) had already alerted them that they had also gotten very sick.  I ended up at Spring Valley Hospital with a $1500 bill (thank goodness I have insurance...my co-pay was $150).  I learned at the hospital that when you get sick 36 hours later it is viral and the virus is caused by dirt rather than bad food.  For this reason, I cannot go back there.  I am very disappointed in this restaurant.  Good luck to those of you who dine there... you're going to need it!!

1BR0xYjVzlcvd4nXaLydrA.text: This place is good---I wouldn't rate it 5 stars, but it is alright.  Hubby and I went to Vegas Super Bowl weekend, so I of course jumped on yelp to plan out our meal plan.  We went in on a Saturday night about 7pm, and it was crowded.  The hostess told us it would be about an hour, it only took about 30 minutes to get a table.  We had the poki tuna salad which was ok, the Rock N Roll which was ok, the Orion roll which was ok, and the Red Dragon roll which was pretty good.  We opted out of AYCE, due to the menu for that being mostly glorified California Rolls.  Our bill wasn't bad at all, hubby even had a beer and I had a hot tea, and we had a $50 bill at the end of dinner; considering we ususally drop a lot more at sushi, this was a bargain.  Not sure if I will go back here--kinda a trek off the strip and away form it all, would need to be much better sushi!

An8lq0P5gU7ln9_owe5efA.text: atmosphere: better than sushimon since its newer  service: good but the food took forever to come out.  food: quality was goood but they didn't have yellowtail!!!! they said they are going to take it off from the menu...which is NOT GOOD!!!

6-nNf57V-wGgga5f8A1t2g.text: I had a serious fight with my gf and after we had dinner here, she's totally happy now ;) we were told there was 45-min wait,    But we were called in less than 30 min. Super friendly staff, food was fresh and authentic. Compared to the other AYCE sushi this one is definitely the best. We tried all the dessert and all were fantastic! Not too sweet. uni was fresh.favorite restaurant in Vegas!!

gYG6iD3KaRMdohQ4S24wsA.text: One of the BEST AYCE sushi places I've ever been to.  Really good quality and the best part is all the different desserts and cooked foods you can order w/ AYCE on top of all the made-to-order sushi.  My wife can't stop talking about this place and we make sure to always stop by when we're in town.

p7AFy2Cq5PWSvpBvvjbTNQ.text: The food was great but the place is rather small.  We ate the ALL YOU CAN EAT and I must say, the food quality was very good.  It even came with desserts.  The price of the meal was average like the other Big Hotel Buffets in town but the choices and freshness was why we came here.  Would surely come again when I visit VEGAS......

1mbaM5iZQxR3aN_YmnZeHQ.text: wow.   all you can eat or not, this is outstandingly good sushi.   great chefs.   fredo is the man.   almost makes me want to come back to vegas (almost!)   win.

oCD7g91QC9f3rVqE_aPX2g.text: We were staying on the Las Vegas strip and were looking for a good sushi place tha t was a good value.  Yelp reviews led us to Sushi House Goyemon that is a few miles away.  We went for the AYCE and it was excellent.  Everything we tried was excellent.  A few of the YELP reviews suggested the pig bellies or something like that, and that was the only item we chose that was one I'd pass up next time. Nice people and great service.

ai_z-qT6t35zmKQI6TzqbQ.text: It was really good, especially Unagi and Seared Salmon! Service is good, prompt and accurate. Mochi icecream for desert was delicious. Sushi-All-You-Can-Eat worth it! Please enjoy it!

cuA2HaiEF3bD0UByw9hNlA.text: just bout everything is great here... miss the yellow tail collars..

Cg83NEALvepljBQJ3SMxGw.text: Ay!!! The rice cracker is the bomb!!!!!!!!!!!! The mussels r fresh n tasty!!!! Service is great!!!!

evq643kiwCFMVplXwFaBvg.text: My cousin recommended this place and I'm so glad that he recommended it, cuz this is my new fav. AYCE! There are tons of sushi to pick from, and there are also some special sushi every night, which I didn't know about the first time I went. But the second time, they had seawater eel and toro (fatty tuna), and both of them were awesome! The sweet shrimp (my personal fav) taste really good. The other sushi were fresh and taste delicious. After the sushi, we had dessert, the green tea creme brulee and tempura ice cream were delicious.  My only complain is the waiting time. So I recommend you order everything that you can think of the first time or you will be hungry for a long time if you order a little every time the server comes over. Also, go there early, I waited for 40 mins the first time and an hr the second time before for seating. Other than that, this place is great and you should seriously try it out.

Gft5nLyRWIq3MmzrHN7VkA.text: Love love love this place! I'm not scared to order anything here- everything is fresh and made as you order. Must tries are the hamachi collar, UNi , super white tuna, albacore, seaweed salad and finish off with green tea mochi! Make sure to get the frequent diner card, you get a free meal after 10 stamps!

eqLbl2VMKfE2zLiJRKKX-A.text: OK.  We ate at Nobu the night before and this place surpassed it.  But the locals would probably just smile... Perfect Nigiri with the perfect amount of rice.  The flavors are amazing in everything! Oh and Yea, you can get pork belly. NOMMMM.  Desserts are scrumptious too - I liked the tofu cheesecake.  This is the one place that maked me wished I lived here =)

OUVF2yjBwo5Yjf77x7b91g.text: came here three time and never go back again, whenever I went, there's always some "seating" issue, for example, we were waiting at the front door, we clearly see seats and table open, but when we ask, waitress said it's reserved, ok, no big deal, but 20 minutes later, STILL NO SHOW, I asked them again, they said it's reserved, ARE YOU KIDDING ME? this is NOT how you do the business, if there's no show, then they have to give up the seat to customers waiting, I went to another restaurant, they will even let 3 people sit in 6 people table if they can, goyemon really have horrible seating strategy, another issue I have is whatever sushi I order, sushi chef just splatter bunch of ponzu(?) sauce on top of everything, all I can taste is the salty ponzu sauce and I can't even taste the fish anymore, towards the end, I got so thirsty and have to ask him PLEASE NO MORE PONZU sauce, this clearly shows they don't even make sushi with care and thought, they just put ponzu sauce on everything? that's just wrong, I went to other two sushi restaurant, each sushi comes with their own type of sauce, not overpowering, and just right.  Long story short I will not come back again.

PDydLpBSBaYJDWJkC_1pVA.text: A bit pricey but other than that very high quality. Let us off the hook with a bit of leftovers. Also caught one of the sushi chefs handling cash with his gloves which I thought he would take off before handling sushi again but I was wrong, he kept the gloves on.

PjTXTaHHDpwZddJPmin46w.text: So, this place, I'm torn whether to give it 4 or 3 starts.  On food, I would say it's probably 3.5 stars.  The service is great though and you can't beat the AYCE factor.  I love the fact that even though it's AYCE, they don't make the huge rice balls to try to fill you up.  That's the only experience I've had with AYCE.  The nigiri was nice.  Fish was super fresh.  Rolls were meh.  I liked the fact that when they say AYCE, they mean everything on the menu.  So you can order appetizers, cooked food like grilled fish, grilled other things, tempura,  udon.  Ramen is only available after 11pm.  But the desserts and sides are also AYCE.  I can see why the wait time is so long.  I do like the fact that you can put your name in and they will text you and allow you time to get back.  Haven't seen that anywhere else.  I would have spent well over $100 bucks if I'd gone anywhere else and ordered same stuff, or ordered ala carte.

CwfVKr9-96V-lBF5fNI-hw.text: My gf and I have been going to this place a good amount of time already, we never had any problems nor complains, until the last two times we went service was horrible. Food was alright as usual, but service got terribly terribly worst. I had the same server for the last two times I went, it was a mexican dude. I don't have any problems with mexican or any nationality but this dude was just ignored us. Every time my gf and I went we always tip good, but he just ignored us, I thought he was busy or something but no he was walking around talking to other customers and took their second round order. He was gone right after he took our first orders. It was just irritating seeing this guy working there. Will never go back until this guy leaves this place.

qRBbLSOa_D6y1qY9VWfzDQ.text: All you can eat for $26.00 is a great deal. Beats the Strip and tourist. It was good, fresh and creative. Definitely do it again and again! A no brainer!

kRbOoxoIqsvB4ng_msDhSw.text: I'm here right now for the first time. I guess I'm not a True sushi eater bc I will only eat the cooked stuff lol. So I came here while waiting for my car to be tinted down the road at Eco-tint. It was perfect bc it was a 3 hour wait and this was a 13 min walk, a little over half a mile. I got the all you can eat lunch. There is SO much to choose from, like 50 special rolls, like 50 regular rolls, appetizers, sides, deserts. It's crazy! It was perfect for trying everything bc they are small portions and u can get half rolls. Everything was REALLY good, the waitress and cooks were great. I sat right at the sushi bar so I could watch everything. I honestly have nothing bad to say. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bc of the appearance. It's very small, not well decorated, and there's no bar. At first glance, if I wasn't pretty much stuck without a car I would've left. But I'm glad I didn't. I'll be back and will bring my boyfriend. Thanks! Now I'm in a food coma, guilty, and wondering how I'm going to roll back to my car lol

fdZEkF7SmgJK-cJ-9S7Ubw.text: Awsome place. A huge variety of rolls, Fresh tuna , great tempuras. Awsome service.

JocmsUCBPk175Sr3CUa8HQ.text: This is my favorite new AYCE sushi place in town!  I love their specials and side dishes, which are more inventive than your average edamame or vegetable tempura.  For side dishes, I loved the grilled pork belly, grilled yellowtail, and spicy tuna on rice crackers. Honestly there wasn't anything I didn't love!  The uni here is the freshest I've ever had in the US.  The menu is very extensive and the fish is all very fresh.  I had the green tea creme brulee, strawberry mochi ice cream, and lychee sorbet.  I think my favorite dessert was the lychee sorbet.  This is definitely going to be my go to place for sushi from now on!

0Hz9W-KstTB3ZRxt3MYy7w.text: Okay seriously get out of here with your bad reviews. This place is amazing. I cant wait to go back to vegas so i can eat here again. I was visiting friends in vegas and this is one of their favorite places and im so happy they took me to goyemon. The all you can eat is awesome. Though you must finish all the food you order but its soo good i dont know how anyone could leave food behind. THE PORK BELLY OH MY GODDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD drool!! It was the best thing ever, we must have gotten like 4 orders of it. The mingus roll is probably my favorite roll, deep fried spicy tuna, cream cheese and avacado. The seaweed salad was awesome, desserts were awesome. Im actually not a huge fish fan aside from tuna so i cant tell you much about other things. But everyone i was with loved their food. Ive been obsessing ever since i was taken here. The only bad thing is it gets really busy so you might have to wait a while, i do wish the building held more people. But that goes to show how great the food is.

_eMkkaRUzfSx66ylR24Q9g.text: I was really looking forward to having some sushi (actually, A Lot of sushi).  This was my first visit to Sushi House Goyemon.  Unfortunately, I wasn't too impressed with the taste & quality of the sushi.  Ordered the  Alaskan roll, Dragon roll, seared salmon nigiri, volcano, amaebi, uni, and for dessert- green tea creme brulee.  The Alaskan roll was a disappointment. I was hoping it would be similar to another sushi place (one that has a red mask in it's name), but it was lacking all around.  The sauce on the dragon roll was a bit overwhelming for me.  I tried the uni for the very first time & the only positive thing I can say about it is " thank goodness it was a small serving".  I'm glad I tried it, however, I will never try it again.  The best part of my experience here was the green tea creme brulee.

vpGFBrbPyuIB34z4jOUD7Q.text: The All you can eat is a great idea, they will give you half rolls so you can try a lot of different stuff, and the pork belly I could eat a lot of these.  The dessert choices were excellent too.

EALGKMLaOrWx7HeVK2exOA.text: My roommate and friends have always raved about this place and I decided to finally give it a try. I had the all you can eat, which is always a better deal no matter how hungry you are, because at least you'll get to try everyone else's foods of your not happy with yours. Which in my case did happen. I felt like I was ordering everything wrong. Everything I tasted that my roommate ordered was delicious. The pork belly, for example. I can't tell you how many servings of those we chowed down on. Overall I'd say the red meat selections were better than the white. I usually eat chicken but like I said what I ordered was okay compared to what my roommate ordered.

5j1-v-kSTtvDhMbq9MngZw.text: I would like to say that my recent trip to Goyemon was not a good experience, the sushi was made with huge amounts of rice and just a 1/3 portion of fish, so yes they are being cheap , Then I ordered a tiger roll, it was prepared with less than fresh vegetables, and the fish was some sort of processed fish. I tasted it and it was awful,  Ordered seaweed salad, that was ok, the tempura shrimp order, 2 shrimps, 89 percent batter and 11 percent shrimp, so you get the idea its all made to be cheap. My advice stay away unless you are looking for a cheap quality fast food sushi experience.

Ec28GMTtj9FzmnoZHDrV6Q.text: Apparently, 200+ people in Las Vegas have no idea what good sushi is. This place was terrible. Inexcusably dry fish, burned "grilled" vegetables and the worst (read: slowest) service ever. The place was packed with "all you can eaters" who appear to be more interested in quantity over quality. I trust the all you can eat menu is why portions were so small as well, not really fair for those not interest in pigging out. Walked out on $40 worth of food on the table, it was literally that bad.

GZmyfVoMBUiqOypYGYLM-A.text: for $26 ayce sushi, nigiri, rolls, cooked items, etc. basically the entire menu for 1 hr, it's a great deal.  got white tuna, scallop, salmon, crab hand rolls, etc.  also tried poki salad, udon, grilled tofu, etc.  would say that the sushi was fresh enough, but the rice not very accurate, and the scallop needed some citrus treatment.  udon was too sweet. poke salad was good.  last order 2:30 am.  easy to order enough to cover the ayce price.

qwo3TiYNPonIa9BMQArqWw.text: Ate here in may and june was ok then ate here in July and it was awful. will never go back. I should have noticed most of the bad reviews are in july, seems like its getting worse .Fish was not fresh rice was bad. Most of  the  staff just seems confused.

M3JY4Ayr8Xeu0qmB7I-rFg.text: Loved it!  For an AYCE sushi place, the menu is extensive.  We especially enjoyed the Grilled Pork Belly, Scallop sushi and Sweet Shrimp sushi.  They added the shrimp head to our miso shiru so it had a wonderful flavor.

xJnuDIBd1kSVP9p228-CIg.text: Truly wonderful experience. I brought a few co-workers here for a post-deal celebration. Wasn't completely turned on by the all you can eat option but once we sat down, we had a great experience.  My guests opted for the AYCE, and therefore I obliged. We started with the lighter flavours of your traditional sushi ordered a couple of their "house" specials (masago jalapeno sushi) and pork belly which we're delicious! The fare was so brilliant we decided on a few pitchers of asahi and premium sake, all recommended by our fabulous waiter. Next time I'm in Vegas, we will definitely stop by.

L9XzPXwVUaNogfD7VDGoHA.text: Big disappointment.....Went for early dinner on 3/20/13, to avoid the  typical 1 hour wait.  Been to this restaurant 3 times over last year.  Rice for sushi was cold with some parts of rice uncooked.  The raw fish (nigiri sushi) was bad, I think they gassed the fish with carbon monoxide to look red, but bad texture.  Raw fish on nigiri sushi pieces were cut small like they were trying to save money.  Although service at Goyemon has always been poor, it makes it worst when the food was terrible.  We brought 4 guests bragging about this restaurant and our credibility was shot.  I don't think I will be going to this restaurant again when I go for my semi-annual trips to the Orleans Hotel and Casino.

F8V-0ng0SRyXC-QH_7_sJg.text: This place is absolutely worth the visit. I did a lot of research for a good sushi place before my room mate and I went to Vegas for a week over NYE and we weren't steered wrong by the reviews. The AYCE sushi was great quality, there is a ton of variety on the menu, and you can also place half orders so that you don't fill up too much on just one thing. We went three times in one week! Twice for lunch and once for dinner. Sushi is super expensive where we are from in Bermuda, so we were beyond excited to pay less than $30 for AYCE (we definitely don't have that option at home!). They don't do sashimi but they do pretty well everything else. It is quite a small restaurant and was packed every single time we went, there was also a line waiting. That's when you know it's worth the wait. The last time we went for lunch, we went right when it opened so we didn't have to wait to be seated, but it did not take long before the place was full. I spoke to some guys who were from Vegas who said they eat there all the time. I can't list my favorite roll because there were too many choices, just try everything! I will say the steamed gyoza are incredible, I could have eaten those all day long. They do have a time limit stated on the menu, I think it was 45 mins - 1 hour per person, but I'm pretty sure we were there a longer than that and no one kicked us out.   Go here, it was amazing. I am craving it right now and can't have it as I am 4 time zones away *tear*.

Gfllty-c70EQQnOadEU8kQ.text: My son and i went here for lunch and we both loved it.  The fish was fresh and the selection they had was awesome.  If you go the yellow tail and the white tuna are the best.

T-pJL1CoZOd2GjLGWgfQzw.text: I was so excited to come here after all the rave reviews and hype from friends. So I finally go with a group a friends to try it out!   They have a nice selection of rolls and the norm for nigiri, decent for AYCE.  There is also a selection of the days special and what's fresh, so that's nice to look at. Quality of the rolls were just OKAY, the rice on my rolls were a little...soggy? The deep fried rolls were very tasty, and fulfilling. I have to commend the spicy rolls they have here though! The spicy rolls, in particular one...was HOT! Besides the spicy rolls, the dessert was a pretty good factor in making me like this place, the creme brulee was great!  Service was okay, the servers can be dauntingly slow and inattentive. They took forever to bring the check to us, despite rushing us to finish our meal.  I might return to Goyemon to give it another try, but in the meantime, I'm in no rush.

2RAR5vYRg2wxa4KKjdj1Ug.text: we loved the sushi and came there regularly.  we always come as a group and it is a special treat as locals.  the last time we came it was friday evening and the wait was over an hour so we took the group to another sushi bar.  we decided to give it another chance and came on thursday at 6:15pm.  they told us it would be 45 min. wait.  we waited an hour and I went in to check and they showed me an empty table by the door.  My group watched five other groups seated prior to us even though it says on a sign first come first serve.  I told the person behind the front desk that the table would not work for us as a group we like to visit when we eat.  they told us that it would be another 15 minutes.  we waited another 30 minutes and still no table for us and we were the only group still not seated.  I'm not sure if we were to give the head guy a tip to get a good table, however, it was obvious larger groups, small groups, were being seated before us.  we again left to go to another sushi house and  was seated within 5 minutes.  the night that we had planned turned out okay, however, we didn't eat until 8pm.  we will never return, obviously they didn't want our business.

jNFT2NXwCzW8Hz1Tr0sWMw.text: One of the happiest days of my life was when my relatively new gf, who used to not be a fan of sushi, asked me if we could have sushi for dinner. Of course I would take her to Goyemon. Now, it's our "every other week" spot for AYCE sushi.  The first time I ate here, it instantly became my all-time favorite sushi restaurant. After having tried another place, that place came pretty close, but to this day, Goyemon still holds the spot for #1 sushi place.  Super white tuna=like butter in my mouth. I can finish 10 orders of this and still not be full. Gotta try the dynamite, it's the best in town. More staples are shrimp tempura, calamari, baked green mussels. For nigiri, other than super white tuna, yellowtail, garlic tuna, salmon, sweet shrimp, unagi, and cajun albacore. The gf likes rolls, and always gets the Japanese Lasagna and the OID. I like the pastel myself. I don't like rolls that much anymore. They make me full a lot quicker and I want to make my AYCE experience worth it every time. I honestly haven't had a roll here that I didn't like. Dessert: You gotta save some room for some green tea creme brulee. Sometimes, they have vanilla creme brulee and chocolate mousse too and I just go all out and order that trio. Now this is the only sushi place in town I know of that has this high a caliber in desserts, and that my friends, is the second reason why it is my fave sushi joint. You already know the first (clue: it's like butter in my mouth).  Oh my, now I'm craving for Goyemon.

qccQV2ejI37mwoq0FjmkUw.text: Okay same chain and menu as sushi mon. Love the concept, love the menu and love the food. The place is clean and the bathroom is well kept. We sat at the sushi bar and although the sushi chef wasnt that nice, the food made up for it. This place gets super crowded though since it's closer the the strip so come as soon as they open, otherwise you're in for a wait. We got to order a la carte for the kids so definitely a good option for us. Otherwise I would have liked a cheaper AYCE option for kids under 12.

MxEGEotpCm3yq7GFUsGYXA.text: Affordable, yummy and not that big. Usually a wait so try to call ahead. Quick service and the all you can eat is a really good deal. I enjoy the lychee desert and everyone I go with likes the super white tuna. Enjoy!

qWXBYt0eeUrRX07iRHD6Eg.text: This is the most reviewed AYCE sushi in Las Vegas area. Therefore, this was also the first restaurant I considered to go back in January. However, I was a bit concerned about people's comment about the bad service here. Finally, I went to Sushi Yama in January and was very satisfied with Sushi Yama.   This week I am in town again. Really want to give this place a try because of the good review about food quality. Also I am planning to go on Friday lunch and did not expect this place would become too busy, and hopefully I won't encounter the service issue that other patrons mentioned.   Unfortunately, I end up have all these first hand experience with a cocky waitress. I called in advance and ask them if there is one hour limit for lunch time. The host told me that I can eat there for 1.5 hour. I think it is quite reasonable because we don't like to be rushed. When we were seated, I saw the Uni and sweet shrimp are not included in the lunch. I was not very happy about it because if you look at the menu online, it was a bit misleading. Then I saw the 45 minutes limit on the menu and I tried to clarify with the waitress. I told the waitress that we just called the host and she said we can eat here for 1.5 hours. The waitress insisted that 45 minutes is the limit stated on the menu and it has always been the rule. Well, I just spoke to the host 10 minutes ago and now I am getting the total different information. Then, this WONDERFUL waitress said the time limit is 45 minutes, it is up to you if you want to eat here or not. I don't trade off being respected and welcomed no matter how the food quality is. It really upset me. Later on, she added on if they are not busy, they don't really enforce the time limit strictly. So I figured out that was why the host said 1.5 hours when I called the restaurant.   It would just be a lot easier that if the waitress explained they don't enforce this strictly instead of telling me it's up to me to stay or go. I think she maybe too exhausted and she feels better if she doesn't need to serve that many customers.  So, finally we walked away and went to Umiya and enjoyed the great sushi and excellent service there. I will recommend all my clients and friends going to Yama or Umiya in the future

VTdftvDGIx-GqW_VAnW2-Q.text: I was hoping for a little better.  Nice place I enjoyed my food, but everything was a little bland.  I still liked my sushi and some things were really good, but overall it was underwhelming.  Here is my rundown  Regular rolls including spicy shrimp with yum yum sauce  crab meat roll and yellowtail were good but no bite.  The eel nigri was very tasty.  Albacore nigri was over powered by lemon.  The Mingus had a very nice tempura finish. And the catapillar had a lot of avocado which I love.  I also love cream cheese so I tried the baked lasagna sushi. I found it somewhat disgusting.  Lots of oozing warm cream cheese.  Yuck.  The tempura ice cream was interesting and a nice cap to the meal. Crunch and cream.  I liked enough that I will try again, but overall I prefer sushi koma.

TPfV0urDVh0i-JwTNj4QXQ.text: Good price for ayces but fish was just average and I felt a bit rushed at the sushi bar. Sushi orders are on the small size ( the fish cut) and the poke tuna was underwhelming.

RX-5rPfu8HXqx5Uqj2iQHQ.text: Good sushi, always order the spiciest roll! Great sushi salad. Went on our lunch break.

_0oQEgG72X6H56qNFcAs0w.text: That's really funny that other people (yelp members) got Food poisoning from this place too! I am also in the medical field and I knew I got food poisoning. ( along with my wife). I called Goyemon to let them know what happened to us and all they said was sorry the first time. Then I called them a second time (after I figured that my friends also got food poisoning. Coincidence....I think not) To let them know that it was definitely from their food. They proceeded to argue with me and not let me speak to the manager. (actually I heard them talking in the background and the manager says its not their fault). They advised me that I was suppose to call within 48 hours and let them know. I did but I didn't remember the lady I talked to. I really think it was a bad way for them to handle this situation.They also told me that they fly everything fresh and everything on their menu is toxic free. They tried to blame the situation on my own doing. Just to let everyone know, I went on 12/16/2012.  And DUK C. went on 12/21/2012.  I thought the food was amazing and delicious but unfortunately they did not own up to their mistake. I am now scared to eat from Sushi joints all because of their place. I hope this post would serve as a warning to all before you attempt to eat at this establishment.

fSEonsTO4OFtzpd3Z1g13Q.text: Visited wonderful Goyemon again last night with some girlfriends.  Highlights were the pork belly with mango salsa and the crispy rice roll!

adLhe_dTTyucHv3CeDdyrQ.text: Not a huge fan of this place. There's plenty  of other all you can eat sushi places (Sushi Freak) that serves similar items with better service. The time it took them to bring out cooked dishes was insanely slow. We ordered chicken skewers and it took about 30 mins to get there. We had to flag down the waitress to get our tea refilled but the only plus was we got our sushi fast cause we sat at the bar.

cjIMT-vMqIYhNW_8pqZDEw.text: Our favorite AYCE sushi place in town.  Sometimes you get lucky and don't have to suffer the wait, but a lot of times there is a long one.  And if you get super lucky be sure to try the salmon collar!!

_soZdLBJRP0EllPtFxCtUg.text: Best AYCE sushi joint! Gets pretty packed at dinner time though, even on cold, rainy, week nights like yesterday... They have great selections, and you can do half rolls from the start. Try the garlic edamame to start off. Crispy rice is bomb if your ok with a little spice in your life. This is also the only place I like the 'dynamite'. I could go on and on. BUT JUST DO IT. I always have a good time here :D

IRW1nKbSo8lBaWuug9ZmgQ.text: This place rocks! Personally I like this place better than Sushi-Mon, because they have more special rolls available and there are way more desserts to choose from - all of which you can have in the AYCE.   Our server was very good, she made awesome suggestions. The pork belly isn't one to miss as well as the Blue Fin tuna sushi which was really fresh. Beware of the 911 roll! Talk about en el fuego! It has habanero chili sauce. Be prepared for a fire in your mouth that lasts about 10-15 minutes. Eating more sushi rice after helps quell the heat but damn, it's a hot one. It was cool to try it though.  I am looking forward to my return!

MDS8EV3unutsRI_1HvUkZw.text: We were out on a Friday night date...our favorite sushi place was sold so we were looking for a new place...we drove around two three different places and finally ended here..they said it was an hour wait...but we waited..(which we never do) and so glad we did...it only took 40 minutes and the food was great!! Service from Shima was even better!! All orders came fast and delicious!! Will definately come back again...

3lv-l6scaFl77Rg-Tc34nQ.text: This place is great and all you can eat for $26 how can you beat that, pork belly was awesome way better than morimotos napa, for a lot cheaper, if u come to Vegas this place is a must try. Their stuff is very friendly too

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuuummm

ioCdgiM4gNlifgZ7b-5iSA.text: The sushi is amazing! We had all you can eat sushi which totalled 33 per person with tip for dinner. We had up to 4 different kinds of rolls per person with various side dishes and even dessert. Yuzu sherbet was amazing. The pixie, spider and hurricane rod were excellent.   Worth the wait!

6tVJHyco-Ad148QBxCawSA.text: Good sushi. Just seems to take forever to get the dish over to us.

7wGUrgp86wh-AnvDSwrFeQ.text: BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI!!!!! Generous portions of fish, great variety of rolls and open super late. Can't beat that mix. We eat here whenever we are in Vegas- it's love at first bite at Goyemon.

wcgNZw3__M1H7BPz6_lRmg.text: All you can eat AMAZING sushi. Need I say more. Hands down 5 starts!! Don't forget to eat the tempura ice cream. Hint: get half sizes so u can order more.  Example bring 4 people. Half sizes are 4-5pices. So u all get to try. And then order different items.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rvGzWJi51-XCf5zY8OBZwA.text: Can't believe, the worst service in my life!!! The food is good but very bad experience.. We took our son (3 years old) to this place have all you can eat dinner. First, when I order the food, the server keep checking my son, without just simply asking his age, made me so uncomfortable....  Later, when we asked for the bill, they charged $13.95 on my 3 year old son. I asked what's the age consider kids $13.95?? The guy did not answer my question directly , instead, he questioned me back twice, how old is him? ?WHAT KIND OF ANSWER AND SERVICE IS THAT?? ! I told him he is 3, the guy starting to say... well, yes, with 3 years old we charge $13.95 blablaba... WHAT A LIE!!! They have it on each menu, 4-9 year old is $13.95! He ended up with another LIE: THE MENU ON THE TABLE ARE THE OLD ONES AND HAVE LOTS MISTAKES. So he still charged me $3 for sharing! If it's the old menu and with LOTS mistakes, why you still give it to the customer?! Plus, I DO NOT SEE ANYWHERE FOR THAT $3 SHARING!!!! IT'S TOTALLY A RIP-OFF!!!!  I paid the $3, don't want to deal with this CHEAP restaurant anymore! DO NOT GO!!! I will go back to Yamasushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3PfL5kYlF-inJehtyqj5pQ.text: That was one of the worst staff collectively that I've seen in a sushi restaurant. I would not recommend Goyemon to anyone.

41MFjhKg-TM7iqPdBF_pyQ.text: Terrible service. Waited almost an hour to be seated. Waited almost 45 min for a second order of sushi. Ordered dessert and the ice cream was half melted. Sushi was half ass made. Staff moves very slowly. Really bad first experience. Don't recommend coming here. There are other restaurants that will take better care of you.

erUEQHKqY1fsIaC_R-6-mQ.text: I've been back a few times since my initial review, and now knowing what I don't like and what I do like from them, Goyemon is pretty good. When my boyfriend and I are feeling like eating something light and the wait's not too long, we go here for ala carte and get either the sashimi or sushi platter. When the opportunity cost is better, we get AYCE which is decently priced at $27/person.   The crispy rice with spicy tuna app is one of my favorites from Goyemon. They also have daily specials for desserts for AYCE that are limited one order per person, last time we were there they had chocolate mousse and creme brulee available - both very delicious! The chocolate mousse was thicker consistency more like a ganache.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amberjack!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi special from ala carte menu
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail jalapeno from ala carte menu

2EtzVva5wFXbRBvMOp_oeg.text: Pretty good place to eat sushi. All you can eat $26.99 dinner $22.99 lunch. Not bad price if you're really hungry for sushi. We chose to eat dinner plates instead. Katsu curry was good. Chicken was fairly meaty and lots of curry. The tonkatsu was crispy but rather thin. As a result, some parts were hard and more panko than pork. It was rather crowded when we got there around 930 pm but the wait was only 15 min to get seated. It was good cause we got to talk story awhile. Next time, I'll try the all you can eat sushi....... maybe

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork tonkatsu
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry rice

YJgAWG0mX-JxQYBuQ2jGyA.text: If I could give negative 5 stars I would. We've been dining here for 7 years since we moved in town. Tried to dine on a Tuesday night and got to the host stand by 1:15 since, they do last seating at 1:50 and last call at 2:30. We even called before hand to make sure they would stay open on a slow night in vegas and we're assured we would be taken care of. Upon entering Goyemon the hostess Ashley was instantly rude and obviously did not want us to come in. I've worked in restaurants for 15 years so I understand wanting to go home but after we called and such a consistent restaurant assured us we would be served the normal hours. I was shocked. Ashley said she first had to get chef approval and they were only offering ala cart after 12. I've been dining here 7 years and never heard this restriction. I also live In Henderson and live one minute from sushi Mon (same owners) and won't support their business any longer. I was so embarrassed and disappointed about these new rules and Mis information. So many places in town go somewhere else

Mk92ZggPvqHTbdRLe674Aw.text: When I come to visit Vegas my friends are always talking about how much they like Goyemon. we went here on a night when they had Salmon Belly as their special. Unfortunately with this place being small they don't take reservations. The couple times that I've been here its taken 30 mins or more to wait for a table. Usually its worth it for Salmon Belly but if you're starving this might be the place to go.   After our 40 min wait we were seated at a table for 6 even though we had 7 people. Tight fit! We were immediately greeted and asked our orders. We all just placed one large order and waited for them to have it out. It took them 10-20 mins for them to have it ready, It all came in small waived but that worked out for our group and table size. As soon as we were done with one plate another would come. They also kept checking if we wanted to order more so that it would be ordered to keep consistent.  They were busy and couldn't really keep up with our refills but they did a decent job. We ordered a lot of sushi, but unfortunately they ran out of the main reason why we were even there... Salmon Belly... *sigh* We did however get to order a lot of desert so that was nice. Personally the price was good for all the food that we ordered, but I wasn't too impressed. The wait time itself wasn't the best, and the size of fish slices on our Nigiri wasn't the best either. I don't have a problem coming back here because the taste of the sushi was good, just wish they had bigger portions. I mean it is all you can eat so can't expect huge pieces.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v0Cmeg5kyvoS7l7bKjoo4w.text: Ohhh my beloved Goyemon...If I was good at writing poems I'd write them all for you. It is not even fair how good you are and how much value and cheap umami you provide to shushi lovers like myself. You don't cut corners, compromise quality for profits and your fish portions are not small like in many other sad attempts of AYCE restaurants in Vegas and around the country and the world.  The year I spent appart from you I missed you more than anyone I ever met in Vegas, and the day when I move out of Vegas, whenever that might be, I will miss you more than anything else.  If you think there is a better sushi AYCE in Vegas and you call yourself a foodie, I don't want to be your friend.  I hope you outlive me...

rhzwgH49ITKfpwautFGYLg.text: I don't know why I've never written a review for goyemon, I literally frequent this place all the time. I know they're under new ownership so it's changed a lot over the years, but what hasn't is the fish. I love all of their nigiri and I love that their accommodating to every request. I get their fresh wasabi (trust me, you'll thank me later) and a side of Yuzu every time. Don't forget to check their white board for their specials!!

qKqPnx1pOx87tE6Wv878xg.text: Love this place! All you can eat for a VERY reasonable price. I always get the dinner special so I can order Uni & Ama ebi.  Their fish is soo fresh tasting and delicious.  The food comes out pretty quick too. If i lived in vegas I would probably be eating here once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NYvqGkBD2yusmhjuADD3lQ.text: Loved this spot! Always a must have every time we are in Vegas. Fiancee loves the chicken teriyaki and I always go for the all you can eat sushi. Great quality and pricing.

Wwme_Xr3Yt8FpbTI-9wnrw.text: For the price, 4 stars!  We dined in for dinner, with a party of 12 adults and an infant. There are no reservations, so we had to get there and hope for the best. At 5:30, the restaurant was 90% full. That being said, we only wait for 20 mins to get seated as a full party. Awesome. I didn't have any expectations of this place, except that I hoped for $30/ head it would be decent. They completely surpassed my expectations. Sushi is one of my favorite things to eat, but living the midwest I am limited in the places that have good quality fish, I am usually paying $25 for 2 great rolls at a legit place. So to pay $25 for all you can eat (affectionately dubbed ACYE), I was pretty much in Heaven.  We mainly stuck with Nigiri, and only did a few rolls and apps. I think we ate 15 orders of 2pc Nigiri each!!! The selection of fish is outstanding, and they will even let you order some of the more expensive cuts (toro etc) at least 1 times per person. I consider that pretty generous. Their "signature" sauce here was a garlic ponzu, and while it was mighty tasty on the first few orders, it got old really fast. You can ask for the fish and the rice plain for any of the nigiri, which we started doing after a couple of orders. The fish are a nice cut, and thick too. They aren't skimping on you here. They also have hand roll, maki, and baked rolls but we wanted to keep it simple that day.  Definitely recommended as an excursion off the strip if you love sushi and basic Japanese apps (tofu, kaarage etc).

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hamachi collar
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ahi
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QgHqSniX-_eOMGzuZf7Pwg.text: Great price for a quality AYCE place. Doesn't force everyone to get AYCE which is really nice. The standard menu is really extensive, fish quality is usually really high (I've eaten here probably 15 times), and the rotating special options are really good (like grilled miso salmon that was so good).

9PGZWXP0qY0FPrt0eSemUA.text: This sushi restaurant is delicious everything is amazing all you can eat is definitely what they are talking about! My fav dishes would have to be the Sexy Girl, Rock & Roll, & also the Royal California roll is my top 5 so far! I will be coming back anytime.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QAx3anEtLyijMdLuqGSnpA.text: Nice place, not too far from the strip.  Looks like your regular strip mall local Vegas AYCE Sushi joint. Nothing really stands out. Seems like a favorite local hangout.   The one thing I like about this place are the daily specials. IMHO it's the Goyemon daily specials that set it apart form other AYCE sushi places. Goyemon has specials that are unique or unusual...a type of fish or delicacy you never heard off. Some of the specials are limited to one order, while the others are part of the AYCE experience.   No complaints at all about the food. The waiter did bring us wrong items...stuff we did not order, but no complaints really, we were game...totally willing to give it a shot. While the food was good, the service was a bit spotty. When it got busy, the staff started forgetting some of our orders, brought out doubles of stuff we already ate and also stuff we did not order.   I would say for the best experience, try to come here during off peak hours, when its not so busy.

eJCEPKr2J8pz44wj4uDM0w.text: A must go all you can eat sushi place for me every time I come to Vargas! Last time we came in a weekend and had about an hour wait and I remember we were starving. This time we decided to go on weekday 5 pm and got seats in the bar area with no wait !! The restaurant is extremely busy so you'll have to be patient with your orders, but it is definitely with the wait !! Their nigiri and seafood is with really high quality, and I can see all the action in making. My favorites are uni (tastes like heaven), sweet shrimp, halibut, yellow tail and scallop. And please do try their grilled items as well! The yellow tail filet and cajon salmon is out of the world. But one order is pretty small so you may want to order more than that !

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Every guest is limited to one order for these 2 items - uni and sweet shrimp. MUST ORDER THEM!! The best !!!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Highlight of this round- yellow tail on the left, halibut in the middle and scallop on the right !

8MbZEuSGDBxKUeKt1K7_Pw.text: Arrived at 9pm... Quickly seated... quite busy... Service very pleasant and expedient... Sushi, side dishes, and ala carte arrived less than 5 minutes... reorder AYCE also very quick... This was the highlight of the visit...  Heavy rice in rolls... Deconstruct to check fish quality... salmon seemed a bit off in color but tasted ok... chef a bit light handed with sauce...  Pork belly was good until second order, then mainly fat... Teriyaki chicken is large chunk dried breast meat with teriyaki sauce drizzled on top after cooking, or warmed in microwave...   Yakitori chicken skewer much better... Thigh meat actually grilled then teriyaki sauce drizzled on top... This dish took 20 minutes to arrive, maybe because it required real prep and cooking...  Small place packs in many customers so is quite loud... service was good up until waiter saw me writing this review, then he was gone...  Excuse me... Hello... May I receive a refill of water please... Anyone...???... Hello...???!!!...

CNy4_Pkwp3Fyh0PGPBiXZA.text: This is the third time I've come to Goyemon this year and overall I've enjoyed each time as the food has been really good. To start Goyemon is always busy, so if you have more than two people expect some kind of wait. They don't take reservations, but you can put your name and phone number down when you get there.  You'll get a text when your table is ready and can also check your place in line on their website. Once seated service is usually prompt, though one of the times it seemed like they were short staffed. I've only gotten AYCE and can say almost all the nigiri is delicious.  If you're hungry for some good sushi and don't mind waiting 10-20 minutes this is the place to check out. Also the pork belly as an appetizer is awesome, so try it out!

dpnKcvdEibjnxPs_5TSE1w.text: DO NOT ORDER THE TUNA. Idk wth kind of tuna they use but it's extremely chewy and TUFF, I had to spit it out I was chewing for like a whole damn minute. Fav was Cajun albacore.... nothing special.

rk6egeShHIoMjLJxDnyD8Q.text: I try to avoid doing the all-you-can-eats and buffets.  I never can eat my money's worth!  But whenever I'm in Vegas, I try to make an exception and Goyemon is definitely a place where I go all out.  Skip the skinny jeans and put on that billowy dress with the stretchy belt because we're having half the ocean's worth of fish for dinner tonight, kiddies!  I'm Seafood's worst enemy and I take no prisoners at Goyemon!  Goyemon is my ultimate favorite place to go for sushi and it's crazy for me to even say that!  I've taken my brother and friends here and they all go crazy for this place.  Nothing in Arizona can compare.  With uni, sweet shrimp, salmon belly, blue fin tuna, unagi, conch, aji mackerel, garlic tuna, and black tobiko being on their menu, how can I not love this place?  There's so many more amazing bites and everything is fresh [Remember:  fresh salmon should smell like cantaloupe!]!  Even with the all-you-can-eat, they don't try to rip you off by offering more rice and less goodies like a lot of other places do.  It just proves how great their work ethics are.  Don't forgot to check out their ever-changing daily specials.  Goyemon is a trendy little place and it's nicely decorated.  The wait time can be pretty crazy and they're always busy.  The wait staff is pretty on point here as long as you're nice and polite.  Loud annoying people generally are given much worse service as we've seen first hand with the annoying drunken jerks next to us.  But in the city where clubrats and lushes prevail, I can see how they're just over it.  Stay on The Strip, fiends! Let me just have Goyemon all to myself.  Give me an hour, dim the lights, and don't come in when my stretchy belt is hanging on the doorknob.  NSFW.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke salad.
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni --- Sea Urchin!

Ek1FQaW5PsgKOSQk09phjg.text: I've had this place bookmarked forever!  As soon as we got off the plane today, I drove here to finally check out all the hype.    My main interest was in the saba and the uni.  A sign greeted me at the door that said that they were out of uni.  Poo.  Anyways, my impression of the menu was that Goyemon relied heavily on the deep fryer, cream cheese, and yum yum sauce (along with the amusingly named "orgasm sauce").  I'm a nigiri/sashimi type of girl myself, but I can still appreciate this stuff.  Still, this was a bit much.  On the plus side, they were really nice about making subs.  Like I wanted the Alaskan, but with real crab.  Done!  And the servers were so fast with the order, which was important when you only have 45 min to indulge (though I doubt they time it).    Good sushi has to have good rice.  Here, the grains don't melt together.  It's like the individual grain is a little too al dente.  The rice improved later in the evening, but still wasn't great.  Also the knife work wasn't on point.  I'm not talking about against the grain of the flesh or whatever...like the sushi was cut all crooked at times.  And someone at the bar was overzealous with the lemon.  My hotate and escolar nigiris had quite a pucker factor.    As far as my favorites...def the saba.  I always order saba b/c aside from not having to worry about food dye, mercury, or pcb, it's mad good.  It's got a very strong flavor though, so if you do eat tuna, salmon, etc, you might want to save the saba til the end of the meal.  The grilled squid was great, too.  It comes in thick cuts like fat fries.  They also offer it in tempura form.  O, and if you're feeling like there's too much rice (they really don't overuse rice here), save the rice from your sushi and order the dynamite.  Yummy!      Overall, this is def a fun restaurant to visit and for $20 of unlimited sushi, you can't go wrong.

D0SsDej-RZ7c4yrDzNiNjg.text: 3 stars for the price and because their maguro was good, but had it not been for the pretty decent quality maguro, this place would get 2 stars.  0 stars for their toro which was disgusting, fishy, and had a brown tinge.    I think the quality of this place is hit or miss.  I saw some pictures of toro that looked decent, but the pieces that we got were just nasty.  I put it in my mouth and instantly choked because it was so fishy.   The saving grace was the maguro.  It was fresh and a decent cut, and I liked the garlic tuna which was basically a ponzu sauce. The rolls were pretty involved and had a lot of stuff in it, if you're into the complicated and overly sauced thing.   However, for what you get and the selection, its a good price and pretty good for sushi on the mainland that is AYCE. If I didn't live in Hawaii and have access to Kona Kai on a regular basis, I'd probably love this place.

XUtc2FQ66NpwAJcCEiqklQ.text: Lunch 11:45 am-4pm $21.95 AYCE Dinner 4pm-3am $26.95 AYCE!!!!  Best deal in town  This place is the BOMB!!! I will come back here every time I come to Las Vegas because it is literally the best AYCE sushi place in the city, and just off the strip. You usually have to wait a while for a table, but if you're eating at the bar, you can go right in if there's seats open.   I recommend not ordering too much off the menu right when you sit down. You have to finish everything or they will charge you ala carte prices, so you should order from the sushi chef as you go. You can order half-rolls so that you can try more types of specialty rolls without filling up so fast, and you can even order 1 rather than 2 nigiri at a time.   Don't get the spicy tuna roll because it's just a plain roll with nothing else in it. The pork belly was just o-kay...it wasn't super special and it's just too greasy. The tempura ice cream is not that great either--the tempura batter isn't crispy, just bready. Next time I'll just get 1 or 2 mochi ice cream, because the green tea ice cream that I had wasn't a strong green tea flavor, more on the bland side.   The $5 sake I got was such a generous amount, I kind of regretted ordering it since it made me feel full too fast. I should have gotten the smaller size.   But all-in-all, despite my ordering blunders, I really REALLY enjoyed this place. Go for the unagi, amaebi, hotate, and ikura. Super duper fresh, generous, and artfully done.   Mostly locals come here, so the party next to us asked how we heard about it. They were regulars. It's a small place, so go early if you have a larger party, or sit at the bar if you're on a hot date. It's worth every minute and every penny!!!

fBtwyWdFIdiO5eLE0IQrtg.text: My favorite AYCE place in Vegas. They don't short you on fish, they don't give you huge pieces of rice with your sushi to save money, they don't slow the service down to prevent you from ordering more, and the food's delicious. Around $27 per person for dinner and $22 per person for lunch.   PRO TIP FOR FATTIES LIKE US: if you order a crap ton of sushi like my family does then sit at the table and not the sushi bar. Sitting at the sushi bar means you order direct from the sushi chef which can be awkward if you place multiple big orders. We sit at the table and place our order from the server which is less awkward.   The only downside is the wait is crazy long on weekends. They also ran out of uni one evening (included in the dinner price) and wouldn't compensate for this in some way whether through an extra order of sweet shrimp or anything.  If you download their waitlist app you can check how many parties are before you. They call or text parties when their table is ready so most parties wait in their car. Don't be fooled by the empty front desk: there are usually dozens of parties before you.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni and sweet shrimp, one order per person for dinner only

qmlmWCcbFlv_SKsLIyyH2g.text: Cheap. Consistent. Delicious.  Who would have known that I'll give another all-you-can-eat buffet a 5-stars after Bacchanal Buffet? For $26.95 at dinner, you can't beat the quality and service. If you're on a budget, I think lunch is a bit cheaper.  There are so many good rolls (and some forgettable ones) that it's hard to dislike this place! My only warning is to make sure you don't over order. You can order half-portions for a lot of them, which is what I always do when I dine here.   For appetizers, I especially love the tempura shrimp and fried calamari. I order more than 2-3 each because they're just so darn good. They arrive super hot temperature-wise, so be careful. I feel like they deep fry them right after you place the order.  Overall, this place is a safe bet for any meal. I'll definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to get a bang for their buck. There can be a wait sometimes, which sucks. Oh well.   Make sure to save some room for dessert too!

NA4oNTp4dN36TMMgu7x9jw.text: The food was ok! The nigiri sushi could've been alot bigger! My husband enjoyed the white fish. We were told wait was going to be 45 mins. but got sat in 20 so that was a plus. We ate here straight after a 4 hour drive from LA. I wish it had been a little more satisfying. Service was ok but kept having to ask if our orders were coming and for refills. This is off the strip so you do need to be able to drive to location. May or may not come again next time we're in town. If you go hopefully they have their lychee sorbet. That was my favorite part of the meal along with their shrimp tempura.

fVOGLJ5_rXKJRvBHPe5w5w.text: Love this place! Been here several times and had great service. Giving four stars due to the wait time. I know this place gets busy, worth the wait, however the hostess, a young white girl working tonight bypassed our name and turned our 35-45 min wait into over an hour and a half. She couldn't even apologize. Will be back again, crossing my fingers for a different hostess next time.

I_n1EVuBdzyttBv4ydA4qQ.text: It isn't as hype or as great as it used to be...what made the dining experience even worse was when we were charged for dinner. The FIRST server, Maria, told us ramen was for dinner. Long story short, we got our bill and was charged for dinner. I know it's a $5 difference, but be True to your advertisement and words. That definitely knocked off a good tip. I believe in tipping good because I have family who earn money that way. I could care less about this place, tbh.

pZ4XaGdx36ZMsSuspinjFg.text: Best deal for all you can eat sushi in vegas! Be prepared to wait a little while depending on what time you go!

w36UwziiPqsk8eTh0Wcngg.text: Sushi was okay, salmon was better than most places but there was too much rice in both the nigiri and rolls. My mom had asked two workers for napkins but they both had forgotten and my mom was annoyed. Our server, Valeria, was great and the reason this review gets 4 stars. Valeria was able to get us napkins and recommend the desserts which was the best part of the meal.

GqhadtANM6OBOeaqgDC0-A.text: Hieu was amazing!  My 15 y/o daughter said she hated raw fish and wouldn't eat it.  Hieu said he'd make her something special that she would like.  He did!  He made her a roll with just a little bit of raw fish and she liked it. Then he made her a special nigiri with raw fish but seared and she loved it.  Then he made her a raw toro roll.  Wow! He's a superstar chef--thank you Hieu!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MS4nnTamcdJZkI5266x11A.text: Came in for lunch on a hot weekday. I'm not a big fan of AYCE sushi but Sushi House Goyemon also offers lunch specials. Parking was easy to locate. I arrived after the lunch hour began and the place was near capacity for lunch.  I opted for the lunch sashimi special which was reasonably priced and included miso soup, rice and salad. The quality of sashimi was unfortunately A-ok with the exception of the salmon which was the tastiest and ended my meal with a generous portion of green tea ice cream.   Another con was the spotty service - I had to flag down the waitress for assistance and also request dessert! Not sure if they were having a off day here but I probably wouldn't return here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy ending!
Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi lunch combo

V9m5v8e75wvpHxGBBY6SVQ.text: The food was really good but I ordered 2 plates of ikura and took more than 1 hour. I'm pretty sure making 4 pieces of ikura does not take more than 10 minutes. We also asked multiple times and it never came.

-kOS9dhxSvd6jSJuGV5BCw.text: Came here on a Friday night at 7pm to celebrate my 30th birthday and waited ten minutes to sit at the bar. And thank God I did, sushi chefs andrei and gian are the best! They make the best recommendations: ecstasy, sexy girl, and hurricane rolls = SO good. And they're so funny! I wanted to try the crispy roll and that wasn't good, pass on that roll (it's just a Cali roll deep fried). But they also emphasized how they're known for their nigiri, mainly the blue fin. And OH MY WORD, it's life changing. We got several orders of that. And lychee ice cream and green tea creme brulee is to die for.   My server (older Japanese lady) was thee worst, very slow and short. And then when my bf asked if they do anything for birthdays, she said no. When bf responded saying "well I saw people post on Yelp about a free t-shirt" she said "not anymore, we only give one free candle." Then, the sushi chefs had another server bring out one free mochi and a t-shirt (thanks guys).   I tipped $20 but JUST for GIAN and ANDREI, too bad they have to share it with others. So in a nutshell:  SERVICE DOES SUCK but sit at the bar  FOOD is worth the wait DESSERTS are beyond amazing

2kguXcQ1ZCgHGqtv_Yz7hQ.text: Me and the wifey met up with Bethany E and her hubby Mike for lunch on a Sunday just right after they opened which was 12 pm. Already the place was packed and we were told that the wait was an hour. So we were given the option to sit at the bar. I thought it was better way for we got superb service in getting our rolls because the chefs were literally right in front of us.  We opted for the AYCE ($21.95) lunch option which was from 11:45 am to 6 pm. According to the menu, you had 45 minutes to alotted time to do the AYCE which didnt make sense because we were there for at least an hour.  What is good to mention is that most of the rolls you can get you have the option of getting a half (4 pieces) or full (8 pieces) roll. I strongly recommend that you get the half rolls so that you have more chances of trying more rolls. Some rolls are only available as a full (refer to menu for they clearly state which ones are not available for half orders).   As for what I ordered. Man, I will only tell the names but not describe them because this review would go on forever! That's what's good about doing the ayce option because you can try just about everything!  What I got for starters were the Garlic Edamame, Fried Calamari, Ahi Poke, and Shrimp Tempura. Then, we got half orders of the Taylor Roll, Sexy Girl, and Frying Jason, Then full rolls only for the Spider Roll and Pixie Roll. We also tried one order (2 pieces) of the Seared Ahi. Lastly, we finished it up with 2 pieces of Strawberry Mochi.  Originally, we wanted a table so we can all hang out much more comfortably while we ate, but after sitting at the bar, I think we got our orders much faster for the chefs actually hand you your order instead of your server grabbing it and bringing it out to your table. If you are at the bar, the servers are mainly there to get your drinks, appetizers, and dessert.   Overall, I think that this will be the measuring stick to other sushi places that I will be trying out. The only negative thing that might deserve a mention is the wait time. But after eating here, I can understand why it can be a long wait for they serve good stuff  and the overall size of the place is not that big. Shout outs to Bethany E and her hubby Mike for inviting us to lunch! You guys are awesome!  Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #135 "Go Go Goyemon!"

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi House Goyemon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Poke.
